review_body: guest relationship manager Sharon is great, she helped us sort out our accommodation arrangement when my booking was messed up by internet booking agency. we are very thankful. hotel location is just five min walk from central train station, very clean, breakfast is deliclous. I highly recommended room 025 if you are solo traveler. the layout of that room is great, has little extra Zen corner with garden view, bathroom is big.

review_body: Very friendly and accomodating staff! The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the breakfas buffet is super, with many options. Filling out MyPage to customize our stay was a great feature, choosing temperature in the room upon artival, bedding blankets etc.

review_body: Enjoyed our stay. Room was clean and comfortable. Great location with easy walk to Milan Centrale. Luca was there to greet us at check-in and to say Ciao! At checkout. Very courteous and professional.

review_body: This was the only hotel we visited on our Italian trip. Close enough to the train station, not the greatest surrounding atmosphere, but inside it was fine, if a little cramped. Lots of ceiling room for some reason and the quietest ceiling fan I've ever (not) heard. Friendly staff.

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Berna. The staff was super friendly and helpful. My room and bathroom were clean and reasonably comfortable (except for the hard mattress). The free beverages in the minibar were a nice touch and appreciated. I took full advantage of the yummy breakfast and enjoyed an aperitif each evening in the bar which also included some light antipasti. While not my favorite location in Milan, it is very conveniently located a short walking distance from the central station. Otherwise, the neighborhood is full of tourists and lackluster restaurants.

review_body: I stay 2 night in hotel.this hotel had very good location,wifi and cleain room.The breakfast buffet was normal.bathroom was very clean.All round good service and I would recommend a stay based on good value for money coupled with cleanliness and a good breakfast

review_body: Very convenient to central station and the underground, a good selection for breakfast and complimentary soft drinks in the rooms. All round good service and I would recommend a stay based on good value for money coupled with cleanliness and a good breakfast. The bathroom facilities were excellent. The only downside was the mattress and pillow were the hardest I have ever known

review_body: A few nights stay at the end of a 3 week holiday. Great location within a few minutes walk of the Central Train Station and Metro Lines. Close to great bars and restaurants. The Hotel decor in the common areas is very dated. But the room was modern and tidy. For €20 extra can extend late check out to 2pm - quite handy. Would stay here again.

review_body: We had an excellent experience at Hotel Berna, where we stayed for one night after arriving from the U.S. The service was excellent, the rooms were very nicely appointed, clean and comfortable, and the breakfast featured a wonderful assortment of delicious food. It was conveniently located near the train station, in a very nice area, and only about a 30 - 40 minute walk from the Duomo and other major sites. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean hotel with accommodating staff and great breakfast. So close to the train station and not very far from central tourist sites. I would highly recommend this hotel you will not be disappointed.

review_body: It was our first trip to Milano. The hotel is only a few steps away from the central station (Train, Tram and Metro....perfect for a sightseeing trip) The welcoming at the hotel was already very warm and friendly. The service of the staff is unbeatable. The receptionist gave us a lot of useful tips to make our trip as unique and worthwhile as possible. The hotel is already a bit older but very cosy. The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. The bathroom is quite small but also clean and functional. The continental breakfast offered a wide range of fresh food for every taste. We would come back any time. Special Thanks to Luca!!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night during a trip to Italy and were super happy. First off, great location and very easy to find. The staff here are also very helpful and friendly, we felt really welcome here! Room was really spacious, big bathroom with a spa bath, great toiletries, free minibar. Not the most modern but absolutely had everything we needed. Breakfast was okay. You have to leave your key at reception when you leave the hotel which I thought was quite odd. Otherwise, we were really happy with our stay and would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna

review_body: We booked this hotel mainly because of the proximity of the railway station. However, we were impressed by the other aspects of the establishment. Well equipped rooms, nice restaurants nearby and next door. Efficient staff and a decent breakfast too!Room view wasn't that exciting, but can't do much about that!

review_body: We like the customisation page. The hotel would send you a link to this page in their website where you can select your amenities. We also like the pre-checkin registration. Location is great too if you are travelling by train as it is near the central train station.

review_body: Recommended by Rick Steve’s, stay was fine but if all the hotels we stayed at in Italy this was too expensive for the room we had. Side note- Outlet in bathroom does not work. Being in the annex is like the stepchild across the street. Keycard didn’t work but bellman took care of although had to wait. Just not worth the price we paid and my cousin had the same room for over 100 euro less.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first visit to Milan -and we were delighted with our decision to stay at the Hotel Berna. Firstly the location is ideal--just a few minutes walk from the Central station where we arrived on the regular shuttle bus from Linate airport. 5 minutes walk and we were at the hotel. It is also 2 minutes from the yellow and the green metro lines-which take you to the city centre , or to other attractions like the wonderful Navigli district. The metro is easy to use -so being near one means you can get anywhere in the city very easily. Reception staff were courteous and efficient, as were all the staff throughout the hotel . Our room was number 226 and it was a good size with a large comfortable bed , free soft drinks replenished every day, and a decent bathroom . It was also spotlessly clean. Breakfast was as described in previous reviews--a great choice , and plenty of it-even including a machine to juice carrots !The restaurant manager is extremely friendly . The bar is also well worth a visit, with plenty of choice -and a charming bar manager. Milan is a wonderful city to visit -worthy of a week in itself. we were here 4 nights and also took in a day trip to beautiful Bellagio -via Varenna which is only an hour by train from the Central Station -another great advantage of staying in this hotel. We really want to return to Milan -and will definitely stay at the Berna next time .
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Berna was our last accommodation over our three week period in Italy. While it isn't the fanciest of hotels, it certainly exceeds all other hotels in service. Hotel Berna sets the benchmark for excellence in service. And we appreciated the friendly helpfulness in navigating our way within and out of Milan. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:

review_body: We had a lovely experience in Berna hotel. The receptionist was very welcoming and provided us with a nice room. The rooms are pretty big and have a nice view as well. The hotel is beautifully done and has a medieval palace look. The breakfast was very good. The hotel is also 4 min walk from the station.
hotelName:

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights early June. On arrival we were given a triple room despite booking a double. Reception were very helpful and moved us to an excellent double room with bath and spa built in. Bar, aperitivo snacks and breakfast all very good. But most important all the staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm usually very picky about choosing hotels, but after reading some reviews I decided to give hotel Berna a try on a two days business trip to Milano. I was not disappointed! Great service and clean rooms, even with little surprises for the visitor to bring home... The breakfast selection is very good, lots of fresh fruit, yoghurt and granola, breads and spreads, vegetables, eggs and different cold/hot drinks. I also tried the room service, which was very good. They recommended a very nice restaurant, that we ended up going back to both days (Osteria Fara). Great experience at hotel Berna, I give them all my best:)

review_body: Small but well-appointed and quiet rooms. Great breakfast buffet. Very friendly and accommodating staff- we arrived early and they allowed us to check in as soon as a room was ready. Easy walk to Milan Centrale (train station), where you can also catch a shuttle to the airport.

review_body: Located walking distance from the train station this hotel sports one of the best prices in Malon. Being next to the train station means easy transport anywhere around the town or to and from the airport. They have a very nice breakfast and the security is excellent. The rooms are normal sized for the city and the price is unbeatable for the level of comfort you receive.

review_body: Good location, pleasant and helpful staff, comfortable and well appointed room and at a very good price, especially for Milan. I spent 2 nights there, travelling with friends and it is excellently located for Milano Centrale and the Metro.

review_body: We spent 2 nights here. The location was ideal. It was a 5 minute walk from Milan Central train station and there were plenty of places to eat nearby. The room was clean and everything you needed. Breakfast was a treat with plenty of food and drink. All very fresh. The staff were friendly and helpful especially Luca. Would I stay here again? Definitely.

review_body: This hotel has a good location. We booked based on TripAdvisor and were disappointed. They put us in the hotel Berna tower across the street. It was quiet but old. Shower and sink drain very slowly so you have to take a fast shower in order not to flood the bathroom. No updating.

review_body: We had a five-star experience. This hotel offers the perfect location. It is a short walk from the termini and close to major attractions. The reception staff is efficient and courteous. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable. Coffee, tea, and croissants were available throughout the day and we enjoyed the breakfast.

review_body: The 2 stars are for The breakfast. The staff was horrible, rude and tried to charge us twice for our stay. We arrived at 12pm and they made us wait 2hs in the lobby. We were exhausted and just wanted to go to our room. Would not stay here ever again and definitely do not recommend.

review_body: The hotel was located very near the central station and the metro which made it very easy to get around Milan. This hotel is really great! Everyone in the staff was very helpful and made me feel "like home", always with a smile. The room was clean and comfortable, a spacious single room. The morning buffe was really good, and the wifi worked perfectly.I have nothing to complain about and would stay here again when visiting Milan.

review_body: The hotel is located a short distance away from Milan main station which made it convenient to get around. There were a couple of steps up to get to the lobby which could be a challenge if you have huge and heavy luggage. Otherwise, it was very manageable.The hotel façade does look a bit old school, but very well maintained. The rooms have been updated and is clean and well stocked. The staff were all very friendly and helpful during our stay which really made a difference. Breakfast spread was great as well.

review_body: A nice hotel with friendly staff, the breakfast is very good. I have stayed in both the main hotel & the Annex building across the street. The main hotel has more recently renovated bathrooms, however the rooms are smaller than across the street. Hotel Berna is in an excellent location, 5 minutes walk from Milano Central station with easy access to two of the main metro (Yellow & Green) lines.

review_body: Stayed in this Hotel. Felt disappointed when I was informed that I would be in the Annex, But was too tired after the flight to argue against it.The annex is not as nice or welcoming as the main Hotel.Reception and breakfast staff were good.I would not go back if the Annexe was the only option!!

review_body: The breakfast were just amazing - there was a lot of to choose from and also the quality was rather good.The location of the hotel is excellent - just few steps away from the Centrale and subway station there. Also the neighbourhood is fine; few very good places very close-by to go eat.However by the room was not impressed that much. While booking (using the hotel reservation system) based on the pics i got an impression we could get a room in the tower. Unfortunately was not the case. Our room had something like ‘cushion-like’ walls which looks anti-modern nowadays; inventory definitely needs some refurbishments; although there was a temperature screen inside i very doubt it was working. And it was very dull. Staying there for a few hours i guarantee you fall into a depression soon. Also would be preferable to upgrade to using queen/king size mattresses and consider card-based key system and abandon ancient system with annoying system of leaving and picking the key at the front desk.Also half of the front desk personnel was rather hard to deal with. (The issue with some rooms left unlocked by the room service one day i want to believe was just an individual misconduct, not the whole place fail).Bottomline - yes, for all the good things (listed above) i’d probably consider staying again, would just definitely ensure what room getting before confirming a reservation.

review_body: I have no complaints. Clean room, good breakfast, helpful and friendly staff. My room was on the ground floor, and I was worried about noise from the street, but it was no problem. I can recommended this hotel to everyone with a night or two in Milan.

review_body: the hotel is close to Central Station (2 min) and 25 min to Duomo. Great staff and good rooms, excellent quality-price. The breakfast is variated and all with very good quality. If I return to Milano I will choose this hotel.

review_body: This hotel was conveniently located – about three minutes walking distance from the central station. The neighborhood was full of restaurants and very safe.I stayed for only one night in a single room. The size of the room was fine for one person. It had a single bed, mini bar, safe, electric kettle, desk, chair, tv. There was no wardrobe, just a rack with hangers. It did not have airconditioning, just an electric fan, but this was not a problem for me as I was there in early April and temperatures were low. But I am sure this is going to be a problem for guests staying during the summer months. The room, overall, was pretty basic but looked dour and in need of refurbishment. I particularly did not dig the drapes that were supplied to cover the area where the safe and the hanging rack were placed. Ditto the floor carpet that seemed overdue for replacement. Wifi was fast. Electric outlets were limited and not conveniently placed. The bathroom had a great shower, spotless and of good size. Towels were pristine white and toiletries were provided. Buffet breakfast was pretty basic with limited choices.Would I stay here again? If location is the only factor to consider, I would. But in terms of quality of room, not.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located near the Milano Centrale train station and is literally steps away from entrances to the Centrale FS metro station. The staff is very welcoming, friendly and helpful. In the lobby you can find tea and snacks, and you can also make tea in your room. Drinks in the mini-bar (in my room it was water and a soft drink) are free. Somewhat unusual for me was that my room was opened with a physical key which had to be returned to the reception each time I leave the hotel. However, this did not create any problems. A very pleasant experience overall.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for its proximity to Milano Centrale, figuring we don't want to drag our luggage around too much after an overnight flight from NYC. With that in mind, this hotel cannot be more perfect. It is within easy walking distance from the terminal but located on a quiet street. What made our experience even better is the courtesy of the staff and the delicious breakfast buffet. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Milan.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a short walk from train station and Metro,a perfect location for sightseeing. Our room was ready when we arrived and nicely appointed with toilet articles and cold beverages. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean and updated. The front desk staff was professional and helpful. They made a dinner recommendation and reservation for us at a special restaurant within walking distance, and we were treated like royalty there. The breakfast buffet was extensive, more than traditional continental/Italian menu, including proteins.There are several restaurants in walking distance and a few late-night places across the street, and they get noisy late at night. We were awakened by the noise, so you may prefer a room that doesn't overlook that street if you are a light sleeper. Overall, a very nice visit in Milano.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my fourth time staying at the Berna. I plan to stay here whenever I visit Milan. The staff -- front desk, housekeeping, breakfast, bar -- are all concerned about meeting and exceeding expectations. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. There's a great breakfast buffet, with eggs, a variety of fruit, cheeses. meats, salad, friittati, dolci, ... Great location too -- a few hundred yards from Milano Centrale, Milan's main train station, and close to good restaurants and cafes. Subway is at the corner: four stops to Piazza del Duomo and Piazza Della Strada.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great hotel! Warm and welcoming. Staff are marvelous, friendly and helpful. Nothing too much trouble. Rooms are spotlessly clean and have all needed amenities. Breakfast is excellent with a huge variety. Could not have asked for better. My only criticism is that the rooms are a little on the small size but it is what it is and that can’t be changed. Other than that just perfect. Highly recommended. Exceptional value for money. Well done Hotel Berna Management and Staff. Thank you.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has nice and clean average size rooms with AC, fan in ceiling, small fridge, coffee/tea, small sofa, chair and table and a comfy bed. No restaurant but excellent breakfast and evening snack at the bar. The locations is great, just five minutes from Milano Centrale and lots of very good restaurants within a few minutes walk. From the moment we entered the hotel for the first time we were greeted with a welcoming smile and for our nine night stay, we were treated like a part of a nice welcoming family. Out of everyone of the excellent staff we must mention Max at the bar. He is always willing to give good advice on places to eat an what to do. What a friendly and nice guy, always willing to help.This people really know how to run a hotel and we will be back for sure.

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in Milan a year ago, and when I came back this year I didn't even think of looking for another hotel. This one has it all: just steps from the Centrale train and metro station, clean rooms, comfy beds, friendly staff, and a marvelous selection of breakfast foods. I know that if I come back to Milan, this is where I'll stay.

review_body: From the moment we arrived we were treated like dear friends. Service and hospitality are the norm here. The rooms are well appointed, location is great, morning breakfast was superior to most hotels only to be topped by warm and friendly servers. Highly recommend

review_body: Great hotel, the bathroom could do with a modernisation and it leaked from the bottom but apart from that everything was super. Breakfast had a good variety and the reception staff were very helpful. Would recommend to couples.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only thing that prevented me from giving Hotel Berna 4-Stars is the temperature of the room...it was obnoxiously hot. Another Euro Hot Box! I don’t know what it is with these European hotels that program the air conditioner based on the outside temperature and not the inside. My room was boiling! And I had great difficulty sleeping. Opening the window helped a tiny bit, but was impossible at night due to street noise. In the morning, by the time I showered, had a cup of coffee, and got ready for the day, I was sweating bullets. Several times I propped open my room door because the hallway was at least 10 degrees cooler. I talked to a lot of other guests and they said the same thing. In reality, Hotel Berna lied when saying “Air Conditioning”. It should be “Air Conditioning in the summer only.”Other than that, everything was very nice. The room was clean, nice, modern, and comfy. The bed was small, but hey…it was just me. The staff was friendly and courteous, and the location was fantastic. I would never stay there again because it was just too darn hot for me. So, judge for yourself if you want to stay there.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel because of the ratings and the location it was located in. The central station is literally 5 minutes away and there are many metro and tram stations nearby too. There are plenty of restaurants nearby for you to try. The hotel itself isn't modern which we were aware of. The atmosphere in the hotel is quite cozy. The room was small but we had no problem with that since we spent most of our time exploring Milan anyway. The staff were friendly, nothing to complain about. I'm also happy with the room cleaning. Also, you get free water bottles everyday! Now onto the breakfast, which many of the reviewers were happy about. I was having high expectations but unfortunately it was a letdown. Breakfast was mediocre compared to other hotels I've been to. The food was cold and cakes were dry. Coffee was good though, but other than that nothing too special. All in all, I would recommend this hotel nonetheless!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is literally around the corner from the central train station in Milan which was very convenient for our travel plans. The staff were very attentive and responsive to our requests for information. We arrived early in the day well before check-in but were still made to feel welcome. We were invited to sit in the lounge for coffee or tea and to refresh before we headed out for the day. We were able to store our luggage and obtain day passes for transportation to spend our day sight-seeing in Milan before returning late afternoon to check in. The room was clean and comfortable. We stayed in the tower rooms across the street from the hotel, but access was easy and controlled and with elevator access. The hot breakfast buffet provided lots of variety and quality and the service was great. We were made to feel welcome and taken care of from arrival to departure.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very good and exceeded every expectation. I arrived early, and as the room was not available yet, I was invited to sit in their lounge and have coffee; one of the staff even brought some croissants for me and other guests in the lounge. The next time I am in Milan, I will definitely choose to stay at the Berna. Great location, my room was very nice and the staff were all wonderful.

review_body: We stayed here for two nights in October 2018. The room was small but we liked it. When we were checking out, there was a really rude receptionist. He did not say hi or ask how was the room. After we checked out, other customers approached to him and he was all smiling and asking them several questions haha.. 여기 호텔 직원 엄청 루드해요. 동양인이라고 깔보는 느낌의 리셉셔니스트 있음.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I flew into Milan from Houston and booked 1 night in Milan. I arrived early in the morning so was planning on dropping my luggage then doing some sightseeing around the Milan Cathedral the day I arrive then get a good nights sleep hitting the ground running the next morning with a couple scheduled tours before heading to the train station. The hotel was in a good location being a short walk with good sidewalks from the train station. The hotel staff is very helpful in offering advice on getting around and even set up a reservation at a local restaurant. My only complaint was the room was stuffy and I could not cool the room without opening the window. I like to sleep in a cold room so I did not get a good nights sleep.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My single room was lovely. Nice big double bed, loads of towels and toiletries, kettle and tea, coffee etc, free water and soft drinks in the mini fridge, safe, wardrobe and storage area. All in all, a very good place to stay for your Milan visit. Staff were very pleasant, helpful and friendly, and the nice big breakfast set you up for the day.I probably won’t be coming back to Milan as I want to visit many more cities in this wonderful country but, if I did, I know where my first choice would be. Thank you Berna Hotel.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I could give this amazing hotel the full 7-star rating, I would do so without a second thought! I had booked my room through Expedia (as I always have) and right after the confirmation, I received regular emails directly from the hotel welcoming me. In addition, they also sent me some questions as to how I wanted my room to be "served" before my arrival (type of blanket/pillow, room temperature, what kind of drinks I wanted to be included in the FREE mini-bar on my first day). Wow!! I have never had any 5-star hotels asking me these questions before!! I arrived (too) early for check-in, but were greeted warmly (despite the very long queue from others who had also arrived early). The concierge efficiently stored my luggage securely (by giving me luggage tags), so that I could start my day-trip to Bergamo without much fuss.Location-wise, this hotel is ideal, not only for those who want to be located near the Centrale Stationze, but also for those who want to explore the highlights of the city. I had stayed at another hotel near Duomo for my first 3 days in the city, but I wouldn't mind staying at Berna in the future, because the rate is much cheaper, with high quality and standard in terms of both its rooms and service.My room is a "Quality Single" - spacious enough for my big luggage and hand luggage, with sufficient storage cupboard. My single bed was very comfortable, the writing table with thoughtfully located socket for my laptop was brightly lighted for work. Mini-fridge with 2 bottles of mineral water (still & gas) plus another 2 cans of soft drinks (of my choice made before arrival) were free for the first day. Coffee/tea making facility was also provided for. Shower was powerful and hot, wifi was free and strong from the room. Room was very clean, basic toiletries and towels were of good quality. A cute plastic duck as a free gift in the sink was a really nice touch and brought the "intended smile" to my face!! Breakfast was of a wide spread of choices and included in the room rate (can't believe how reasonable the rate was for a city like Milan!!). Waiters were friendly despite having to serve so many guests. Front-desk staff were also excellent, and so was the guy who stored my luggage.Overall, you can see very thoughtful and personal touches to details in the room and the entire management of the hotel. Congratulations to the Owners and managers!! I LOVED my stay here, and can't wait to return again in my next trip to MIlan!!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our introduction to the charm and ambiance of passion of the historic city of Milan: were the patrons at the hotel Berna. Exhausted and confused after a very long flight from the USA to Italy, their professionalism and hotel savvy stepped up and created a trusting and quality environment for someone so far from home. True professionals in the world of the service industry, and hotel etiquette. Once we passed through the front door we were no longer strangers however: honored guests. Every moment during our lengthy stay, was greeted with respect and travelers coddle. Never a worry once we signed in as a guest.Helpful and sincere beyond explanation, it truly was amazing-a dream come true for our entire stay.The hotel was highly recommended to me by my own medical Doctor, he was completely correct in all of his information and claims.This hotel and its staff, are the most professional that I have seen in a very long time. I kept pinching myself the entire time of our stay, is this real!As with the enormity of their professional hospitality their cleanliness surpassed anything I have ever witnessed before.Under the beds, over the beds, in the closets the entire room was royally cleanliness at its best. The relationship between staff and patron: phenomenal. Their caring concern topped off with their knowledge made a huge different in our stay in their incredible international city. Breakfast as well as Aperitivo another service presentation they have perfected and achieved. To experience such an incredible hotel in a foreign country was truly a treasured gift. Hotel is a very short distance for the mail train station in Milan, another plus to our stay.I can’t say it enough, this hotel towers above the rest for quality.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You will simply love everything about this cozy hotel..everything was perfect (Room, breakfast, parking..etc)..we loved our stay & will be back for sure..thanks for all the staff who make our stay at Milano city a memorable one.. God bless..
hotelName:
0    Hotel Berna
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed at the hotel for a few days last week. The hotel itself was very nice but we had a few housekeeping and other issues that needed to be taken care of right after we checked-in. We went downstairs and were lucky enough to be met by Bernie, the super concierge. He was extremely sympathetic and did everything he could to solve the problems. He was also a very funny guy. He helped us over the next few days with great restaurant and sightseeing recommendations and we really appreciated his service and good humor.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed just one night here as a stopover between Rome and Lake Como. Whilst not very close it is within walking distance of the city centre (about 30 minutes) or by taking the metro (close by). We did walk around Milan (5 hours of walking) which was enjoyable (lovely castle and gardens).Nice, modern hotel, very clean. Professional, welcome reception. Our room had a huge bed with a couple of cups worth of complimentary coffee. Breakfast was typical of the type, very satisfactory (we didn't eat dinner there).The hotel has nice facilities. A gym (smallish, with Technogym equipment) which doesn't appear to get used much! Plus a pool, jacuzzi, steam room and sauna. Unless you have a slightly upgraded room (which we did), you have to pay extra to use everything (not sure how much). You have to wear an unattractive swim cap which you can buy for 1 Euro. We whiled away a nice bit of time here.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for a week for a conference at the Mico Center. The overall service was just excellent. Bernie, the chief concierge, was super helpful and very knowledgeable. He suggested some great restaurants for us to try. The people at the restaurants also took great care of us too because of Bernie. The hotel has a very nice garden. It was great to have breakfast outside each morning. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Air conditioning completely ineffective and a horribly slippery shower inside the bathtub... I’ve been trying to ask for something so to avoid problems but the answer was simply: “ sorry, we don’t have nothing”So, be extremely careful if you take a shower!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed the hotel - service is excellent. Definitely more a business hotel, not really a family-oriented place. Rooms were small but very well-appointed. Not in the center of Milan but it's very accessible
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Other than some minor negative points below, I think it's a fantastic hotel. Beautifully designed, nice gym, nice pool and lovely staff.The gym was sufficient for me but if you're looking for lots of free weights, you may be disappointed.It's really close to the metro also and can get to the Duomo easily. Plenty of nice cafes close by also.Negative points:- The bath was flooding when having a shower (despite removing the stopper). Obviously well overdue for a proper clean. - Windows aren't sound proof. I was on the second floor and even at 2am the street noise kept me up.- The room was freezing despite outdoor temperature being 24 degrees Celsius. Couldn't control the thermostat.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked Gran Visconti Hotel for a 25 university reunion in Milan and booked for 5 rooms. Superb facilities, made me and all my friends so welcoming and really appreciated the amazing service and hospitality. Thoroughly recommended as a place to stay when visiting Milan for business or leisure. I have been going for years there and excellent location and service. Bravi!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights for a short holiday in Milan. From arrival and check in, to departing for the airport, the stay was excellent and all the staff were there at all times to help and assist.The rooms are a good size with all the facilities you expect for the star rating it holds and a spacious bathroom. The public spaces are large and airy and well maintained and the bar is great place to unwind after a days sightseeing or night our at one of the numerous restaurants nearby. Again the staff are to be complimented on their service and friendliness.Breakfast is served in another large room, and has a great choice and something for everyone.The location for some may seem a bit far from the city centre, but access to Milan’s public transportation means this is not a problem.Of course a mention of “Bernie the Concierge “ has to be made. His advice is invaluable along with his sense of fun and cheekiness.A nice touch was also the chocolates on my birthday.This was going to be our only visit to Milan, but a stay here, has us seriously thinking about a return visit soon.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel. Very friendly staff and huge room. Slightly outside Milan central but good safe walk or catch the metro. Staff all speak English which is very helpful. The concierge was amazing and incredibly helpful. Thank you.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel because of its name (ours being Visconti also). It turned out to be a very pleasant experience. The front desk help (Waldo) was particularly outstanding in making a change to our reservation when we thought it wasn't possible. Greatly appreciated, went the extra mile for us. The hotel was elegant, clean, and had an excellent, bountiful breakfast buffet. Everything a guest could hope for at suprprisingly reasonable prices.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for 2nights at the executive suite. It was cosy and clean, enough space for me to have a business meeting in the living room area. Modern design. I did not have a chance to use the pool unfortunately.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Near the Metro. Near downtown. Close to airport. Hotel is nice with a good pool.However, Bernie, the concierge is extraordinary! He made us reservations downtown, recommended a scenic route after dinner and made the brief stay for the airport the next day memorable. Stay there just to meet Bernie!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the hotel on chance as all other were full. It was outstanding service (concierge best ever met, booked all dinners and gave great recomendations), very good rooms and outstanding breakfast. My new first choice in milan!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ProfessionalsWe came on April 1st for 2 nights We ordered classic room.A/C yet to be operated. Window towards main noisy road.So, we complained… We got an upgrade for the second night free of chargeThey did not charge for the swimming pool and spaGot a free parkingStaff are very professional and friendlyHigh level breakfastSuperior room are huge, comfortable bed and coffee machineWhat else can I ask for…
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first sign that this would be a luxurious experience was the breathtaking building entrance, especially after dark. The lobby is spacious and gleaming. The doorman greeted us before we entered the property and was at the ready to help us the entire visit. The desk clerks were a bit less friendly but professional nonetheless – more no-nonsense businesslike. Entering the room was a true “wow” moment, of which I have very few even in my 80+ nights a year travels. From the furnishings to the plush robes and towels to the top of the line amenities, there was little to be desired. Befitting an Italian luxury hotel, there was marble and thick carpeting everywhere. We didn’t ask for the royal suite but it felt as if we had. One of my pet peeves is water pressure, which can be lacking even in the nicest hotels. I can honestly say the shower here was the most powerful I’ve ever experienced in a hotel. I’ve only felt such heat and pressure in the thermal spa on cruise ships. Unlike the previous three hotels on our Italy trip, many of the lights were controlled with a digital panel – not the confusing buttons which seem to be the standard in hotels here. There was little to complain about. Don’t expect a fancy coffeemaker. It’s just a hot pot, the exact same one we had just had at a $69 hotel , with the same Nescafe instant coffee. We didn’t have time to use the pool but were surprised that there is a substantial charge to do so, as there was for the parking. When booking, there was no indication of a fee unless I literally hovered over the word “parking” with my mouse pointer on the site I used to book the stay (as I discovered after I returned home). Still, the location understandably warranted it and the charge was reasonable. Later that evening, as we headed out towards the subway, the doorman stopped us, grabbed a map, and eagerly directed us to exactly where we needed to go – without our asking. That is great service. It’s one reason – of many – that my one night there was much too short and I would love to return to Milan for a longer stay.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was difficult to review. It is a brilliant location out of town. The room price was value for money because the quality is good. The reception service was very good, we were introduced to the concierge who recommended the hotel restaurant and another one close by, he was very keen to help make our stay a good one and made us feel very welcome. I was quite disappointed that the swimming pool was not included in our room rate and was €20. I expected all of the spa facilities to be optional extras but not the swimming pool. The area was not vibrant, but we found some decent eateries and bars within about a 10-15 minute walk. We brought two drinks in the hotel bar which cost €17 which we felt was too expensive. The prices of the mini bar in our room were ridiculous. €4.50 for a tiny bar of chocolate no bigger than a tea bag or for a tiny tube of nuts. This said, we could not fault the service, and the rooms were to a very high standard which is why I have given 4/5 as my trip advisor review.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights. Came from Berlin and had 2 rough flights ( Berlin to Munich and Munich to Milan) and 45 minutes from the airport to the hotel. After almost 12 hours of journey reached at the hotel at 2 am early morning. No welcome, no drinks and nothing offered or even no one asked if I need anything such as food, water anything at all. Rather he was concerned about check in and I had to wait at the reception for almost 29 minutes to complete the check in as he wanted to even print the receipt at the same time. No sense of arrival time and what he should do when someone reaches late night and is tired. Breakfast is ok with decent selection of breakfast dishes. Did not try the lunch or dinner as always eat outside.HotelLocation is great, 2 minutes walk from the metro and from bus stand. Easy to reach any tourist destination.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was not able to stay at this hotel as I canceled my reservation while exchanging few emails with the staff prior my stay. And I am happy I did it. First they state they provide "no prepayment needed - pay at the property" option for a higher room price on booking.com. As soon as I booked this option they tried to preauthorise money form my card, stating that this is a hotel policy. If you pay more money for a room to get this option (btw also with free cancelation) I would not expect someone to preauthorise money. This is the whole logic to pay higher price for the room. Secondly I really didn't like the tone of the support person replying to my emails and I believe this is a good indication and red flag that most of they staff might have pretty much the same attitude towards their customers. Would not recommend this hotel overall
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really good in all services, decoration and, above all, the staff working there who are fantastic!The room was big and confortable and the bathroom as well with high quality amenities, everything extreamly clean.Just one thing, windows are not well isolated, if you can, avoid first floor, I had problems with the noice of people in the street talking just under my window (I shoul have joined the conversation instead of trying to sleep) and the traffic.I only stayed for one night, enough to know that will come back but not in the first floor!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a few nights in Milan and decided to book here at the Grand Visconti. The hotel was great and the staff was really the best part. They were all very helpful and pointed us to a great restaurant our last night in Milan. The location is great because it is a nice distance from the center, but right next to a metro line. Only four or five stops and you are in the city center. Overall, we had a great experience and would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked for my partners birthday, so it needed to be good. It was!Bernie, the concierge was super helpful with how to get to the hotel, the check in staff welcomed us warmly, the breakfast team were smiley and helpful, in fact every staff member was, greeting us wherever we wandered in the hotel.The breakfast was excellent in a fresh and airy, classical designed room. The bedroom and bathroom were decorated beautifully and spotlessly clean.The metro is a short walk away for a short, direct ride to the centre. The bus that circulates the city also stops just up the road. That public transport accessibility combined with plenty of good restaurants withing walking distance, made this a great location for us.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was really something else I have to say the staff were amazing so friendly, would be hard to stay anywhere else after the example this hotel has set. Great location as we walked to the duomo cathedral from the hotel in 25 minutes. Definitely recommend to everyone and if I was to go back to Milan I would stay here, wouldn’t even bother looking at any other hotel.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has very nice amenities. Bernie is so helpful and kind! There are great restaurants just a block away for dinner each evening. It is walkable to the Cuomo, and other major sites. The breakfast is delicious, and we were upgraded to a suite, which was very special for us! We enjoyed the spa.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was really a great stay! Loved the lobby area and the bar. The staff was just so friendly! Got a suite for such a great price! The only thing missing was body lotion in the bathroom, which was a bit of a shame because the first time I had forgotten my facial moisturizer. I will definitely go back!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights. Very comfy beds and delicious breakfast which caters for all tastes. Very friendly and helpful concierge. Reception very sweetly sent a gift of a fruit bowl following a couple of minor comments. Very quietly located and an easy ride on the metro or 20 min walk from the centre. Few nice cafes locally too.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with some friends/clients and enjoyed every moment. Our rooms were well appointed and super clean and the staff was wonderful especially Bernie the Concierge. Every extra we requested was granted within moments. The breakfast was very good. The location is somewhat removed but the subway line is nearby. Our bed was very comfortable especially when we asked for a topper to be placed to cover the space between the two joined beds. I agree with the reviewer who complained about the powdered creamer. In a hotel of this level the in- room coffee service should mirror the hotel stature. Beautiful outdoor spaces.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding service and good facilities, stayed with two other couples for 4 nights. We paid c£54 a night per room. Close to tube and tram stations. Just 4 stops to Duomo.Reception staff couldn’t have been more helpful, printing off tickets and arranging transport.Excellent breakfast selection and free access to Spa, (normal price €20). Spa a bit basic, but adequate,(especially as offered free on arrival.) Consisted of a steam room, sauna and reasonable sized pool.All 3 bedrooms nicely decorated, with good en suite and plenty of free lotions etc. Also had tea/ coffee making facilities. In addition to a large double bed, and bedside cabinets, our room had three armchairs, a padded double seat, (which could also be used to put suitcases on,) a very large wardrobe, a large desk and a square table. Making it an excellent venue for pre and post dinner drinks.Didn’t use restaurant or bar so can’t comment.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk staff very helpful in assisting us getting train tickets for our next stop. They also offered dining suggestions and made reservations for us. Rooms quiet and comfortable. One of the best breakfast buffets on our 2-week trip in Italy (5 hotels). Enjoyed the pool area, which opens at 3pm. Close to Metro, and one of the best recommendations was for us to purchase a 24-hour ticket (just over 4 euros). Good location!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ll start with the good : 1. a girl named Faith at the restaurant was a delight. The food at the restaurant was great. 2. The two girls for the evening shift at the reception were easy and warm, also booked a taxi for us to the airport. 3. Tamer - A man helping with luggages was really warm. Also, a man at the bar was nice who came to the room to open the wine. Now the bad : 1. Most of their staff wasn’t warm at all. I don’t know if it was Milan in general where people are like that towards Asians because overall I’ve found people in Milan being very cold towards Asians and not any other place in Italy. The receptionist didn’t even show us the breakfast place or time until we asked. 2. Not at all a 4 star especially after travelling all over Italy and otherwise. The basics- There was an extra 8 euro charge for room service. The bathrooms didn’t have lotions or dental kits unless asked for. One night,The bed had a bug which I informed the reception about which they said they will take care of. The towel had a stain. The entire hotel bar had only one wine opener and couldn’t give it to us in our room so the bartender did oblige and open it for us which was sweet. The staff at breakfast wouldn’t get you anything even if you asked which I understand since it’s self service but they would just point towards the buffet and ask you to get it on your own, even if it was water. Today, I had to take breakfast for my mother in the room because of her knee problem, the staff told me that wasn’t allowed and that wasn’t ok to take until I specified my problem. They switched off the entire AC control of the hotel as it was close to a 16 degree in Milan and there was no way to switch it on since it was centrally controlled. We found that absurd because we’ve paid for an AC room and had 4 nights there out of which 2 didn’t have the AC. We told the reception about that but she suggested getting a fan instead. The AC should be a personal choice! This place doesn’t serve you well like a 4star should and needs to definitely work on their hospitality. The place is also a good 20 minutes away from the Milan centre. There were definitely more misses than hits. Totally missable!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three days and the hotel and services were top notch. Great room that was modern and clean. The location is not central to the city but very convenient to get to the city Centre. We walked everywhere and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first time in Milano for two nights and could not have picked a better hotel. Beautiful details, clean and comfortable room.,415. Our room was quiet and had views of the beautiful gardens.Bed was very comfortable and great wifi. Breakfast was buffet with lots of choices. Great cappucinos.We walked everywhere, just because we chose to, but there was the metro just down the street that took you to the Duomo in four stops. There were plenty of nice restaurants not far away. Courteous and helpful staff. Would stay again any time.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: what a great hotel...had a great stay.in a group of 12 girls.the concierge bernie was brilliant could not help us enough.sorted restaurants for us.hotel really lovely rooms lovely.we had taxi organised for us.beds changed everyday.breakfast had great selection.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous hotel just 4 metro stops from Duomo.The hotel was fairly quiet but this was due to the time we visited - mid summer and during the national holiday. As a result, we were limited with local restaurants and needed to travel further afield to have dinner out.However, It’s a perfect location for visiting the city and lakes (we did both) and the transport links are very easy. The hotel staff were delightful and the breakfast buffet was plentiful and fresh.The pool was closed when we were there for refurbishment which we knew before we arrived and this will absolutely enhance any trip as the facilities looked great. The rooms were stylish and luxurious and had everything we needed.Would definitely book again.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for two night from 1 Oct-3 Oct on a business no problems as it should be. Staff seemed friendly not that I had to call them or ask anything. Breakfast was ok but the scrambled egg was really runny and didn’t look too appealing. I went away for one night to Vicenza and came back on 4th Oct. After checking in while I was trying to do some work all the lights in the room started to go on and off repeatedly at about 10-30 mins interval. I called reception and they promptly sent me a maintenance person within 5 mins to have a look. While this person is in my room obviously the light didn’t go off and with limited English he explained that the key cards might not have been inserted properly (it was). Anyways soon after this person leaves the light started to go on and off again so I called the reception again this time I wait for 30 mins no one comes and I had to meet a colleague for dinner so I told reception that I am going out. The person at the desk says they will replace my faulty key card when I return. I come back around 11:30pm the receptionist gave me two key cards and tells me that I shouldn’t have problem but if I do they will put room’s light setting to manual so it stays on permanently regardless of key card present. I went to my room and while I was trying to catch up on email and this poltergeist thing starts again this time the difference was there were no natural light outside. I called reception again and this time a completely different person answers and after explaining and asking about this “magic” manual setting she said she will do that. Finally thinking it’s all sorted I was in the shower when the light goes out completely (trust me not fun experience) potentially very dangerous. I call again and now she tells me that all the room were fully booked so she could not change my room and only thing she could do was help me find another hotel in the middle of the night past mid night. I politely declined the ridiculous offer and decide to go to bed without finishing my work and hoped that with natural morning sunlight I could finally finish my work. Next morning came I didn’t sleep well due to this constant humming noise coming from possibly some kind of machinery near by, I wake up to find my phone and my laptop I left charging wasn’t charged at all. Now up until this point this point all the power outlet was working.As I was checking out I complained to the receptionist that I was not happy at all about the service and the stay but she seemed more concerned about what I had from mini bar and ensuring I pay every single cents for the water I drank from the mini bar. After I paid for the room and mini bar tab and while I was talking to her to complain she continue to answer the phone in mid conversation and afterward just said I will pass the message the general manager later. As I was traveling with colleagues who were waiting for me so I left also I hate making a scene. I didn’t feel valued as customer at all. No offer of gestures of goodwill or sincere apology for completely unacceptable stay in the hotel.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very clean, the staff are friendly and continental breakfast was delicious. 2 min walk from Lodi Tibb Metro (2-day pass 8Euros). Good-sized rooms. Supermarket 5 mins away. Would recommend.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I were surprised by our children for our 40th wedding anniversary ,for once I didn't have control of anything but I shouldn't have worried ,from flights to the hotel were excellent service was excellent .I would recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic Hotel, from check-in to check out, staff were helpful, friendly, room was impeccable, was a short walk from the underground and connections for the underground were always quick Definitely invest in the breakfast it was worth paying the extra. The only negative was the pool closed at 2:30pm on Sunday, as a visitor and after a long day, it would have been nice to use.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a pleasant hotel. Near the shops either by cab or subway. We loved the room and the garden. The service was top class. They were amazing with my kids. Can really recommend it but be aware of all the mosquitoes, I’m not exaggerating. All three of us got many bites while we stayed there
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chose this hotel as it had a spa. When I trekked to use the pool I was told it was "too busy" and they wouldn't let me in. Rooms are bang average. Lobby Bar sterile and uninviting. Breakfast was ok. Wouldn't go back in a hurry.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice and good hotel with kind staff and clean rooms! Very good beds, a various breakfast and helpful staff! The concierge is very kind and helpful, nothing is too much asked! He searches a solution for every problem and always with a smile!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The thing I loved about this hotel was the breakfast. Breakfast is really important for me and in this hotel has so many things are very delicious. The room was also comfortable and nice bathroom. Very close to the metro station. The only problem is that reception doesn’t know about how things work but it is okay to handle.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 wonderfull nights in this 4 star that feels 5. Large very well appointed clean room with marbled twin sinks in On suite. Great breakfast in amazingly large dining room that had the feel of a grand ballroom. Hotel is only 4 metro stops ( station very near hotel) to the DuomoLarge manicured Tuscan garden. Finally the staff were amazingly helpful and warm. Thanks Bernie, he is the Concsierge . Bernie you are a ledgend Thanks mate ‍♂️
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for my 21st birthday in August 2017 for 3 nights. It was amazing! We were shocked straight away by how beautiful the hotel was and the staff couldn’t do enough for us they were lovely people. At night we were greeted by Henry who worked at the bar and he made our trip. He was so lovely and was willing to make us cocktails from our home town. He also shown us places to go which didn’t disappoint. We are coming back for New Year’s Eve and we hope to see him again!! Thanks a lotConner
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bernie and staff very helpfull had a great stay Large hotel and beautifull gardens great location metro 1 min walk easy reach to airport and city centre , great restaurants within location at good prices...
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chosen by my husband -which is always a concern! However, I was more than pleased with the accommodation at the hotel. In fact I could not have chosen better, all the elements you need for a comfortable stay. Spacious rooms, very comfortable beds and lots of fluffy towels. The staff were very helpful, especially the breakfast team led by an efficient manager ( maître d'hôtel?) who kindly produced scrambled eggs for one. We would like to visit again and hope the pool area will be available and all the current refurbishments will make what looks like a lovely area, even better. Do note you will need to bring a swimming cap -a requirement not usaully found in the UK.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found by accident, just one night. Very nice rooms. Good breakfast. Easy access to city by Metro (24hr ticket 4,50€) - 400m walk.Quiet room (garden view), polite staff, decent breakfast. Parking underground.Good value for 150€.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have seen so many reviews about ‘Bernie’ - I guess we were not important enough, LOL!The hotel was nice - clean and comfortable, although the beds were not quite what I would expect from such a nice hotel. My sons and I stayed four four nights, and for four nights we played ‘musical beds’ - neither of us could get comfortable; the beds were hard and lumpy. We opted not to have the expensive buffet breakfast each day; we went across the street to the cafe and had coffee and something to eat for a fraction of the cost - and the food was delicious and the owner, very friendly. The turn-down service at night, was a nice touch!The pool closure was a huge disappointment, and really spoiled our stay a bit; we had both looked forward to cooling off in the Pool after busy days sightseeing. The proximity to the train station is a definite plus. I would probably stay again.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent a weekend at this hotel with our two young children and it was one of the best places we have ever stayed. The concierge Bernie was so friendly and helpful with lots of recommendations about how we could enjoy our time in Milan. Our room was very clean and spacious and when it wasn't made up for the children, Bernie got it sorted out straight away. The breakfast was incredible and delicious in lovely surroundings with the only disappointment being that the swimming pool was close down for refurbishment when we were told that they would be finished when we booked a few months ago. Finally the location was great, we enjoyed the local restaurants and the tube and tram stations were within very easy walking distance. We would highly recommend staying here, we loved it!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bernie Gallotta from concierge greeted us as soon as we stepped foot through the hotel and was a ray of sunshine! His recommendations for restaurants were incredible and he made our stay at Grand Visconti Palace unforgettable!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Grand Visconti Palace on our recent family trip to Europe. Milan was our first overnight stop and planned to go to Lake Como for the day, then head to Venice, Salzburg, Rothenburg ob de Tauber, St. Moritz, and then back to Milan to fly home. We selected this hotel because it had spacious accommodations for a family of 4. The hotel was located near public transportation so that worked well and there were decent restaurants within walking distance. The hotel itself was very lovely and with well appointed rooms; however, the hotel staff were very unfriendly and unwelcoming upon our arrival. We had traveled over 10 hours, had very little sleep or food, and were met with having to fill out extensive paperwork - me, my husband, my 19 year old daughter, and my 17 year old son. Our cousins - another family of 4 - were also staying here as we traveled together and they were not asked to all fill out this paperwork. They could not give me a straight answer of why other than my daughter "was over 18." Well, my son was not and he had to do it as well. My cousin's son was 21 and he was not asked to fill out any paperwork. No other hotel on our 4 country trip asked us to do this. A welcome drink or something would have been nice upon arrival. We promptly stowed our luggage away in the room - which was really nice - and hopped back on a train and headed to Lake Como. So glad we made the time to see it since we were only in Milan overnight. The breakfast the next morning out in the garden area was the best part as all 8 of us grabbed a table. The food was plentiful and there were lots of options but the service was horrendous. They simply did not want to serve us and when we tried to serve ourselves a simple cup of coffee they seemed annoyed that we were walking outside to our table with a cup of coffee. Well...perhaps someone should have brought us some coffee when we asked for it 30 minutes earlier! Not sure I would stay at this hotel again based upon poor service. Rooms and breakfast are nice - hopefully if you stay here you will get better service!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is very helpful and friendly, good location close to Lodi Tebb metro stationBernie, the concierge, is full of energy and gives you the right adviceBreakfast in the garden is magical in the dewy mornings!The most important thing is the cleanliness, you smell aromas of fruits and olive oil everywhere!Grazie Grand Visconti Palace!
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With such good reviews, i had high expectations for this place on the final leg of a recent family trip to Italy and Greece.It was disappointing. It is mainly full of business travellers so if you want a big business hotel, this is for you. If you want a hotel that is friendly and welcoming, avoid this one.On the plus side:- very nice big rooms that were spacious for a family of four. These were excellent- good convenient to transport though not much in the area of any interestOn the down side:- staff were not friendly at all. on checkout, i was asked to settle the bill, even though i had a confirmation email from them telling me they had already charged my credit card. A 15 min debate ensued, which we had to go back and check our statements online (using their poor free wifi!). Staff were non apologetic at their error in emailing me confirmation of payment (which they had never taken) then asking for payment again- breakfast was extensive but very very poor quality. Our worst breakfast in 4 week of Italy and Greece travel- free wifi in rooms is poor. If you want better you need to pay for it. Not good enough these days- garden area is infested with mosquitos. We had breakfast in the garden area one day and regretted it for the rest of our stay- pool / spa was closed for maintenance. this is a major drawcard to the hotel. no apology or compensation for this.In general, great rooms but poor service and unfriendly staff make this place one to avoid for families in my view.Disappointing.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed just for 1 night at the end of our holiday. The place suited our needs well, the location was convenient (close to the metro just a few stops to the Duomo), we had a very comfortable bed and to our delight we found clearly labelled vegan options at breakfast including vegan croissants! Despite this we couldn’t find soya milk or vegan spread (we didn’t ask anyone so they may have been well hidden) but we ate well. The staff were helpful and friendly. The only downside for us was that it was rather noisy at night (I think we could have asked for a quiet room if we’d have thought about it) but it didn’t ruin our stay. We would happily return if ever in Milan again.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, convenient location (close to the metro station, about 100 meters walk), comfortable room. Breakfast is really good and complete. Unfortunately, swimming pool was closed due to maintenance during our stay. Restaurant staff is friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
1    Grand Visconti Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel very close to the metro station and to great restaurants and shopping very large comfortable rooms especially for a hotel in Italy where hotel rooms can be quite small. Very comfortable bed and room had excellent air conditioning. The staff at the hotel were so helpful and friendly and very accommodating. Breakfast was good and had enough of everything. The spa wasn't working so I can't comment on that. Would definitely stay again and would recommend.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with our stay. The room was very clean and comfortable and the service was terrific. They went above and beyond to accommodate us. They breakfast was also nice with a nice variety and excellent coffee. The staff was very friendly.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Getting to and from Linate airport.From airport - get the bus outside the airport directly to Milan Centrale station 5Euro one way or 9euro return. When you get to the station get a song or journey ticket valid for 90 mins and costs 1.50 euro. Take he orange Line to Duomo and then once there change to the red line and get off at Porto Venezia. Take exit of Buenos Aires and it’s pretty much there. When going back to the airport to the the reverse. Hotel is central located and is within walking distance to pretty much everywhere. We walked 30 mins to Castello Sforzesa, approx 15 walk to Duomo and if you fancy going to the canals where there are lots of bars and restaurants it’s about 40 mins. There is a park close by which is has a pretty equipped children’s playground if you have kids or want to sit in the sun.Staff: brilliant friendly staff, check in was with Alissa (I think it was) was extremely professional and friendly and we were able to check in upon arrival which we didn’t expect we could. Breakfast was good and worth the money, typical croissants, cheese, ham, tomatoes, selection of cereals, yoghurts, juices. Hot food was only sausages bacon and scrambled eggs. Staff in the breakfast room were very welcoming and attentative top marks to Domenico and AnnaLisa- all restaurants should have these two welcoming and serving people to this standard. Rooms: we booked a classic standard room and were given a room with street view which was just brilliant- although could do with double glazing at night as very loud sirens. Bath room was small - any bigger persons might find it difficult to take a shower in the small cubicle- could do with a revamp and new tiles but otherwise sufficient. Toiletries are provided and include, shampoo, shower gel and body lotion. You also get a small amenities kit including shower cap, ear plus, ear buds, cotton wool and shoe shine. Hairdryer in room but no ironing facilities but you can request these. The room comes equipped with a mini bar, kettle and teas and coffees. Our cleaner Sharesh did a great job always super clean and lovely to return back to a nice fresh room. Would highly recommend hotel because of the fantastic staff, location and rooms were a good size and most importantly clean. I would definitely return here if I come back to Milan. Recommend for family, friends and couples. 4/5 stars because the shower cubicle is tiny and could do with a revamp.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice hotel with friendly staff. We stayed in a superior room which overlooked the very busy street. Although this was constantly busy it was fine once the doors were closed! Weather was beautiful and the hotel facilities were good. We used the Spa area which was small but nice and relaxing. This hotel is slap bang in the middle of all shops and nearby is the main shopping mall right near the dourmo cathedral. There are plenty of bars and restaurants to visit and not too expensive either.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast was great. Location was excellent. Bed like an ironing board. On arrival we unpacked both suitcases into our four wardrobes and then we found fridge wasn’t working. Then we felt so hot and found aircon wasnt working. Moved to another room with two wardrobes and didn’t fit clothes in. Smaller room. Hotel reception guy was more worried getting me off the phone. Ask to see reservations manager in morning and no show or didn’t contactMe. Never again.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here recently and the staff are golden. Much better than 5 star palaces we had previously been staying at in Turin and Genoa. The breakfast was good and our room was large and quiet on the 6th floor.I left my phone there and the staff went over and beyond to get it air shipped back to me in the States.Nice place!Thanks,Mark and SheriUSA
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was extremely friendly and polite...overall excellent service, great location, clean and tidy rooms, suitable for any sort of trip. I had a very pleasant stay and would definitely repeat it during my next trip to Milan.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent four nights at Cristoforo Colombo (remember that Christopher Columbus was Italian!) and were very pleased. It is a charming and elegant old world hotel with every amenity. The staff was fabulous as was the free breakfast buffet. The rooms we spacious with high ceilings and tall windows that could actually be swung wide so you could step out and watch the activity on the street. It is centrally located in a busy neighborhood about a twenty minute walk to the Doumo which is the actual center of Milano.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The trip to Milan was a birthday present from my husband and me to our 18-year-old son Antoni, a keen opera lover. Of course, Teatro alla Scala was part of the package. :) I booked the hotel because it looked great on photos, and most importantly, had enthusiastic reviews.Antoni was absolutely impressed with the hotel and the level of service. The first photo we got from Milan was an artistic fruit salad he received with compliments in his hotel room, which miraculously appeared a class higher than what we actually booked. Antoni shared with us someone had brought him a bottle of champagne, but he politely refused alcohol – hence the fruit salad. :)The staff was super nice, starting from birthday wishes on arrival and a thorough explanation on where to go in Milan including a city map, ending with a kind staff member helping Antoni tidy his suit when he was leaving for the opera. The fabulous “La Traviata” with Placido Domingo and the exceptional hotel experience made it all a fantastic trip.If we have an opportunity, we will definitely book the hotel again.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coming towards the end of a four night stay at Christoforo Colombo. Lovely hotel. Great location, right next to the metro. Very good selection at breakfast, there's something for everyone. Hotel is very clean. Room is of a good size and our bathroom was huge. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend to anyone planning a stay in Milan.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very professional customer service, high-quality room, neat and clean, prepared every day. It started with great first impression, the staff welcomed us like at home and that continued till our check-out. We received nice gifts every day, the reactions of staff members were more than accurate and instant - they even kept in mind our preferences for breakfast (great meals!). In addition, the minibar was always replenished in no time. One of the best experiences, we will definitely come back. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited here for my partners 30th birthday in December and were very pleased with the location. Heaps of restaurants, bars and shops on your doorstep and the staff were very friendly.The room was very nice and a good size as was the bathroom. The breakfast was a slight let down, lovely staff there and very efficient but the cooked food was cold and there was not a lot of choice.As it was my partners birthday they upgraded our room and they sent champagne which was really appreciated.One thing to mention was the spa, I picked this hotel because it had a lovely looking spa and I paid for the room with spa access however upon check in we were told the spa was closed for the next 2 days which was extremely disappointing as we had planned to use the spa every morning and this had been the reason I picked this hotel. We were assured the spa would work on our last day (my partners birthday) and on this day we sat in there for 1.5 hours without it working before being told it was still not working which was so upsetting especially as I had tried to plan it all for my partners birthday. In the end once I made a fuss we were given a free massage each but the spa was a let down and if someone was picking this hotel for the spa I would maybe have a second thought.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel room is smallThe receptionist is very kind and nice and helpful The breakfast is poor and the man there with the eyeglasses is not very friendly The parking for the car is cost 30eThe room was clean The area is good
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had I had a better experience with the breakfast, I would have given a 5 to this hotel. But unfortunately the breakfast was a big let down to me.
