Otherwise, nice staff, very clean and new rooms, modern bathroom and overall a pleasant stay. Also, It was only during check out , when declaring the two drinks I had had from the minibar, I realised that minibar had been free! There is a metro station right in front of the hotel that makes this hotel very convenient.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been lucky enough to travel the world and my experience at this hotel has been a first and hopefully a last.The hotel have charged me a substantial amount of money extra and even though have spent a whole day on the phone and email to them and sent countless bank statements to them they refuse to accept it. Further to this massive problem, the hotel is nice but staff seem to think that they are paying you instead of you paying them.In regards to the theft of my family’s money, staff has been extremely unhelpful and quite rude. There are many hotel in the area that seem to be on the same level, choose another one you won’t regret it.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed for a 3 night break, we loved it, all the staff were very welcoming and helpful, the room was nice, comfortable bed's, there was plenty of choice at breakfast, and was delicious, the location was good, would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hotel is its central location. A 2 minute walk to the subway station. A 2 minute walk in the other direction to great shopping. A good 15 minute walk has you in the city’s hotspot, the Duomo Square — with all of the high end shops. Yet it is far enough away that you don’t have the noise of the massive Duomo crowds around the hotel. Check-in was very simple and they hand you a rose as you come in (vase is provided in your room,). The hotel restaurant food was excellent for breakfasts and dinner - and if you can’t stay for breakfast due to a tour, they will pack you a ‘take-away’. The room size for a single is typical of most European hotel rooms — quite small. Stayed a few days later in a couples’ room and it was much larger. My only complaint about this hotel would be that in the single room, you can hear a lot of noise in your neighbor’s room — the sound of plugs being put into the wall or water running in the bathroom. But otherwise a very good hotel with very good service!
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two night stay in October. Good room, excellent staff, extensive breakfast, lovely extras like mini fridge and toiletries, great location 2 minutes from Metro. There is also a spa and pool that we didn't investigate. Would definitely re-book if visiting Milan.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for one day stopover at Milan on 6th Oct 2018.amazing location plus really helpful and friendly front desk reception named:Miss Alessia!Was impressed by her patient and helpfulness.Will definitely stay there again without hesitation if I’m going to Milan again..
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic stay...great location and very central...safe to walk about at night...Staff were friendly and helpful...We loved the comimentary bar fridge and free WiFi...the room decor seems a bit old fashioned but near and clean
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If your visiting Millan this is the only hotel you should stay at it’s very central. The staff go above and beyond to make your stay perfect,fabulous breakfast rooms very clean and had a free upgrade with use of the Spa area .
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well maintained, the breakfast is delicious and the pool area is great!The room I stayed ws an individual one but was just perfect for a work trip. This place has different restaurants and shops around!
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the hotel for three nights at the end of September. It was a fabulous stay. The staff were very professional and very friendly and courteous. The breakfast was very nice and there was more than enough choice. The staff in the breakfast room couldn't have been nicer. All in all one of the nicest hotels we have visited, many thanks.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here twice on our recent European road tour and thought it was excellent. Had a bit of a time of it finding it as the satnav was a bit confused with the oneway, but once there the valet parking took care of the car, our bags were dealt with, I was given a rose, we were both given chilled water (we needed it) and we were taken up to our upgraded room, no 603, as smart and stylish as you would expect from Milan. The bathroom in particular was superb with lots of space and the best shower ever, I wanted to take it home! Complimentary minibar which was a nice gesture. The first time we stayed for two nights, ate in the restaurant as we were tired after a long drive from Beaune on the first night. There is a taxi rank outside the hotel so very easy to get into the centre which isn't far away, and it is close to one of the stops of the sightseeing blue bus route which was also useful. We spent the next day sightseeing and ate out that evening at Lucca nearby (very good). There was a very pleasant bar area for a drink, and an excellent buffet breakfast selection in the morning. The staff were brilliant. The second time was for one night on our return journey, when we were attending the ballet at La Scala so we didn't spend much time in the hotel but as we knew where everything was (including how to find it!) it made it a very stress free experience. We were even staying in the same room! I would definitely recommend it for anyone looking for an almost city centre hotel which has a parking facility.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked 9 months prior, the hotel is well situated in central Milan with a wealth of excellent restaurants nearby.The staff are first rate, we were upgraded on arrival and had room 602 which had just been refurbished. It was superb, of exceptional note were the shower and bed.This is in a par with a very high end four star in the best categories. Breakfasts were generous with plenty of choice to suite any taste.Compared to some hotels that claim to be four star but are little better than three, this is far above expectations. Indeed some hotels would class themselves as five star at this level.Overall, a surprisingly wonderful experience that left me deeply impressed. That’s not easy to do.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. The service levels of staff far exceeded our expectations. We were always greeted warmly and staff were always willing to help in anyway possible. It was a lovely gesture to be given a rose on arrival. The breakfast was nice. The room was very clean and had a very comfortable bed. A fantastic hotel and I would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Milan.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cannot rate this hotel more highly, the location, staff, excellent breakfast and value for money makes this Milan hotel a standout. Metro station steps away taking you to the Duomo and Galleria in 6 minutes.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is excellent, right in the middle of a ahopping district. Rooms are very clean but need a bit of renovation, but are ok. Breakfast is rich. Staff is adorable, they are so helpful and caring. Spa is small but nice and useful.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location of this hotel. It was walking distance to shopping and close to metro stations.Service was also pretty good. My room was a single bed, it was a bit small but not so bad. Bathrooms were also clean, though there was no bathtub. What was disappointing was breakfast as the scrambled eggs in the buffet served were too salty and overcooked. Hot food items were not great either (bacon and sausages). There was a selection of healthy options though. Overall, for Europe, the breakfast buffet selection was better than average.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the world hotel Columbia Cristoforo from the 6 th to the 10th of August. I was very impressed with the hotel from check in to check out. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English which is very handy as I don’t speak Italian. The room was very clean, perfect for 1 person, breakfast was lovely and all staff that I encountered were very helpful. I found the hotel to be great value and cheaper than a lot of hotels I had stayed in, in Europe. The metro is outside the door, the sight seeing tour bus stop is just down the street and the hotel is located on the main shopping street. Excellent hotel, 5 stars
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to Milano a couple of times and have stayed in different places, just for comparison.This time we are staying at the Cristoforo Colombus hotel near Porto Venezia. We arrived at the main railway station and took a quick taxi to the hotel (cost 6 euro). It would have been about a 15 min walk.Hotel is located on the main street (full of all the popular brands) with the Metro outside the door, 3 stops from the Duomo. We walked it one morning and it was a lovely walk, and took about 30 minutes, with lots of shops and great cafes.I am very happy with this hotel, staff are very helpful and the room, while being small, has everything we need. Bathroom is tight, so best for only one person at a time!Must say that i was very surprised when on arrival at checkin, I was presented with a beautiful rose. First time ever. Highly recommend this wonderful hotel.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is so convenient for everything, with the metro stop so close. The room was lovely - with double windows which we opened to sit on the deep window seats and watch the world go by. Breakfast was also great, and the massage at the spa downstairs was so good I went back the next day to repeat. Only downside was the small and awkward shower.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear staff of the Cristoforo Colombo Hotel,Thank you so much for making our stay in Milan amongst the best travel experiences we’ve ever had.From helping out with excellent restaurant recommendations (loved Brellin), to booking a rental car (Stefano, thank you for introducing us to Savalan), to your morning staff knowing from day one we liked our coffee double espresso with a shot of hot water.You obviously take great pride in working for your hotel. You are the best. Keep up the good work. Grazie mille!Keiko & Case Everaert
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel the beginning of June, since this time I have travelled through Northern Italy, all of Portugal and am currently in Madrid, however nothing has come close to Cristoforo Colombo.It is pure class.Excellent foyer, rooms and amenities, how lovely to have tea and coffee facilities in the room, the room superb, quiet, good choice of tv channels and the toiletries!!!, you don’t need perfume!!Superb breakfast.All staff top notch, helpful, professional and kind.Absolutely I would stay again.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I stayed here in May and can't say enough good things about this hotel. We had a superior double room and it was fantastic! We had a small balcony and the room was huge! Everything about the room was excellent, the size, the comfortable beds, the temperature - and the bathroom was wonderful with a nice soaking tub which was perfect after a long day sightseeing! The included breakfast was beyond wonderful with an amazing selection of well prepared items. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it!
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in the city centre. Easy access to the metro and central station. Good value for money.. Good size room. Bathroom a little small and shower not very powerful. But hey for a couple of days stay not so important
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. the room was nice, clean but a bit small, had no view at all. (A deep shaft..) but the location was great. we enjoy walking to the park that was 5 min walk from it and shop in the nice shops around it. The shower stall was a bit small but they put a shampoo, cream and soup set of Roberto Cavagli...and that was nice :)We walked from it to many directions. even to the Duomo. (around 20 min walk i think)BDW - it is located in the centre so outside the hotel you can take a bike on the street from the bicycle rental station.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for two nights whilst in Milan and our high hopes for the place have been unfortunately dashed. After reading TA reviews, we expected a 4 star hotel and on arrival, we got it! The hotel is beautifully presented, with helpful staff to help you with anything from restaurant recommendations to booking a taxi, both of which we did whilst staying. However, this is where the good part of the review stops. When we made it to our room on the 3rd floor, we entered a room with an unusual smell, something my girlfriend picked up on first before I did shortly after. We opened the window and went about our business in Milan hoping the smell would go by the time we had returned. It unfortunately hadn’t and we sprayed some perfume to kill the smell as best as we could. It gets better... Milan has been reaching temperatures of 30c this week and the advertised air con was considering by us to be a blessing. However, it didn’t work. We suffered this until midnight when we couldn’t take it any longer and called out maintenance, who to their credit, came quickly. After realising the vent to the air con was closed, we thought it would be okay. It wasn’t, the air con had as much puff as an asthmatic blowing up balloons and my asthmatic girlfriend would know! Finally, we found the limited breakfast choices to be abysmal and what we expected on first impressions of a 4 star striving to be a 5 star, has unfortunately ended in a 2 star rating instead. It’s such a shame considering we had high hopes too
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After cancelled and delayed flights, we finally arrived at the hotel in the early hours of the morning, quick check in and into the room with no issues. We had a double room on the 3rd floor, which was fairly small but no issues with that as we weren't planning to spend a lot of time in the room. The room was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed, facing the road with great views of the city.As some reviews have said the road can be quite noisy, despite soundproofing and there is noise from adjoining rooms and from the metro but nothing that is worth complaining about.Breakfast was good, service was good, staff were very polite and helpful. There is a metro station right outside the hotel which is great for getting around the city.One plus was after arriving back to the hotel after a long hot day there was a bottle of chilling champagne and fruit waiting for us in the room, which was swiftly finished off. I did mention it was our anniversary so may have been for that or our very late check in, whichever it was very much appreciated.Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Milan, which is a great place to see.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Could not ask for more!! The hotel has a perfect situation (5min ride from central station), the breakfast is very good, the spa is everything you need after a long day visiting Milano, the rooms are being renewed so if you are lucky enough (as we were) you’ll get the chance to stay in an amazing brand new room and finally the most important thing: the workers of the hotel are amazing!! I would totally recommend it!!
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was walking distance to the shopping street Via della Spiga and convenient location with a lot of shops and restaurants around. The Duomo cathedral was just 3 subway stops away. We were surprise and happy to receive pretty roses when we were checking in, it was a warm gestures from the hotel. There was also a supermarket nearby which make shopping for chocolate a bliss. Although the ambulance passing by in the middle of night was causing some disturbance, we still enjoyed our stay there.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a week in this hotel and it's very good. The quality of the room and the breakfast buffet make it one of the best hotel I have been to in Milan. It's in a great location as Porta Venezia is central enough to be able to walk to the historic center of Milan, while far enough to not be among tourists. It's very well connected (trams, metro and trains) as well as at a walkable distance to the station (Milano Centrale).I didn't rate it as excellent as I was in an aisle of the hotel where smoking was allowed; hating the smell of cigarette, it was a very negative point for me to smell it in the corridor while leaving my room (even though it was not super strong). I am going back there again.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow what can I say, we stayed for 2 nights checked in on 24th April and the reception staff could not do enough for us. I had contacted the reservation manager before arrival to see if anything special could be done for my daughter as this was a surprise present for her 21st, I am so glad I did as we got an upgraded room free use of the spa and gym and also a little gift in the room. We also received a free rose each on arrival which was really nice. The breakfast was good and the room beautiful. We had a wonderful couple of days and would definitely recommend this hotel. It is also in a very good location for getting around MilanElizabeth Liverpool England
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have booked the hotel through booking.com back in february. We booked a suite as we are a family with 2 small kids. Room was available and got the confirmation from both the reception and from booking.com, 1 day prior the arrival, suddenly the suite wasn´t available and we were ask to move hotel, but due the fact that my husband, should have run the Milano marathon, we kindly denied. Well a lucky guest got the junior suite we booked in february, probably a frequent guest, that last minute just show up and got his will... We got a room with a window facing a wall.. yes.. correct! a wall ... i mean there was a space between the window and the wall .. but still facing the a wall I was quite disappoint, from how a managing, could even think of "degarde" a guest from a junior suite from the top floor to a ground floor facing a wall. When we confront the reception... they gave us an email, for future booking ... for what??***********Despite this awful room, the check in was great and the touch of giving a red rose it´s unique touch. The staff has always been kind and smiling a true italian style thank you.Even at the restaurant, lovely staff. Thank you also for the late check out to all the marathons runners, it was highly appreciated :) well done PRO: close to the metro, P.ta Venezia and Corso Buenos Aires are great shopping area.****Breakfast was also very disappoint.. lovely the touch with fresch orange juice .. but otherwise, i have seriuosly seen better considering the 4 **** of the hotel. it´s basic nothing to complain but again ... it was very blend, and basic... fresch homemade cakes ( and not buy ) or delicius briosches italian style could be served, instead of the small frozen one ... Overall, I will not suggest this hotel to my friends, I am sorry, but the stunt that was made for the room was a huge mistake and truly disappointment .. you might not care, as it´s "only"one customer ... but i hope you do care.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the staff are incredibly friendly, helpful knowledgeableand patient nothing is too much for them combine this with quality rooms which are kept to the highest standard and a fantastic location this is the perfect hotel and the spa is fab too i cannot recommend it highly enough
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i stayed here couple of years back and still like it, the location was perfect and the room was really nice, we have the room facing the city, the staff was really funny.... i love the spa... although you have to pay 15 eur but you get some goodies, which is nice..... i really enjoy the sauna and cooling down roon, i love this place!!
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Worldhotel Cristoforo Colombo oozes old world charm in modern Milan. Located just on top of a metro stop, it is a well-run and friendly place to stay. Front desk is efficient and professional. The main lobby, with a bar and snacks, is a comfortable place to have a relaxing drink. Breakfasts are plentiful and hotel is in the middle of a lively restaurant and shopping area. My only quibble would be with the size of the rooms -- I stayed there twice in one week (before going and after returning from Lake Como). Granted, I booked a single room each time. They were well-appointed but very small. Luckily the high ceilings helped. But the bed took up most of the space. Still, I'd come here again and would recommend it to others. It also has a spa on premises that looks awfully nice although I didn't use it.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked here, because one of my friend told stayed before. The hotel is in a good location, need to pay for parking 30 Euro per night a close by garage. However, the breakfast was not well organized. I was traveling with my family, and we asked for omelette. Unfortunately they can not cook even we wanted pay for it. That was odd for a 4 star hotel.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very polite and helpful, rooms very comfortable, breakfast is very good with great choice. Free mini bar for soft drinks and tasty Milan chocolates on pillow in evening was an added touch. Good location for Metro into town centre, just a few stops, entrance a few steps from hotel. Or short 20 minute walk into town. Old fashioned tram stop nearby too, which we took for short trip. Very busy street outside, so ask for an inside room if you are a light sleeper.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my third stay in this Hotel with my Family for 6 days and my stay was comfortable, the hotel staff are friendly and very polite and the room was clean with excellent view but I had a problem managing the heating system and the AC, the mini bar is free and they will refill it daily for free, complementary bottles of water are provided with coffee, tea and milk.the bathroom is spacious and very clean, the room view was on Crosso Benues Aires and the window prevented the street noise.the breakfast was so fresh with variety of food and the restaurant staff are very friendly but I had one problem that the restaurant allows pets to enter which will increase the risk of getting sick.the reception staff are the best, they talk fluent English and they helped us with our requirements and I must mention Mr. Alessandro who helped us and guided us when my daughter got sick.the lobby is very quite and suitable for business meetings and relaxation in your tea time.I will definitely come back to Cristoforo Colombo ..... Thank you
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is very well located near the "Quadrilatero della Moda" (fashion streets in Milan), the service is very good and I found the hotel very comfortable. I loved the chance to have a casual meeting in the inner courtyard, under a awesome sky!Also the terrace of my room was good to take a breath an plein air.My visit was very fast my pleasant!
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well what Can I say except to say this hotel was amazing. The staff were truly lovely and went out of there way to help. breakfast was superb and plentiful, the bed comfy which is always a plus we will return
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled around Europe staying in mostly 4-5 star hotels like Hilton Berlin, ParkCity Grand Plaza in London etc so this is what I’m comparing our stays to.First impression - the building is in a great locatjon on a busy shopping street that is only two metro stops from the city centre or you can walk there within 20-25 minutes. The building front is grand and hard to miss.Lobby is elegant and spacious.We were upgraded to a slightly larger room which was very spacious and has plenty of storage space, a nice bathroom with toilet and bidet. Pros- location is fabulous. 200m from the metro station. This metro station goes to all lines on the metro system- spacious rooms- English speaking staff who are kind and helpful- good value for money- turn down service - Roberto Cavalli toiletries- robes and slippers - large LG flat screen- double beds (a lot of places in Europe have two single beds put together) - Complimentary minibar restocked daily including Heineken beers and small bottles of spirits, snacks, water and juices (complimentary!) - wifi everywhere (and no hoops to jump through like signing up or logging in your room number etc. you just login and it works) Really brilliant hotel and great value for what you get. I’m going to argue that it’s really a 5 star hotel at 4 star prices. Definitelt staying again.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights over weekend in December for concert and sightseeing.Hotel was great, staff friendly and helpful and near to everything we wanted to see.Will definitely stay there again if ever going back to Milan.
hotelName:
2    WORLDHOTEL Cristoforo Colombo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Genuinely, a unique hotel with a service to rival any other. It’s a fabulous boutique residence, with a quirky design. If you want a ‘standard’ group hotel and room, this place is not for you. It’s original in design and perfectly comfortable. The staff are second to none and can’t do enough to help. The breakfast is a wonder - they have everything and if you really can’t find what you’re after, they pretty much will make anything for you. The location is perfect too - just a short walk from a fabulous park, the main shopping area and the Duomo.Overall, I’d make this my base any time I visit Milan. Simply can’t go wrong.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay here, on our arrival front the valet to the front desk staff they make you welcome.The hotel itself is as you see in the photos.We checked into our room very well decorated and you feel like tlyou are in a fairy tale.We ate in their restaurant the first night again the staff are fabulous, so friendly and professional.I must give a special thank you to the lady bartender who was excellent, she really made our stay with her lovely cocktails and conversation.The hotel is a short walk to the city centre maybe 15 minutes.We fould a very nice bar/restaurant close to the hotel, as you come out take a left cross the road, its about 3 minutes down the road.We had a wonderful time staying here and if back in Milan we would definitely stay here again.Thank you to all your staff for a great week's vacation.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an excellent stay at Chateu Monfort. The hotel is wonderfully decorated and the staff were splendid from check in, in the restaurant and bar, right through to check out. Thanks for helping our honeymoon start so well!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, cute and stylish rooms, excellent breakfast (just impossible to find that good in Milano) and silent rooms make this hotel very appealing and the reviews do justice to it. Will visit again.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Milan was just a stop on the way to other places in Italy for me. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I loved how I could block out all light to sleep well. The staff were lovely. There is construction all the way up and down the street which did not distract my sleep but distracted from the beauty of the area. It will be well worth it when gardens in front are complete. There is a grocery near by but not many restaurants within walking distance for supper but many breakfast places within walking distance.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and welcoming staff. Great breakfast food range and services. Beautiful lobby area and intimate imperial vibe. Rooms are intimate and inspIred design. Very close to walk by to the shopping area and center of the city. Make sure you drop by for at least two nights!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A gem in Milan made more precious by the high standard and quality of services provided by Stefano and his amazing team. Thank you to Alberto who attended to us immediately after our 21 hours flight, and to Martina and other beautiful ladies for their patience and knowledge in answering our queries, and to Madi who made us laugh and reminded us of our moscato, and to Hussain and the guards and other staff for all their help. Our room is clean, modern with a touch of magic. The breakfast is sensational and dinner exquisite. The secret part of this hotel is its enchanting and relaxing spa. We have a great time and look forward to coming back again. Thank you for making our first trip to Milan such a wonderfully positive experience.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was extraordinary, from the staff to the hotel quality. The staff, from the receptionists at the front desk to the staff at the bar and restaurant, made our stay at this hotel enjoyable and extremely warm; they made us feel at home and would help with whatever was needed. They made excellent recommendations to several restaurants throughout the city that we never would have found on our own. They went above and beyond whenever we requested anything, and we can’t say enough about everyone’s friendly attitudes. Stefano the general manager has done an excellent job with his team at Chateau Monfort!! Located within walking distance of the heart of Milan, the hotel itself was beautiful and unique, with its classic decor. We have never seen any hotel like this, and would highly recommend anyone here!!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night with my son for a short break in Milan. Faultless stay. Despite arriving early in the morning a room was made available for us much earlier than expected. Delicious breakfast, wonderful spacious room and the spa was perfect too. Fantastic service too.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is Wonderful 5 star in every way!!From check in to check out service was amazing!We arrived late and the reception greeted us, giving complimentary drinks and took our cases to the room!The room was beautiful, a large room with an amazing free standing bath and everything you could need, all toiletries, many towels, wardrobe, safe, nesspresso coffee machine, waters, WiFi, tv, slippers, everything!You can even request GHD hair straighteners!The bar area is stunning! Like a fairytale as is the hotel.The spa is complimentary and WOW! Sauna, Turkish bath, huge various showers, a salt water pool and relaxation room with free hot and cold drinks.bath robes, towels, flip flops, all toiletries provided again!!All staff were absolutely amazing and caring.Fantastic location, just a walk or quick tram to the Duomo cathedral and shops.Highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay again.Thank you :)
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most beautiful hotel. Decor was amazing. They have thought of everything. The service was the best I had ever experienced. I didnt want to leave. The staff recommended a great restaurant and perfect place to spend our holiday in Milan. Really 5 star hotel.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best place for family! Also good for business. The service is what 5 star service should be. The rooms are well kept and fairytale like without being tacky. I highly recommend it.The hotel restaurant in the bar is also quite good. It is a place that exceeds expectation
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an amazing hotel. The hotel is quirky but charming. I was worried based on the photos. It is absolutely lovely! They could not have been more kind. The turn down service was amazing? I put out the sign and very quickly the room would be cleaned. I never once had to complain ever about the room. The connecting rooms were brilliantly designed! This is a gem that deserves praise!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and had 2 connecting rooms.At arrival we asked for help to find a wash and fold that we could give our laundry since we have been traveling for a while with kids. They offered the laundry service at the hotel and we specifically said that we are looking for a much cheaper service.They send us to a place near by, we gave our laundry and they charged us $210 for a load of laundry!!!!We were shocked. We were very specific about what we were looking for.At the laundry place they didn’t speak English and we had to trust what the hotel told us.I asked to speak with a manager, none was at the hotel at that time. In the morning I spoke with a manager who basically told me that this are the prices!!!I told him that we are not from Italy and asked for help to find a place that is a good fit for us.The manager told me that he will see what he can do and at check out he did nothing.I told him that are leaving the hotel very upset. He didn’t seem to care.Other than that the hotel is nice with a good breakfast but we will not be returning.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We liked very much the set up/decor at Chateau M, but it gets negative from the check in when your room is not ready and they demand an extra 35 EUR for having the car per day! In terms of the fee it is simply not acceptable and brings you in a bad mood from the very beginning. We asked where we could eat while they were fixing the room and they did not know here there were a pizzaria!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful hotel in Milan. The lobby is whimsical, we will always linger around for a few minutes, such a joy to be there. And to enjoy some of their complimentary sweet treats (lollipops, dried fruits, detox water, gums and sweets)We stayed in the Junior Suite connecting to another room ( Executive Category) spacious and perfect in every way. Just note, that some room has an open shower concept, do let them know your preference. In the Suite there is a Nespresso machine and they give you Diptyque Paris shampoo and shower gel. And free movie channel (MBC), usually you won’t find anything to watch on TV except for CNN. Complimentary drinking water is provided everyday and there is Evening turndown service. Breakfast at the restaurant was a treat, beautiful place, delicious food and great coffee and tea. (no additional charge for cappuccino or juice etc)The true gem of the hotel is Mr Stefano and his team. We have certain dietary requirements and several requests due to my mother’s condition and the team fulfilled all of them without any hesitation. A solid team indeed. The concierge what’s app chat is great, the team provided very good recommendations of restaurants and places to visit. They will also provide you with pocket WiFi. The gym and the small salt water pool which also has sauna and steam room was good. Is about 15 mins walk to Duomo area (this is where all the malls and attractions) and nearby (3 mins walk) there is a U2 supermarket. Would definitely be back to Milan just to experience Chateau Monfort awesome hospitality. Thank you to Mr Stefano and his team for making our stay perfect and magical.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just beautiful, every room and common area has been thoughtfully decorated. Staff really friendly and helpful. Great location, drinks at the bar were really expensive (even for Milan) but we would still love to visit again.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we pulled up in our car, to our host at check in, right through to service staff at breakfast, dinner and the bar, and the spa and staff were very accommodating. All staff knowledge, service and smiles were faultless. The hotel “story” and Alice features make it that much more special and certainly well worth the stay. Beautiful hotel.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: impressive decoration, with art decó inspirations, same in the common areas as in the room (i had the very cozy room 110). i superb job of design and good taste.ratherthan describing, i suggest to have a look at the photos of the hotel: be sure that what you see in the hotel gallery is not as good as the realitythe location is ok, but not the best in milan: an elegant residential area, 20 minutes walking (or 10 minutes by taxi) from the duomo area) and there are not too many good restaurants aroundthe staff was helpfull and politethe room had a big safety box, a minibar with a not so impressive variety, very good bed and pillows, a kettle and some instant coffee and tea supplies, a small balcony, a very well equipped bathroom with good amenities and an impressive shower with glass walls which together with real good taste in the decoration bcame impressive and made us porget that there was no wardrobe, no cupboards, no shelves....the free wifi was very goodthe spa is really charming and should not be missed when staying in this hotelthe breakfast was an excellent buffet with really good scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, different cheese, pastries, juices, yogourths, sweets... although the service could be more proactive and carefull in orderto attend the guests needs (a brief explanation of the buffet upon the guest arrival, more coffee when needing, punctual withdrawal of used plates, having salami cut at the buffet area, faster refilling of plates....). besides 5 persons family (apparently form usa, according to their accent) dressed as if they had just arrived from the gym was allowed in the breakfast room; that does not match with the category of the placethe restaurant was good, with very good service, but too expensive for what was offereddogs are accepted for free no carpark in the place. valet parking costs 35 euros and a 20 minutes advice is requested to have your car in placemy complain refers to the air conditioned: despite it was not a warm day, the temperature at the room by 4 pm was 25 dg. c. after my complain to the receptionist, he said he would fix it from his end, but after a while, the temperature finally went to 27 and did not decrease till the night. bad air conditioned is very usual in italian hotels, but you cannot expect it in a hotel of this categorydespite of not so good service at the breakfast and this problem with the air conditioned, i will return to this hotel as soon as i can and instead of one night, i will try to stay 2 or 3 nights. the price is not cheap, but one feels that something unique is received
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A heartfelt thank you to all the staff at Chateau Monfort. My wife and I enjoyed an extended Easter weekend here and couldn’t compliment the hotel and staff enough. Nothing was too much trouble and every question/request was greeted with a smile and genuine warmth.I’d like to make a special mention to Toni the bartender who made me a Negroni and a Whiskey old fashioned the likes of which I have never tasted as good before or possibly never will - such a talented polite barman whose career no doubt will rocket in the future.I’d also like to thank Stefano, whom I only learnt on leaving the hotel was the General Manager. On our first day he was sat at the concierge desk so we presumed he was the concierge. Every day Stefano greeted us with such warmth and enthusiasm and at no point felt compelled to tell us that he was the GM which I found incredibly humbling and genuine. It’s no wonder all the staff are so friendly and happy with Stefano at the helm - thank you for looking after us. We hope to visit you again as soon as possible.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful hotel over Easter. In terms of service delivery and offering a "personal touch", this is probably one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. Stefano and his team went out of their way to ensure we felt comfortable and offered great suggestions for dinner/things to do whilst we were there. We felt they were genuinely interested in their guests and special mention should also go to Julia and Roberto, who were also incredibly helpful and professional. Highly recommended and will be our go-to place to stay in Milan.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: each room is designed interestingly and with such care! the service is great and the location is very centric! try to eat there as well- the staff is great, not the usual attitude that one often finds in these big cities...
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved every minute of staying at this fantastic hotel. It had a lovely feel and we loved the ambiance of the place; from the Alice in Wonderland theme to the spa facilities. We were made to feel very special throughout our stay and everybody who works at the hotel deserves a big congratulations for being so friendly and accommodating. We loved the little extra touches that they included to make our stay so memorable. The food was amazing and everything was tasty. We used the spa, which is set downstairs in the basement; it was so quiet and peaceful. We didn't realise that this hotel was part of a group called Relais & Chateax, if this is anything to go by then I think we have found a new group for our travel plans. Thank you for making our honeymoon stay so special... it really was a lovely end to our Italy experience and you made it memorable. We will be back again.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is excellent. It has a quiet and personal feel to it. Our room was quiet and well kept.Most importantly, the staff was excellent. We needed advice and help with taxis and other transportation, and it was all cheerfully arranged, even as they worked on the Easter holiday.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a stunning renovated palace with loads of charm and character!!! The reception and bar area are simply beautiful, starting from the scent and finishing in every little detail... Drinks are quite pricey but that’s the norm for this area of Milan. Breakfast is fantastic with really quality produce...again pricey but you won’t find much cheaper in the area...The spa area is very small but a beautiful place to unwind after a day walking... The decoration is reminiscent of a roman palace and it stays open until 11at night which was a bonus!Staff is really nice, helpful and accommodating.The rooms are small but beautifully appointed and again full of fairytale charm.Location is excellent, only a 15 minute stroll to the Duomo in an area full of designer boutiques, so most places can be reached by foot... public transport is very efficient...there s a tram stop 2 minutes from the hotel that takes you straight to the centrale station.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Special thanks to Mr. Stefano Risole, Julia and Alberto for their kindness, and attention to our family and our kids. They have made our 3-night stay at the Chateau an unforgettable and wonderful experience!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From check in to check out and all in between you can't compare the efficient and high level of service at this hotel. The staff couldn't have done more to make our stay pleasant and comfortable. The decore of the hotel is out of this world! Thank you... we will certainly be back to stay with you
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely adored this hotel. We've stayed in many hotels in Milan, often priced much higher than Chateau Monfort, and this was by far my favourite. The decor is tranquil. The staff attentive. The bed perfect. The bar a perfect way to end a day. Thank you for a wonderful stay in truly every way.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First visit to Milan and this was the perfect place to stay. Great location some 15 mins from main Duomo.Extremely relaxing with very comfortable rooms. Above all staff extremely enthusiastic and professional. We walked everywhere from here including Navigli Grande. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy with the service and comforts at Chateau Montfort. It’s a unique environment. The breakfast was magnificent, the beds very comfortable, the service couldn’t be better, and the spa was relaxing.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a beautifully refurbished historic building that perfectly fits into the elegant city of Milan. The location is very convenient within a short walking distance from the city centre and the main sights. There are also plenty of restaurants and bars nearby.Our room was nicely decorated and looked out the courtyard which we very much appreciated as we did not hear any noise from the street.The reason why I deducted one star is that there was hardly any storage in the room. There was no proper wardrobe, just half of an antique wardrobe trunk with 2 small drawers. Same applies to the bathroom; there wasn't any shelfing provided for one's own stuff. I found this a bit disappointing as in my opinion, you shouldn't be forced to live out of your suitcase in a 5-star hotel unless you chose to do so.The staff was very nice and helpful. We also used the valet parking which working out fine.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent and best place , staff so kind and very helpful very nice location near duomo the hotel is so special and amazing the lobby and the spa are very beautiful the decoration was so classy and the smell over all was excellent
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is not one bit of service lacking at Chateau Monfort. From the moment we booked our stay, the staff was incredibly helpful. My husband exchanged numerous emails with the staff to set up restaurants and tours. When we got to the hotel, we were bleary-eyed and terribly jet-lagged. The front desk staff found a room for us to nap in and refresh ourselves until our room was ready. I have never had a hotel do that for me-ever. The beds were comfortable; the rooms and bathrooms were immaculately clean. The staff was fantastic. I wish I could recall the names of the front desk staff because they were so compassionate and helpful. Alberto helped my husband plan a great day at Lake Como and saved us a lot of money with his advice. The bartender made a drink for me that was just delicious. The staff really made our weekend in Milan memorable.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chateau Monfort is a master piece of restoration and adaptation to the modern requisites demanded from a top hotel.I found its location perfect! Very close to Quadrilatero della Moda, Duomo and Victorio Emmanuele but not as close as you have the urban crowd disturbing you. The square in front of the hotel is under severe repair what takes a bit the magic of this nice building and meanwhile the elegant and friendly staff tries to stuff-in for that ;-)At last...my wife told me....good that we found out our place in Milano....as simple as that!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even if we have a choice, we are coming regularly to the Chateau because we are not a number here, because the "boss" Stefano Risolè is taking care of us, because the room 404 is our favourite, because we can personalize our breakfast and indulge, because there is always an event here. Be assured you do not get boring.Thank you guys, keep the pace and loving service and you will have our fidelity. Promise.G&B Novelli, Geneva, Switzerland
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay with first class service. Lovely decor and ambiance. A special mention to the manager Stefano who from start to finish went out of his way to look after us. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Château Monfort is a very good place to stay at: very nice rooms, extremely efficient and nice staff , a great spa and small indoor pool to relax after a long day of touring and the restaurant for dinner is top quality . Not a "grand lobby " type of hotel if this is what you are looking for , yet the same service but friendlier, we spent a week there and were sorry we had to leave ! Will definitely go back there. , and the location is perfect .
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very beautiful hotel in the center of Milan. Walking distance to the Duomo. Rooms very spacious and cured into the smallest details. Breakfast Buffet is very rich and everything you desire you can find. You really feel like Alice in Wonderland in this Hotel.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Relais & Chateaux hotel just 15 minutes walk to Duomo is well worth a visit. The attention to detail in every aspect was outstanding with a highly visible General Manager, Stefano.As someone who through his work regularly inspects top quality hotels i would have no hesitation recommending this very atmospheric hotel.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel, very different from the mainstream, rooms clean, a good size (executive) and the staff were great. Service a bit slow in the bar, but would stay again. It’s location is perfect, 10 min walk to Duomo, tram stop outside so ideal for getting about.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This refurbished 19th century palazzo is a living testimony of Rococo style. It awakens memories of those days where beauty and good taste still mattered in everyday life. The floral motif is ubiquitous throughout the hotel, in lobbies, restaurants, facades. Fresh cut flowers adorn hallways at each floor and on dining tables. Most of interior is decorated in soft pastel colours dotted with floral patterns. Although our room is quite small, the designer made efficient use of limited space. Each piece of furniture and fixture is well coordinated to maximise comfort and utility. Housekeeping team is exceptional, and paid meticulous attention to guests’ individual needs. This hotel is located at a chic neighbourhood with numerous bars and trattoria to suit different tastes and budgets. The Duomo is not exactly within walking distance, but one can always ride the tram right outside, and takes about 15 minutes.Special thanks to Carolina, Silvia and all the rest of crew for outstanding service. I absolutely enjoyed my stay
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a charming hotel! It’s just beautiful from the moment you see the giant rustic pink mansion of a building, to the doors always being held open by a friendly greeter into the hotel. The pastel fairytale decor whisks you off into an air of Alice in Wonderland, complete with glass jars filled with penny sweets for your indulgence, images of a white bunny on all of their literature and a beautiful white baby grand piano on display in the bar. The welcome is warm and friendly and the rooms are elegant and pretty in an ever so functional way with your every need prethought of and catered for. The spa is definitely worth a visit. So relaxing and unusual in its display.Just a 15minute stroll has you in the heart of the city at the cathedral, so location wise its great. A metro station is currently being built directly outside (not that you would notice from inside the hotel), so this will be a welcomed added amenity to this hotels location. Food, drink, all was an absolute dream. An all round charming place.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location about 20 minutes walk from the very centre of Milan and the Duomo. We stayed in a twin room on the first floor, which had its own small balcony overlooking the road. Our room was small but well-equipped with a large wardrobe, safe, minibar and a kettle with teas and coffee, and the room was themed in keeping with the Alice in Wonderland design of the hotel. The bathroom was really nice, with a rainfall shower over a large bath. Climate control in the room was very good. They have a menu of extra items you can order from reception which they'll bring you, which included ghd hair straighteners and travel plug adaptors, which was really handy.On arrival, the checkout staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We were given a complimentary drink in the hotel bar, which is a very pretty room. As part of our stay, we were also given access to the spa, which has a small pool, sauna, steam room and 'emotional shower' (no, me neither). The spa is really beautifully designed and well worth a visit. My only gripe with the hotel is that the mattresses are quite old and hard. You can feel the springs jutting out of it, which really isn't ideal for a 5-star hotel. I would definitely stay here again, providing that the beds are updated. You get a lot more for your money here than in comparable 5-stars I've stayed in (I didn't once feel like there were 'extras' I was constantly being charged for), so I would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was amazing identical to the images on the website. The staff were very attentive and friendly, always around to help if needed. Breakfast was a huge selection of various foods. The spa facilities were great and very quiet. 15min walk from the duomo, an ideal location to explore. Without a doubt this is a 5 star hotel. The only negative I have, was that the bed mattress’s were a little harder than I like, but would never mark this hotel down. Danny
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sisters and I have just spent 4 nights at this amazing hotel and we have been so indulged. The high standard commenced when we arrived early in the morning after 24 hours of travel and were warmly greeted by Olena. She settled us in with a lovely coffee as our check in was organised. The entire process was efficient and smooth. She also organised some tours for us and explained the train timetables as we wanted to visit our relatives. Nothing was too much trouble.We then had a hearty breakfast with loads of choices. There was something for every taste, sweet and savoury. The food was high quality, fresh and well presented. All the staff here deserve credit as they make you feel special and welcome whenever they see you. Rosanna our waitress was always smiling and so friendly. Anita on Reception was a font of knowledge as well and couldn’t do enough for us.The house keepers work their magic everyday. Even when you have left your room in chaos.The property is just stunning. It is well maintained and elegant. There are lovely mirrors everywhere, gorgeous light fittings and plaster decorations on the bedroom walls. It’s Italian design at its very best.Stefano this property is a delight and you should be very proud of it and your entire team. They clearly follow your lead.We will definitely be back and will highly recommend the hotel to family and friends.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was excellent: clean and quiet room, fabulous breakfast, smiling staff. The hotel is only fifteen minutes walk from the center of Milan and ten minutes drive from the Central Railway Station.We shall obviously recommend the Chateau Monfort to our friends and if we go to Milan we shall stay also here!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ... enchanting!Such a lovely, cute and warm place to stay after business activity or some leisure time in a freezing Milan.Staff is absolutely at your disposal; always gentle and smiling, they fullfill any wish you may have. Dreamy rooms, designed in different styles; dining rooms with boiserie everywhere.. so charming.. so warm. Breakfast impeccable.Downtown is ten minutes away on walk. Well friends, to cut a story short, don't miss this gem if you are around here.I swear I was a guest even though (reading back) my review may seem written by an hotel employee ah ah ah.Soooooo loooooong
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was comfortable and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was well equipped with good towels. We found a bowl of fruit, a full bottle of sparkling white wine and a half bottle of chianti to welcome us.We had a good dinner in the restaurant, but the breakfast was standout. I have seldom seen such a wide choice and so beautifully displayed. Above all the service throughout was excellent and very friendly. If you are driving, the stopping area is a bit difficult to find because of building works - it is right on the corner by the traffic lights.If I have a quibble, €35 is a lot to pay for parking.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional decoration, good location, good gym, best spa that i have been so far, great staff and wonderful breakfast, for the value of the money it is the best in milan , in fact i believe no one can be better even if u pay more, just one little advice for the staff because ill come again and i want everything perfect :p , after midnight menu should be better
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The team, the service, the rooms, the breakfast - everything was impeccable!We fly into Milano on the way to see family in the north of Italy... Now that we have found Chateau Monfort, we will never stay anywhere else.Absolutely wonderful :)
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights & couldn’t have wished for more. Super room & facilities. Excellent restaurant & staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. A brilliant hotel, just a short walk from a Metro station & very good restaurants.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Husband and I stayed here for our anniversary trip! We did tons of research before finalizing this hotel. Upon arrival, the staff was very welcoming and sweet :) Throughout our stay, the staff was generous, kind and helpful! With that said, we did run into a few issues but management went above and beyond for us to make things right. My Husband and I were impressed with management’s interest in our concerns and the eagerness to resolve those concerns to our full satisfaction. Honestly, in a city as commercialized as Milan, we were absolutely stunned to come across this gem of a hotel where guest experience is above all else. They really take an interest in your stay and satisfaction. Aside form their stellar service, the hotel is also centrally located (close to attractions, shopping and public transportation). I definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
