review_body: Very, very nice and absolutely super interesting Hotel, perfect central location , very best to the Dome, absolutely super service, nice supermotivated team, super breakfast and nice dinner ( ok. - Not absolutely fantastisch but nice ,- price absolutely worth ....
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Haven't a bad word to say about this hotel - the reviews for this place are spot on. 5 star hotel that feels like a 5 star hotel, staff, ambience and service all top class. Milan's not really my scene ( too many shops, although my wife liked that), but we are already considering a return trip, on the basis I can get this hotel again, that's how much we enjoyed our stay here.
hotelName:
3    Chateau Monfort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had to book for full previous day only for 3 hours inspite of making specific request. I had 5 nights booking & my International Flight reached at 8am & I reached Hotel at 9am. Since I had to attend an important meeting & to get ready only paid full one day charge of €160.I am also regular member of this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent five nights at the Radisson Blu hotel while attending an International Lions Convention. Our room was very spacious and nicely cooled by an efficient air conditioner. The hotel was very quiet and with the cool air sleep came easily. We found the front desk staff efficient and helpful both at check in and check out. We had no surprises on our bill. On our second last night we asked one of the staff if there was a store close by that sold gelato. She searched on the internet, found two places within walking distance and printed a map for us to use. We truly appreciated her help. We had breakfast three times in the hotel restaurant and dinner once. The buffet at breakfast was great. The food was of excellent quality and there was great variety. While the hotel was a bit out of the centre, this allowed us an opportunity to explore the local neighbourhood when we returned from our sessions at the MiCo centre. We found a convenience store, a great restaurant, grocery store and as mentioned earlier a gelateria, all of which we patronized. We enjoyed our stay immensely.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were told when we came that everything was payed for but when we checked out we had to pay around €250 extra for the rooms. The reception argues and say you are always wrong, even the lady that told us everything was pre paid said we were lying. Hotel room is not impressive, a lot of dust and everywhere in the hotel has very bad wifi! The hotel is located far from the city centre, it takes minimum 40min in to city centre. So for your own good, do not stay at this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful Boutique hotel. This is one of the few facilities in Milan that extends a block and is not covered in graffiti job well done. The staff were friendly and courteous. I did have problem at check out the spoiled my 6 day stay at this hotel. I was quoted in writing that my single room for 2 would be 179.50 euro and was charged 215 euros and was told I had a double room which I was unaware of. The staff would not honour the contract. Which cost $53 Canadian dollar/day EXTRA.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we came to Milano for one day. the hotel is good but for us location was distant. breakfast was very good. staff was helpful. sauna and indoor pool were nice and "on time" as we were after a walking vacation.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to Milan before and thought I’ d visit with my daughters. The hotel has really good personnel and they are all really friendly. The room was big. Bathroom a bit dated and difficult to get the shower temperature to work but fine. Expensive snacks in the room and no wine in the fridge. I regretted booking a hotel out of the underground zone and spent way too much on taxis, confusing tram and buss schedules and directions. Thats not the hotels fault but it was not easy to be out of town. Hotel was nice and quiet and the area is fine and calm. I guess it depends what you want. Next time I ll book within metro.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked the hotel in general but it’s located a bit far from the city center. The area itself is fine. The water in the pool was cold. There were no bathrobes in the room but it might depend on the room I booked.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay in many hotels on business and for leisure - and I was most impressed by this one! Located on the edge of Milan, the bedrooms were medium sized but recently refurbished and excellently appointed. Mine had a the usual large screen TV, free fast internet, good desk for working , large double bed, mini bar, tea/coffee facilities, hair drier and a superb bathroom with a large walk in shower - but sadly, no bath. Reception check in was fast and friendly with good English spoken. Breakfast was efficient and very varied with good service and lots of choice. The meeting rooms were large, well appointed and well supported by good service. A great place to do business - although about 30 minutes from Malpensa and a 100 euro taxi ride!
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotels in Milan, very clean rooms ,big rooms , comfortable bed , pillows, fully provided with whatever you need. Breakfast is good there are most important things (can be more) , public transportation ( tram is 1 min away , train is 5 min, no metro around) , very kind staff . Price is reasonable. I strongly recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property is on the outskirts of main city or central city. It's quite after 8-9 pm. The neighboring area is residential.If you want to enjoy Milan and city life then I would not recommend this hotel because it is far from center and cabs are expensive.This hotel should be used if you are in Milan for trade shows or fashion week etc or during peek season because it's best to airport.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Radisson Blue Hotel is located in Via Villapizzone in the outskirts of Milan. There is practically nothing around the hotel, like shops (except grocery like a PAM) or restaurants. It is well connected via Bus (57), via train and via tram. The average time to get into Milan is around 30-40 minutes by bus or by tram. The Nr 57 is very regular and it takes you quite central. However, when we booked the hotel, we were looking for a hotel near the San Siro stadion. We even called up the hotel to ask if it was near the stadion and we were told that it was near and easy to get there from the hotel and back. Now, if you look at the map, from a distance perspective its misleading, because it appears close. If you have to take the public transports, it becomes challenging and it might take you more than 30-40 minutes to get to San Siro (and more to get back). By taxi it might be easier on the way there, but impossible on the way back, as you won’t find any.The room we were given (a standard room), was run down, with stains on the walls, on the lamps, mold in the bathroom, the bathroom door all dented and moldy. They are currently refurbishing the rooms and we were offered to upgrade our room for EUR 70 more to a refurbished room with an included breakfast. However, when I asked if we could just get a free upgrade of the room without the breakfast (in order to avoid exactly this kind of situation), we were told that there weren’t any left! ;)Staff is however very friendly. Would I return to this hotel or recommend it? I would certainly recommend other more centrally located hotels which will take you the same time to get into San Siro. All in all, it was a ‘ok’ experience as we did not spend much time in the room.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and offer great equipments.However, the hotel is outside the city. I would suggest that you take a hotel closer to the city (even if you have to pay more but less transportation costs to spend per day).Moreover, at night, there was a lot of noise in the corridors.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good quality hotel, friendly staff & very helpful, can’t fault the staff. Out of way from central Milan but easy transport links. No problem. Downside was Pool was cold & changing facilities poor. Carpet in room had stains of damp by the door. Overall experience was good though
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good located hotel if you want to enjoy different parts of milano. you will never have longer than 10-15 minutes to the place you want to go. The neighborhood of the hotel are very old buildings like a social weakness area but like i said with taxi you can get within 7-15 minutes wherever you want in milano. The taxi you can order directly at the reception and it will be there within 2-3 minutes. The price is always around 10-15€ to get in the city.The restaurant is very looking, the service is top with a good knowledge and everyone is very friendly.The problem is that we got cold plates at both days so the food was Unfortunately cold too. and for the price i expect a little bit more.The points that arent so good are the room conditions especially the bathroom has some points that arent clean, like the shower,bathtub and the towels had some dirty spots. For me it doesn't mather how old the rooms are, i expect something from a 4 star hotel.The gym is very good with enough variation. The saunas are very small but thats enough, the spa wasnt visited that much. The water quality of the pool wasnt that good it was like a little bit foggy and not so clean, the drain was dirty to with dirty green spots.The price performance ratio is enough to be good. I will come back soon and hope for a cleaner room, warm food and a cleaner pool area.The rest was good and if the negative points would be positive next time this would be a great hotel!
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've spent 2 weeks there and I had a very pleasant stay. The breakfast is good and with produces of quality. I did not dine there; who wants to pay 15€ for pizza or a dish he can get for half the price nearby ?The only bad point is the TV signal makes you feel like you are back in the 80's and analog TV. Everywhere it's like this (Gym, room, bar). It's just unacceptable. I could also point out that things are damaged left and right in the room or elsewhere... the SPA wasn't working during my stay.Close to the tram (line 12) and the train to MXP or MILAN.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will not stay again in this hotel. It used to be a very nice hotel with a great spa and relaxing area with sauna and hammam on both men and women side, they have gone cheap, and after informing they were "renovating" after a year it is still not the case; They just lied about it and do not offer that service anymore. The swimming pool is not heated anymore and very cold making it impossible to use; The hotel does not as clean as it use to; Personally I will not go there anymore, and do not recommend it to anyone of my followers. Keep posted I will soon listed my new favorite place for Milano but stay away from Radisson Blu
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was such a pleasure to have Christian check us in. We were left stranded when another hotel didn’t want to accomate our reservation. I finally got a hold of this hotel, stating that there was just one Queen room left. We took it because there was no other place to go and my mom had become ill the day before. He noticed how tired we were and was kind enough to give us an extra hour to check out so my mom can sleep.We were trying to figure out how we would sleep with not enough beds, but then we hear a knock at our door- Christian had called the staff to supply us with an extra bed. This was all at the wee hours of 2am!Thank you SO much for your hospitality Christian, you are the standard that many hotels should follow.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After accidentally booking the wrong date (mixed up February and March, oops!) on an nonrefundable, non changeable room, the hotel staff was very helpful in looking for a solution. This finally resulted in a refund. Many thanks; will stay again on my next business trip to Milan!
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Radisson is a very nice 4 star hotel, great staff, easy parking and surprisingly convenient access to the city. We stayed for one night and checked in early. The staff provided excellent service and quickly found a room for us. In our standard room we had the usual mini bar and a coffee maker. Free water, fruit and candy is available in the lobby. WiFi was a bit slow but works great for browsing the internet. The tram (line 12) stops very close to the hotel and takes you straight into town and the cathedral. The hotel can sell you tickets to public transportation or you download the app and buy online. The area around the hotel is quiet and street parking is free.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice staff, very good services, including gym, spa and room service. All a good quality and good fluxibility, the spa and gym close at 11pm and the morning breakfast also end at 11a.Wa a good experience
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice, modern and large bedroom, very well decorated, a bathroom very clean.A good location, only 15 min to the city by train.Tha parking is very usefull!Spa area is very smallThe bar has a good atmosphere
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located close to Villapizzone urban train station and no12 tram (30 mins) to city centre. Very good facilities including pool, spa and steam room. Efficient and very helpful Reception staff. Well appointed rooms. Difficult to sort out room temperature without hotel staff (very helpful). Full breakfast and decent range.Location good for Politechnico di Milano. Limited restaurants / night life close by but trams and trains are very regular.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time I stayed in this hotel. Room 924 for two nights.Nice large clean roomGood kingsize bedMini barLarge shower in a clean bathroomSilent non- smoking roomBar, restaurant and breakfast are okParking available
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a night at the Radisson Blu Hotel and hope we could stay longer. I booked a standard room the day before our stay and I was surprised for the low price. As soon as we got to the hotel, we had a free room upgrade, so we had the chance to stay in their great suite, with one huge bathrooms (bathtub and shower) and an amazing view of the city! We had also the time to enjoy the spa and interior pool (free and open until 11pm)If you use public transports the location is convenient, just 3 minutes walk from a train station, in 20 minutes you can be in the Brera area.After staying in different hotels in Milan, I can say this was the best experience I've ever had and I'll come back for sure.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As al radisson blue hotel, services and rooms are great , but the problem is with it’s location. It is about 5 km away from the active part of the city which made things a little bit difficult, knowing that Milan has a lot of traffic and a bad Uber and taxi service.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here and loved this hotel. The staff were fabulous and room suite was we stayed in was ideal with large luxurious bathroom. The location initially we wondered if would be a little too far from centre but we enjoyed the relaxing location within easy tram ride from centre. Restaurant and facilities were very good too. Great spa and pool along with outdoor drinking area. We went on a leisure break but Highly recommend this hotel and we would return again . Business or pleasure this hotel in Milan should be top of list.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb staff and very good room. overall i had a very good experience staying at this property. the staff was friendly and helpful. They were eager to serve and happy to give me information on how to go about the city.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The breakfast is not of 5 stars hotel, it is 3 stars hotel. small place for having the breakfast, coming after 08:30 , you have to wait outside the restaurant to find empty table, also some items of the breakfast finish without replacement. Restaurant staff is very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely, modern hotel. Nice swimming pool. The room we had was spacious with a large, clean, and modern bathroom. The only problem was that the room was heavily perfumed. We opened the window (which was necessary to cool the room off too since we could not reduce the temperature below 21 degrees). Unfortunately then our 5th floor room filled with mosquitoes.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After many years of travelling I think we have found one of the best hotels ever. We could not fault this hotel. From the first step inside we got excellent service. The check in staff extremely helpful and professional. As we had a very late flight we asked for a late check out but unfortunately they couldn't help but kept our suitcase for the day and offered us facilities to take a shower later on. We could not speak highly enough of all the staff here. A good breakfast with plenty of choices. This hotel is out of town so no problem with noise but the local tram into the city is 2mins away. Thank you Radisson Blu Milan for a most enjoyable stay
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited the hotel years ago when it was called Chendi and because we had been impressed. It still is a nice hotel, proper facilities, great breakfast, clean and with very helpful staff. It is just that the passage of time and people has left its mark and a renovation should come in the immediate future. Till then, the hotel is perfectly adequate and the service is just fine.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights , not in a tourist area of the city. It is a 25 minute tram ride from outside of the hotel into the Duomo area and tourist Centre. They let us check in early at arrival. The rooms are modern with nice beds , excellent buffet breakfast and professional staff. Gym and sauna on site. You can get a good nights sleep here and are still close enough to take in the sights. Nice toiletries with bathrobes and slippers etc.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was booked in for the weekend of the Italian GP,due to convenience of trains to the track,as well the reputation of value for money the Radison group has build up.I was booked into room number 444,only to find that the basin plug was unable to be opened,and the bath plug did not seal,this room did not have a shower,so bathing was the only option.The inter-leading door had water stains running down,the ceiling had hand marks around the smoke detector,the carpets were filthy,the coffee tray was swollen and chipped,the curtains were ill fitting and appeared to have been for different sized windows, the final nail was when the TV switched on,but could not switch off,due to the poor state of the remote.I complained,and the reception Lady was very accommodating,and moved me to room number 731,the overall appearance of this room was much improved,however,the basin in the bathroom did not drain,the shower door leaked when showering,and the bathroom door was water damaged and swollen.The positive was all the staff were very pleasant,but the facilities including the sauna wet area are in need of some serious management attention.I do have photos should management show interest.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly be aware that the hotel is quite some distance from the centre, however this is made easy as there is a tram stop just a few steps from the hotel, and tickets available from reception. Aside from this, a very clean hotel with added bonuses : sweets and water in reception, free water in room, nespresso machine, best hotel hairdryer I’ve found, very large room (117), good breakfast, restaurant on the premises for dinner (important as it’s far out of the centre), good internet connection, indoor pool, very reasonable gym. No complaints and especially convenient for attending Monza as the train station was very nearby. Perhaps being out of the hectic bustle of Milan centre isn’t a bad thing either, although it’s about 25 Minutes on the tram.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Actually came back from here today, I was looking forward to writing the review.Before arriving I informed the hotel I was coming to celebrate my second year anniversary (14/08) and they did not disappoint. Arrived on the Monday to such professional and welcoming staff. We were told we had been upgraded to a king suite and someone would be up to see us soon.Walking in we were greeted by strawberries with chocolate and a lovely note. Five minutes later a bottle of champagne and glasses were brought up to our room, this was a lovely surprise.The room itself was clean and had all the things you would need. The king size bed was comfortable and gave us a great nights sleep- no noise outside. Bathroom had a best feature (husband said it is a must add to review) when refreshing etc you are able to listen to the tv (English channels only news) through a speaker - can be turned down if you want quiet time.Called down for extra milk and tea, these arrived in good time considering we were on the 9th floor again by professional staff.There is a spa and gym available for your leisure. If we needed a taxi we could press M2 and ask them to call before we got down. Be aware the taxi begins charging from the time of the call so make sure you are ready to hop in as soon as they arrive- usually takes them 3-6 minutes to get there.Location is out of the way and local shops bar two or three food and market shops were open during the night and day so did need to taxi out to other areas. Travel from airport- cheaper to hop onto a coach/bus €8 get into the central train station and get a taxi around €20 from there. Taxi from the airport costs roughly €100.Definitely worth the stay and would love to come back in the future.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overalll is an excellent value in Milano. They take care of you very easily. We were here for a quick visit to boutiques in Milano. Price is very at this period and we enjoy all the ammenities free from hotel. Super service for an apero time in bar, great barman and coktailsFood is very good also and service is amazing and very quick if you need to leave in the early morning Great place we will return with pleasure
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super service from incheck - during stay - good and safe garage - nice pool etc - taxi service - smiling and nice breakfast / dinner staaf - correct and nice at check out .................................total Very Good !We will be Back !
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First let's just get it out there: the location is awful. It is in a run down area of Milan, well away from the sights. I was there because I was doing something with the Politechnico, and frankly I imagine that's the only reason anyoneo would be there. But that said...The hotel was really nice. Our room was large, with a cool multi-room suite layout. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom large and modern. They had a very nice range of branded amenities in the bathroom (I'm an amenity snob; I cannot help it, I used to sell little shampoos and conditioners to hotels when I worked for P&G and you can tell a lot about a hotel by the amenities it chooses). It wasn't a brand I was familiar with but my daughter recognized it, and they included the extra things like a toothbrush, shaving kit, etc. See how easy it is to win me over? But I haven't even gotten to the really good stuff. There was a lovely indoor pool that really made the hotel fun for my kids. The water was a little cold for my tastes, but they had a blast, and the benefit of them playing in cooler water is they crash out for hours afterward, so we're all winners. But the BEST part of the hotel is probably the breakfast buffet! First, it's a stylish area with an ample spread. It was definitely higher end than the other breakfast buffets we had while in Italy. But the highlight was definitely the fresh, full-sized vegan croissants!! Score!! We went vegan about six months ago and it's usually hard to find vegan food when we travel. I had pretty much written off things like croissants. But these weren't just vegan croissants, they were EXCEPTIONAL vegan croissants! My kids talked about them for the rest of the trip (and we stayed at four hotels after this one!) They were so good that I'm including a picture. So, Radisson Blu, you had disappointed me in Leeds, but you won me back in Milan. I'm happy we're on good terms again.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here since I was at a conference in Polytecnico de Milan. Hotel was good, staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel is a bit worn. Negatives are: Shower in my room was inside bath tub with no glass cover or shower curtain to keep the water from making the whole bathroom wet; TV picture HORRIBLE, this was during the World Cup....Internet very slow. Gym really good, breakfast ok, bit pricey, location a bit off the beaten path, but TRAM right near hotel.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late at night and perfectly handled by the hotel team. The room was perfect. The breakfast is very good and the coffee is very tasty. The equipment of the hotel: the fitness room is very well equiped, the sauna and steamroom are small but nice and the swimming pool is large enough but quite cold. The parking is very useful since parking in the street is not easy. Less good point: the airco is not very well positioned in the room, too close from the bed.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The team is very helpful! Rooms are good, breakfast was ok, not very impressive. The location is good if need quick access to the highway. You can buy a ticket to the trum in the reception. About 30 min to Duamo. In the area there is nothing to do. Hotel restaurant and Bar are good. Il Centro shopping center is 10 minutes driving.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Radisson Blu in November with my friend, having a great spacious room on the 2nd floor. We were very nicely welcomed and greeted by the reception staff and their service was outstanding the whole time of our stay. The staff at the bar and at the restaurant were great too - there's really nothing we could complain about. We went to the bar and to the restaurant both evenings we've been there and had a nice chat with the staff - it felt really amazing.Now the location - the hotel is not exactly in the city centre but it's soo easy to get there. Just a tram ride where you can rest before and after the day spent in the city. They have the tram tickets at the reception. Also the whole staff speaks great English.And last - the pool and the gym were amazing as well! :) If I'll go to Milan ever again I will choose Radisson Blu again for sure! Thank you! :)
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: super clean hotel, very modern , lots of parking space, nice lobby area and bar. rooms are comfortable and VERY nice. they upgraded me to a suite that had a WALK IN bathroom that was great.Small gym area, would have been awesome if they had a nice gym...but it was still ok for a quick run and workout. they have a nice indoor pool too.I love this hotel I had my car so i am not sure if there was a Metro station around me.The hotel location is not in the main attraction area for Milan. lovely place and well managed
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What more can you ask?This is one of our favourite hotels now.We got there a bit frazzeld by a flight from Edinburgh/45min taxi drive, and slightly early to check in. The 'bellhop' came to take our bags from the taxi, took us inside. The receptionist checked us in straightaway while the bellhop plied us with lemon water. I mentioned to receptionist about our trip to St Moritz on Tues, when a bus (I thought) would be picking us up. Buses dont normally call here, she said, and copied our trip details, phoning us later to say that a SUV would pick us up and driver would wait in reception. In the meantime, the bellhop (I do wish Id taken their names) took us and bags to our room, made sure the air con worked, and arranged for a porter to bring us milk for our tea.The room was on floor 2, near the lift, over looking the courtyard next to the restaurant, protected from the traffic noise by a row of tall trees. There was minimal noise from inside or outside the hotel. The bathroom was great, including a multihead shower room, plenty of storage. The room had loads of wardrobe and drawer space and space for cases, minibar (reasonably priced), safe, TV with English news channels, bedside tables, a comfy club chair and footstool and comfy chair to sit at desk console. Nicely decorated.We couldnt face going out for dinner so went to hotel bar. All items on the main course food menu were between euro 10 and 18. I chose lasagna, he chose macaroni. Both were in an absolutely gorgeous meaty tomatoey sauce. There is only one draft lager in the bar, but it was very good, on a par with Stella. The drinks menu included long cocktails, all for about e12, so we had one each night. We availed ourselves of the bar meals each night after treks round Milan/S Moritz, and found the food great, bar ambience good and friendly.Our booking included breakfast, which although buffet style, was equally good. The hot selection was crispy, very tasty bacon, Italian sausage not to our taste, scrambled eggs, and 'coddled' eggs ie eggs cooked in an egg cup, but just right with runny yolk. Him indoors reckoned really good. There was the usual fruit juice and yoghurt, fresh fruit and cereal selection, loaf bread, croissants and bread buns in all shapes and sizes, and the cold selection defied belief: vast array of cheeses, cold meats, smoked salmon etc etc Lovely atmosphere in the restaurant as in the bar.The hotel is near a small train station, bus route and tram route. We twice used the tram (you can get a ticket from reception), other times we used taxis which reception booked for us.All the staff were really helpful, friendly and professional. I hadnt been expecting it in Italy, and was worried about the language barrier. However, they all spoke very good English.The only negative is that its a little way out of central Milan, so because of the never ending graffiti in Italy the area can look a bit run down (but then so does central Milan with gorgeous buildings covered in stuff Banksy would be ashamed to be associated with).The tram fare each way is e1.50, and taxi about e12.If Im being supremely picky, some of the paintwork in our room was showing signs that its time for a lick of paint, but nothing significantWhats not to like?
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I must admit we choose this hotel initially as we could use our QANTAS points. Having said that it was a great stay. The hotel is large and modern with all the things you would expect. The staff were fantastic. Helped us in every way. Directions, maps, local information. Can’t speak more highly of them. The rooms were spacious and spotless. Tea and coffee making facilities and a mini fridge. Local supermarket a short walk away. The hotel is very close to the #22 tram and metro so no problem getting back to the centre in about 25-30 minutes. However if you want to be right in the centre with all the city attractions and restaurants at your finger tip then this may not be the hotel for you. There is a great pool which was sadly closed for annual works while we were there. I think the biggest downfall of this hotel is the very high price for breakfast. No doubt perfect for business people putting the cost on an account but absolutely out of the reach of a family of mum dad and a couple of kids staying for a week for example. €25 per person per day. No doubt the food was extensive and lovely but it is absolutely price inhibitive for most, except for a treat.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel is located bit far from central in a deserted kind of location. Not much to do out of hotel. Hotel looks a bit classic but rooms are really modern, big and classy. They have a huge bathroom but i struggled a lot with right water temperature. Breakfast is always great in Radisson. Their restaurant has amazing Italian wine with great food.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel room was very big, bigger than the average. It was clean and had anything you needed. The bathroom was also big but without a proper shower it was nit so convinient. The cost per night was quite fair for the design week period but there were many extras like a very expensive (but good quality) breakfast, parking facilities city tax. The location is good for business especially if you have a car, not good for leasure. Staff is good and profecionall. Most propably I will choose it again
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pool was nice . Rooms are acceptable but carpark is really expensive.About 15-20 mins to the center. the hotel is indeed quite good for a business trip in the area.Staff is friendly for your reqirements.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I actually booked requiring specifically availability of the spa the morning after before the check out. Ended up the spa was not available till 1pm (my check out time)... Looked to be a joke properly organized
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just arrived at the hotel on Saturday 7th April at 11.50pm to be told our reservation had been cancelled due to the card not going through on pre payment. The reservation was made on 29th March and they tried to take payment quite a few days later and the card had expired on 1st April, but the point is the card should have debited immediately or the day after for confirmation to be sent, and at the very least we should have been contacted to tell us it had been cancelled. We are now in a taxi trying to find another hotel, not a very good start to a birthday surprise trip to Milan organised by my husband and I’m pregnant and the hotel had absolutely no sympathy whatsoever! Terrible service Radisson Blu Milan. Won’t be using you at all in the future for any conferences or events or trips away.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very nice very well decorated it has a lot to offer the staff are very friendly very accommodating will do anything to accomplish your requests when I stayed it was pouring down with rain I didn't have any umbrella they gladly offered me one of those to use during my stay the rooms are very big very spacious very good for any disabled people with mobility issues the lift is very big very spacious easily accommodate a wheelchair or a mobility scooter the TV has numerous English channels there is a local overground station nearby called villapizzone that will connect you to Milan centraleAnd then from there you can get the underground the Metro is single on the overground train is €1.50 the room facilities are very good there is a mini bar with drinks and a wide selection of alcoholic drinks carbonated drinks for the kids two bottles of water there is a price lists for that minibar there is a safe which is really good downstairs in the restaurant the food is very nice very well presented very well cooked be prepared for a little wait time as it is cooked fresh but you don't mind that because obviously tastes good I highly recommend this hotel as a place to stay for a couple or a family the links to the centre of Milan a really good there is a tram nearby number 12 which will take you straight to piazza duomo where the cathedral is and from there you can get to all over Milan.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the hotel is located slightly further out then ideal, transport is easily accessible 4.50 a day for all transport bus and train station 5 minute walk.We went in March and the hotel was very quiet, always the only ones using the pool and the facilities.Drinks and breakfast was expensive and breakfast was lacking and I would not recommend.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the rooms are HUGE and clean, beds are comfortable. The staff are friendly, polite and helpful. However, it does take 20-30 mins to get to downtown by tram (tram station less than 5 mins walk from hotel). There's a metro station about 10 mins walk away. Not much options for food around the hotel.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, large rooms, very good breakfast, great service, beautiful pool, very nice restaurant, only average location, but trams run non-stop, so no problem with communication. I will definitely be back as soon as I am in Milan.
hotelName:
4    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the middle of the city and the train just in front of the hotel. Staff are friendly and room are clean. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choices. Hotel allow me to store my luggage few days prior to my check in as I'm travelling to others city for the weekend. Thank you for the service.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located right outside the Lima metro station, walking distance of 10-12 mins from both the Duomo as well as the Central station. I would recommend the walk from the Duomo back to the hotel, a tad long for tiny feet as it’s 2.6 Kms but perfect for adults. There is a supermarket called Pam’s just 3 blocks away and a lot of nice food options within walking distance. The family room is huge with 2 big rooms and a sitting area which we loved. Free laundry available on the 2nd floor with key card access too :)
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Why no one mentioned that the metro is passing just under the hotel and some rooms will have the vibration.The first room we had , the vibration was so much we could not tolerate, then we were moved to fifth floor which you could still feel it when you lay on the bed but it was ok. I am not sure, if I had to stay in the first room, it could be the worse hotel but the second one was good. Most of us are traveling from overseas and already so exhausted from the airport and the plan, we choose the best western and a four star hotel to make sure we will be comfortable and it will have the standards but a vibrating room is NOT expected. Changing the room again got more energy out of me and time.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first visit to Milano. Hotel Galles was very well located as I was travelling by train and it was about 15 minutes walk from Milano Centrale. Staff were very welcoming and friendly and the room and common areas were spotlessly clean and efficiently run. Had all facilities I would want and the breakfast buffet was exceptional. Would certainly use again.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: excellent customer service; I would definitely recommend to all my friends and families. Would stay here again if we ever go back for a vacation; rooms are very clean; location is good nearby stores, restaurants and shopping areas
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and well-located, although a bit of a long walk to the top spots, but the Metro is virtually a few steps away. The staff is courteous and efficient. The rooms at the budget end are satisfactory. The breakfasts are excellent, and the view from the small terrace at the top of the building are very good.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best Western is the BEST. Excellent location, good SPA, beautifull rooms, high speed internet , excellent restaurant and lounge bar. I were satisfaed with all. But need to pay little bit expencive for this :-)
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty close to central station.Clean, careful staff, clean rooms.Enjoyed the most the swimming pool, the SPA (you can dry your swimming suit up through a speed dryer available in the room!), and you get everything but your swimming suit and flip flops.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went here for my husbands retirement and we weren’t disappointed. I requested a room with balcony and was delighted on arrival to have got one. Hotel is well situated right outside metro. Room clean and comfy and we had a good view on balcony to sit and people watch after walking all day. Staff very friendly and helpful especially Terrence at the bar Good wee find on right, few streets down from hotel was a restaurant Bella Columbia, great food and cheap. We would recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in good condition. Great breakfast. Very good service and stuff. Great position and surrounding. Nice SPA. Great view from the terrace. Very warm atmosphere. Absolutely would come back. Nothing to complaint.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a brief 1 nt stay at this hotel and we loved it! The best part is the indoor pool and spa area. So relaxing and water very warm.Our room was small but sufficient and the beds were super comfortable.This BW is better than anything you will find in the US. The European standard is completely different (better).The concierge recommend a fantastic restaurant about 10 mins walking from the hotel, Mama Rosa. We loved this restaurant and spent a good couple hours just having lunch. Highly recommend both the hotel and the restaurant.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel at end of March. Everything was just perfect. We loved the central position, the staff could not have been more helpful, the room was very clean, beautifully appointed with great mattress, breakfast was very good offering a great selection of Italian breakfast items. Try the spa area .. is perfect for a relaxation after a busy day!!!Finally we had a great time at the Galles Hotel and for the price, we felt we had great value.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Galles. We both agree this is a really good hotel for a city break. The rooms are of good size, quiet and have some lovely touches. Staff were all so friendly and helpful throughout our stay.Great breakfast with fresh fruit, suits, cooked items and good coffee. We had also cocktails in the lobby bar twice - these were reasonably priced and of high quality.We would return to Galles in a heartbeat and look forward to visiting again
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious rooms, great service and nice bathroom. The shower pressure was amazing! The service was really good as well. The beds were comfortable and clean. The breakfast was okay- comparable to other Italian hotels. Hotel is located near the train station and right off a bustling main road. Even though the Duomo was a bit of a walk, the Metro was literally just outside the hotel which made traveling easy.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This may sound bad and I am sorry, however in the US I would not stay at a Best Western. However this one in Milan was so beautiful and great. The breakfast area was large and very nice, Rooms were large. The location was great, right next to a subway, we could get any where in the city, right outside the hotel. I will stay here any time I am in Milan.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Practically next to LIMA train station, there are variety of shops & dining places to chose. Breakfast is surprisingly good by European standard. Free Wifi is not letting me down, swift & consistent flow of data is essential for business usage
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles

review_body: , location is very convenient, I have stayed at this hotel before and I have seen better services in the past, price was 4 times more than usual this time and they blame fashion week for it , it was absolutely rip offff and you feel you have been robbed, load noises at night which make it difficult to sleep comfortably, the quality of breakfast and restaurant is absolutely disastrous, for me personally no more at this hotel as a regular traveler to Milan, my suggestion to travelers if you find very cheap deal on this hotel it’s ok but if you paying premium look at other places.

review_body: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel ...the people are warm and friendly the room cozy the breakfast terrific and the location is great. I wont dare try another hotel when I have find a wonderful home away from home.

review_body: We stayed at the Galles for one night off the back of a ski trip, ahead of our return flight from Malpensa. Great points:1. Centrally located, only 10 EUR from Duomo by Uber plus the tram line is just outside 2. Secure underground parking - we were able to leave the car with all our ski gear inside overnight with no concerns 3. We had a family room which, whilst being a long walk from the lifts, was perfect for one or two nights with a child - the big double sofa bed had a clean and extremely comfortable mattress and the room was more than spacious enough for three. There was even a little balcony for morning coffee4. Staff - excellent. Service attentive and ultra friendly and accommodating. Downsides - none. Very highly recommended.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles

review_body: The formalities were done pretty fast at the reception and i went directly to my room, as i were just arriving europe flying from asia.I was tired and the bed was nice and confortable. I did even watch tv a bit and could even connect my netflix on it.Cannot speak about the breakfast as i did not take it.
hotelName:

review_body: The hotel was exactly what we hoped.The stuff was amazing and very helpful for any need of us.The location is perfect, on main street (boenos airos).The spa was great and relaxing.Very value for money.Bottom line, deffenitly will come back next time.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles

review_body: Great location! But... The walls are like paper and because of that I could not sleep at all. I heard the guest next door talking to his phone and I could also hear voice of the other person on the line.. It was like he was in the same room yelling to his phone. So if you are a sensitive sleeper, this is not your place. I think it is too expensive for a place you cannot get a good sleep in.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles

review_body: Confortable room, good stream system to see your Netflix subscription on TV room, Good fitness and swimingpool. Large familiar room with a Good ver for your child. After a “hard” turistic day is very pleasurable you find a Good swimingpool to relax!!!!
hotelName:

review_body: The hotel's location is excellent close to everywhereThere is a very cozy pool and gymThe atmosphere is pleasant and personalAnd of course speaking English all the staff that it is very rare in ItalyI highly recommend the hotel
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles

review_body: The hotel’s location is great, approximately 30 minutes walk to Duomo square. Many Restaurants and bakeries near by.The metro (Lima station) is very (very !!!) close so in one hand, it is very comfortable, but on the other hand, every time the trum is passing by, our room shook. It was really shaking !!!The breakfast is good, although I would prefer little more variety of vegetables (tomatoes and peppers would be highly appreciated). All in all, great value for money.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is perfect, room is very beautiful, buffet breakfast is very rich, staff is very helpful in anything you need, daily rate is very reasonable comparing to other hotels in the area. I have been in Milano in different hotels but I highly recommend Hotel Galles for all visitors to Milano to book in this hotel for many reasons. Sure I will book again in Hotel Galles again & again.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a week here for business. Excellent location next to great shopping and easy transport links around the city. The hotel is traditional in style, immaculately clean, spacious rooms, comfy bed, multi language t.v. channels. The restaurant is fabulous I ate here every night and tried a lot of the menus....food is fresh and local...breakfast is plentiful. The best part though? The restaurant staff are amazingly friendly!!! Chatty and just lovely. I haven't seen much of Milan being so busy with work but it seems like a nice city and when I come back I will 100% stay here again for pleasure and business.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well situated within walking distance from the central train station and the Duomo Square and lots of other tourist areas. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within easy reach. We found it to be clean, comfortable, well equipped and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They left a card and small gift in our room for me as I was staying over my birthday which I thought was a lovely touch!
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a perfect place to stay as a tourist.This is a 5 star property and very close to all shopping centers,Metro station and also the central station.rooms are decent and well maintained and good for families also.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a good location, on a shopping street and right next to a metro station. There is a swimming pool which is small, more for relaxing than swimming in. There is a good sauna and steam room and nice relaxing area. The room was comfortable, by the road side but shutters and thick curtains so the noise was kept out. A confusing thing was we booked through booking.com which gave us a price including the tourist tax but then in the hotel upon check out they asked us for the tourist tax which we thought had already been paid. When we looked at the credit card statement we saw they had taken an amount minus the tourist tax and then asked for it separately. We didn't eat at the hotel but there looked like there was a nice rooftop restaurant.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time. The breakfast and dinner were above our expectations. Service was really good. Room was cosy but very comfortable. Well situated near public transportation. Really reccomend this hôtel.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located just off Buenos Aires, right beside the Lima subway station. Buenos Aires is a busy touristy street, and a 5 minute ride to the Duomo. The Duomo is spectacular and it is close by.The rooms are cosy...but comfortable...and the price (value) was good. We were part of a conference and the price was right.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel in october 2018 and it was brilliant from start to finish. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the location perfect with a metro outside but most of all...the staff. The staff at reception are brillaint. Whenever we needed something they were helpful in every way possible. The duty manager, Francesco, was also super helpful and accommodating. I have found my home in Milan.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is stuck in a time warp and is not worthy of its 4 star rating nor can it justify its price in any way shape or form. The first thing to note is the layout, it's mind boggyling complex to navigate your way around the hotel. My room was 251 which seemed to be in a weird annex from the rest of the hotel. To get to my mind-boggling I had to pass two extremely annoying sliding doors. One activated by a key and one automatic.The automatic one was very close to my room so every time someone passed through it the sliding mechanism was extremely loud and annoying and travelled into my room.Lets go back to the decor of the hotel and room, it is stuck in the 1970s and I found the hotel itself to havde a creepy vibe to it. In fact it reminded me of the hotel in the Shining.Now to my room itself, every time I opened the door there was a pungeant smell which can only be described as the 1970s deoderant Brut. One plus was that it certainly matched the 1970s decor of the bedroom.Navigating myself to the bathroom I was greeted with the site of a toilet that woukdn't stop flushing.As a light sleeper this constant noise would have resulted in impending insomnia. I called reception to complain and to be fair they despatched two handymen quite quickly. One of them lifted the back of the toilet and after a few seconds of jiggery pokery announced that it was fixed. It appeared to be, but a short time later it was evident that his fix was only temporary. Not wanting to go through the same rigmarole again by calling reception I implemented my own solution which invlolved me having to suspend the cistern by lifting the pulley to an angle that would block the flush. I would then have to repeat this every time I wanted to flush/stop the flush of the toilet. Four star hotel I hear you say.I visited what they call on their advertising a fitness centre, spa and swimming pool. The fitness centre consists of a few running machines, free weights that only go up to 10kg and one machine with only a lat pull down and pec press. The sauna and spa were good to be fair but the swimming pool was tiny and not the size advertised. Also there was a phone in the spa area and a sign saying pick up the phone to order and have a drink brought down from the bar. Surprise surprise this phone does not work. Most of the staff are not friendly or welcoming and seem disinterested. The only thing they seem interested in is your money. One exception was Terence the bar man who is friendly and courteous.The location of the hotel is decent enough and there is a BikeMi rack just outside. It is about a ten minute cycle to the duomo from the hotel.In conclusion, this is the first time I have stayed at a Best Western and it will be the last. I'm guessing they are just playing off their brand name and have become complacent. My advice is that this hotel does not offer value for money and you should consider cheaper and more modern alternaltives if you are planning a trip to Milan.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another hotel and great staff.From the moment we arrived never saw an unhappy staff member.Terence who ran the downstairs bar was great and loves his cricket.Food was good and room service excellent.Will be back!
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location, Hospitality, Fresh Morning Breakfast - AwesomeYou want a swimming pool or jaccuzzi or spa you get that You want special treatment on your arrival the staff is ready to serve youThe breakfast spread in the morning on terrace is amazingJust a room size could have been bit bigger but the bathroom size compensates the same
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Soo.. As you always do before your holiday, you check the reviews on Tripadvisor to see what people thing. There are some very funny reviews on here which can only be described as delusional. We paid for a metropolitan hotel in Milan expecting to have somewhere nice to sleep in this incredible city.. We got a lot more, Breakfast in this hotel is vast and amazing. They have a good selection of warm eggs, sausage etc. as well as all your cold meats and cheeses, cereals, fruits, yogurts,
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel . Clean and spacious .. good stuff good location .. recommended to stay in ..close to metro station and walking distance to Milan train station . Steer is also good with decent shopping places .. in the heart of Milan .. good price Vs good value
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel, I came here with my boyfriend from Toronto, Canada and the hotel was very nice, very well kept, we had a few issues with the vending machines being broken so we couldn’t purchase the laundry detergent but the concierges helped us and got us some from the back, also the tv channels are terrible almost nothing works in the tv, it’s all broken up... you can do your laundry here if your on a long trip which is very nice and convenient, it’s in a very good location, not a far drive from the cathedral, lots of stuff around in walking distance if you don’t want to take cabs or don’t have a car to drive around. I spent my birthday here and I had a lovely time! Very nice staff, and I would recommend.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for money. Friendly staff, good service, convenient to Metro and not far from Central Train station. On Saturday enjoyed farmers market in park close by - delightful! Free coffee but limited hours 430-7am! Good breakfast buffet, great value for price!
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, beautiful hotel and the absolute best staff! I can't say enough good things about the staff. They were friendly and very helpful. Piazza Lima is not far from the train station. You can easily walk to the hotel or take the metra which stops right outside the hotel door. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel as it was within a 10 minute walk of the central station. The location was great as it was right on the metro line so we were able to get everywhere we wanted to within the city. Our room was quite small but clean and well presented. The indoor pool was a great addition and we enjoyed using it after exploring the city. We also enjoyed the rooftop terrace to get some afternoon sun.There was plenty of choice at breakfast and we were able to ask staff for a better coffee than the machine stuff.One small negative, our room was right next to some of the lifts and the room service hatch and as a result our room was quiet noisy. We could hear the lift and hatch every time it was used so it was difficult to get to sleep -we had to use ear plugs.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had one night in Milan before catching our flight the next day out of Linate. We choose this hotel because they had a family style room available -essentially two rooms with a bath and it was centrally located and on the subway so we could get the most out of a very short stay in Milan. Compared to an Airbnb, for one night, this was a preferable location and we wanted a place that would be easy to get a cab to and from for the airport. Usually, when we only have a stopover/one nighter somewhere in Europe where we want to catch a cab easily to an airport, I look to see if there is a Best Western because their family room/suite product is really excellent for families and it is priced reasonably. The rooms are usually updated and modern, even in older historic buildings. This hotel was no exception. Check in was easy. The room was clean -our two teenagers shared the "living room" which as two daybeds for them to sleep on. We had a small balcony overlooking a side street. You are right on the corner of the main shopping street, the Corso Buenos Aires. For us, that is all we needed or had time for and our teenagers enjoyed exploring the various shops --and it was the first day of the July sales. So it was very busy! The rooftop restaurant serves a standard European breakfast buffet that we enjoyed. We intended to take advantage of the unique Spa pool on the lower level but never did --but it looked very nice. It was only a 15 min drive in no traffic to Linate Airport to catch a Sunday morning flight. The hotel arranged for a van to take us to the airport. You are also 2-3 blocks from the main rail station to get to MXP airport or express bus to LIN. 4 stars mainly because the staff while nice, not consistently helpful like we've experienced at other BW's in Italy-- but my understanding is this is probably more a reflection on the culture of Milan than the hotel itself.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located on a busy shopping location. It is right next to the metro station which enabled us to go to lots of places easily. It was surprisingly quiet inside with a lovely wellness centre which was great when outside was too hot! The room was smaller than I expected but was clean and well presented- I loved the olive oil toiletries! Air conditioning could have been better but the bed was really comfortable. Good breakfast with a large choice of foods. The restaurant was on the top floor offering views of the city. Staff were helpful but inobtrusive. Our 2 night stay was very enjoyable
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were warmly greeted on arrival to this older hotel. The lifts/elevators are very small. We had two rooms as there were 4 of us so a couple of trips up was needed. Our rooms were very small. The air conditioning wasn't quite up to par. The temperatures in those days were 36 degrees.We had to leave the shutters closed to help defer heat. Our room faced a fairly busy street. When emergency vehicles go by the sirens can wake you but its not an enormous problem. There isn't too much storage in the room although there is an armoire to hang clothing. We did have robes which was nice. Our other room did not for some reason. The bathrooms have the half glass wall to contain water in the shower so you have to make sure that is in place to reduce the water on the floor. The hotel has shampoo, shower gel and lotion but does not provide hair conditioner. If its something you need - bring your own.The breakfast room on the top floor is bright and open and staff there are very very friendly and are constantly working to keep things neat, clean and stocked up for everyone. It has an enormous selection of food items and beverages for everyone. Gluten free, vegetarian, and you can see they try to incorporate many cultural diets. The bar downstairs has a wide range of selections available and a large seating area lounge space to sit. There is a workout space that is smaller and a pool.If we returned we would probably want to try somewhere else for accommodations but this did the trick for us for our short stay in Milan. People that work here are very friendly and welcoming. Checkin and Checkout take quite a while for some reason and a line up forms especially at checkout times. Taxi service is easily obtained by asking the front desk and they arrive promptly. In emails the hotel offers to be of assistance and we did ask the hotel to arrange a ride for us from the airport which they did. The service was there promptly but barely uttered a word to us the entire time. When we had questions they were barely answered. The cost was enormous for the drive in. Later in our trip we had a driver pick us up in Naples and take us all the way to a town down the Amalfi coast. It was hardly much more than what the cost for this ride was. And we were catered to and we stopped for scenery etc etc. and it was a few hours in length. The hotel is close to restaurants and public transportation. There are also lots of shops very close by.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the hotel for one night and had a good experience. The room was a little small and the furniture is standard a bit outdated though. I went for the wellness area straight away and the hotel provided all the towels and slippers. It took me a while to figure out the SPA entrance due to lack of staff. Great sauna and steam room. The pool was a bit crowded hence I didn't stay long enough. Great breakfast the following morning and a big Thank to breakfast manager that offered a real coffee.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel for three nights and had a good experience. The room was a little small and we took some time to figure out the air conditioning (still not sure what we actually did but we managed to get it to a good setting somehow!). However, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a good size with all the toiletries provided and replenished daily. The breakfast was good although a bit disappointing that the coffee from the machine was very acidic and unpleasant. I really enjoyed the selection of pastries and bread however! The hotel also provided a welcome drink on the day we arrived, which was a nice touch. The hotel is conveniently located next to a metro station and within walking distance of many shops and restaurants. We took a walk to the Duomo which took about 25 minutes so definitely manageable in good weather. Would recommend this hotel for a city break or business trip given the location.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Milan Best Western Plus Hotel Galles. Took a double bedroom, low floor. Nice bedlinen. Good size room. MRT just outside hotel. However, to look for the hotel, it is at a corner and may not be visible from the main street.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a 4 nights stay in this hotel for my wife and my 2 year old daughter. As we had a family size of 3, we had to take a bigger room. The room was indeed much bigger than i though, just that the additional bed is located in a separate room rather than the bed room. which is totally fine for me. First 3 nights was ok as we spent the timing in the hotel washing up and going to bed. However the last night was unacceptable. At 10pm there were noise from drilling and hammering. I called the reception and a gentleman was kind enough to check the room next to me. After checking he knocked my door and mentioned that there is no one living next to my room. So I requested him to sort it out but he said that it is not within his means to do anything and ask me to bear with the noise. Again... If my 2 year old daughter was not with us, I am ok. But it affects her sleeping.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The main asset of this hotel is its location: very close to tube station and adjacent to the city center.The room was comfortable and clean with nice amenities. Spa and fitness facility was used with great joy in the morning and in the evening. The restaurant has nice food options.The friendly staff made our stay a memorable one and will definitively recommend this hotel to our friends and will consider it when coming back to Milan!
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good points - Great location - right by Lima metro stop and about 15 mins walk from the Duomo. Clean, comfortable room and bathroom with choice of pillows and good free toiletries. Nice little swimming pool (but not big enough to swim properly) with sauna and steam room. Breakfast copious and good value for money (book in advance). Staff helpful.Minus points - Noisy - Main road just outside so ask for a room facing the inner courtyard and above the 1st floor (could feel the metro trains rumbling underneath) or bring earplugs. People in other rooms also noisy but there isn't much the hotel can do about that.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel last year and it was lovely! We had a great selection for breakfast and the place was always clean. The staff were also lovely and very helpful. It was surrounded by a few shops or you could hop on the metro just outside that would take you up to where the Duomo is situated and the shops around that area which was lovely.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 2 nights stay here and found it to be very comfortable and in a good position for visiting Milan. About 20 mins walk into the centre of Milan or catch the underground train very nearby. There are some very nice neighbourhood restaurants, cafés and bars very close to the hotel.Our room was comfortable and clean and nice and cool in hot weather with the good air conditioning. The buffet breakfast was great, everything you could possibly want. Always greeted warmly by Rita who was lovely. All the staff at the hotel were great and seemed very happy in their jobs, both the young man and lady who were standing in the foyer were lovely and there to help with advice & bags etc. We felt extremely welcome.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alright, so my visit was in May 2017 but this only lets me go back to August. Having just made this account, however, I still need to praise the Best Western Galles. The hotel was incredible. I can't think of a flaw with it. The staff where attentive, the breakfast was good (for Italy) and the place was spotless. Then right outside the door was the metro, connecting you to the Duomo or Sforza Castle. If i'm ever back in Milan, I'll certainly consider this hotel again.
hotelName:
5    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is extremely uncooperative and irresponsible. Our bags were stolen from the hotel lobby in the morning and the hotel took no responsibility for it. There is zero security and anybody can enter the hotel as a guest and do what happened to us. We asked the hotel to order a taxi for us to take us to the airport, informing and showing them the size and amount of luggages we had, asked them for confirmation about the same twice but they still ordered a wrong taxi. When we asked them to solve the issue as it was their mistake, they again refused to take responsibility and asked us to pay more for a new one. I have been travelling for 15 years and have visited many hiltons but this was the worst ever.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room and comfortable hotel with high standard in a excellent locationStaff is very polite and all amenities are outstanding Toilette items are Hilton standard and the room feel fresh and pretty big size
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is nice, clean, spacious. Free parking in the garage is provided. Close to metro station, walking distance. Breakfast is OK. Selections limited, but adequate. Gym is available - and good condition.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thankyou Donato for your help In always helping us with your good advise on where to visit , you are a credit to the hotel .Nice clean hotel with great transportation link to metro line , we stayed here for a short break, breakfast was good
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel is incredible! The team is well organized, professional and willing to help well before you ask. Although the hotel is not in the center of Milan, it is a very short, inexpensive and easy Metro ride making it very attractive. I highly recommend staying at this Hilton Garden Inn!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is beautiful and grand for a Hilton Garden Inn. Beautiful lobby and the staff were very cordial, friendly and most helpful especially the front desk. My husband and I enjoyed our stay and nothing was lacking. Would love to get the opportunity to go back and stay at this location as it is also convenient and close to the train station.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Big property of the famous chain.Large gym facilities with roof top city views.Big comfortable rooms and modern bathrooms.Excellent breakfasts.Convenient for Milan but avoid driving there at peak times as not directly on motorway exit.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like to be close to the central hub of the city so traveling does not take up too much time. Loved this property because it was right around the corner from the railway station that runs frequently. Our sixth floor balcony view was also beautiful!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and convenient - just few minutes away from Metro station which has direct line (M1) to Duomo. The room provides sufficient space. Bathroom is spacious. However, the bathtub is quite high and slippery - potential risk of danger. But, the biggest problem of this hotel is that some front desk staff are not as friendly/warm as they should be. We did not feel welcomed at this hotel. The staff members hardly smiled and greeted the guests. Some staff members (maybe interns?) just stood there and showed no interest to assist the guests - very strange. Maybe they are unhappy staff? If the front desk staff can show a bit of warmth and welcoming gesture, this would be a very nice hotel.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The ground floor toilet is see through from the men's into the ladies'. There is no tap that runs water to wash hands in the toilet sinks as well, but comparing to the seeing through theme, I think it's just a small issue. What more can I said, the whole experience is horrifying......
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The amenities overall were fine. Nice, fancy looking lounge, room, and breakfast area. Super close to a metro station, a few restaurants/eateries, grocery stores, and gasoline/petrol station. Plenty of underground parking as well if you were driving there. Not sure how well it is connected to the Malpensa airport though (because it is quite far, 60+ km or 40-ish miles away). The person who helped us with reservation and check-in was nice and helpful. He seemed eager to help us have a good stay there. But we did not see him during the remainder of our stay.However, our stay here was not particularly enjoyable. Here is some of the negative feedback that contributed to the not-so-good experience at the hotel:- The quality of the room, furnishings, door, etc. looked good on the surface but they really lacked in details. For instance, there was a big gap between the room door and its frame when locked. See below about my note on the bathroom and the mini-fridge.- Loud construction noise woke us up on the first morning around 7 am. We had no heads up about it from the front desk.- One of the blankets had a fairly big light brown stain on it. It was replaced soon after we brought it to the attention of the front desk.- The mini fridge in the room was incredibly loud. We first thought that the sound was that of loud winds blowing outside.- All the bathroom fittings were fancy but their functionality was very poor. The light above the sink and mirror was poorly place. If you got close to the mirror, you could hardly see your face because of the shadow of your own head. The toilet sink faucet had a massive amount of splash.
