You had to be very careful in operating it in order to avoid a messy situation.- We experienced very poor operational efficiency with respect to the amenities (we had paid for breakfast but they did not have it on record for one of the days) and even the final billing (they got our final charge the right the 3rd time after we questioned the first two).
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A bit far from center of Milan, but access to the city is quite good. Just 15 min from center by metro. We stayed only two days, but received Hilton level services with affordable price. If you don't mind that location, I can recommend you.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room with free mobile phone- nice expierience for people without roaming. Very good breakfest. Hotel is just few step far away from metro station- red line. Nice equiped gym on the top floor with city view
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hilton garden inn during our 2 nights stay in Milan. The hotel is at good location with Villa San Giovanni metro station just 3 mins by walk. Duomo is 8 metro stops from there. Not in the crowded area neither too far from the city centre and attractions. Hotel is quite luxurious. Rooms are large and very clean and comfortable. Huge bathroom with good amount of amenities. Staff was helpful with check in and check out process. We didn’t opt for breakfast which was charged separate as we prefer to eat out while exploring the city . Overall a nice stay.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Milan for a short break. The standard of the Hotel was first class. Ate in on first night and food was very good along with service. Short walk to nearest Metro station giving access to central area. hotel although busy was not noisy.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although they will have you pay 4-Star prices for the privilege of staying at this abomination of a hotel, the lack of attention to details that separate luxury hotels from garbage dumps just isn't here. To start off, they charge money for plastic bottles of water aside from a "complimentary" bottle the front desk will give you on the first night. The next thing you will notice is that they do not provide any luxury items one would expect such as room slippers or bath robes.The cleanliness of the rooms leaves something to be desired as well. We found large dust bunnies that were piled up on the picture above the bed. We continued to sneeze throughout the night, even with the window closed.In the provided picture, you'll see the hole in the wall where a telephone was once installed. Unfortunately, it did not add to the luxury standards that the name "Hilton" once stood for.The beds were comfortable enough but the air conditioner didn't seem to work that well in the evening and the room would remain muggy until the early morning hours when it would finally start working.Another item of note is that the staff appears ill-prepared in dealing with the sort of clientele that a 4-Star hotel would attract. They were not able to even provide basic information on the services sold through their in house "handy" device. We actually ended up wasting a bunch of time after purchasing the Milan City Pass through their device. We found out later that the discounts offered through the device were for none of the main attractions and many of the advertised services no longer existed with the exception of the 24 hour metro pass. The trick is that you have to go to the office that sells the Milan pass before you can get the Metro tickets. None of the staff at the hotel had any clue about anything. Speaking of their service desk, much like others have said, they seem to lack a certain level of professionalism. The female staff running the Hilton club portion flat out refused to help answer our questions even when they did not have any customers and the other representatives were busy. We had to wait 15 minutes just to talk to one of the other two representatives.On this same topic of customer service, we would also add they lack bell hop service which should be standard for a 4-star establishment.Another issue with the hotel is that it's not in a good neighborhood. While we weren't scared for our lives, seeing graffiti and run down shops right outside the hotel left us scratching our heads as to why they would pick this location for a 4-Star hotel. The hotel is not within walking distance of Duomo so the only way there is to take the metro.The breakfast at the hotel was okay. My wife was not happy with the undercooked scrambled eggs but I was fine with them myself. They had a decent selection of juices (the pineapple juice tasted watered down).If you are planning to come to Milan and want a luxury experience, I would recommend the Hyatt at Duomo for just a few hundred more euros than pay good money for this dumpster fire of a hotel.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night, great value for price; located in mixed residential/business area. Close to metro with easy access to city center. Very attentive and helpful staff. Silvia at front desk was exceptional, went out of way to get reservation corrected. Breakfast was OK, but other services make-up. Hotel has a decent restaurant and others are within walking distance. Would stay again and highly recommended.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hilton is approximately 3-4 miles outside of the city center. I chose it because I am a Hilton member AND it was half the price of many other hotels located closer to the center of the city. The reception staff was very nice. The room was comfortable for one and would have been fine for a couple. Shower water was hot! Beds were comfortable. I had a “queen” bed which was really two full size or two double size beds. The hotel fitness center was perfect for a quick sweat. Weights, workout mats, workout bench, two treadmills and two ellipticals. Probably the best part of the gym was the view from the sixth floor. Breakfast wasn’t the best. Very wet eggs. I would have liked to have oatmeal as an option. Lastly, the shower had a towel warmer which I think is a nice touch. Overall, if prices were lower in the center of the city I would have liked to stay downtown but my stay met my expectations.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bed was little bit too hard, location not bad, near metro station, brekfast could be better. Didn't like that they took a deposit for a room without any notification. Rooms was clean. And coffee in the room could be better.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a surprise trip to Milan for my boyfriend. It was our first time in Italy. Booked this hotel through the travel agents. From we arrived until we left everything was fabulous. The staff were all lovely and nothing was too much trouble. A two minute walk from San giovanni metro that took you straight to Duomo (a must see when in Milan) The handy travel buddy available to all guests (a smartphone) was a total surprise and godsend as we walked everywhere n you could use Google maps, make calls and use for free. Thank you to all the amazing staff in an amazing city. We're already planning a return trip to you. See you all soon
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is round the corner from the Villa San Giovanni Metro station on the red line. On the map it looks as if the hotel is a bit out of town, but since it's only 15 minutes between VSG and Duomo stations, it is actually very convenient. A single journey ticket is 1.5e and a 48-hour ticket for metro, tram and buses is 8.5e (ticket machines in the stations are multilingual).Getting to the hotel from Malpensa airport by pubic transport was easy. The Malpensa express to Cadrona costs only 13e and takes 50 minutes from terminal 2. At Cadrona you can change to the red metro line for VSG or, if you have a lot of luggage, a taxi from the station might be a better option.The rooms are as you'd expect in a 21st century international hotel: clean crisp bedding, a spacious bathroom with plenty of towels and nice toiletries, blackout curtains, international TV channels. The standard of housekeeping was high with everything very clean. We liked the fridge (a usable size), the small kettle and having a safe. Superb value for money.We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant preferring mostly to go into the city centre. There aren't many restaurants close to the hotel, but we ate twice at Vineria San Giovanni which we liked a lot. It has a very long wine list (all prices), rather good sharing boards and authentic Milanese classics (e.g. risotto, osso bucco and tiramisu). The locals eat at Trattoria San Filippo (Precotto) - extremely popular, mostly open at lunch and we didn't manage to get a table. We also liked the newly opened Lidl supermarket nearby on Viale Monza which has an in-store bakery and is open to 9pm (much posher than UK Lidls).The hotel reception staff were unfailingly helpful. We stayed five nights and were greeted with a smile each time we passed through the lobby.The general area felt safe to us. You're not getting traffic noise from the main thoroughfare as the hotel is parallel to it. The area is a mix of residential and businesses of various kinds. There are some newer flats nearby and areas where demolition has taken place, so some future redevelopment can be expected.Top tip for tourists staying here. Whether you think you like contemporary art or not, the Pirelli HangarBicocca has large-scale installations unlike anything you've ever seen. Take the 51 bus to Via Chiese - it is only half-a-dozen stops or so. The bistro there is very smart too. Open Thursday to Sunday 10am to 10pm. (The Bicocca district is a large post-industrial urban redevelopment with a cinema, some shopping and cafes.)
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good Hilton with reasonable prices and easy access to the city center, 20 mins. Breakfast was reasonable but with little choice. Room pleasant. The only setback is the distance from the city center but considering the price it will continue to be our first choice when visiting Milan.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to be welcomed in the mornings when you come down for breakfast, or return from work in the evening, this is the hotel for you. Staff is extremely kind and helpful. Breakfast foods accommodate any type of dietary needs - and the omelettes are wonderful too.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is only about 100 m from metro Station, and about 20 minutes from the station to city centre.Room was big and spacious. Bathroom was also nice with separate shower and bathtub. There is also a supermarket and kebab shop nearby the hotel. It is a very good value for the price you pay.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well , for a 2 nights stay just £100 for 2 persons, to be honest is a good price with it location, 2 minutes to Metro station connecting to down town Milan .But , please have a look of so call " king bed " , is actually a merge of twin . And during the night , the fire alarm light really flashing in the room . Some more , not everyone like stay in a disabled room which Hilton , the big brand hotel sell as a king bed room without notifying the guest , be careful if you get room 111 .
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had great time at Hilton North Milan. Nice, friendly and helpful staff. Great location and value for the money. I'll always recommend to friends and colleagues for personal of business purpose. Overall very satisfied.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time visiting Milan and it was amazing. The hotel was great, super clean, modern and the staff were 10/10. This made the stay 10 times better and worth it. Would highly recommend and no doubt visit again!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very modern hotel, located in a lively neighborhood right outside Milan city center. The subway stop to the Dome is minutes away from this property, making everything very easy. There are tons of restaurants and bars in the area, and some good shopping areas.Rooms are bing, modern and very well equipped. Receptionists are very professional, speak impeccable English and are very friendly and helpful.Totally recommeded!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decently sized new room, good shower and bathroom and helpful staff. Perfect for a business trip if you are in Milan north area. 4 stars just because breakfast is not great.I was by car, but this hotel is 1 min walk away from the subway.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Then, we went to the other old small outdated hotel in the middle of Milano, and it was a nightmare. 35 euros parking in the other place, here parking is free. Manager Alessandro a real pleasure dealing with him. breakfast is amazing, rooms are clean and with "american" matresses. Something you understand if you live here.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Passing through for a family trip. Only issue was the internet connection. Because of the location of our room the connection was very poor to no connection. We arrived late and left early. All the amenities and staff were very nice as always. We will continue staying at Hilton’s throughout our travels.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this Hilton Garden Inn because when I was hotel shopping 3 months ago, I found the best rate of any comparable hotel of this category or area of Milan. Granted the hotel is not in the center of the city, but it is a 3 minutes walk to the local Metro station which will have you near the Duomo or shopping areas in 15 minutes. It is clean and very quiet in the area. The staff were outstanding and it is the best HGI I have stayed for probably 10 years. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was clean and sleek. It had all the amenities you need in a hotel and i loved that it had a bath where you can just soak and relax after a long day of walking around Milan. It’s not the greatest in location, as you need transport to get you in to the heart of Milan but it was also not a great hassle to get to. It was still a short walk from the nearest metro. My husband loved that our room had a complimentary phone that you can use as you tour around Milan, you can use it as a guide for local food and activities or just to simply use google maps instead of using your own cellular data. I think it was the little things that the hotel had that made a great impression on us.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a lovely hotel in a very well located place - just some steps away of the metro station.Everything is well kept, beautifully decorated and warm!Very good breakfast with a lot of different possibilities: from the typical american pancake, to the classic bacon and eggs, etc.The room is warm and comfortable with a lot of space, a huge bed and high quality finishing.A really striking option if you are going to stay in Milan for a couple of days!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was quick and efficient, room was comfortable, Has a mini bar in the room (refrigerator). Wi-Fi was very good. Hotel staff was awesome, we needed to print our boarding pass and they printed multiple copies for us. However, I have to provide extra compliment to Maria, she was so helpful with everything, from getting taxis to restaurant suggestions. She was patient, helpful and detail. Great asset. Location - There wasn't too much activities near the hotel, in fact, we have to walk around a couple of alleyways to get to the front of the hotel, streets were dark and not many people. But the train station is only a couple of blocks away and the metro system is pretty efficient. The ride to the city center is only twenty minutes away, the Cathedral and Galleria mall is one stop closer. The restaurant areas are on the same metro line with one transfer (less than half an hour). Supermarket Coop is a good fifteen - twenty minute walk, but they have everything that you need, the local supermarket is five minutes away, but I don't recommend it, very limited selection. The hotel also do not have any tours for the city, you have to book it at the city center at the visitor center. But overall, nice stay, will definitely return. Maria, Great Job.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My last stay was the 7th one at this hotel during the last 2 years. All the people working there are super gentle and helpful! The room are big, the bathrooms too. Using a wheelchair I must say that it is super accessible for people with mobility problems. There is also underground parking and gym. It’s 50m from a metro station so in case you need to move to the city center it’s fast and easy. I will definitely visit again this hotel in the near future!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice hospitality beautiful room very comfortable the staff were very nice and polite we stay there for a week the hotel is next to the train station just ten minutes ride to the city we definitely recommend this hotel to our family and friends
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently spent a long weekend at this hotel. It is obviously a modern hotel of rather 'minimalist' design, very conveniently situated near the Villa SG metro station (M1 red line) in a quiet residential area of the city (maybe a bit far from the city centre for some, but absolutely fine for us). We were very warmly greeted upon our arrival and, even though we arrived very early (around 11:30am), our room was available. The room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean, spacious and well equipped. The bed was supremely comfortable and this, along with the fact that there was very little noise from either outside or inside the hotel, sleep quality was excellent. The a/c was very powerful and very welcome as it was unseasonably warm outside. The complimentary WiFi was reasonably fast and reliable. We took breakfast at the hotel (a reasonable 10 Euro) and it was very good with plentiful choice and good quality. The room rate was extremely reasonable given the quality of the accommodation. The only negative comment we would make is that it is a pity that the hotel doesn't offer a pool (could be because they are attracting mainly business clientele rather than tourists?). Otherwise, an excellent choice!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay at the Hilton Garden Inn September 22 - 25. We were upgraded to a balcony room and was able to check in early because of our points status with Hilton. The bedding and bathroom area was large and roomy. The room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and toiletries. The buffet style breakfast was good. The hotel location was a short walk from Villa S. Giovanni metro stop. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood and has a new modern appearance. I would recommend this hotel if you want the convenience of public transportation and looking for a bargain place to stay.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel looks brand new. Nicely designed - minimalist / modern. We were lucky to have a balcony, but there is not much to see in this area of the city. The neighborhood seemed very boring and a bit run-down. Not many restaurants or attractions in the immediate area. However, the hotel is located only about a block from the M1 red line of the metro which was very convenient. Hotel staff were pleasant. Mattress was extremely firm. TV channels in English were scarce. Breakfast was below average with very runny scrambled eggs. Overall, an above average hotel in a below average part of town.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is ok breakfast was poor bed was 2 singles pushed together but room was comfortable and adequate. Staff nice and bar area was nice. Biggest problem for us was the 900euro deposit they take against your card and 10 days later struggling to get it refunded! Difficult when we are now home! Bill paid in full and no extras or damage.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights.Good sized room with very good ensuite facilities. Stayed on a B&B basis. Breakfast was average, nothing to fancy, not much hot food just the usual bacon and scrambled eggs. Hotel is about 15 mins on Metro Line from Centrale Station. 2 stops on the Green Line then 6 on the Red line to Villa San Giovanni. Then only a 2-3 minute walk from the Metro entrance.Nothing around the hotel as it's in a residential area. A few restuarants, no shop or supermarket that we could find for buying water or snacks but can be bought in the hotel. Most annoying thing for me was when trying ro get to sleep the flashing green light in the smoke detector in the ceiling that kept flashing all night. €5 room tax per person per night added to the bill.As stated it's not a very good hotel but it's better than Average.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is off the main city area, but can be easily accessible with the metro. Staff was great and hotel was very clean and modern. It was good to have a washer and dryer, as this was a middle point in our European travels. Would recommend staying here!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If the hotel was any closer to the city center if would be perfect for the stay in Milano. But even though it is a little bit far from the city center and it major attarctions it is still an great choice. You have a metro station close to the hotel so you are in center in 7-10min.Hotel in general is modern. I really liked the room I got, where the bathroom is not the first thing you see once you open the door. The room is big and comfy. It has a balcony but it's missing chairs and a table. That would be a great addition.Breakfast was good, plenty to choose from. Dinner was excellent. Maybe not a lot to choose from (if you stay more then 4-5 days) but the serving is great.The staff is exccelent. At the front desk you can get all the info about Milano (what to see and how to get there). The restaurant staff will welcome you with a smile and present and explain all you want to know about a certain dish or drink.Thank you for an excellnet stay!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would really like to appreciate the hotel about all comforts but really sad that they have so bad behavior staff they even don’t know how to talk with guest they treat really bad and don’t even talk with you totally disrespectfull attitude for the guest ,i hope the management will take look on this for such kind of staff,,we pay you mind it
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel nearby to subway station, which was very useful for initial access, as well as getting into Milan. Our room was very very clean and the bathroom was beautifully done. The freely available fridge was a nice touch, especially for storing food during the height of summer. The room service was very convenient, both reasonably priced and quickly prepared. The only downside was that the the we hoped that the price would mean that the hotel was more central, which would have made it perfect.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 rooms. 6 family members. Hotel staff couldn’t care less about our concerns or requests. Basically ignored everything we asked about. Manager decided to turn off the air conditioner for all rooms for several days. Didn’t tell anyone. We could understand why our rooms wouldn’t cool down. Room locks and elevator access inop for 3 days.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel because of the included parking, the close by metro station allowing us to go to the main attractions in the city center and we booked directly on the Hilton website as we are Hilton Honors members (just for info, the HH membership is useless, you get the same price on tripadvisor and the hotel will not give you any upgrade or extra, like complimentary water bottles or a fruit basket in you room with this membership).We did not like the neighborhood, the reception staff was not particularly friendly, the Deluxe King room was spacious but not at all cosy, the bath was very dark and not convenient for make-up, the mini-bar was empty and we had to buy drinks in a bizarre and not well catered self-service store next to the reception desk. The breakfast room was like a huge cafeteria designed for tour bus groups, not very cosy either. They have a large choice of pastries, meat, cheese, yogourt, cereal - they show vegan options on the room service menu, but it was not possible to have dairy free spread (margarine) or milk for breakfast.Let's say, this hotel is clean and has all the amenities you might expect for the price, period.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I didn't love the area - it's far from downtown and the neighborhood seems a bit rundown. Fortunately, the metro is half a block away which is great. Not only was that convenient but I wouldn't want to walk long distances in the neighborhood when it was dark. Now that we know our way around we might consider staying there again although I'd look for something else first.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and clean hotel. Rooms are spacious. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. I would like it to be in a better area but the Metro station is very close to it. So it is easy to move towards the centre .
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel. Clean room. Friendly staff. I enjoyed the grab and go breakfast bag they prepared for me, as I was up and out before the restaurant opened. All in all, a solid Garden Inn close to Linate Airport.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very new Hotel with nice rooms, Ober 100 TV channels from Italy, but no German TV and few EnglishPower slot at room entrance is a bit hidden, so I searched and stopped to sleep soonUnderground connection near by
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a perfect ending to our trip to Italy! The location is not city center, but it is very close to the center and the Metro into the city center is super close by. The hotel is brand new and all is very clean and modern. The staff was fabulous - all friendly, knowledgeable, welcoming and helpful. Would totally recommend!
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great atmosphere! I always stay with Hilton and have never been disappointed. They had a wake up call and a taxi waiting for us when we needed to leave super early in the morning.
hotelName:
6    Hilton Garden Inn Milan North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect stay to see Milano in a beautiful, easy and cheep way!Metro Stations are near by to visit All the Hotspots :-)Sightseeing Bus Station is at the Stadion San siro (only across the Street)! And absolutly the Best is the Very Very good and Delicious restaurant next door (sixties style) with American food
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good location, good service, near public transportation and the Mitic San Siro Stadium.The American grafity restaurent near the hotel is good, cooking well and nice.Also, the Ippodromo with Leonardo di vinci Design
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reception people were nice, especially the rott :)The room was good, comfy bed, tv with Sky channels.It would be nice to have a heating system in the bathroom.The location is great - nest to te San Siro stadium.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I selected this hotel because it was close to my office. I was surprisingly happy with the quality of the hotel. I would recommend it and will certainly come back there. maybe one thing would be that the hotel is a bit outside of the city center.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I have just spent an excellent week here I had travelled from Cyprus my son from the UK we just couldn’t fault this wonderfully friendly ran hotel.The rooms are lovely and warm cleaned and towels and bedding changed daily ,the breakfast is extensive and varied to suit all tastes the lovely gentleman from Cuba was very kind and the Receptionists Marianna and Andre spoke excellent English and gave us so much help and information a big thank you to them too.This is the first time in my life I have stayed in a dog friendly Hotel and I loved it .Excellent trip around the San Siro Stadium as it is directly across the road and many Restaurants in close proximity we hired a car for the week but there is a Metro station near the stadium and buses and trams into Milan which run frequently would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to all my friends and family as it is exceptional value for money.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff very helpful, easy check-in, rooms are spacious and very clean. Located beside San Siro stadium, literally 2 min walk away! The only downside is that I had a room facing the stadium, and after the match there were noises of machines cleaning the area around the stadium. Next time I will ask for a room on the other side of the hotel.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was cute, modern and clean. The staff was helpful and courteous, and the price was very affordable when booked well ahead of travel dates (I imagine the price goes up during games!) It is not bear the center and the metro is on the opposite side of the stadium. There is an good American restaurant attached, where I did eat after discovering there was nothing else nearby. Overall this was a great value, but you may want to consdier another location if you plan to visit the city center often.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is set right next to SanSiro ​​Stadium, great for football lovers. Very clean, decent and clean rooms, breakfast for all tastes, staff is receptive. It is very close to subway and tram, so it is easily accessible to the center, train station and other facilities. I kindly recommend
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here only one night. The room was nice and clean but a bit small. Check-in went smooth and breakfast was nice. There is an underground parking which is nice. Only thing that bothered me was a lack of maintenance in the room - shower head was loose, shower door did not close peoperly etc. No problem for one night stay, but could be annoying if staying longer.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On business trip in Milan, I was here for 2 nights. Decent room, bathroom could use a maintenance as some pieces were hanging loose. Breakfast is quite simple. Price is very competitive so I guess this is ok.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: average hotel, receptionists were not nice when I left the breeze,the room could be cleaner than wiping,a comfortable bed and a nice bathroom , the pictures look larger than the rooms are unfortunately much smaller in size
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is modern and great views of San Siro. The beds are very comfortable and rooms are spacious. Great restaurant next door ‘American themed’. The hotel is a long walk around the San Siro to the metro especially walking it 4 times a day haha. We had trouble with our room as the doors wouldn’t lock so had to move us twice and wasted nearly an hour. The room we eventually moved to wasn’t as good as the first but we was happy the door locked. Would have been a nice gesture for a complimentary drink/breakfast for all the messing about. Good hotel at the end of the metro line easily access the city within 10 minutes but again a 5/10 minutes walk from the metro but a scenic walk.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped here overnight after taking the F1 kit down to Monza racetrack.Hotel is modern with little atmosphere, it is clean and well thought out though.Rooms are clean and brightLobby is functionalBeds are very comfortableBathroom is greatShower is AWESOME !!!If you want a central base you could do a lot worse than this hotel
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I do not recommend this hotel.For ~ 100EUR / night you will receive this cleaning.The hotel itself is ok and very modern, but cleanness is the minus point of it. There is no mesh mosquito net. I'm sorry but it was a great disappointment.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous hotel! Should definitely be more like a four star. Staff were so helpful, and had us checked in within minutes. Room was spotless and lovely, spacious with a safe. Hotel is slightly out of Milan city centre however there is a gorgeous American Diner next door, and some cocktail bars round the corner. Room was cleaned daily by the maid, with fresh towels etc so we couldn't really ask for anything more. Allowed us to leave luggage until our evening departure, five minute walk from metro link which is the best way to get around Milan. Would definitely recommend, and for any football fans it is literally on top of the San Siro stadium.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time in this chain and I have no words, really! It's the best 3 star hotel I've ever stayed! Stuff and their wish to help was really of 5 stars : ) Lovely lady at the reception gave us a wonderful room with a view to the city. I'm not very much on breakfasts and big fancy rooms so as an accommodations it was really super!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room, staff , location, and food all were very good. The only issue was that there is no elevator to take you up to the rooms.making the climb a bit challenging for the senior citizens to gt to their rooms.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, good stuff, perfect breakfast. Close enough to the metro to get to anywhere we wanted to go to in Milano. Perfect for business trip.The best choice if you have a game or a concert at San Siro stadium!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stopped here for two nights as the first stop of our two week road trip. Easy to find with plenty of parking and directly opposite the San Siro stadium. Unfortunately we weren’t met with a warm welcome and were treated like a problem. Saying this, they did let us check in 2 hours early which was a godsend given we had a very early flight! Breakfast was not included. Rooms were very modern and comfortable. Short walk from the metro station and easy route into central Milan.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If Football’s your thing, make sure you get a room overlooking the San Siro Stadium. There was a match on when we were there, and it was exciting seeing he teams arrive. Hotel was good, friendly staff. Breakfast was a bit cake heavy and the beds were very small. Hotel has great links to the city and some nice places to eat. Recommended
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very happy with my one night stay at the B&B San Siro. Bearing in mind it is a budget hotel and very cheap for Milan, I set my expectations accordingly. Rooms were exactly as shown on the web, basic but modern and nice and clean. I asked for a quiet room and was given one on the 4th floor - it was quiet although you can hear a little traffic noise (very minimal). I did like the layout of the building, an octogan with a couple of rooms on each side - so no noise from the corridor or of the slamming doors of other rooms.I found the staff to be very nice - friendly and polite and gave me a nice recommendation for pizza nearby. Regarding location, the hotel is a 10 minute walk from the metro and from there a 20-minute ride downtown, so it is a little far out for visiting the old centre of Milan (although possible). There is an American diner on site (I didn´t try it - I wanted Italian food) and a nice Italian restaurant about 10 minutes walk down the road. Apart from that, there´s not much else in the area.If you are interested in AC or Inter Milan you will love the location - right in front of the stadium, so great for watching a match, doing the stadium tour or visiting the shop. I would definitely stay here again next time I visit Milan for business.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights to see Milan play football at the San Siro and also to explore the city. It was ideal for both. It is a stone's throw from the stadium! Also a 5/10 minute walk from the nearest tube stadium to get into the city centre. Our room was big and had all we needed (including a safe). Comfy bed - it's clearly a new hotel so everything is new. Great value for money. It was a really good stay and I'd recommend this hotel. The American restaurant on the ground floor is good too.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night when visiting Milan. Got exactly what you pay for; bed, shower, towels, toilet. Good value for money. Free wifi too! Nice American diner attached to the hotel, but aside from that not many (or cheap) places to eat near. So would recommend eating in the city before coming back here.10 mins max (if you're a slow walker) to the underground, very easy to navigate your way back to the centre.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: "Overall pleasant stay but a little dirty."The hotels location is easy into the city centre by metro which is just a short walk away. The san siro stadium is right outside the hotel. The hotel has a restaurant underneath which is open late for food which is good as the area is quite quiet. The hotel room itself was lovely, however the floor and the wall were incredibly dirty. People had signed their names on the wall in the dust. Very unpleasant. When mentioned to reception, they said they would mention it to the manager. I have emailed in with pictures and just waiting on the reply.Still waiting on this reply after receiving one stating they would address me directly.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay 1 Night in Milan.. Subway is near to take to Duomo di Milano.. Taxi cost from City Center 12€Pictures taken from our Balcony 6th FloorRooms are clean and spacious Balcony goes around building Nice staffParking over night 10€
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was staying at this hotel only one night. I definitely can recommend it. Very comfortable bed, clean, perfect interior, staff was very friendly to meet us at very late night and make for us a coffee takeaway :) Stadium is next to it and very gorgeous.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night for an AC Milan match, it's the opposite side of the road to the stadium, closer to it than the metro station. The room was spacious, had a good sized bathroom with basic toiletries, check in was simple, and the whole experience was painless. Would definitely return here when watching another match.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very good located hotel. The hotel is situated opposite the San Siro Stadium. The San Siro metro stop is just 5 minutes walk away. The rooms are a bit small but adequate. For a big person like me the shower can be a bit claustrophobic. The breakfast is extra. It has a poor choice of food selection. Just 1 type of ham and 1 type of cheese cut very small. There is yoghurt and some cereals. 2 hot items only. Scrambled eggs that are very bland and tinned sausages cut in circles. The pastries are good when they are fresh. They keep the old ones and use them the next day. The seating is very uncomfortable and not practical. I gave it a 3 star for the location and cleanliness. I would consider returning as the location is fantastic. The staff are very helpful and very cordial.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice, clean and cozy hotel. Breakfast is optional. The San Siro stadium is in front of the hotel and the metro is a five-minute walk. There is one ridiculous thing - the parking fee is 10 € per day!! Other than that, everything else was satisfying. Expect younger clientele.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 1 night for exhibition at Fiera Milano Rho, which was just a short taxi ride away! Room quite basic but very clean & comfortable, good size modern bathroom with great shower! Breakfast great value with lots of options.Very good American style diner on ground floor for dinner!Right opposite San Siro stadium!Would definitely stay agin
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is a just a bit off main streets, which results in a quieter night's sleep. We left the windows open on a pleasant summer night. Room was clean, modern and comfortable with above-average selections for Italian breakfasts. A great value in a great city.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel, the location is great if you are going to San Siro station. The staff are great. good wifi. The Metro is near the Hotel. I have visit this hotel twice now, and always happy with the stay.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night before moving to our holiday apartment within the centre of the city. The hotel is based right at the end of the metro line and overlooks the massive Milan stadium. Easy enough to find by car and by public transport. We parked downstairs for the night which was and extra ten euros. Apon check in we had to pay extra for the so called "tourist tax" in other words just a surcharge for being a foreigner. Never heard of this before but fair enough. Once paid we headed up to our room on the fifth floor. Nice and quiet.The room was modern, not thoroughly cleaned with stains on the desk and a mark on the bedding but nothing mega considering we were only here for one night. The bed was comfortable, shower was average. We couldn't borrow an ironing board and iron as apparently 99% of Italian hotels don't provide this. (Which I find hard to believe) The stay was good overall and we'd stay again. Just make sure you pack with everything folded ready to wear!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just checked out and we were not overly impressed. Upon arrival we were confused as originally told breakfast was included and then told otherwise. Staff were polite and helpful though, apart from the above. There was no tea or coffee in the room and no fridge which meant that we spent a lot in the hotel lobby. The spot is good for public transport with the no. 16 metro from outside the stadium taking you to the Duomo and the underground is a short walk away. However, there is little to do in the area. There is an American Diner next to the place which is quite nice and a bar down the road but other than that there was little choice. We also walked to the large Supermarket which was around 15-20 minutes away which a member of staff kindly directed us there. On a budget it is not ideal to stay here as you end up spending more on transport. We lived off bread and cheese from the supermarket rather than venturing into Milan every night. This meant we saved money but our taste buds were not satisfied!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms of this B&B hotel is amazing. Big rooms with big bathrooms. Location wise the hotel is near the Milan bus stop. Metro station is 10 mins walk away. There is an American dinner adjacent to this hotel. But a word of caution to reserve your seat in advance as this is the only hotel in the vicinity and the next nearest place to eat is Mc Donalds which is 15 mins walk away. The neighbour hood is quite and relaxing. A very big stadium is in front and Metro station next to the stadium. To reach the heart of Milan one needs to change two metros. The airports are far away from this place. Since metros dont work at late night we had to take taxi which charged as 100 Euro. The breakfast was for 9 Euro but the best spread I saw in my whole stay in Italy.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for a couple of nights at the end of July and were greeted fairly rudely by reception at this hotel. They were quite obviously making comments about us and another English couple we were with in Italian to each other and laughing. The guy made us feel awkward and as if we had asked for him to donate a limb rather than have help with checking in!! He said "you are making this very stressful for me" when I provided the 'incorrect' itinerary number (the one it stated in the email...) but there we go! The room was nice, smelt a little bit but clean with a comfy bed. The metro is more like a 5-10 minute walk but great to be close to as very cheap and convenient if you like to sight see. We were absolutely bitten to DEATH by mosquitos (not so much in the hotel, mostly outside in the day and night) so please take some repellant because it becomes quite unbearable!! Would also be nice to have a plug closer to the bed/mirrors and perhaps in the bathroom. Overall, not bad! If you have a football crazy partner then it's a great location for the stadium.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional room and lovely hotel. Once found way around easy to get into central Milan. Highly recommend the hotel and the little bar just around the corner for best Caesar salad.Staff were friendly and helpful
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this is the subway is 5 minute wall and you take one train to get to central milan where all the shops and cathedral is. Its less than 2 euros one way to central for tube. Also getting to central milan train station is pretty easy too!My airport was bergamo and at central milan train station you can find buses to take you there for 10 euros.The room are clean, modern and spacious you really can't go wrong i will deffintley be returning!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel for a weekend trip in Milan. The location is ok, metro and tram stops in front of the hotel, however there is nothing in this area...closest grocery store is 1km away.Room was clean, strangely no keycard but we had to pin in a 6-digit number every time. Our room was on the side of the riding hall with very strong horse smell, so opening the window was no option. The airco was quite loud, there was no nightstand and plug by the bed, which was a bit uncomfortable. The bed was sooooo comfy, had a perfect sleep both night!!Breakfast was...well...mostly sweet things, they had the worst scrambled eggs so chose the sugar instead :) But as a good point, coffee was really nice! Possibly a must in Italy:)So probably would not choose this hotel again, but if you"re going to a match or concert, then it is perfect!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly placed for my work in the stadium, it looks promising. Kind of large, but oddly shaped room. No fridge! No plug sockets near the bed, only on opposite wall. When you turn the bathroom light off, there is one that remains on which is stupid. Also, when you turn off the main light, the aircon turned off some 30 mins later so you wake in a pool of sweat. I found that I could change the aircon language to English and reset the power off behavior thankfully. But really shouldn't have to do that. Instead of a key or card for the door, you are given a 6 number pin code. Rubbish. One saving grace is the fact that they had a well stocked fridge at reception and a night receptionist so we could have late night drinks after work, lthough the old fella was pretty moody. Breakfast was not at all good the one time I made it there.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an excellent stay at B&B Hotel Milano, spent 8 days close to metro, tram and bus 5 min. walk. It is a bit far from MXP at least 45mins. My recommendation is some sort of contract with Taxi Services for guest to have access to the airport that cost less than 95 euros. I wish they had an Ice Machine being your drinks remained hot unless you choose to spend 3 euros for a small can of coke. You can obtain metro passes from front desk at 4.50 euros for 24 hrs. access that was GREAT!! It's always GREAT to have a go to person prior to your arrival so confirm. Lorenzo was a huge blessing and then I was taken aback on his days off. The remaining staff was courteous however didn't speak any English at all but very accommodating.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple of days during our holiday. The hotel is right next to the Stadium , metro 5 and tram 16 is close to it. The hotel is modern, our room was clean and comfy. Breakfast is not included in the price and it's like €7/ person. Staff is nice and you can buy beverages and snacks, too, which is good because there isn't a shop close to the hotel. There's a really cool american restaurant next to the hotel, America Graffiti it's worth to eat there.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved that one night spent in this hotel! It was extremely clean! Big bathroom, really clean towels, comfortable bed... Receptionists were kind and helpful. We got some discount on breakfast cause we happened to be there during the weekend. It's close to metro and very easy to find too.Another positive detail: you can enjoy FREE and REALLY fast wifi here!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my girlfriend here for three nights in Feb 2017. Room was very clean and modern with LED TV included. Bathroom was clean as well with modern furniture and stuff.We really liked the breakfast at B&B Hotel, especially pancakes were excellent.If you are visiting AC/Inter Milan, this is the best place to stay, San Siro stadium is situated right cross the road.If you are in Milan to visit mainly the city, it can be little bit out of perimeter but it is not an issue when you use underground.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my fiancée stayed here in late March 2017. We stayed for 3 nights after getting a great deal booking through Trip Advisor.Prior to arriving, I emailed the hotel directly asking for a room on a high with a balcony. Sure enough, when we arrived.. my request was catered to. The hotel is directly next to the San Siro Stadio and the view is truly breathtaking.I had forgotten to print our transfer documents for arrival in Bergamo but tickets were avaliable on the flight. These were around €10pp return. There are also plenty of coaches outside Bergamo airport that will take you to Milan Central Station for €5 one way. There are also return transfers to the airport from Milan Central Station to the airport for the same price.Depending on your time of stay in Milan, using the Metro is by far the best way to get around. We stayed for 4 days and bought 2 x two day urban tickets that can be used as often as you like on the Metro for 2 days. This ticket costs €8.25 for the 2 days.When arriving at Milan Central Station, walk around the corner to the Metro. Take the green line to Garibaldi Station (2 stops) and then swap onto the purple line. Take the purple line from Garibaldi to San Siro Stadio (8 stops). When you exit the station, turn left and walk towards the stadium. Looking to the left of the stadium, you'll see the hotel approximately 200m away.Check in is pretty simple. We were greeted by Andrea (Who was fantastic our whole stay). Our passport details were taken and the City Tax was paid. The Tax was €24 for us both. The rate is usually between €3 - €5 pppn.As previously mentioned, Andrea was fantastic our whole stay. He was able to give recommendations for places to eat and drink, directions when needed, was very friendly and spoke great English with us as our Italian is quite limited.The hotel is extremely clean and very modern. The room was of average size and contained a television, hair dryer and desk. The beds were also extremely comfortable for those who are like me and love a good bed. We stayed room only but breakfast is offered upon arrival for around €7 per person. There is also an American restaurant next to the hotel. They kindly gave us a table on our last night without a reservation even though it was extremely busy. The food was really good and cheap.The area around the hotel is extremely quiet. We weren't there during match day, but I'd expect it to be quite noisy then. We would have loved to have seen a match but maybe next time. Being so close to the stadium was great and we took the stadium tour which was €17pp.For those wanting to shop in Milan Centre, take the Metro from San Siro Stadio (Purple line) to Lotto (4 stops) and then switch to the red line. Take the red line from Lotto to San Bagila (10 stops). This will leave you right in the centre of Milan's main shopping area. Go one stop extra on the red line (Duomo) and it will drop you right outside the famous Milan Cathedral.All in all, I'd definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Milan. It is a little further out of the City Centre but with the area being quiet, being next to the stadium and the breathtaking views of the Centre of Milan, it is definitely worth it.Enjoy your stay in Milano!!
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean little hotel near the stadium. Staff is very friendly. However, don't go to the breakfast area at rush hour in the morning. It is so small that you have to fight to get your coffee. I will go back again.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very marvelous hotel near to the san siro staduim. The view of stadium was amazing, the room was very large, the decoration 's room is minimal and the bed was very enjoyable for a couple. The breakfast is fully and the staff very pleasant and kind.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a really nice place, a 5 min walk from the san siro metro station and the best part was that the San siro was right next to it. The rooms were really good and clean. The shower was pretty good and the staff were really friendly. 5 star for me.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant location! Not far from San Siro Stadio metro station! Rooms were clean staff were helpful. The only con would have been breakfast their wasnt much option and the orange juice was watered down but amazing! the stadium is right outside we were lucky enough to have a football match on during our stay the atmosphere was AMAZINGI would deffo come again
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights (11th Jan-13th Jan 2017) as we were watching an AC Milan game across the road from the hotel, San Siro Stadium.We arrived from Malpensa airport, took the Trenord XP1 train to Cadona (£13 each way, bus is cheaper), got a day travelcard (called an urban card in Milan, you can buy a daily card for 4.50 or a two day card for 8.25) at Cadorna and got the M1 line to Lotto, and from Lotto we got the M5 line to San Siro Stadium. Took about 25 mins. The walk from the M5 line to the hotel takes about 10 mins. Check in took longer than I would have expected given that I had paid before my stay and all my detail were given. The gentleman who checked us in picked up the phone while checking us in which I think is rude and definitely held us up but this is the only thing that wasn't perfect about the hotel.The hotel was very cheap but it is modern and clean with lovely showers, good size beds and a little shop downstairs which isn't too badly priced (1.50 euro for a 500ml of water) I asked for a good room as it was my boyfriends birthday and we must have got the best room there was (room 515) - we had a direct view of the stadium. The rooms were really spacious, as were the bathrooms. The heating system in the room was easy to use and control. The best part of this hotel was going to the game and being able to walk back within 5 mins. Amazing. WiFi works in your room and is quick and effective.There is an American diner themed restaurant right next to the hotel which was lovely, burgers and chips range from 4 euro - 12 euro. Lots on offer.I would 100 per cent recommend this hotel. The area hasn't got much to offer other than the stadium but with cheap daily travel, it doesn't really matter.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This could be a really good option to stay in Milan. The staff is very kindful. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The view from the windows isn't the best thing on it, but you can try to imagine some stories throught those walls (joking).I recommend B&B.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For some reason every time I needed something from the reception they give me the face.. I asked for more blanket in the night and they told me to wait an hour- so I did. And then, the cleaning lady took it the next day. So I asked again, now I need to wait "couple of hours". I asked the reception guy for his name and refuses to say.. Overall they are not to nice. It's too bad because the place it self is nice
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am very satisfied with my stay here. The room was very clean and comfortable, the staff was very polite and helpful. Breakfast was excellent!!! I will come back here for sure next time I visit Milan.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel because it was a) right beside the San Siro and b) well priced. Sadly that’s just about all it has going for it. To begin with, the name is misleading – it’s a B&B hotel but for some reason they deem it acceptable to charge extra for their breakfast – unlike almost every other hotel in Milan. This really reduces its value for money. Secondly, when you read that there is nothing nearby, believe that this is the case. The metro is 5-10 minutes walk away if you cut through by the side of the stadium - if however you arrive at night and don’t fancy walking round this empty area, you will take 15-20 minutes to walk the long way round. There is no restaurant (beyond breakfast) in the hotel, and the shop they tote on their web site comprises merely a few packs of Pringles and other unhealthy fare. There is one restaurant next door and one other 5 mins walk away, but in the main you will need to walk 5-10 minutes to the Metro and then another 5-10 minutes beyond it to find anything at all to eat. There are then a few pizza restaurants, a McDonalds and a small supermarket with a rather poor selection. The restaurant next door is fine at a push, as long as you aren’t vegetarian; all veggie/vegan options contain revolting fake meat. We asked for a quiet room with a view of the San Siro. It turns out this is an impossibility as there is a busy road between the hotel and the stadium; this is especially a problem on Friday nights when the local boy racers scream up and down until the wee hours. We ended up with a room on the side of the hotel so no view of our beloved stadium, however it did have a great view of the Milan skyline so not all was lost. The room itself was a decent size (note: the higher in the building the larger the rooms as there are fewer per floor) but it had only one chair, and only two plugs which is completely insufficient. No hospitality tray. The windows had obviously been open all day when we arrived as the room was full of mosquitos, and the walls were spotted with the corpses of their forebears and the blood of previous residents. The room was otherwise clean. The bathroom grout, however, needing a damn good bleaching. The toiletries provided were minimal, but adequate. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom. The shower was powerful and hot water was plentiful. The pillows on the bed were awful, inducing pain within half an hour. I ended up having to put the two tiny ‘for-decoration’ cushions into the pillowcase as a makeshift alternative. The air con was quiet and also quite effective, which was a relief as it was very hot in the room and there was no way you could open the windows and not be eaten alive. There was quite a bit of noise from within the hotel with doors banging. We were on the top floor but did wonder whether the floors below us suffered from noise as the floors are hard. We’ll be back to the San Siro, but we will definitely be trying one of the hotels in the vicinity of the nearby Lotto metro station instead. We would only recommend this hotel for a one night for a match IF you really can’t find anywhere else.
hotelName:
7    B&B Hotel Milano San Siro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to this hotel due to our AirBNB not having sufficient air conditioning on an extremely hot day.We booked two rooms ; this was the cheapest for a same-day booking so we picked it! When we arrived, staff were very kind, helpful and generous. The woman at the check in desk was lovely and was a lot of fun t talk to!Due to being diamond members, we were upgraded to deluxe rooms - very beautiful and a good amount of space!Food-wise, I wasn't personally interested in the restaurant they had (Food was expensive, no "staples"). Instead, we opted for room service! Best of both worlds. Food was delicious and delivered in a timely manner.This hotel is literal steps from the train station - great location!
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel next to the train station, very well organized, professional staff, a real pleasure. The lounge is nice, clean and the staff is super friendly, will do business again. Thanks for a great memory.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights in June 2019. Conveniently located near the Central Train Station. Hotel and room were dated. It was a mistake to open the window during my stay as I had multiple bites by mosquitoes. Had breakfast on the Executive Lounge and it was pretty quiet and pleasant.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the proximity to the central station makes it an ideal choice for a hotel to stay at in Milan, which is of very good standard, clean and convenient, especially for business travelers. the hotel has a nice lobby , and easy access.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, near train station, overall staff was good with one person named Dannielle was superb. The bed @314 needs replacement. Water heating was very well controlled & Free internet was good. Breakfast was excellent...
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ate at the executive lounge but didn’t care for the food options. The room was a bit noisy but close to the train station. You can’t walk to the duomo or to shopping from there though which is a bummer. Diamond members get to choose from room service breakfast, mini bar items or an ironed shirt which was nice. The whole thing just didn’t really feel special since it was packed for a conference when we were there and I’m not sure if there was a pool or not. It’s good for a solo business traveler but not for vacation
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, good location with great service. The central station is a few minutes walk with good connections to the rest of the city. Reached the hotel before the checkin time and was accomodated. However, the room decor seemed a bit outdated.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Design and layout of room was modern. It was also very clean, spacious and comfortable. Good quality toiletries provided in the bathroom. Breakfast served a good spread, and staff at the cafe were friendly and proactive. Most staff very friendly. Good location - just 5 min walk to Milano Centrale train station.Only negative: asked one of the female staff at front desk to help store some stuff in the cloak room freezer. When she was about to do so, a more senior male staff told her that she should direct us to the concierge. Then he mansplained to us that we should approach the concierge. I really don't understand this fine division of labour. There was no queue behind us, so there's really no need for her attend to other guests. Couldn't she have just attended to us? That male staff is really a gem.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Hilton Milan for 3 nights in june 2019. The hotel is centrally located just 5 minutes from Milano Centrale station which is a major advantage for sightseeing. The rooms are spacious & comfortable. A/C was good; lockers & Kettle worked well.WIFI is excellent. Reception very friendly. Best were the Conceirge. They were extremely helpful in booking taxis, giving directions to places, suggesting local markets & shopping areas & talking to drivers in italian. Breakfast restaurant was superb with a large spread. They even made us Fried rice with vegetables at short notice as we were veg. Overall excellent service and highly recommendable
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A typical Hilton hotel, it was clean and employed friendly staff. The room was comfortable and quiet. Breakfast offered many international options. Two blocks away is the train station which can take you wherever you want to go.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice enough and in a great location... walking distance from Milano Centrale and not too far from attractions 9 euro taxi cab ride. I wouldn’t expect great recommendations from the staff... probably better from the cab drivers... that said the food at the restaurant was fantastic, much better than food experienced around town.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was the smallest room I've ever seen even for European standards. Barely enough room to fit a king bed and the bathroom was so small couldn't fit two people at the same time. The only thing good about the location is that it is near the central train station; otherwise, it is a dead part of town. Workers were fine, executive lounge was nice. I would not recommend staying in this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this location, will use in the future for business. Staff is excellent and location perfect . Dinner was high quality and spectacular options and quality at a reasonable price Got the train to the airport with a very short walk, it was convenient all around
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well-cared for during my brief Milan stay. Actually a business trip, but with a weekend layover. Hotel nicely situated near train station and a good launch point. Excellent service, highly recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As we used train as the primary transportation in our 14-day trip in Italy, Hilton Milan is perfect for us to its proximity to Milan central station. Very convenient for us to travel from Milan Airport and carried on to Venice. The metro station is just beneath the train station.Friendly staff, room feels a bit old but clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful accommodating staff who spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful. Breakfast was superb, with chefs taking platters of tasting options to all the tables. Check in was a breeze and the staff were very helpful with local suggestions. Literally a 4 minute walk from central station.Watch the mini bar! My daughter took some items out to play with them and we were nearly charged! Wished we could have stayed longer!
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second stay at this hotel was magnificent.As a diamond returning guest we received a wonderful upgrade to a top floor suite.A one bedroom penthouse suite with a huge separate living area and two balconies.The staff were wonderful throughout our stay.Breakfast in the main restaurant was lovely and the executive lounge remains outstanding.Hotel is so close to the main station and all that Milan has to offer.Fantastic dining a short walk away on via Gustavo Fare and beyond.Thank you again for such a wonderful stay, see you again in December 2019.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well what should I write about this hotel. I was skeptical about my decision when I booked this hotel but today I am happy that I have chose Hilton Milan in Milan. Location is just 200 Mtrs away from Milan central station. Currently I am staying in this hotel and moment I checked in it was pretty smooth . I was treated with smile by Gentleman name Johnny Giovanni. My check in was smooth and being the Hilton Honours Gold member I was upgraded to executive large room with executive lounge benefits. I was surprised to know that this guy is working in this hotel from last 39 years. Then we were helped by Faisal at Bell desk who really helped with our bag which was damaged during travelling and he always greeted us with smile .We are Asian vegetarian so the duty manager Ricardo and F&B manager really helped us in Breakfast and in executive lounge that we get vegetarian food specially prepared for us . Andre at executive lounge really look after us very well. Paola at concierge is a great guy and great help for us to plan all our trips . These are jewels of this Hotel and this Hotel is very lucky to have them . I strongly recommend this hotel to all my fellow Indian friends .
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is absolutely helpful and friendly at any time. They work with you to find the best solution and take time that every guest really feels welcomed. Thank you for that! Unfortunately the rooms are a bit old fashioned and especially the bathrooms are outdated with shower curtains. That encounters for a bit of a stuffy smell in the room, the bathroom. There are renovated , though. But they are small in size.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this property. Excellent service. Clean rooms. Very accessible to the trains and subway. It is also near some very good restaurants. I have stayed here at least 3 times. Would not hesitate coming back if I’m in town.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a 5 minute walk from the Central Station/Metro. Very easy and convenience. Breakfast was excellent and the staff spoke English too. I will highly recommend it! FYI if you don’t have electric adapter, you can buy it from the station’s shops. There is also a little supermarket inside the station too!
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being our last leg of our little Italian adventure, we decided to treat ourselves and booked in here for 2 nights. When checking in however, we were informed that there was no free WiFi. (I know we don't go on holiday for the WiFi, but to use the internet to be able to plan your day, check in online with the airport and talk to family back home, it comes in handy) we were given the option to sign up to some club/newsletter this than entitled us to free WiFi, rather than pay the €20 for 24hrs. This did disappoint me a little. As well the disappointed look on the receptionist persons face when we said we didn't wanna pay and add the breakfast to our stay. We already paid so much and it seemed like they wanted more money from us. The room however was very nice and clean, and a decent size. The bathroom was nice and clean, but the shower could do with being updated. Hotel is in a good location to train station & metro.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2nights at Hilton Milan for a long weekend. The hotel was okay , with good service and clean. However Executive lounge Absolutely needs a facelift! It is old not very cozy but the food was very good!Easy access to hotel from central station and an easy 25 min walk to City centre!
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location and the staff were so friendly I enjoyed staying in this hotelFor next time i will plan to come again Really I recommend this one and the main station next to you walking distance.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The communal spaces of this hotel are lovely, clean, design forward and comfortable. The breakfast offering is enjoyable. The location is okay, but a bit of a walk if you are a tourist vs. in for business. The rooms are small. The beds are hard and the rooms run hot. The hallways are noisy. Between the temperature, noise and stiff bed, I never sleep well at this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let's say you have a lot of luggage, and you are taking the train into or out of Milano Centrale. IF that's you -- this is the perfect location. It is a couple of miles from the Duomo and other downtown sights - but it is ONE block from the train station. Friendly, helpful staff - recently renovated lobby - good restaurant/lounge - "breakfast on the go" options - clean, well-appointed rooms. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, I have to disclose :-) that I am a fan of Hilton hotels based on my experience. We needed to stay close to the central railway station in Milan, as we arrived there from Rome by train for just a couple of days. When I saw a Hilton hotel among the others within a walking distance from the station, priced similarly, it was an easy booking decision for me to make. This particular hotel didn't disappoint. Everything was run smoothly, the room was perfect. We needed an extra bed for our kid, and it was delivered instantly. The proximity to the Milan Centrale station is also convenient due to several airport shuttle buses located there. As of 2019 the bus ride to Malpensa airport is 8 euros.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed at this hotel a number of times for work the staff is always smiling very professional. The Appertivo is not to be missed bartenders are great and good snacks before dinner. Rooms are always clean and smells fresh kept up to date. Breakfast has a great variety. Train station is near the hotel if you want to venture out.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff here were amazing..our room was large, very clean and the bed was perfect. The gym was beautiful...but to be honest, the included breakfast was 10/10 amazing...so much delicious food of all varieties! These folks have really gone above andbeyond and you will be delighted if you stay with them. A bonus is that Milano Centrale train station is a short 5 minute walk away, and there is an awesome supermarket at the train station!
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived to several lines at check in and I asked if as a prepaid guest and a Hilton Honors Membership could we get some preferential treatment. They went looking for someone who could help and by the time they got there it was our turn anyway.Our 5 day stay was longer than their typical booking, we were prepaid and I was a Hilton Honors member... so the desk clerk said she’d give us an upgrade to her favorite room.
