We went to the room and were impressed with the size, although it looked a little worn. We unpacked and my wife went into the bathroom where she found some hairs in the shower. She also noticed the sink was just too close to the toilet and had some concerns over the toothbrushes being in such close proximity to the toilet bowl. I went downstairs to the front desk and asked if we could get a room with a larger bathroom and was told by another friendly desk clerk that all the bathrooms were pretty much the same. When I asked if she could recommend another hotel in the area she suddenly found a junior suite with a larger bathroom... and it happened to be her favorite suite in the hotel.We looked at the room and the bath and we felt it to be acceptable... although again we felt it to be a little worn.The first night was bad. My wife woke up with an allergic reaction to the pillows and we called housekeeping... but got the front desk. When I explained what happened they were very concerned and asked when we planned on leaving the room in order that they could replace the pillows and linens and do a deep cleaning. We gave them a time and left... spending the day touring. They replaced the pillows and bedding and everything seemed ok.We spent the next day in the room as a result of us both suffering from a cold. We had room service the night before and continued with lunch and dinner in the room during our sick day. Ordering was difficult. One one occasion the man taking the order had to come to our room because we couldn’t understand him over the phone. Menu is limited and quality of food is well under prices charged.Next day we left and upon our return discovered the bathroom was not properly cleaned. We took pictures and called housekeeping. Got the front desk and we were asked to send copies of the pictures. We did and when we got downstairs ran into our friend the first desk clerk who heard about our problem and introduced us to a customer service executive who agreed with everything and then told us she’d discuss with housekeeping supervisor... and to have a drink on the house. We explained we’d be happy to buy our own drinks and let them just make sure our room was properly cleaned. We had a drink and dinner. Food quality was marginal and overpriced.Next day we noticed pastry crumbs on the rug from something we ate two days prior... which meant that part of the room was not vacuumed. They also neglected to provide wash cloths. We called housekeeping and got the front desk. Took pics of the rug and sent to our previous contact, answered a knock to reject the hand towels and send him back for wash cloths and went downstairs again.All our friends told us how concerned they were and how they would make it good. We explained all they had to do was have a lady clean the room correctly. They agreed, we went to dinner, Food was “Chef Boyardee” quality at high prices.Next day was uneventful except when we came back to the room we found what appeared to be a clean room.., but... the trash basket in the bathroom was full of our tissues and there was very little toilet paper.We let our friends know, told them not to worry, we’d be leaving in the morning and they even helped arrange for a car to take us to the airport They were truly nice people trying to satisfy us, placate us, very sensitive to our insistence on having a clean room. They even bought our two drinks and two dinners for two nights in a row. Frankly, we had a very pleasant time with them, BUT... we’ll never go back to that hotel. It’s a shame... the location is amazing. The people are kind, virtuous and friendly. If only they could get cleaning people who keep a room clean. A person can get very sick in an almost clean hotel room
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got the family room at Hilton Milan. The hotel is centrally located, just a few steps away from the central station and 4 metro stops away from the city center. The staff at the reception were very kind and helpful. Special thanks to Karen at the reception.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sabrina at the front desk put me in Room 241, which is very small, with only a foot between the end of the bed and the wall. There isn't enough clearance between the closet and the side table, so the closet door can't open completely. The room is also next to an airshaft. If you are put here, the hotel will not give you a discount, so beware!
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here on business for two nights. I’m a regular visitor to Milan plus a Hilton Honors member. Have wanted to try this Hotel for a while. What a huge disappointment. Upon entering the lobby looks good and staff friendly and warm. Due to my early arrival the room I had checked in online was not ready. I was expecting and prepared to wait. However the Reception gentleman advised he was going to upgrade me to a room on the 9th floor. That sounded good to me. My heart sunk when I entered the unrenovated tired and old room. It was large but....... I travel a lot and can not recall ever seeing a TV not in front of the bed. I didn’t use it but would have been a major issue for someone who enjoys winding down watching some tv. They would have had to sit on the desk chair and look across to the wall on the other side. Such a simple solution to move the desk and bed. Beyond logic to me. The curtains were out the arc with a fabric covered pelmet which went across the ceiling. This can only be 1970s. Then no PowerPoint where the kettle is. You have to take the kettle over to the desk to boil water. The bathroom was large but so outdated with ghastly shower curtain and a mission to comprehend how to turn on the tap. Only after did I see the instructions on the wall to turn on a tap!The lighting in the bathroom is so bright one needs to wear sunglasses. Another first for me. The air conditioner I wanted switched off which I did successfully but on off it made a terrible racket. On reporting the noise to Reception it was immediately rectified. Very helpful and pleasant staff. Next was trying to charge various devices. Not nearly enough power points and most were so old they didn’t work. I moved furniture to use better power outlets. The bed was comfortable and room was quiet and clean. The breakfast was good and more than enough to choose from for myself however I wouldn’t call it amazing like others have done. I left a sweater behind on the chair the first morning. Only realised the next day. After querying I was told all items found in the breakfast room get handed to the Concierge. The Concierge on duty that morning said two items were indeed handed in the day before but they were not there anymore. So I guess someone else claimed my sweater. Not the Hotels fault but nevertheless disappointing. All in all the Staff were great, the lobby attractive but the room was really not up to standard for the rates. Fortunately I got a good deal but would never pay over 300 euros per night for one person for this kind of accommodation. The Hilton Garden Inn Milan North is better value for money with great rooms. I did receive an email from the Hotel advising I would get a better room on the executive floor for my next stay. I appreciate the gesture but I won’t be returning to this particular Hilton.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: System went down and I could not check out properly. I was told I was going to be charged on my registered credit card and then be sent the invoice by email. Still waiting. I don’t even know how much I spent. Not expected from a Hilton hotel, usually I have very good experience with this chain. Would not come back to this one in Milan
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a Hilton honors and long lasting customer of the chain I can easily say this is the worst Hilton I’ve stayed in by a mile and I’ve stayed in 25 plus Hiltons globally. Tried to check in early with my wife and three year old. Got served by the tall bald guy that was impolite, bad mannered and looked very scruffy. Our room wasn’t ready so he gave us a room on the 9th floor that didn’t fit a baby cot. Room was old and reminded me of the 90’s. Went back down and decided to wait for our room. Waited for half hour forty minutes giving them plenty of time to clean and prepare our room which was available but just not ready but still nothing. Front desk guy looked like he couldn’t care less. We decided to go out for the day even though we traveled all morning as we were just there for one day before our early flight. Turns out it was the best decision as the worst part of Milan was this hotel and it’s ridiculous staff. People in Milan are generally rude and aggressive but you’d think that Hilton would find a few people that broke the stereotype to employ but they failed miserably. Come back to hotel at night, asked the concierge for scales to weigh our luggage but couldn’t have them as they were locked in a drawer and the keys were with the concierge that starts wok at 11pm and this was not an accident but policy I was repeatedly informed. What a joke. On check out same old madness. Lorenzo came picked up our bags from the room and I asked him to weigh them when he goes down as it was now 3 am. Needless to say he ignored me. I asked him again when I went down and he didn’t want to do it so his colleague tried to do it. Turns out the scales don’t work. Then Lorenzo started shouting to my wife as he was refusing to help and check out seemed like rocket science. Cut long story short luckily we spent there just a few hours and would advise anyone with a little dignity to stat away from this embarrassment. Even the other room we got on the forth floor had no resemblance to a Hilton. The bathrooms were old and dirty. Stay away.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff in this hotel are very helpful however some times a little disorganised. Stayed there for 3 nights and had to check in and out each day, different room each night so had to pack all my belonging each morning before heading off to the office.Rooms are extremely small, kept knocking my legs on the corner of the bed frame so few bruises to say the least.Breakfast is very good, everything which you would expect. Tea and coffee facilities available in your room except that it is powdered milk. Gym is fabulous, best thing about this hotel in my eyes. Only down fall is that the rooms are too small.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in March and the hotel location is amazing central metro station is nearby the hotel staff friendly the breakfast has lots of choices even fresh orange juice machine is in place coffees are tasty and executive lounge service is nice.Very nice and clean suite room, we totally enjoyed !
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made a solo weekend tourist visit to the Hilton Milan, arriving on a Saturday morning and leaving Monday morning. I am a Hilton Gold member and used points for the stay. I was able to check-in online the day before, but upon arrival, I was upgraded and given a 4th floor room overlooking the street about 3.5 hours before the check-in time.My room was fine, a little on the small size, but with a comfortable king-size bed, and a decent sized bathroom. The in-room fridge was mini-bar only and the prices were as you would normally see (ridiculous). However, as a Gold member, I was provided with a coupon for 3 free items (or an cleaned/ironed shirt, 15% off dinner or breakfast-in-bed).The staff was wonderful. From the doormen, to the concierge, to the front desk staff to the restaurant staff, everyone spoke excellent English and were uniformly friendly and efficient. The lobby is very attractive and while I did not eat in the main restaurant, it looked excellent, albeit with slightly higher than expected pricing. Breakfast was included in my room (20E otherwise) and was one of the best non-Hawaiian breakfast buffets I have had. There was a lot of everything, from local dishes to dim sum to a fresh omelet station, fresh orange juice machine, etc. Fantastic.The hotel is about a block from Milan Central train station, which is more central for business than tourists, and the area is a little dead during the weekend. There is a parking garage adjacent to the hotel and a taxi stand right in front. The main tourist areas are a few stops away on the subway and it is a must to get an ATM transit pass, which includes off-on privileges on the subway, buses and trams and can get you pretty much anywhere in the city (even out to the San Siro) in 20 minutes.In all, I was very happy with my stay and would absolutely return and recommend this very well-run hotel.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The main benefit of staying at this place is the proximity to the train station. It's only a few minutes walk away. Walking downtown to the shopping is not too strenuous either. The hotel itself is the standard Hilton set-up but not as thoroughly carried through with as in the USA. I thought the room a little cold and the breakfast a little bland. But the staff do what they do quite efficiently and they speak English well enough to give clear directions.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Become a Hilton honours member and even as a Blue member was able to get an upgrade to the executive floor with access to the executive facilities which includes drinks, canapies and breakfast. Lovely large rooms.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I picked this hotel because it was very close to the train station and it was easy to get around town. The staff were some of the best I have experienced anywhere, and the facility was great. The fitness room even had weights. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very friendly and welcoming staff. The hotel is well maintained and offers good rooms. We had a business meeting and service was well functioning. Food was great, both during lunch, breakfast and even for the dinner (even accommodating dietary restrictions).Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in room 861Pros:- Nice and clean room- Excellent Breakfast- Very close to Milan Centrale station so perfect location to catch metro or interstate trains. Have to catch metro to goto the Cathedral or city centerCons:- I did not like the fact that you have to pay 15 euro/day for wifi - Not a biggie for me but one of the breakfast attendant wasn't concentrating on customers. My request for coffee was ignored
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a business meeting with a large and international team at this hotel. This is a hotel I would go back to but then to enjoy the city of Milano and have some leisure time. Well suited for business meetings, quite enticing for a city holiday.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very close to the train station. You can walk to and from the train station in 5 minutes. The staff was so great because we were late arriving due to our train being delayed. We had a tour scheduled so the staff checked us in, stored our bags and had us on our way in less than 15 minutes. We were able to make our tour with 5 minutes to spare. Not bad considering our train was 45 minutes late. They also had a great recommendation for a local restaurant for dinner.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed three nights in a suite. Nice accommodations and the staff was helpful. Valentina at the front desk was especially nice and a great ambassador of Hilton and the property! The breakfast was good enough but not great. I will say the Executive Lounge was average, at best. Very convenient location to the central train station (a block or so away), which made visiting other parts of Milan very easy with the access to the Metro. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a trip to Milan kind of last minute over the New Year period. We tend to stay in Hiltons as my boyfriend is a member of the Hilton Honours Scheme so this looked great.Hotel itself is very nice - clean, modern, spacious and well equipped. We had a room on the third floor, couldn't complain about it as had everything we needed. We had been upgraded to the executive lounge through the Hilton Honours scheme was great, this meant we could go for breakfast/ refreshments throughout the day/ food and alcoholic drinks between a certain time period on the evening which we always made use of. The only downside personally would have been the breakfast in the main area as this was always busy and there was little food left when we arrived (but I think that may have been down to the time of year and with it being very busy).Staff at the hotel were also great, very accommodating and happy to help with our queries! Check in/out was hassle free, and they were kind enough to give us some vouchers to get so many items from the mini bar free of charge. We also asked for some advice on a day trip to Lake Como and places to eat, and the staff were great (can't remember names - apologies) but they printed out travel times, advised on where to get the train and things to do, and even rang a restaurant to book us a meal one evening.Location was great for us, if you like to walk it was only around 30 minutes to the Cathedral and main square (with plenty to see in between - shops, bars, restaurants etc.) or you could catch a train at the central station which is literally just around the corner from the hotel and doesn't take long. Trains are cheap enough and you can get a day ticket for less than 4 euro per person which means you can swap trains and travel around Milan a little more. Would definitely stay here again if I visited Milan!
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff. Wonderful breakfast. Excellent choice for the business traveler as well as the family looking for a short break away in Milan. It is also connected with a private parking operating next door which basically means that you can park your car there with as little as 25 EUR more or less per 1 full day.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip for several nights. As I see it this is standard Hilton property and you pretty much get what you'd expect from that.What makes this place extra nice is its proximity to the Milan Central Train Station (which is a short 5 min walk away). You can get a direct train from the Malpensa Airport (MXP) to here as well as trains to Rome, Venice, etc. It is also a transit hub so you can get on the Milan subway here to (It's only 2 or 3 short stops to many tourist destinations).My room appeared to be a little bit on the older side but was overall very good; large comfortable bed, quite, good space for working, plenty of closet space, etc. It was on the top floor and had a large walk out patio with chairs and a small table (which would have been very lovely if it was summer). My only nit picky complaints would be that 1) the switches for turning the lights on and off were in unintuitive places and 2) The shower/tub had a curtain rather than a door (I always find that shower curtains either get the floor wet are billow into the shower and stick to you body).
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bathroom felt more like a Hilton Garden Inn. Small, low quality bathroom products, and there was a long black hair in the tub when I arrived. Also, the drain in my sink was pushed down and I couldn’t find a way to lift it back up, so if you washed your face or your hands, it took forever for the sink to drain. We were here less than 24 hours — stayed after an evening flight into Milan and a morning trip up to Lake Como. Standard room is small in size, bed is very firm, but blankets are cozy. Blackout curtains were great. I would have been a little bummed if we were here for several days.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I stayed one night as a stop off on our way to Rome. We walked from the train station, it is that close. I had a sophisticated New/Old Europe ambience and staff that made me feel like I paid a whole lot more for my room.We got in a little late and had some water and a cocktail from the mini-bar. I wish I had written down what the little cocktail was, as I have been craving another like it since that night.Next morning, great buffet. Many choices, ultra clean restaurant. Then parked our luggage with the concierge while we took in Milan for the day until an evening train to Rome.Extremely happy with this stay.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for three nights as part of a package which included the train fares (we travelled by train from London). The hotel is very near Central Station and therefore extremely convenient. The rooms were excellent, and the breakfast was extensive, plentiful and delicious.The staff were so helpful and nice. We would have been far from their most distinguished or lucrative guests, but they treated us with great kindness and efficiency. I would particularly like to commend the concierge, Mr Pio Torrone, who helped us plan our visit (and particularly using the trams, for which it's difficult to get a map), and recommended a wonderful restaurant for our last evening. He ensured that the restaurant knew we were coming and they too treated us beautifully (I have reviewed them separately).For such a large hotel to make us feel so personally welcome and looked-after was really impressive.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Hilton Milan from 15th - 16th December and found overall stay was pleasant. The hotel is conveniently located a few minutes walk from Milan Central Railway station. The hotel lobby is very nice from moment of arrival with a holiday display in centre of lobby, a very lively bar and friendly check in staff. I was thanked on arrival for being a Diamond member and promptly checked in with a room on 6th floor. The representative was nice to present me a map of the area and direct me to best places to go being my first time. I also was escorted to the lift and directed to my floor which was above and beyond Hilton standard as I normally only see that at Conrad or Waldorf Astoria properties. There was also an executive lounge I was offered to check out and was a pleasant place to relax and unwind.The room was nicely appointed and look decent with nice furniture and no signs of wear. The size was decent for a standard room.I had breakfast in the lobby level restaurant and found the food was very good and plenty of selection. Again the staff were nice and accommodating from time of arrival to departure always ensuring I was taken care of and happy with service.I was thanked again for my loyalty on checkout. I would recommend this hotel and personally hope to stay again.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights on the way to London for a business trip.I was glad I made the choice .The location although just outside Central Storico was only 200m walk to Centrale Station which is a an easily connected stop on the express train from the airport.The room was modern anda good size.The staff were very helpful and gave me great info in walking around Milan and how to get to Lake Como. On their advice I took the early train to Varenna on the Lake and then onto Bellagio and Como. Make sure you get to the Veranna, it is beautiful!Definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the first time we have stayed at a room mate hotel and it won’t be the last. Best position and our junior suite was spacious and very quiet. Located at the rear corner of the hotel Great modern decor and total blackout curtains.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent boutique hotel, well priced for such a central location just around the corner from the Duomo cathedral and Gallérie Victor Emmanuelle. We booked a room that had two double beds. Decor was modern, the bathroom was large and lots of space for bags. We selected a rate that included breakfast which had a nice selection of hot/cold options. The reception was very friendly and helpful. Great choice for those wanting to stay in central Milan near the center of it all.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Room Mate Giulia.It is located right at the centre of the tourist area. Perfect location gave us time to enjoy a Ballet at Scalla theatre. The ballet ended so late but we just walked 5 minutes to the hotel. Everyone was so nice!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well I was a little worried about this hotel before we arrived. it is perfectly located for tourists, exceptionally well reviewed and we had selected the largest suite.I was concerned that it might be full of packaged tour groups or a bit too modern and utilitarian.I was wrong this hotel was perfect, breakfast a pleasure and a real refuge as we did day trips to Bologna and Turin. Even the the RAI 1 concerts on the weekend at the Cathedral were a positive experience - even though the noise and crowd security was a bit off putting!!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was fabulous, the service, staff and location is perfect .Only the noise at late night was disturbing and the breakfast can be more diverse .Thank You Room Mate Giulia for the awesome 2 night we spend in Milan.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice greetings everytime you pass the reception with excellent advise on where to eat. Rooms are quite & super clean. Location in the heart of Milan helped us to do business, shopping and tours in one week. Metro station is few steps away. Taxi stand is also close by. Breakfast variety is excellent. Highly recommend this place for your stay. Try it & till me about your experience and give me like.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed at Room mate Giulia for the second time . Couldn’t get a better location near Duomo and Victor Emmanuel shopping arcade , metro la Scala etc Lovely friendly helpful staff Great breakfast Extremely comfortable bed and great room . We love the modern interiors Would definitely stay there again
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights in room 502. The hotel has a fantastic location, just a few steps from the Duomo, and a 2 min walk to Teatro alla Scala. The room of contemporary design is bigger than typical European bedrooms in old cities, comfortable and very clean. The bed was a little harder than what we are used to, but there were several pillow options to choose from. There was no view from the room other than that of an inside courtyard, but it probably explained why the room was so quiet. The staff was very nice and friendly. The concierge, Andrea, was helpful, in particular with good recommendations for restaurants. We will definitely go back to Room Mate Giulia if we return to Milan.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfect in all aspects, the most strategic location next to the galleria Vittorio Emmanuelle and Milan’s duomo, yet it’s not noisy or you feel the hustle and bustle of tourists Staff is beyond amazing, polite, super friendly, very well informed and attentive.. rooms are spacious in terms of European standards, clean and relaxing.. it’s a positive vibe hotel that I would definitely come back to in my next visit to Milan Thank you guys for an unforgettable stay .. Andrea and Sarah you made our trip much more smooth and comfortable
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel forTwo nights and loved it. The beds and rooms were wonderful and the staff was so friendly and helpful. Very good location for Duomo and shopping. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor recommendations and pleased I did.It's in the best possible location. Right next to the Duomo and Galleria.Considering it is in the centre of the city, the room was very quiet.Whilst the room isn't particularly big, there is plenty of space. The amenities are very cool, with an emphasis on reducing waste.The hotel is fun and funky rather than classic luxury.Staff are very friendly and a mainly continental breakfast is included.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love staying here. The rooms are modern in style, clean, spacious with high ceilings and well equipped. Service is bright and friendly. Location is amazing. Always an excellent experience. I often come for business but looking forward to bringing my whole family here again soon. Overall a great place to stay in Milan!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a contemporary hotel, situated literally steps from the Duomo and main square. The staff were extremely welcoming and the room was spotless. We had breakfast included and there was an excellent choice. An ideal place to stay when visiting Milan as everywhere is within walking distance.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room Mate Giulia was a last minute booking at the end of an Italian holiday and was glad I made that choice. The boutique hotel was all class from the moment you walked in the hotel and to the room. You can tell with the details that this hotel was a little different in a nice way. I always judge a hotel not only by the room but the bathroom and loved it down to the soaps and shampoo. The location couldn't be better, right in the heart of Milan, literally around the corner of Duomo Vittorio Emanuele. The staff check in staff was helpful and the Concierge helped with great tips with our trip to Como. There are lots of choices for restaurants and eats near by.Would I stay there again ... Yes
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This pretty new looking hotel is just metres from Piazza Doumo, the Galleria and other central Milan attractions. It boasts clean, fresh and stylish rooms and offers a decent breakfast. Staff are friendly and attentive.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just amazing, clean beautiful well appointed new hotel right on the square near the Duomo.Absolutely amazing find, would stay here again and again, close to all attractions, easy for Uber and transport to find. Quite hotel despite being in the centre of all the activity.Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Milan whether for business or pleasure.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked everything: The warm welcome with good suggestions for areas to visit and places to eat. My room was perfect (deluxe). Lovely design, lots of space and light and the perfect bed and bathroom. I did not have very high expectations for the breakfast. But there I was mistaken. Even though the seating area was a bit compact and dark, the food and service was great. I would love to return!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Room Mate Giulia is the perfect hotel for the discerning couple wanting a romantic getaway in Milan.The location is walking distance to everything you could possibly want. From the World-famous Milan Duomo that is literally next door to fabulous shopping to the myriad of eateries, this is the place to stay!!!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel was perfect for our needs; being just a few steps away from the Duomo and restaurants was a plus. The staff at the hotel was helpful, polite, and always had a smile! The room was very clean and met our needs exactly.This will be our spot in Milan from now on.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is beautiful and clean. You can't beat the location of you want to be in the center. The service from the front desk/guest services is great too. I'm rating it five stars, but I think they could do a few minor things to make the place even better:* Put a fan in the exercise room.* Do something to dampen the noise in the exercise room as it gets really noisy in there when running on the treadmill.* Scrambled eggs are available on the breakfast buffet, but please stop charging extra for fried eggs. Like I said, these are minor changes. But I think these small changes would have make the difference between an excellent stay and a perfect one.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is hard to describe how good is this hotel. Location can't be better, a few steps from the Duomo although quiet. The rooms are spacious, clean,with excellent amenities and beautifully decorated. The bed and pillows are the best.But the diamond in the crown is the helpful, polite, efficient and very friendly staff. All were excellent and helpful the "super concierges" Sara and Andrea were outstanding, and if were busy, always somebody else from the reception offered his/her help. Day and night enough people were available to help, never waited more than 20 seconds. Just happy and perfect.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First the hotel is really great i think its 5 stars not 4 , clean and very comfort , the location is the best part its inside doumo , 20 second walk o ly from metro station , for me we made the best choice
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the absolute centre of Milan, Giulia is a modern, stylish hotel with exceptionally friendly helpful and fun staff. The rooms are somewhat quirky in a nice way, although those overlooking the rear service area are a bit short of daylight and very noisy in the early morning when deliveries are made. We are grateful we were moved to a better and quieter room. The breakfast bar and buffet is very good and the reception area fun for a pre dinner drink. The fitness room in the basement is small and stuffy. An enjoyable and fun hotel for a few nights in town.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central location and very friendly staff. Just couple of meters from the Duomo. Ideal for tourists and business travelers looking for a central and simple accommodation. Simple and good quality without many extras.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In March we stayed here for the a long weekend with our two boys. We had two Rooms and they were trendy decorated and I loved the bathroom soaps and cream. It is a design hotel with special interior which is reflected in the entire hotel - very tasteful. The location couldn`t be better if you want to see the sights in Milan. The staff are serviceminded however not sure how Well their English is. We had some misunderstanding when we needed a taxi to the airport.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super centrally located hotel right on the Dom square and in the immediate vicinity of the Scala. The entire inftastructure in the hotel was professionally furnished with very good installation material. Our room was very comfortable, modern, clean and quite (until the noisy early morning waste collection). The hotel has a well-equipped gym, which I like to use daily plus a small sauna.The breakfast buffet is very exceptionally extensive and delicious. (thanks Steven & team)The professionalism and the friendliness of the staff (especially at the front desk Pietro, Andreina & team) runs as a manuscript throughout the hotel. The helpfulness of the porter at check-in and handling of the baggage when loading the taxi, must be mentioned too; many thanks!We appreciated also the daily handwritten, sweet words and the chocolate on the bed. The beds were very pleasant.The value for money is correct.We really felt welcome and comfortable at Giulia - we will be back. Gracie mille!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Room Mate Giulia Hotel in Milan last week . It was amazing . The rooms were very very clean , the decoration ( both for the rooms and the entire hotel ) was simple , stylish and brand new . It is really in the heart of Milan , just 5 seconds ( really 5 seconds ) walking distance to Duomo and to Galleria Vittorio Emanuele . The breakfast was great with many different choices . But the most important thing which makes your travel great and joyfull in this hotel is the Guest Relations of Room Mate Giulia ... SPECIAL THANKS to Mr. Andrea from Guest Relations who made everything miracle for us . He was so helpfull , kind and knowledgeable . He was providing very easy and quick solutions to everything and everything . We feel like at home . Our home at Milan is Room Mate Giulia from now on ... Thanks for everything ..
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here two nights on business.The location is super central, literally next to the Duomo. This means is also super touristy, and I actually struggled to find a good restaurant that wasn't totally full of tourists. The hotel itself is small, without much of a lobby or bar area. The rooms are tiny, but clean and with all the basic facilities.If you're looking for a central hotel with all the basics, I'd recommend it. If you're looking for something a little higher end and in a more cool neighbourhood, check out VIU Hotel.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location, steps away from Duomo, gallery, and Teatro Lascala. Hotel is very clean, excellent breakfast, with good variety and excellent service at the front desk. Discounted parking close to the hotel.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been here few times. Always a pleasure to be here. Great staff, always helpful. In the middle of Milan, the hotel is very well placed near the Dome. Nice rooms, very clean! Very close to shopping areas
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Giulia has been my home for 5-nights while in Milano.Location: Perfect. It’s right in the heart of everything - literally central. Right around the corner from famous (and crowded) Duomo Piazza. Plenty of shops, restaurants right out and Duomo train station a stone throw away. All major attractions are within walking distance. The breakfast spread is extensive, they have options from gluten free, healthy and served from 7am to 12noon! The breakfast staff are friendly and efficient. The room is spacious and the toiletries/amenities are upscale. Room is clean, modern and bed is comfy. Front Desk Staff are friendly and helpful - always greeting, always smiling. Andrea was helpful albeit a couple of misses on restaurants suggestions. Overall, a wonderful stay. I would keep on coming back. I won’t even think about staying elsewhere. I like the Room Mate brand and would check out their others locations within EU.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room Mate Giulia is an excellent hotel at perfect location in Milan. It has fairly large rooms that are very tastefully decorated. I will continue to use this hotel in the future. Highly recommendable.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the center of the city center, next to the Duomo Milan, close to the famous shopping centers and Manzoni Street.The hotel is decorated in a colorful aesthetic that makes you feel you are in a design catalog. The staff scattered throughout the hotel and wherever I went they offered me drinks and help with everything.The room was dreamy! When I arrived at the penthouse that was vacant, I added quite a bit, but did not regret it for a moment. The penthouse has a balcony that is closed with no city view, only to the sky, but it is spacious, luxurious, clean and perfectly decorated. You get slippers, the first bottled water for free on the table, the shower has a professional hair dryer, a towel rack that also warms them, hygiene products for men and women, and the shower itself is huge and luxurious. There is a coffee machine in the room with capsules at no additional charge. The breakfast is impressive, rich, varied and everything tastes good to me. All the food was fresh, constantly replenishing. Each seat has interesting newspapers that can be viewed while you eat. And what was different from what I knew was the meal time: breakfast available until 12 noon.It was such a pleasure !!!!!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am regularly in Milan for business and have spent more than 30 nights at this hotel in the past year. I keep going back for many reasons - its contemporary style where everything is new and works, the spotless rooms, its easy location but mostly for the absolutely wonderful staff who look after me so well.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Milan on 2 occasions this month and stayed at Room Mate Giulia both occasions. The location cannot be beaten - right on the main square, 30 seconds to the Galleria, Duomo, museums and the metro, walking distance to La Scala and the endless shops Milan has to offer. The staff are incredibly helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. Rooms are modern, clean and spacious and breakfast is excellent as you’d expect in most places in Italy. Great hotel , wouldn’t consider staying anywhere else in Milan.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were both extremely satisfied of our stay within your hôtel. Great location (1 min walk from Duomo), nice rooms and very friendly personnel. I would like to thank in particular Andrea from the reception desk who helped us and contributed to make our stay very pleasant. I wish that all hotels would be like that !
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service. Friendly and helpful staff. Relaxed atmosphere. Modern and cool interior. The perfect hotel for a weekend in Milan, as a couple or with girlfriends as we did. Excellent location yet good value for money. Super breakfast. Will definitely come back next time. We were also given extra tips beforehand, where to eat, clubs etc.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want somewhere good to stay in Milan, this is the spot.The hotel is beautifully designed and decorated. Modern and spotless.The facilities are great. The gym is small but has everything you need. The rooms are great. Functional with attention to detail and well-designed.The breakfast is well worth paying a bit extra for. Healthy options are there as well as traditional European style breakfast food.But it's the staff which make this hotel so good. Pawel on reception is the best hotel staff member I have come across. But his colleagues aren't bad either! Nothing is too much trouble and Pawel in particular made our stay in Milan so pleasant and relaxing. he deserves a promotion that one......we couldn't recommend this hotel more highly.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a low key, boutique hotel with great location, this is it! It's simple, but has everything you need. Rooms are clean and nicely decorated. Everyone was very friendly and made you feel at home. Could not recommend it enough!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this boutique hotel for two nights. The location cannot be better. You are literally 20 steps away from Milan Cathedral, 10 steps away from Galleria Vittorio Emanuelle and less than 10 minutes walk from the Fashion Quartier. The hotel has beautiful rooms and the customer service is very warm and helpful. The only reason why I haven't give 5 stars is the breakfast as cooked breakfast such as omelette is charged separated. Also the coffee is machine made although if you ask they happily make you a proper one.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Everyone was really nice and they made you feel like you were home. They made our stay as comfortable as possible. Also, the rooms were very spacious and clean, and the location was right at the center, next to Duomo. We would like to especially thank the following staff who have been great with us, Pietro, Claudia, Sara, Andrea A., Andrea P., Bernardo, and Sidy. They were very welcoming, always had a smile on, listened to our needs and helped us. Also, it was my mom’s birthday, and Andrea was so kind to get us a cake while we were out so that we could surprise her. After we left the hotel, we stayed at a 5-star hotel in Paris, however, we had a much more pleasant experience and had better service at Room Mate Giulia. We had a very positive experience at this hotel and would definitely come back if we visit Milan again.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don’t know where to start!! Maybe the gorgeous decor??? The friendly and helpful staff (especially Sara at Concierge- definitely a Wonder Woman!!). The room was beautiful and spacious. We were in a large room (suite perhaps?) and everything in there was comfortable and clean. Very cool decor. And the location - just amazing!!!!! I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again if I’m ever back in Milan. PS breakfast was good as well.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in this hotel several times now. Excellent location, very nice room each time, regardless of the category. The staff is very nice and helpful.Our only (small) reserve concerns the wi-fi network which tends to "disappear" from time to time...We will definitely go back!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, few steps from the Duomo.Simple, essential, but great value for money.Staff was super polite and welcoming. No big view from the room... but considering the location and the price, was not expecting more.Only the room service, outsourced was a bit disappointing. Something to improve, but will surely get back or suggest to friends.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location can't be beat. We stayed here on the last night of a 2 week trip. Was the nicest appointed room we had during our entire stay, and definitely the most comfortable bed! Lots of amenities. Staff went out of their way to interact with us and give us dinner suggestions. Even suggested that we leave earlier than we had planned to get to the airport, knowing getting out of Milan is not the easiest. Absolutely would recommend!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Milan on 14-16/11 and we stayed at Room Mate Giulia.The hotel was at the perfect place, next to Duomo square, close to metro station.The staff was extremely keen to assist you on every query. They gave us a lot of tips such as to visit Duomo cathedral as early as possible (opening at 08.00am) in order to avoid crowdiness.Breakfast was good (could be better). Room was excellent.We had a great time. See you next time.Dimitris
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is about two minutes' walk from the Duomo and the main square, being in a quiet side street just off the square. The reception service was excellent, the room was spotless and well fitted with food bathroom products. Comfortable bed and a great night's sleep. And superb breakfast with plenty of choice and fresh cooked dishes. We stayed two nights and will certainly stay here if we return to Milan. We will also be looking out for other Room Mate hotels when we're booking city stays, since this one has impressed us!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well situated, 2 steps from the Duomo, this modern hotel seems appealing for young and trendy clients. But everything is rather disappointing, from the rooms, with a cheap furniture (design is not equal to cheap !), to the service (very friendly at first sight, but nothing more than a competent welcome. The breakfast is really not what you expect from such a hotel. When we arrived, the guys at the front desk offered to give us advice to choose a restaurant, 'because all those that are around the place are only for tourist, and are not worth coming in' ... same for this hotel !
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel , very nice decor, great location, wonderful breakfast, very relaxing rooms and beds , highly recommended. Staff were very friendly and nice always smiling will definitely come back Soon
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located footsteps away from the cathedral,central square, mall, multiple eating options and a host of other sites. The rooms were clean, quiet, large and well furnished. The staff was excellent and went out of their way to make sure that you had everything needed for a day or evening out. Every request, large or small, received their insight and guidance. Thank you Room Mate Giulia!
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room, location is great and service is ok, but the ambience is not good enough in my opinion. The bathroom design felt like a hospital bathroom. The lobby pictures well but in reality it’s a cold feeling space not fun to sit in and relax. Will not stay there again because the overall experience didn’t feel cost effective.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely boutique hotel in the centre of Milan. Short walking distance to the Duomo cathedral and easy access to other major sights. Metro and trams also made getting about Milan very easy. Although no dinner served in the hotel, we were given details of some excellent nearby restaurants for both lunch and dinner ... together with help re arranging boat trip to Lake Como. Large, spacious room, with good sized bed and very good amenities.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful and unique hotel in every details, specially their staff friendly and helpful, our flight was early morning so they have this breakfast box which we didn’t know about it, but the nice lady in the breakfast area prepared one for us, thank you.Definitely it’s my place again.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It is extremely clean, location is perfect and very central and the design of the rooms and hotel space is stunning. We are big lovers of Mid-Century Modern and really loved the design aspects. On arrival we were welcomed by a man (and we could never find out what his name was) but he was so wonderful and arranged for a bottle of prosecco and chocolates in our room. The room was also ready early for us which was so lovely. His help and welcome was the stand out service of our entire honeymoon.However, after that first check in encounter the service greatly varied. As I mentioned our first staff member we encountered was amazing and I wish we knew his name. Hopefully it's on file as he really made a big impression on us. We also found the recommendation from the Food Tasting representative very good - he was great! But the remaining staff at reception provided poor advice on day trips, didn't follow up on requests and at times seemed too busy or slightly annoyed by our questions and requests for advice. We had issues with housekeeping throwing away documents, flyers and coffee vouchers so we ended up having to hide everything from them to ensure that we didn't have to visit reception again to get more flyers/vouchers. It was very strange. Whenever we would order room service (a glass of wine or coffee) it would take two or more follow up phone calls and 30 minutes later we would have our glass of wine. The lady who would organise apertivo was lovely and very kind and she was very efficient but because the only way to order was to call reception, many requests were never passed on to her. It was very frustrating and in the end we would just head downstairs and speak directly were the food and beverage assistant and she would help us. This is a beautiful hotel with good service and I would definitely stay here again but the service overall could be improved.
hotelName:
9    Room Mate Giulia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just 1 block from the Duomo, this fabulous hotel was a delightful treat for the two of us. Snacks and water bottles are complimentary, breakfast was extensive and delicious, and the staff was exceptional!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for its amazing location, and we were blown away by the quality of the hotel. Everything about it was carefully and thoughtfully done to make your experience wonderful. The staff was always friendly and helpful, the breakfasts delicious (with extra water bottles for your day), and I loved the bag of practical items in the bathroom. We highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location couldn't be better. And the hotel is clean and the staff were nice. But for me, that should be standard of all hotels. This is a sister property of a hotel we stayed at in Turin and I found that hotel to be a step above this one. Spadari just doesn't have the details to raise it to the same level as other hotels. That said - the location is excellent and there is nothing wrong with this hotel so if you want convenience and just needs a hotel to see the sights, then this would be a good fit. If you want a little extra, some luxury, bigger elevator, less hot/cold water fluctuation, then you may want to look elsewhere - but it may be at the expense of location.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This lovely hotel is only a block from the magnificent Duomo and Gallery shopping. It is first rate. Water and snacks are available all day and breakfast is delicious. The staff is very service oriented. Excellent experience.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has the best staff of any hotel I have stayed at in Europe. They were friendly and very helpful as we navigated our first trip to Milan. Our room was very nice with modern amenities and great appointments (wood flooring in room, marble in bath, art on walls). The breakfast was elaborate with fresh fruit, bread & pastries, cereals, meats and eggs to order in a fancy, quiet dining area. I will definitely be back!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for only two nights, but would recommend it in a heart beat. The staff were friend and very helpful. The breakfast buffet in the morning was very nice with a good selection and I loved that during the day they set out water bottles and snacks. It's also very close to the cathedral, as the name implies (about a block or two). Peck, a wonderful grocery store is next door, and this is not your ordinary store. You can eat there, as well as shop. Finally great gelato at Granaio Restaurant on the corner. If I'm ever back in Milan, this is the place to stay!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a small super cute hotel located in a little side road just around the corner from Duomo. Super convenient with polite staff, clean well appointed room, comfy bed with crisp white sheets changed daily, amazing breakfast with the best filter coffee I had ever at a hotel! Free water and soft drinks is an extra that was greatly appreciated during last week’s heat wave! Just make sure you request a room at high floor because despite the double glazing if you are a light sleeper you may be bothered by the tram. We were on the fourth floor and the thumping sound and vibration was not really a big issue! Air conditioning was adequate to make our room a haven away from the humid 39oC city! Having said that however, the corridor just outside our room was warm and stuffy! Overall highly recommended!!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our 3rd stay at the Spadari. Always great service and a lovely breakfast. We had a large room with a partial view of the Duomo which was special. Walking distance to the Duomo, the Galleria, the Ambrosiana, the Sforza Castle and more.Next door is the most fabulous food emporium ever. Peck has been there for 100 years. Several good restaurants in the area.When the staff found out we were celebrating our 50th anniversary they surprised us with a bottle of Proseco and a huge bowl of strawberries and whipped cream
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great experience at Hotel Spadari. The location, rooms and staff were all terrific.The breakfast food was really good. The front desk staff gave great suggestions. Would certainly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect spot for us. Our family of 4 fit nicely in their 'family suite' which included two toilets/sinks plus the upstairs portion of the suite had a large tub and separate shower. Importantly, the a/c worked perfectly as it was very hot while we were there. small mini bar in room fridge. fold out sofa is wider than a twin, but tight fit for 2 (1 adult size) kids. The location is ideal, short walk to duomo and associated sites. Staff helpful with recommendations. Breakfast more than expected. Small issue handled well. Very clean.Would definitely stay again if in Milan.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: totally loved staying at Hotel Spadari. The staff is amazing. Meticulous attention to details. The rooms were very comfortable. I enjoyed the delicious breakfast buffet with a la carte availability. Excellent location. I would love to return.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We can’t say enough to convey the attractiveness and comfort of our room or the warmth and helpfulness of the staff at Hotel Spadari al Duomo. It’s in a central location and a short walk to the beautiful piazza in front of the Duomo- a delightful evening stroll to see the Duomo lit up at night.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location , great hotel , great helpful stuffRooms were clean , breakfast was o.k and the stuff was always helpful and smiley .Unfortunately my son got a fever and the stuff did it's best to call a doctor and even helped me translating the medicine's prescription.Would definitely come back again Most recommended.Most recommended .
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, great staff - professional, friendly, knowledgeable. Very Comfortable bedsGood size boutique hotel. Loved the balcony off my room and the sitting room with interesting selection of books
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: GREAT hotel with an amazing and helpful staff! It is close to the Duomo and centrally located to so many sites. The breakfast each morning was amazing and totally spoiled me. The hotel felt more like a home than a hotel. And did I say the staff was amazing? I just can't say enough about this place! Highly recommend and can't wait until my next visit!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel for its proximity to the Milan Duomo but found it so convenient for so many other popular downtown sites. We were able to walk easily to the Galleria, LaScala opera house, the Sforzesco castle, the Last Supper and wonderful neighborhood restaurants. The accommodations at the hotel were stellar with spacious bedroom and bath, lovely lobby and excellent breakfast buffet plus water bottles and fruit readily available at reception. Staff was helpful with directions and meal recommendations. Booking early also offered a rate discount. Would return here in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel very centrally located. Staff was pleasant and helpful, breakfast was very good with excellent variety and quality. From here all of the great sites, restaurants etc. are within easy walking distance.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here 5 nights Nice hotel. Rooms are small but clean and nicely decorated. Bathroom had a tub and shower again nicely appointed. Breakfast included. Staff courteous, helpful and attentive. Would visit again. Near Duomo, Metro, walking distance to many attractions.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a wonderful find tuck in near the Duomo, only a 3 block walk. Great places to eat near the hotel. Beds were so cozy with soft linens, Very clean. Wonderful breakfast. Front desk arranged transportation to the airport for us. After a long trip of many hotels, this was a relaxing place to stay before flying out of Milano.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great overall experience! Very professional & courteous staff that mades us feel welcome as soon as we walked into the hotel. Nice & good breakfast buffet that provides you the boost to start the day. Superb location! 'Pescheria Spadari' in front of the hotel is a great spot to have a nice & quick lunch amongst working locals during their lunch break. When we return to Milano 'Hotel Spadari al Duomo' will be the first option we look at for our stay. Grazie mille allo staff!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is ideal, and the friendly service is excellent. It's our "go to" hotel in Milan for years! Wonderful breakfast buffet, including made to order eggs - highly recommend it. It's very close to Duomo and shopping, but rooms are very quiet.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5+ Stars across the board! Location - cant get any more center (2mins walk from the duomo/train station), with easy access to transpo lines. Check in - warm, fast, helpful & had something extra sweet delivered to our room immediately after! Room is excellent (we are very travelled couple and we usually only leave comments if its truly worth or much needed feedback). Spotless clean, modernly equipped, just the right size. The most amazing thing about the room is its sound proofing! Stayed in many 5star / upscale hotels around the world, sound proofing of this level is just superb (right infront of the busy street, but cant hear a thing). They were also very responsive and warm when i was emailing them back 3 months ago. Ultimately, have nothing to say except do stay here if you plan to drop by Milan. Wont regret it! To the Spadari Al Duomo staff - thank you for making our Honeymoon, and round-the-world trip final stop, a highlight! - J&D
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have had another very happy stay at the Spadari . The location is great, the rooms are very clean, comfortable and well appointed including the very plush bed with the beautiful sheets. The breakfast is full of fresh and healthy food and all the staff are friendly and helpful. We will be back!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for making our stay so wonderful. i wouldn't change a thing .. nice memories of our time in Milan. great location and a delicious breakfast. we appreciated the help & guidance in getting to Lake Como by local train, as well as suggestions for going to Turin .. 1 hr away by train.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My hand luggage was stolen while the van was unloading our 6 people luggage from the back trunk. The bellboy acted very slowly (may be in cahoots with the thieves outside), and only took in the large luggage. So my small hand trolley was stollen, because of the bellman's wrong remark of kept pointing me to talk to the Receptionists, by the time I went outside the street, no one and no luggage was there. Hotel Reception said there is never been camera outside the hotel. I lost my iPad, head phones, cash, jewellery and wedding rings. The local police station opens till 6PM only.The hotel has no loading area, and the tram stop is right across. Many beggars (or pretend to be beggars) on the street corners. Be aware!!!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have traveled a lot over the years and found Spadari to be outstanding in location, Staff, amenities, and cost. I would suggest anyone going to Milan to consider this hotel.Only two blocks to Duomo where most walking tours begin.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and practical, but very overpriced given what is on offer. The rooms are comfortable but in no way luxurious, and the property is generally a little pokey (the lift feels crowded even with only one person, for example). Location is great, very close to the Duomo. Overall, I would book again if it were half the price but otherwise probably not.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small and discrete, situated near an excellent seafood restaurant and deli, Hotel Spadari is cozy and comfortable and quiet. Not well suited for business as there are no meeting spaces and not family oriented, it is instead the perfect getaway in this part of Milan. Being so near the Duomo is a wonderful and we went everyday. Having a view of the Madonnina al Duomo is unique to this location if you are fortunate to be on the top floors and facing the Duomo.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean, efficient, well run and in a great location. Bar/sitting area/breakfast area are modern and chic. Service is excellent, with smiling and friendly staff. Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fabulous boutique hotel located right in the city centre. Just a quick stroll to the Duomo and Castillo . Close to transport. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was usual buffet style with eggs cooked in demand. Reception staff were extremely helpful and able to fulfill any request. I have now stayed there three times and would happily do so again.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for two nights at Hotel Spadari and had a perfect experience. The hotel is steps away from the Duomo yet on a quiet side street so you don't feel overwhelmed by the crowds. Very friendly, helpful staff; ultra clean, spacious room; great breakfast included in the price (many hotels charge extra) and even free snacks from the mini bar. What else do you need from a hotel?Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Hotel Spadari for 3 nights in the Spring while visiting Milan - and experiencing all that the city has to offer, history, good food, and good wine! Spadari was booked by our travel agent who told us it was in a good walking location just minutes from the Duomo piazza, La Scala and the Galleria for shopping. We arrived late in the evening after a long train ride, and the gentlemen behind the desk quickly called a nearby restaurant and had them wait for us for a quick meal - it was that kind of personal service that lasted throughout our stay at Spadari. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed, the breakfast was delicious (fruit, meats, eggs to order, homemade coffee cakes) and the location was perfect. Only note is that the hotel is on the trolley line, so you should ask for a room not on the front of the hotel, or at least higher up.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was amazing. Highly recommend. Will not consider staying any where else while visiting Milan! The location was great. The rooms were spacious and clean. The shower was amazing. And the breakfast was fantastic!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in many hotels in Milan and I am certainly going to add Hotel Spadari to my list of good hotels in Milan. The hotel is situated a few minutes walk away from the hustle and bustle of the duomo. The room we had was spacious 74, the bed was comfortable and laid with white bed linen sheets. Quite unusual to find these days as most hotels use cottton linings. The bathroom is also spacious and equipped with enough toiletries. It is exceptionally clean. The amazing thing about this hotel is that all items from the mini bar are free except for alcoholic beverages. Their breakfast is also good even though, I personally was craving for smoked salmon. I hope they’ll include it in their breakfast. Every single staff from the reception , cleaning ladies to the bellman were nice, professional and polite. I highly recommend this hotel. I’ll be back soon.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect; city center near everything and near the metro. The breakfast was very good and very good service. The bed was AMAZING! Our best nights sleep was at the Spadari. Very helpful front desk staff.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three at the duplex, during the 2019 marathon weekend, amazing place, so well located, clean, the staff is so friendly and kind. Very good service, you really feel the place is worth the value you are paying
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with wonderful service and a amazing location in Milan. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly and room and amenities were wonderful! Breakfast was exceptional and eggs to order made it that much better.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy with this hotel. It is just a few minutes walk to both the Duomo and La Scala. The staff is very friendly and our room (34 - deluxe) was sparkling clean, well appointed, and large enough to be comfortable.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights in Milan and could not have been more pleased with the location of this hotel. It was close to everything we wanted to see. The quality of the rooms was excellent and the breakfasts were amazing. The front desk staff was extremely helpful with several requests. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff, large and modern rooms, outstanding breakfast buffet! The hotel is only five minutes away from the dome, the galleria and ten minutes from the scala! A lot of fine shops and restaurants within walking distance
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the great fortune to stay at the Hotel Spadari. It’s old world charm facade coupled with a completely modernized interior was just perfect. The employees were gracious, attentive and professional. Extremely friendly and accommodating. The location is just steps away from the Cathedral, shopping and so many great restaurants. We had the top floor with breathtaking views of the cathedral and roof tops. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This calm, comfortable hotel has a team that knows what they want to deliver to their guests. I even noticed that the staff regularly press the call button of the elevator so it is on ground floor and ready to open .Now that is attention to detail .Don't miss out on the snick snacks during cocktail hour!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Milan is an amazing city and staying close to the centre allows you to soak up that feeling.Hotel Spadari was perfect for all aspects. It has a great atmosphere and the service was brilliant.Not hard to find the Duomo - It's just about next door!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel because of the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel location was very good, very close to Duomo. The hotel staff were generally nice with free minibar. However, the hotel room and bathroom looked very tired. All the toilet facilities were very old, water leaking from the shower head, the toilet released strange sound like it would explode anytime. Also the room and the bathroom had very bad sound proof. We could hear the noises from the other rooms and hallway very clearly, even heard somebody was having a shower upstairs. The bed was very old and bad, very uncomfortable.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very good option in a very good location. The decor is interesting and sophisticated, perfectly preserved museum quality 1990s Milan. Please don't change a thing! Service is excellent. Breakfast is nice.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:Amazing location, 5 min to the Duomo and the MetroVery friendly and accommodating staffGreat breakfast with fresh orange juice, coffee (done in a proper barista machine), cheeses, cold meats and pastriesGreat toilet with rain and waterfall showersVery comfortable bedNon alcoholic drinks free in the room fridgeCons:You can hear a lot from the outside specially because I got a room near the lift and where the cleaner stored some thingsSpeaking about the cleaning, it started quite early in some days, like 8:00Could hear also people flushing from the toilets above, not really nice for a 4 stars hotel of this priceAlso similar to above my toilet sinks where doing noises, maybe related to stuck pipes or somethingI think daily rate is a bit off, I do not think it was a high season (January) and I know Milan is expensive, but still some of the points above and the erratic deco/structure of some stuff say otherwise
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Here on business/vacation and this hotel is lovely, very accommodating and makes you feel like you’re someone important. Relaxing lobby, beautiful rooms, calming colors. Everything in the room fridge is complimentary except the alcohol but it’s packed with sparkling waters, sodas, juice etc..... little snacks as well. In the lobby they serve water, fruit and cookies all day, also complimentary to guests. Large bathrooms with more than enough toiletries if you forgot anything. Less than 5 minute walk to Cathedral yet so quiet. Slept very well each night. I would come back again!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent locationQuality furnishings and attention to detailDelicious breakfast excellent quality and choiceFriendly efficient staffWe were spoilt for choice and rate the Hotel Spadari breakfasts very highly Highly recommend Hotel Spadari to travellers with discerning taste Comfortable beds
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really close to Duomo. The staff was very kind and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. It offers you everything you need. Nice breakfast with many choises and preferenses...
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took my time to find a hotel that would be right for me. I was travelling a,one, wanted to be in the centre, spoke limited Italian but wanted to experience a stylish Italian stay, everything completely exceeded expectations - I didn’t want to leave! Aside from the beautiful room I was give, upgraded to a room with a lovely terrace, what struck me most was the warmth, kindness and politeness of all the hotel staff. The receptionists especially were so lovely - helpful always and with excellent English, suggesting places to see. Letizia and Marianna were their names. The food at breakfast was delicious and plentiful and my room was quiet and luxurious, with a calming colour scheme. The hotel us brilliantly situated, on an elegant side street minutes away from the duomo. I loved Milan and much of that positive experience was due to the fact that I always came back to this lovely hotel. It was more expensive than I am used to, but was completely worth it!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Spadari is the place to stay in Milan's city center. Great breakfast; helpful, friendly staff, and great rooms. Close to all the things you want to see. We have stayed there five times now and will continue to come back.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff in this hotel are all very friendly and helpful! It’s clean and is excellently located, just by the Cathedral, main shopping street, restaurants and bars. It’s just really nice! Thank you for a great stay!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
