review_body: Milan was the last destination on what was a two month tour of Europe. We stayed at the Hotel Spadari al Duomo for 4 nights in July. As it was our last hotel we upgraded to a Special Superior with Terrace. The room was ample in size and well appointed, with a modern, pristine fitout. The room was spotlessly clean. Very comfortable. The bed, luxurious! Staff were lovely and helpful and quick with advice on local sights. In fact, there is a pamphlet in the room in which each of the front office staff advise on their favourite parts of Milan, sights and experiences we explored on a couple of days. The hotel is incredibly well located with a short walk to the Duomo and the Sforza Castle museums and, of course, shopping! For a hotel that is so well located we found it to be very quiet. Breakfast was included in our deal and the variety and quality was on par with any on our trip. Would stay at Spadari again any time. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being that I was only staying one night in Milan on my way through to Parma, I did not do too much research as to where to stay. That being said, I was extremely impressed with the hotel, it’s staff, and location. If you’re looking for comfort, service, and an overall pleasant stay, this is your spot. We reserved a balcony room but due to the length of the stay, we really did not have the opportunity to take advantage of the balcony. The rooms are on the smaller side but very clean and user friendly. These are perfect for solo or couples looking for a good hotel to sleep in while on the move taking in the sights. Overall homerun.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Spadari al Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and totally loved it. Great location, near a subway station. Large, comfortable and modern rooms. Very professional service at the Front of the House. Very nice restaurant
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights at this hotel and it was above my initial expectations Pros - very clean and room had a pleasant smell when we first walked in - check in was quick and easy - breakfast buffet excellent value for 15 Euros - pool and outdoor area appealing - only a 10 to 15 min walk to Metro Train station Turro and for 1.50 Euro we got to Milan centre in 15 mins- good supermarket directly across the road with very cheap prices on items such as bottled water and snacks Negative - the shower space was way too small and we had a lot of water come out of the shower on to the bathroom tiles All in all a really good pace to stay in Milan
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 8 with kids booked rooms from Hotel website before 1 month. But unfortunately we were given differ rooms in separate buildings. The response i got from staff is the system allots rooms and if booking is in different names it allots as per availability. But i told we booked in same name. Then the lady said the system allots and staff confirms the rooms. So we were rudely put in rooms far from each other. We have three children between 2 to 6 yrs. They ruined our holiday.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very nice and clean. Near underground substation (Torro) 3 minutes walking and in a quite area. There are some restaurants close to it also. Breakfast buffet is good, not a lot of varieties but tasty, enough and good.I enjoyed my stay.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed overnight in this one of the better Ramada's I have stayed in. Property out of central town area. Taxi from central station just under eur10.Large property consisting of a few towers though minimal walking involved. Rooms large and I had a large balcony which overlooked a large grassed area and pool for guests use. Metro station a few minutes walk away delivers you to city centre within a few minutes.The only property of a number i stayed in over several weeks in Europe where I did not have to pay for breakfast and best breakfast I encountered.Onsite quality restaurant. Worth considering for a Milan stay
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Milano Ramada with our 4 years old kid. Our room was big with extra bed/ no extra charge and with a really big balcony. Breakfast buffet was more than enough, there was several kind of good food for breakfast like kinds of cheese, bacon and fruits. Location is a bit difficult. But it’s worth for the hotel conditions. About 10 minutes walk from metro station and 6-7 stations far from Duomo. Carrefour supermarket is near/ open 24/7. Staff was kind and helpfull. If i stay in Milano again i choose to stay in Ramada again certainly.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here. A lovely clean hotel with nice rooms. A 5 minute walk to Turro metro which takes you straight to the centre of Milan. Breakfasts ok and a good selection of cocktails at the bar made by the excellent barman Michealo. A good base for Milan but a bit out of the way which I think is reflected in the price. Overall a good 2 night stay.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a junior suite in March, which comes with spa access included. The room was a good size with a small walk in wardrobe, and very clean. The spa again was alway very clean and perfect after a long day in the city. It’s about €24 euros from here to the centre via Uber, there was always plenty around.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I got the presidential suite for a night in Milan in this hotel, we where both very disappointed. First of all service is not good at all. After breakfast, we went to the front desk to ask for information about the spa because it was too early and it was closed, that’s when we encountered Lorenza. Not only she was not smiling, she was also not nice and not helpful at all to us, considering that she is an employee of a front desk of a “good hotel”. She made very clear that she could not provide the information we needed in the worst way possible. We understood right away that there is no relationship and/or communication between the hotel and the spa, but we just wanted to know a little bit more about the prices or at least the services they offered, no intention to book a reservation at that moment, so we suggested her to tell the hotel management about it. She kept repeating as if we did not comprehended what she was trying to say in a very rude way: “you can’t make reservation for the spa so why should we know.” So right away we noticed that it was was her who did not understand well our English or our intentions which would have been completely ok if she would have just have been nice. Maybe you should consider changing her position with Aziz who was very helpful, great attitude, always smiling and probably speaks more languages than Lorenza. Remember that the front desk is the face of a hotel, smiling and being nice to the customers , or at least listening them before you respond rudely, should be a basic requirement for the position, after all they are paying a few hundreds of dollars for a room in this hotel. Second of all the room was spacious and not dirty, but the bed we told we would sleep in was a king bed, and it was actually two smaller bed put together, feeling the separation in the middle all night, and not comfortable at all. No luxury. Something that we where not even considering complaining about, but since Lorenza ruined our mood first thing in the morning we decided not to be quiet about it either. We are giving 2 stars just because of the wayAziz treated us.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel and rooms are nice enough, however breakfast was a nightmare. Over crowded, no food left, asked staff if we could order something from the kitchen as the buffet was empty, he was extremely rude and told us it would cost extra. Each morning we were woken by cleaners bashing hoovers and brooms against the door and wall in the corridor. To top it off we planned our check out to catch the shuttle to the central station, as we were checking out ten minutes before the shuttle was due to leave we watched it drive away. Asked the staff if that was our shuttle, she said yes, that yesterday it had been caught in traffic so it left early today. Not much use for us as no alternative was offered, we were left to do the 10 minute walk to the metro, pay for a ticket and make 2 changes with all our luggage. Not ideal when you have a full day of travelling ahead. Really disappointed. The neighbourhood the hotel is situated in is not nice either. Did not feel comfortable walking to and from the metro at night. If we returned to Milan would defiantly stay closer to the centre of the city. The price saving is not worth the hassle of getting in and out of town.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a couple nights in Ramada while attending a conference. Ramada is a conference place. I was not particularly amazed or disappointed, it is OK for a business stay. Average hotel. It takes about 15 minutes by a cab to get to the city centre.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Milan and stayed at Ramada Plaza Milano for a couple of nights. It's located just next to Turro Metro station (500m away). The hotel is well maintained and the front desk staff is really courteous. I was upgraded to a superior room as I was traveling on my Honeymoon. The breakfast buffet was nicely spread. Shuttle service till central station is available almost every half an hour in morning hours. The room was spacious and the balcony was good. The only problem I faced was with the air-conditioning as it was on heater mode and it got really hot at night and it couldn't be turned off. I had to call reception to get it switched off.How to reach Ramada from Malpensa Airport ?My flight landed in Malpensa Airport (Mpx) and I took a train from Malpensa Airporto Terminal 1 till Milano Cardona which costed me approx €26. From Cardona I took a metro till turro for €1.5 and a 5 min walk made me reach the hotel. Cabs on the other hand were costing €140.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is good but the WiFi is so so slow, can’t get any work done and breakfast was very very average. Overall a very meh hotel. For the price paid you’re better off at Milano centrale, with a nice hotel around there.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated in Turro it is about a 10/15 minute walk to the Turro Metro. Very safe area and lots of restaurants near by. The hotels itself leaves a little to desire. We were on the 7th floor and it was so hot!! The rooms are ok but expected a little more. Plastered peeling off the walls by the side of the bed and the hairdryer in the bathroom over heats and cuts out after 5 minutes so suggest taking your own! Breakfast was poor, it is continental so you have your usual cakes, croissants, cereal but the hot food was a poor selection. Bacon is very greasy, sausages don’t look cooked, scrambled eggs very watery and then you have beans and rice?! Over all it was a nice place to stay but probably would not return.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights at this hotel in August for a birthday celebration.Rooms well equipped with a nice balcony.Breakfast had a good choice.Used the hotel shuttle bus a couple of times.Small pool in grounds which was great to cool off in.There are not many restaurants near the hotel and it is a few stops into central Milan but a good hotel for a short city break.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: sparklingly clean and big rooms with big balcony. Nice and friendly staff. Just walking distance from a lot of restaurants. I would love to rate a delicious and nit pricey restaurant near the hotel but cant remember the name, best carbonara ive tasted.. so far! walking distance to the metro if you want to go to Duomo for 1.5€. breakfast is not fancy but good enough to start your day! nice bar too. Book your taxi to and from airport, the same as taxi charge if you get it from outside, and youll be alot safer with their friendly, respectful and nice drivers who also speaks english
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was nice. Be sure to have necessary adapter. staff was ok to poor. breakfast was good. Still cannot believe the front desk asked for a cash deposit to loan an adapter. My room was at the last building (4) and had not brought my wallet to give the deposit. Had to go back to my room, get wallet, and then back to the front desk, get adapter, then go back to my room. completely unnecessary. Agree with Andreas S the hotel "leaves something to be desired". Thought it was closer to the train station. but nice walk to subway station. did not see anything around to eat. There was a little supermarket close by.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 5 nights here in October and although the executive double room was decent, the extra bed was so-so and the hotel had switched off the AC already. It was 27 degrees outside abd very warm in the room and it was too noisy to leave the doors open at night.Breakfast is ok, but nothing more. Also, we made the mistake of trying room service one night. The club sandwich tasted like it was made hours ago and the burger, well suffice to say I only ate the fries.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This large complex is easy to reach with public transport (nearest metro station is Turro, 10 mins away from here), despite it's not situated in the city centre. I had a junior suite at the 4th floor and my room was spacious, perfectly cleaned and with all the amenities and services I needed during my stay. The junior suite also has a large balcony, a living room with sofa and a table, a large cloakroom with a safe, 2 smart tvs, free wifi, minibar and a complimentary coffee station (very useful). Pillows and bed are super comfy and I slept well with zero noise, despite my room ovelooked a street. I really appreciated the breakfast at the ramada hotel because it's large with a great selection of foods. Staff is always present, helpful, smiling and despite this complex is large and separated in different buildings you can easily find someone everywhere ready to help you. In this complex you can find a lot of services: restaurants, meeting rooms, private parking, swimming pool, a garden, fitness room, shuttle service etc. All this services compensate well the location, that is not properly the best in Milan.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 3 double rooms for 2 nights. Even all rooms were under same reservation we were not allocated next to each other which was very upsetting. Very big and busy hotel, the lobby was always full of people. front desk work 24/7 which was a plus for us as we left 3am. They were kind enough to make us breakfast to go as we missed breakfast due to early check-out.Rooms are huge , the bath is luxuries.We were with a big van and parking is very bug so no problems there. Breakfast is great with large selection. distance from metro is about 5-7min walk and than a metro of 8 stations, very quick. However the return walk from metro to hotel is not so nice, dark street and not feel so comfortable. this is the only reason why this hotel gets 4 and not 5 start.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights before our flight home. The staff are excellent, friendly and very helpful. 20 to 25 euro taxi fare into the city, but they do have a shuttle available. As this hotel is in a residential area, it’s very quiet. We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment, price was very reasonable. Definitely worth the stay.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been there for a week and it was quiet okay. The hotel seems to be not in the best neighborhood at all but you could get into the city very fast by taking the subway. The normal rooms are very modern, having a great size and a balcony. There is also a small pool (it was closed while our complete stay) and a gym with quiet old fitness equipment. The breakfast ist very small and most things were not very tasty in my opinion so you should better try to have a you breakfast directly in the city center. All in all I have to say the price performance ratio is good in general but you shouldn’t expect to much.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I visited Milan and stayed at the Ramada Plaza Milano. Got to the hotel using public transport from Milan Linate Airport. Buy a ticket just outside arrivals, get on the Bus number 73 that stops near the ticket machines. This bus goes to the heart of Milan, DUOMO. From there get the Metro (RED LINE) to TURRO. This costs EURO 1.50 each – cheap! Each single journey ticket lasts for 90 minutes. The hotel is about 7 minutes’ walk with a suitcase. The whole journey took an hour. Turro is a rough looking area but it is fairly safe. It is situated away from the main town in a residential area where many of the local businesses are shut. We arrived on a Wednesday and there was a street market selling all sorts on the street next to the hotel. The hotel is fairly modern with majority of the staff being friendly and speak very good English. As we were early, we stored our bags and headed into town using the hotel’s free shuttle service (one way only and max. eight passengers). On our way back, we got a 48hrs ATM transport pass, this costs EURO 8.25 each. Unfortunately, our room on the 5th Floor, had a disgusting smell, we got a room change to the 2nd Floor and the smell was still lingering. It is probably in the drains or in the air conditioning system. This second room was designed for disabled guests with a very large bathroom. Anyway, we got a third room in ‘B’ Block on the 4th Floor, this room was perfect. Room had a hairdryer, tea & coffee facilities, mini bar and a safe. Thank you to the apprentice receptionist. She was also very good in provided local information.There is a bar, a restaurant and a supermarket across the road from the hotel. I did use the supermarket to get some bottled water. The continental breakfast is good for the hotel’s rating, it has got fruits, cold meats, hot food, cakes and teas and coffee machines. If you to order something extra e.g. an omelette, then you have to pay. We did not use the hotel facilities (pool, gym & SPA) as we were out most of the day sightseeing in this lovely city. However, I did use the computer room to check up on my emails etc. The printer was out of ink and there was no replacement ink cartridge. A bit disappointed with that, as I had an urgent document to print and read. Upon checking out, visitors to Milan have to pay tourist tax of EURO 5 per person per day. As public transport is very reliable and cheap, we used it on our return journey to the airport.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, the room was very lovely, including a large nice balcony with a view of the park behind the hotel. The bathroom was very nice, too. They have an outdoor pool which is small but very nice. Our room reservation included free breakfast and the food selection was amazing! One of us has celiac disease and he may consume only a gluten-free diet and another one has a lactose intolerance. The restaurant manager was ready for us not only welcoming us but making sure that no cross-contamination would take place either breakfast morning. She is an excellent manager! So basically, we had a lot of choice even for those of us who followed a gluten free or lactose intolerance. Breakfast was a special part of our morning! The hotel is less than five minutes walk from the Turro station in the Milan red metro, this made it very accessible to many places served by the metro. The area where the hotel is located is residential but not central– yet it is very safe to walk at any time, there are few restaurants nearby, we suggest Mamma Farina, it is worth a visit although it doesn't offer a specific gluten free menu (for gf go to Il Papiro instead). Across the street from the entrance there is a cheap grocery store, if you need to buy water or soda for your minibar. Basically we had a lovely experience at this hotel, we found our rooms to be big and they were clean with fresh towels, sheets and pillows, the air conditioning in the room made our stay enjoyable. The entire staff was amazingly friendly from check in through check out! They also have a free shuttle that took us to the main train station after check out. Overall great experience and stay!
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked in very late and staff were there, the hotel and staff are excellent. All I can say is perfect hotel you will have all what you need including car parking. Breakfast was included and it was tasty. and more than enough.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a suite, for 3 nights, suite is lovely, very big, includes a lounge which has - mini fridge, desk, sofa, chair, TV and tea/coffee making unit. There is a separate bedroom (large superking bed) – and a walk-in wardrobe room, two large balconies, and the bathroom is very nice. We did visit the restaurant on the first night, it was fine, only problem was they did have allergy alerts on the menu (I am Gluten-free). Clearly stated the steak, Veg and potatoes had no wheat/gluten, so I ordered it, they advised I could not have to potatoes, so I just had veg and steak – still paid the same though. Also no deserts except ice cream available for GF. So basically, not a lot of choice if you are on a special diet. Breakfast was fine, nothing special! 2 mornings I got some gluten free muesli, but then they ran out!! We walked to the train station, and got the tube into Milan, which was easy. The area where the hotel is – this is inner city, safe to walk in though, few local restaurants nearby. Opposite a Penny Market – which is little supermarket with great prices on beer, water etc to put into your fridge. I used the spa – which was relaxing. The outdoor pool was small, but lovely and cold for a quick swim to cool off after a day in Milan.Overall the hotel is lovely, rooms are big and cleaned every day with fresh towels etc. car park is free, good air con in the rooms. Lovely staff! Clean and well-kept gardens, pool bar (expensive drinks) and outdoor seating area in the gardens.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a nice surprise for me because I saw the place near and it’s near railway station and it’s not so nice,but,but. Hotel is excellent clear with nice rooms,helpful employees rich breakfast and payable parking inside.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for four nights and am pleased with the experience. The apartment was very big, the bathroom clean and practical. Breakfast was good. Overall nothing to complain. I especially liked the huge wardrobe in the room.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was really clean an modern with spacious rooms. The location is decent, it’s not central but it’s only 10 mins trip on tube to central milan (Duomo) with a 10 mins walk from hotel to tube station. The staff were really pleasant and helpful. The first room had an adjoining room with a door - when we realised someone was in the next room we could hear a lot of what they did. We asked to move rooms and they did this for us straight away. So just be careful if you get one of these rooms and check if anyone is staying - if you’re a light sleeper it may be an issue. Hotel has a nice (small) outdoor pool and recreation area. Recommended. Also note that a nightly tourism charge is applied on top of the room cost on checkout which was £5 per person per night - I assume it applies to all hotels in Milan.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is easy to find, really close to the station Turro, not far from the Duomo.The room is really spacious, clean.. You have free tea, coffee and water. The "garden" and the pool was very pleasant. The only small weird thing : the airco and the lights sometimes came back after i switch off or in the middle of the night.. Still don't know why.. a ghost maybe ;)The pillow was a bit to hard for my neck.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited as a group of friends who wanted a classy hotel on the outskirts of Milan and it is just that. A ten minute drive from the centre and within walking distance to the metro this hotel offers great value for money. One of the main attractions for us was also the offer of the outdoor pool and area which is beautiful- although the pool is rather cold. There’s a lovely spa on site that you can pay €10 to enjoy the facilities whilst staying there which is good value for money. We had breakfast included which offered a food selection and the rooms were modern and comfortable with a balcony. You MUST visit the bar and restaurant opposite with friendly staff and amazing quality for amazing prices! There’s also a supermarket that is really cheap too.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I first saw the hotel from outside I was dissapointed. It is just grey concrete and old. But things change when you enter the building. It is totally reinnovated. The rooms are very spacey with wooden floors. Everything you need is there. The bed is big but I found the mattress relatively rigid. Everything inside the room is new and very clean. The breakfast is basic but the have some fresh cakes. My basic problem was the food that was not appropriate for a 4 star hotel. No fantasy in the tastes, nothing special in their plates, no nothing (for lunch). Their restaurant for dinner is better but in the same pace. This is something the hotel must change. The neighborhood was safe to walk, which is important since it is outside center and you will need to go to the metro which is a 5-10 mins walk from the hotel. I liked the hotel very good and if they fix their food then I will get back!
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want a top hotel out of the tourist area, then look no further! Ramada Plaza Milano has everything that you expect from a 4* hotel. Bed & Breakfast, Bar, Swimming Pool & Spa. There are a range of restaurants and bars around the area if you dont feel like heading into the centre of milan (10 minute walk to the metro - nearest station is TURRO). The staff in the hotel are very friendly and are willing to help you. Speak very good English (also heard a couple of them speak Spanish). All staff members that we saw in the morning all said Good Morning (Bonjourno). There where a couple of occasions where we had to ask for some more milk or teabags but apart from that nothing else to really say. Excellent choice of breakfast. You are able to choose from a traditional continental breakfast - Pastries and Cakes to Fruit, cheese and salami choices. You can even chose to have cereal, toast, muffin, bacon, sausage etc... aswell as a selection of yogurts and hot drinks. The hotel are able to arrange a taxi pick up service to and from the centre and airport. Without staying in the hotel it does give the impression to only cater for business but far from it. I would definitely stay in the Ramada Plaza Milano again if I was to visit Milan.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived after midnight from the airport and left before 9am the next morning.Staff were welcoming and friendly, happy to check me in quickly so I could sleep.Room was nice although was designed for wheelchair access meaning everything was much lower in the bathroom and the shower was "wet room" style.Room was spotless, with crisp sheets and covers and nice firm pillows. Plenty of sockets for charging devices, and standard free internet was good enough for video calls.Breakfast choice was very good, and staff were friendly and helpful.Hotel is a short walk from my company so will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in an executive room over Easter. The room was nice with a large bed, pleasant decor and a balcony overlooking the garden. There was no kitchen which was shown when booking the room via easyJet holidays and a TV too small for the size of the room. Breakfast is what you would expect in a three star hotel. You get your usual foods but fried eggs, omelettes and others are charged at an extra cost which is something completely new to me and quite shocking to say the least - see image for charges.The outdoor swimming pool and mini-golf are way too small for the size of the hotel and only open in the summer months.The spa is closed on Mondays and not available for children under 12. The hotel also offers free bike rental however children’s bikes are not available - both mean families with young children may have difficulty doing any activity together.Hotel staff are polite on the whole - I found the Italian people to be extremely friendly compared to other European countries I’ve visited.Unfortunately one maid burst into our room without knocking in the afternoon assuming we were out- not good.The location is okay - 1hr from Malpensa airport via train & metro for £10 per person and 20 minutes to the Duomo city centre (7 min walk to the metro plus 12 mins journey). Public transport is far more economical than transfers, uber etc.As the hotel does not cater for children very well at all we done some research and discovered a park was a minute away which is nice in warmer weather and a decent bowling alley & arcade a 10 minute walk away. Neither were advised by the hotel staff when asked what activities are nearby for young kids.Milan EuroPark is a large funfair an hour away by metro & bus which is great for kids and teens for a fun day out. - about 17 euros each.We ate at a Turkish place just outside Turro Metro station where you can get very good food and pizza but not so good customer service. Overall I would give the hotel a 6/10 and Italy a 8/10.I had higher expectations for a 4* Ramada hotel and would not stay at a Ramada again.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has large comfortable rooms with efficient heating.There is many English channels on tv.They provide complimentary water and tea and coffee facilities in room.Breakfast was good.Bathroom is so spacious and the toiletries provided were really of good quality.We were really impressed with this hotel and is a few minutes walk away from some good restaurants.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked my stay in this wonderful hotel ad will definitely come back!But just do not understand one thing..making check out I asked the taxi to the aerport. Mr Ricardo (the man from the reception) called me the taxi and it came in a few minutes. Later on talking with my colleugues I found out that the hotel has it's own car (and I saw it by myself parked next to the hotel) with a very gentel driver and that my colleagues paid only 40,00euro for the trasfer, instead I paid 60,00 for the unpleasant trip by city taxi. So my question is why at the moment of check out Mr Ricardo did not propose me the service which offeres the hotel? Hope next time when I come back your service will be even better than now. For the rest my best compliment to all of you
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROs:Nice big rooms, with modern furniture. Big comfortable beds, big bathroom with everything you need. Also a nice big balcony. Very good coffee and food, though a little expensive. checkin very quick and professional, staff helpful and polite. Small spa also.CONs:Location is quite remote with nothing to do in the area. Still, access to the metro is not far away. Balcony should have a small table and chairs.Had room in building B, and had to go out in the cold to get to the lobby, restaurant, caffetaria and spa. Not very comfortable.Spa is very small, but clean. One small hydromassage pool and 3 saunas.Room services is a little to slow for my expectations.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff, spacious and well designed rooms, nice balconies to the internal green courtyard. The location of the hotel is 5 walking minutes from the M1 Metro Station Turro, so you are in 10-15 Minutes in city centre.Fitness centre well equipped and in summer there is a little pool in the internal courtyard.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Expectations exceeded. Friendly staff. Excellent free breakfast, hot and cold, with many choices. Room was large and comfortable. Heating was a bit of an issue, temp controlled from hotel front desk.Great location, 10 minute walk from Turro subway stop on Line 1.Strongly recommend the Malpensa Rail Express to Centrale Station, then a cab.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two families, each family with two interconnecting rooms. Checked in late around 11pm. Although emailed hotel in advance and had their unique reference with notes on system, the checking was painfully long and complicated. The staff couldn’t read or understand the prepaid hotel voucher and insisted we only had two rooms and not four. After checking the prepaid hotel voucher with another colleague or manager, he finally confirmed booking is for four room. No bell boy but directed to the lifts to our rooms. One lift out of two in operation. The lift is small so had to use twice. Got to rooms, comfy and clean but had to call reception for them to unlock the interconnecting rooms which took over 20 minuets to arrive.Next morning after good nights sleep heading to restaurant for breakfast, the only one operating lift was so busy we walked down two flights of stairs. Breakfast was very basic and limited.Bathroom clean with large walk-in shower. Mini fridge wasn’t cold. Tea coffee making facility maybe isn’t used much or not replenished because was dusty and tea bag, sugar and milk missing or enough for one cup.Outdoor pool was the main reason for staying at this hotel as there were better and cheaper hotels more central but without a pool. Big letdown, more like a large domestic pool but children still enjoyed.Shuttle “bus” service to town centre limited operational times, morning only and just one way plus max 6 people. Short walk to subway, about 10 minuets walk. Supermarket nearby but no late opening. Very nice restaurant nearby for lunch or dinner. Checkout quick and able to book taxi to the airport easily on the day (you can’t order in advance).
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly reception Spacious room very clean and pleasantI had the room on the garden, pool side and it was very quiet.  Big breakfast buffet with all you can need...and eatPlace I’ll book next time in Milano.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights here . The location is about a 10 minute metro journey from the centre of Milan and then a 5-10 minutes walk from the metro stop in a quiet residential area. Our room was comfortable and spacious although the air conditioning was not working. Breakfast average, good selection but hot food was cold !! Reception staff were helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The friendly and efficient staff and excellent rooms and facilitates made our stay at the Ramada Plaza fantastic. The breakfast was first class!! The location is near the train station but a little way from the city centre. So for a quick visit it is a little far away from the action in Milan itself. Over all a positive experience.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the ramada with my 2 boys for a long weekend taking in the milan derby nice location good price lovely people one fault breakfast was tepid not hot but plenty of continental to eat so no worrys
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great price and great location means that you can easily access Milan centre by Taxi or Subway! Pool was lacklustre, however reasonable restaurant on site and very good buffet breakfast. Stayed here for Monza GP and for the price I was satisfied.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very modern with all the latest facilities and staffs were very friendly. Hotel is very close to the Metro station. Breakfast had lot of options. Rooms were big and comfortable with Balconies. I had a comfortable stay
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on a short trip to Milan. The nearest Metro station is Turro and the hotel is about less than 10 mins walk from the station. The hotel looked a bit dated from outside and I was a bit sceptical whilst walking towards the hotel. The hotel was great from the inside though. The check-in process was quick and the rooms were spacious. The staff was helpful in directing us towards the places we wanted to visit during our short trip. The breakfast had plenty of options and upto the standards that you would expect from such a hotel. All in all, a great place to stay for a short break.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as part of the Grand Prix package and had no real complaints. Arrived on the Friday and check in quick and easy. Room was lovely and clean with a big balcony, but no chairs on the balcony to sit out. Ate at the Brassiere twice, food excellent, drinks in the bar a little expensive. Supermarket opposite handy and a small restaurant, which we ate at twice and was good and more reasonably priced, but only one girl serving so a bit slow. Extended our stay by an extra day and went into Milan - 6-7 minute walk to the Metro - 8 stops to the centre €1.50 each on way. Only real complaint was the English tea! Plenty for the weekend in the restaurant and room, but ran out Sunday night.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice surprise! This modern hotel is not in the centre of the city, but you can reach it in a few minutes with underground. Rooms are wider (than other hotels same category in downtown) and with all options; the internal garden (with swimming pool) is very amazing.Breakfast is very good. We had dinner in the hotel, not bad but a bit expansive. There is also a SPA, but I didn't utilize it.Staff was very friendly and flexible, according to our needs.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very clean and has big rooms. I had an extra bed for my 10 years old daughter and it did not take out of space. The position is good, it is very close to some good restaurants and is also close to the Turro subway station. It has great free parking. The breakfast is excellent; you can find everything you want to eat in the morning. I highly recommend this hotel for a city break or shopping visit in beautiful city of Milano.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've have arrived in hotel in 10th of July after long journey. It located in calm place. Room was clean but small. Receptionists are very welcome. Breakfast was good and met our satisfaction. There is an Egyptian restaurant nearby the hotel and provide halal food.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is away from the city center But I enjoyed my stay in the hotel however some of the reception staff were unfriendly Lots of spsces in the room mind u I booked a suite. Price is quite cheap with breakfast Across the street there a small market To move around the city sure u need transportation
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was great i was on presidential suite, the view is amazing but you expect more. there is no guide to use all the service that you have on the room. There's not a good wifi. Its expensive the minibar. the hotel is nice but the service is very poor, they dont do the best they only do their jobs. I make my check in and never the desk agent saw me to the eyes, always to the monitor. The location is bad very bad.
hotelName:
11    Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it's the 3rd time we spent few nights in this beautiful hotel and everything is always so very perfect!! we are always very satisfied. staff is friendly and room are the best around. nice to shopping and relax in the room, or have a spritz.we will of course come back
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my girlfriend for 3 nights. We were a little bit too early at check-in, but they priories our room. The room was awesome and we even got a little personalized greeting written on the mirror. The hotel is located 10 minutes away from the next metro station and the Navigli district, what is totally fine. The breakfast is great and the hotel in general is an absolute beauty. We had an awesome stay. Thanks for this great experience.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with a friend who was on a business trip, was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Some of the photos on the website made it look quite tacky, but actually it’s pretty fun. The design is bright and colourful, lots of unusual lighting and quirky features. Check-in was quick and easy, with friendly staff. Car park is only small but if you can get a space it’s free of charge to use. There is on-street parking available but this is payable (€2 an hour if I remember rightly). Rooms are quite small, but have everything you need. They feel as if they have been made to look fairly good but on a low budget, nothing is particularly luxurious but does look nice. Beds are typical of European hotels. The wardrobe is a rail/shelves behind a sheer curtain, unusual but does the job. Bathroom is large, really decent sized bath and powerful shower. The bathroom door doubles as the toilet door, swings 90 degrees, which is slightly odd. It’s also a glass door that doesn’t really sit in any sort of frame so just kind of hangs there. Nicely stocked minibar. View was interior so nothing much to speak of. Bar was fun and the staff there are really very good. I spent a bit of time there alone just doing bits of work, they couldn’t have looked after me better. Attentive, chatty, skilled and they offered complimentary bar snacks which was a nice touch. A short walk from the hotel is a tram stop which takes you into the city centre, I walked one-way which was around 45 mins to the Cathedral and Piazza.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visit this hotel regularly with work, the theme changes every time. Keeping the hotel looking and feeling fresh for every visit. There is always service with a smile, shout out to Marco who goes the extra mile and remembers my name. Grazie
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Trendy but pricey for what delivers in term of guest experience. Good atmosphere and helpful team. For sure it’s a great hotel. Localization is perfect and offer art events that are amazing. I would come back.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice old building refurbished to hotel. Lots of Nice design stuff in the hotel. But all of that does not make it very cosy. Room size is oké. But rooms are very warm. Airco cannot really cool it down. Rooms are little worm down. Area is Nice and trendy. But nearest tube station is about 15 min.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very interesting hotel. The room was very comfortable and interesting. Not your standard hotel room. We really enjoyed staying here. The location was great too as it's a little out of the way so you are not right in the thick of it. Stephania at the front desk was great.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I fly over 150 days a year and stay in hotels all around the world . . . rarely have I ever stayed in a hotel with a more friendly staff who sincerely care to make your stay an exceptional experience. Especially Salwa and her team in the restaurant made me feel on top of this world when they came with a chocolate cake to celebrate my 50th birthday during breakfast - I was touched beyond belief. Thank you Salwa and the entire crew at Nhow. I will be back soon. Kai-Uwe
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay at nhow Milano! Very warm welcome by the entire team and they provided me with an fantastic room! #301. Bathroom is enormous and the beds comfortable. Service in the evening by the restaurant team was very good. Local speciality risotto Milanese was delicious. Also breakfast very good!!Thank you for this!!Gijs
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: in my first visit to Milan I stayed in Nhow Milano it was great experience great quality great staff e super breakfast the staff was very helpful specially samir who help my to know better the city and sapport us with the informatin i am sure i will come back with my family
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an EXCELLENT STAY aT this hotel!! Very nice gym. Great food staff was very friendly and helpful especially Samir!!! He went above and beyond to make sure I felt very comfortable and welcomed. He help me me find shopping, museums and local places to eat. I’m a very satisfied customer and I recommend to everybody!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Marco and staff were so accommodating and friendly plus made the best Aperol Spritz ever!!! ❤️❤️❤️Come stay for fun or for fashion week! We will be back!! May 2020 for the Redken Euro Symposium. Ciao for now! Sheri Doss / Redken
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very funny hotel. Funny in a good way. The staff are great, the rooms clean and spacious. The breakfast room is welcoming and the new bar is fantastic.Someone however has the weirdest and most tasteless sense of art. Fascinating in its gaudy, garish, trashy and ostentatiousness! This someone has been given free reign over the interior.I consider this an upside and an antidote to the bland beige of most global hotel chains.Will always be my hotel of choice in Milan
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel as recommended by my dear friend Sonia, my Italian girlfriend from high school back in Australia. The hotel is very modern, with the walls adorned with what I would call pop art. The room was very clean, shower had good pressure, beds were comfortable and the rooms had excellent heating which was controlled by you from within the room. I loved the place, the service was fantastic, very friendly, nothing was too much. We look forward to coming back here in a weeks time when we return from the Dolomites. Thank you Sonia xox for recommending this hotel to us.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is situated 10 minutes by walk from metro station Porta Genova. It is good transport connection to the center and railway stations. The area is very quiet with some good restaurants nearby on the way to metro station. To recommend is osteria Belledonne. It is difficult to find good food in Milan's center, so it was a very good solution. The hotel has its own ambiente. Rooms are very quiet, sleep quality ideal. The breakfast is rich, staff is very friendly and helpful. Very good in terms price-quality.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another 3 week stay in one of my favourite hotels in one of my favourite cities. The location is perfect for my office and the Navigli area has everything you could want as far as dining is concerned. Not too far from other areas of Milan by tram or metro. Rooms are a good size; breakfast plentiful and staff always friendly. Looking forward to another trip this year
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Back on my birthday in end October, my wife and me took a trip to Milano. We are familliar with the progressive and beautiful NHOW hotels but this one was special due to the professionals working there.Jenny 'guest relations' made us feel extra welcome with great attention to every detail while Marcello 'Director of Food & Beverage' made us feel just like home and very spoiled for my birthday. Housekeeping was friendly beyond our expectations.Small talk with a personal touch and extra care all the way of our stay. Thank you again. Happy Holidays from Amsterdam!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the rejuvenated via Tortona / porta Genova district, once the heart of Milano Industrial district, this hotel is all about lifestyle rather than tourist spot.Located inside a former factory, red bricks and steel beams from the 19th century are the main corridors construction materials.Rooms are minimalist in their designs, but equipped with an espresso machine.Reception area is outstanding, and will set you in the mood of your stay, with art pieces exhibited around, and a tray where while waiting for check in you can get munchies and mineral waters of many kinds. I was unfortunately set in a quiet room dotted with a mattress that well reached it's retirement age, and could feel the springs in some parts of the bed. Quiet inappropriate when you pay 180 euros a night. After changing room, comfort was more in relation with the venue quality.Reception personnal is extremely courteous and professional. And the venue has about 20 parking spot free of charge.My room was about 20 sqm, and I enjoyed greatly its neat and minimalist design. Bathroom (and possibly the rooms too) need to be quickly refreshed beside my 1st night mattress disaster, shower joints are blacken from mold.Hotel location is top if you want to experience the Navigli district nightlife, restaurants and cafe abound nearby. For the runners, hotel is located next to one of the Navigli and you can run for miles along the water on a semi pedestrian way with almost no cars.Excellent hotel, but rooms would certainly deserve to be refreshed, at a 180euros per night this is the least to expect.Internet worked well and my rooms all have an espresso machine. I would come back again, as long as prices are competitive agst the other hotels of the same type in Milano
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Aside from being a swell hotel, the front desk/concierge team saved me from doom when I was chairing a conference here in Oct. I stupidly left my laptop WITH ALL OF MY LIFE ON IT on the airplane. Not only were the team helpful (helping me until 3AM) but they made sure that my laptop was safely returned to me via taxi the next day before lunchtime. Big shout out to Giacomo who orchestrated the safe return of my laptop so that for me it was business as usual throughout the conference. Thank you Giacomo and team!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I surprised my boyfriend for his 21st birthday and the hotel very kindly upgraded us. The staff were lovely and gave me suggestions of places for dinner before we arrived. The air conditioning was sooo necessary and always well maintained. The cleaning staff were so polite and courteous. Will definitely be returning, perfect for families and couples. The transport links are great too. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance. Everything you would like from a hotel, first time to Milan and will definitely choose the Nhow Milano again.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: honestly my friend and i had a decent experience here. the staff was friendly for the most part and the room was fine (not 4 star in my opinion but still nice). however, we noticed quite a few mosquitoes both alive and dead in the room. at first we thought it was just one, but after killing that the first night, we had two and then more our second and third night. by the time we left the fourth day, i had over 20 bites and my friend had at least 10. i tried contacting the staff via the what’s app number the supply at the front desk to let them know, but they read both my messages and never replied. won’t be back.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: interestingly quirky hotel, at a reasonably good location from the town center! Breakfast is extra; but decent selection for the cost. Note - Conventions are often held here, so check ahead of time. There were 2 conventions happening on the 3 days in October during my stay. No iron or ironing board in the rooms (!) Odd for a business hotel.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you like art and quirky hotel decor this is the place for you...If your main priorities are a comfy bed, being able to clearly see when walking down corridor and not having big metal structures in the way, or being able to work out where your door is...maybe less so!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is something different...a statement piece! A stylish hotel meets modern art gallery, with some fascinating pieces. Huge beds and nicely kitted out rooms. Its downside is it's location, a 20 minute trek to the main action at Port Genova/Navigli. However, this area is super cool and definitely THE area to stay it - a fab vibe and culture.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has great decor and is certainly very stylish. Unfortunately it isn’t particularly practical and I found it a touch soulless. Wait time to check in was 15 minutes, the room was spacious but dark and not homely. Breakfast was nice, a good spread and quick service.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is very fashionable and fancy.The staff was always friendly and nice. We loved our stay at the NHOW Milan, although there were many russians staying with us, who were really really loud and noisy.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in Nhow was amazing: great welcome, very nice suite and unbelievable breakfast! This hotel is full of design items and we appreciated the nice temporary exhibition during our stay in Juillet 2018!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with a party of 4 other people in 3 premium rooms.What a super cool hotel, incredibly good value for the price we paid for the rooms, well positioned in the city, with spacious rooms, very clean & modern.There were artworks everywhere, it really gave the impression of a much higher class hotel.The breakfast offer was truly amazing - massive amount of variety of good quality foods but just honestly some of the most impressive variety I've ever seen in an hotel!Reception staff were incredibly competent & professional & gave us brilliant advice about a day trip to Lake Como.I would thoroughly recommend this hotel & will look to stay at this brand whenever possible, it really impressed us
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is gorgeous . It showed us everyday living with modern art. Throughout the hotel we found art work by different artists, quite impressive display. They upgraded our room to the junior suite as a present for my birthday and wedding anniversary. Staff is very nice and helpful. Breakfast for every taste. As a bonus, very close by is Modec Museum with very interesting permanent exhibition. Taxi to city centre costs 11-12 euros and the reception will call it for you.One minor negative aspect is the choice for dinner which was limited for our taste. Overall, very nice experience and if it is to return to Milan most likely we will choose the same hotel. Thank you
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at nhow Milano! The hotel is located really well, with nice restaurants and bars around the corner. Also the lobby, restaurant, halls... everything is decorated so beautifully. We loved our room, very spacious and light. Also the staff is very helpful, especially at Front Office. Thank you, we have enjoyed Milano very much, also thanks to your great tips!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My new Favorite place in Italy... :)Congrats to staff. Impeccable, clean and friendlyIt was truly an amazing experience.Had a great Bday."Milano, the city that knows how to party"- Nhow Hotel Milano **** and more -
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you would like to try a different hotel experience - come to nhow Milano. A unique hotel filled with modern art and design. Go explore. Right in the middle of Tortona "design district" and close to the "hip" Navigli district. Lots of very good restaurants on Via Tortona and by the canals in Navigli. Tram stop close by - only 15 minutes to the town center. Runs every 5 min. Great parking facilities. Staff is absolutely great - super service and always with a smile. So many nice details and "suprices" - In the lobby you are greated with sweet treats and saturday morning we were suprices with a dj at breakfast. Every guest lid up with a smile that morning. Breakfast is a colourful experience - huge selection with lots of healthy choises and some "sweet" things as well. Only issue is that the beds are a bit hard. They need a "topmadres". We will be back - and also visit other nhow hotels.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the quirkiness of this hotel....lots of very strange works of art and sharks head bins! The decor was interesting to say the least! I have to agree with a previous comment that you do feel like you're walking into an underground carpark ( not a particularly welcoming front entrance) and we found it rather difficult to find if walking from the Pta Genova underground station - top tip: come out of the Via Tortona exit, walk straight ahead of you across the little square with taxis and tram stops and take the little road to the very far left and there is a cutting across the railway tracks that has replaced the green bridge which is blocked off. We didn't realise this and walked all the way round. Once on Via Tortona it is still a bit off a walk and its location, I would say, is the only reason I haven't given it 5 stars. However there are lots of very traditional and very Italian bistros and osterias in this area and most of the time we were the only tourists in them....BelleDonne Bistrot/Osteria and Boccino were particularly good and Boccino has a lovely roof terrace. Getting back to the hotel, there was a fantastic section for breakfast and the option to have eggs cooked how you liked. There was even prosecco for those who want bubbles for breakfast. What we really loved was the little paper bags that you could actually take a croissant or muffin out with you for lunch! Lovely touch! However we were always so full after our breakfast that we never wanted much for lunch! Given that breakfast was so varied and good we were a bit surprised that the restaurant had such an uninviting menu....we had wanted to try it out but on investigation we decided to go to the local restaurants instead. Our room (249) didn't have the best of views out onto the carpark but it was huge with a massive bed, lovely powerful shower and nice toiletries. They could do with a few hooks in the bathroom but there was plenty of space for toilet bags. Although we personally found the bed a little soft and bouncy we definitely slept well and there was no other noise from the corridor/other rooms or outside even with the window open. I would highly recommend if you don't mind a walk!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We‘ve booked the hotel just spontaneously for one night. We knew already the hotel from last year and also last year was it great. This time it was even better! The hotel is situated in a modern part of Milano with lots of art buildings and restaurants where the locals go, the center is just 15 minutes with the tram to the Dome and Galleria in Milano ( you have to walk 10min. from the hotel to the tram station). If you want to experience not just touristic mashup of restaurants, then the Hotel is perfect! The Via Tortona is filled with beautiful new and modern restaurant with a lot of varieties of cousine. The hotel itselft is a design hotel. From the entrance, to the reception, breakfast room and the hall to the rooms-everything is done with details to art! And they change the exhibitions regularly.Big thanks to Jenny and the whole Team! We feel like home in this hotel, everybody is friendly and helpful, they‘ve recommended us some restaurant, booked for us the restaurants, planned our trip and made the stay unforgettable. We have got a big suite with a bathtub, shower, double bed. An upgrade from the hotel to make their guests happy. Thank you very much again! As we have arrived in the morning, they have already cleaned and prepared our room and gave us complimentary breakfast so we can get some power for the day! Again a big thanks to Jenny and the staff who has organized this for us! We will definitely recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to visit Milano! Everything was perfect and the service is one of the best that I have experienced until now. I will definitely come back here!!! Thank you again!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re in Milano for business reasons or for leisure, and you’re looking for a cool, different, but peaceful and moreover resting place to stay, for one night or a couple, this is the place to stay. The rooms are big and pleasant. The bathroom is huge -almost suite like - even for a standard-type of room. Very clean, nicely taken care of, with details that only picky eyes catch. Design and ambiance are not only trendy but also restful. The atmosphere is cosy even in the hotel hallways and ways to the rooms. Breakfast buffet is gorgeous, almost as good as in the best 5-stars US hotels. Front desk is very professional and attentive. This is the place to stay, whether you’re working like a dog all day (like me this time) or shopping like crazy for a few days, or just enjoying the special and pleasant atmosphere of this North-Italian city. Just enjoy it as good as it gets.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the “tunnel” entrance to the exciting lobby every thing about nhow is special and interesting. We spent a few days here while visiting Milan and loved it! The rooms are large even by US standards A/C works well and the staff was helpful with our questions about the city. When we come back we will definitely book here again ! You must check out the art on each floor
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in Milan with an interestig contemporary art athmosphere. Great breakfast and rooms. Nice and helpful people at reception. Arriving at 1:30 am and trying to find your room in the semi dark corridor with all this art pieces might be a bit scary.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel itself chic and modern but unfortunately I was quite disappointed. After your flight you just want to rest in your room. In my case on my arrival Ive asked one of the staff member if I can borrow their phone adaptor cause I was low on my battery and didn't have the right phone charger, staff just told me ' we don't have it' , which was very unusual as hotels always provides basic things as adaptors. Instead I was offered to go and buy one.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for a Milan city break. The hotel is near the very pretty and picturesque Navigli canals and waterways with a wealth of good quality and reasonably priced restaurants and bars but yet a short ride to the main city centre of Milan if you wish. We would recommend taking the Metro from the station P.ta Genova which is close by and only a few stops and a few Euros. The Milan Metro system is very easy to use and find your way around. A special thanks to Jenny Rossi in guest relations and the team at nhow Milan as nothing was too much trouble for them to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The hotel is spotlessly clean and beautifully designed as only the Italians know how! To take an industrial building and create such a masterpiece of an hotel with great unique design features is nothing short of a miracle. We enjoyed every minute staying there and would like to thank all the staff that looked after us. Would certainly consider going back.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is like living in an art exhibition which is so unusual but also quirky! We enjoy the atmosphere and the rooms were very hit by Italian standards. Chocolates and water were left in the room each night and there was a coffee machine which was nice to use. Overall it was great but very expensive for what you get! The area was fab though only 20 mins from Navigli!
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really nicely surprised by beautiful and very creative design of this hotel. We spent one night in Nhow but were just amazed even with small little details everywhere around us. Very nice friendly staff always willing to help, breakfast just excellent. Hotel is very closed to romantic canal Navigli. I can highly recommend to everybody.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the place, family of 5, 3 teens, service was excellent. We arrived late and were very tired. the guy who welcomed us (guy named JeanMarco) was simply great: helpful considerate and very resourceful, flexible, gave us info and tips regarding late dinner and we immediately felt at home. Rooms are great and quite, breakfast has good variety and make you feel at home too. we loved this hotel and its staff. Highly recommended
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wanted to take my partner away for his birthday to Milan as a surprise. Looking at the photos and reviews of Nhow Hotel, I decided to book our stay there and I was so glad I did.Before arrival I emailed the hotel and advised I was surprising my partner for his birthday and asked if they could recommend places to eat and party that weekend. Jenny Rossi from the hotel emailed me back and straight away said she would upgrade our room and give us VIP treatment during our stay. Jenny did as promised and gave us a few options of places to go and eat.On arrival as soon as we handed in our passports at reception they called Jenny to come and see to us. Jenny greeted us and as promised upgraded our room. Jenny organised for us to have a complimentary drink at the bar and for booked us in for breakfast in their restaurant the following morning at no charge. We went out for the rest of the day, when we arrived back to our room, Jenny had left a bottle of prosecco with a platter of fruit in our room with a lovely note. What can I say Jenny really just made our stay extra special! The hotel is quirky and modern. I love the whole atmosphere of the hotel. Our room was fab, which had an amazing big jacuzzi bath in the middle of the room which is great for couples. The restaurant is beautiful and the breakfast is amazing. The location is fabulous. It is in walking distance to the Navigli area which has a canal surrounded by restaurants and bars, and is quite picturesque in the sun.To central Milan it takes about 15 mins on the tram and the tram is only about 10 mins walk from the hotel. We also travelled to Lake Como for the day and you can easily get the metro to the train station. The metro is also about 10 mins walk away. When we go back to Milan I would 100% stay at Nhow again. All the staff were lovely and helpful. Maybe See you next year Nhow :)
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very quiet rooms , something one does not necessarily expect in this area .... the hotel a lot of spacious areas, the rooms are very functional and well designed, what is missing is space to store your clothes but otherwise all goodService efficient, clean rooms , good value for money
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 days here in a business conference. The conference room facilities are good including snacks. Lunch buffet was average. Hotel rooms are very functional, just the hallways are very dark.Reception is quite slow, many people run around but only one counter is open most of the time. Location seems to be also not ideal depending on what you plan of course.Overall an average experience at quite high price.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really wish more hotels were like the nhow Milano. It was definitely a good value. Here are my impressions of the property ordered from good to not so good.So much style!Free snacks galoreBreakfast at restaurant was artsy and yummySeriously GREAT bathroomBar is a cool hang out spot at all hours, except when cigarette smoke drifts in from outsideYou can't iron in your room; you have to use the ironing roomAbysmal selection of English TV channelsFirm springy mattressNo kind of desk or closetBasically, the common areas and bathrooms are stupendous, but the rooms aren't exactly cozy. There's no doubt I'd stay there again given the chance.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent services and Friendly Staff. Rooms are clean and tidy. Hotel very modern, Turkish Sauna, excellent food and even free water bottles in the room. Near City Center. Very quiet and clean hotel in general.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This otel is incredible for way such as breakfast, rooms, services, people... etcbreakfast includes so many proseccos served by the best staff so thank you.thank you nhow, you best in milanogreat place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place, great place
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I traveled to Milan from Hong Kong on a business trip. The staff at nhow Milano were awesome! Good breakfast, comfortable beds and all of their staff always made sure we were taken good care of. Thanks Nhow Milan! Will book again next time I’m back in Milan.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for a 24 hour visit to Milan to see Arsenal play AC Milan. The hotel was perfectly placed for a quick underground ride to the ground but also for walking to The Duomo and other central sights. The staff were fantastic and breakfast was great with a special red fruit theme on the day we stayed.The decor is quirky but great fun and our room was large and very comfortable with some nice touches like the goodie trolly when you arrived laden with sweets and biscuits.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect. 1st time in Milano and we chose this hotel from its excellent reviews. I decided to take my partner away for her birthday, and emailed the hotel before hand to get some tips on attractions. From hearing my email, the guest relations Manager was straight away replying and being so helpful, and made us feel like royalty when arrived. My partner was welcomed by every member of staff knowing our special weekend. This hotel screams out luxury and stylish sites. We would love to come Milano again and book this hotel. The hotel and its staff, especially Jenny Rossi who deserves all the compliments and credit to make the hotel special. Top marks.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My experience with nhow milano has been sublime. Everyone from the staff was more than friendly and helpful. There was Patrizio serving at the bar who was the best, and made the best cocktails! There was a wide choice of drinks and a lot of places to work and sit. Also, there was the carnaval party with live music, which was very uniuw nd original. The vibe from the hotel and all the staff makes this hotel the best! I will return for sure. Nhow milano and future milano.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern hotel in the trendy Milan's Navigli area. Rooms are spacious, calm and well equipped. Nice walk-in shower, satellite tv... buffet breakfast is generous and ok quality (pity not to have fresh from bakery croissants). The hotel also has a nice gym with steam room.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful place! The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are very nice and comfortable, the location is close to the metro and walking distance to shops, the service at the hotel is very friendly, safety and quality is outstanding.
hotelName:
12    nhow Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a quick overnight stay in Milan and chose to stay with Excelsior. The hotel is just outside the Milan central station so if you're coming into Milan from the MXP Airport, this is an absolute blessing to walk 5 minutes with your luggage and into your room.The staff were extremely helpful, spoke English really well and nothing could be faulted with their service. The room was of good size and we had one with a balcony that looked out over central station which when we ordered some room service that night (which was to die for!!!) made for a perfect restaurant for two where we could just soak up Milan. We'll definitely be booking back into Excelsior next time we're in Milan - thanks again to the staff for such an enjoyable stay.
hotelName:

review_body: Stayed two night on business. On checking in my first room had no wifi, after 2 hours of trouble shooting I was moved to a another room. The second room did have wifi but AC was very poor and it was 37 degrees outside. AC across the hotel was on the weak side. Service was good although the roof top terrace is a bit cramped.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is conveniently located near the train station. The check in staff were very helpful and helped me to my room. the room is spacious and a bath/shower area which was very nice. The breakfast was outstanding with helpful staff. There is also areas to read and sit and talk to friends.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time booking brought Amex fine hotels did not disappoint. Got to Milan at 7am and the hotel let us check in at 10am not bad at all. Service was impeccable throughout and the spa absolutely was amazing. Breakfast buffet included and the variety and quality was top notch. Other than the fact that the location isn’t close to zone 1 the city center this hotel is 5 stars all the way
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had high hopes for this property and it disappointed me. The check-in staff seemed oblivious at times that guests were waiting to be served. I was originally put in a room that had no functioning hot water. I then needed to move to a new room, where I found a used condom wrapper on the floor. To cap it off, the check-in staff charged my room to the wrong card and three days later, I'm still waiting for a response to fix this. Unfortunately, I would not recommend staying here.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed at the Excelsior Gallia hotel and we were extremely impressed with the site. It’s located across from the Milan train station.The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating, which includes ordering taxis, providing directions, and/or making dinner recommendations & reservations.Each room has plenty of space in the bedroom and bathroom. The hotel has a spa and workout center along with a lovely restaurant and bar on the top floor. The bar is worth a visit for the view, scenery, and an aperitif. I suggest an Aperol spritz if you are not familiar with the cocktail. Breakfast is served downstairs at a separate restaurant and the morning selection is wonderful. There is an omelette station and a juicer, where the staff cut the fruits and prepare your juice on the spot.
