The restaurant has a huge selection of meats and cheeses along with breads and fruits.While the hotel is not located in the city center, where the top attractions are located, the hotel provides a free shuttle in a Maserati! I am not kidding.There are plenty of excellent restaurants within 500 meters of the hotel and the streets are safe for walking.I highly suggest this hotel if you have the choice. The amenities are top notch and the hotel staff is truly impressive!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upgraded, great champagne, great suites, great location. Very helpful staff too!I wouldn’t think twice about staying again at this hotel, easy decision; hotel of choice in Milan.Additionally, found the hotel to exceptionally clean.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On June 5th I booked one night at this hotel through Travelocity for $750 for the end of September. Less than 24 hours later (117 days prior to the reservation) I realized I had made a mistake and would not be able to include a night in Milan in our travel plans. Travelocity said the hotel’s policy was “no refunds” but since it was within 24 hours of booking, she thought it would be a reasonable request and would call the hotel. She did and was told they would refund the $750. Travelocity requested an email confirmation which the hotel said they would provide. A day later, Travelocity had not heard from the hotel, called back, and was told there would be no refund. If this hotel is so uncompromising about this situation you might want to think twice about how intractable they might be about any problem or special request if you stayed there.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a shame! A beautiful hotel, spectacularly appointed, but they choose to significantly restrict the guests use of air conditioning! I was so hot I could not sleep. It seems if you leave the room the air conditioning goes off - then when you return, there is no way the system can reduce the room temperature haven’t been turned off all day. Frankly, this is NOT luxury if you are in beautiful surroundings but are uncomfortable and can not sleep. I’ll never stay here again!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is truly an example of how clean and well constructed a hotel should be. Amazing room, we stayed at a junior suite and it was totally worth it. The breakfast buffet was worth including in our room. Great spa and staff as well. Our only issues were with the room air conditioner and room service (staff) and the quality of the food. For some reason even if we changed the temperature to 69-70 degrees it would always stay at 75 or above and it took hours to get the room to cool down. We let the staff know, but they could not figure it out either; their only solution was to close the bathroom door, which oddly enough helped cool the room down a bit. We think they control the A/C from somewhere else and they just don’t want their guess messing with the temperatures, perhaps to save energy?! In-room dining, for the price they charge, needs a true revamp! The staff taking the orders should speak and understand English because a few times they had a hard time understanding us and got our orders wrong; plus they don’t speak clearly, they rushed me off the phone and at times it felt like they were screaming at me; it was obvious they were frustrated that we didn’t speak Italian or they didn’t speak English, either way it was very frustrating to order in. Mariana was kind and was the only one that understood us and took care of us one night, but overall the food arrived cold and not fresh. Their in-room dining experience is not a good representation of the high luxury standards the hotel perceives. Overall, we loved the hotel, the location is ideal and we will surely stay there again. Let’s just hope when we do, the few issues we encountered are resolved.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely one night stay at this hotel. It was a special occasion, since we celebrated the birthday of my mother, and the hotel surprised us with a birthday cake in the room which just made our day! To then get a complimentary drive to the Duomo with the Maserati of the hotel was an extra bonus.The hotel and the guest rooms are beautiful, there is a nice gym, a beautiful spa and breakfast is excellent. However, the most important thing is always the staff and they were all so friendly and service-minded. Lucia in the breakfast room also took extra care of us when she found out that we were celebrating my mother. Thank you for that!All in all, it was a perfect stay. I have stayed at many good hotels and this once definitely qualifies to be one of my (new) favorites. I/we would love to be back!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel on the 9th May for a 3 day break to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This is an absolutely beautiful hotel, and is immaculate throughout. When we arrived, the first thing we noticed was the most beautiful scent of flowers.. the second thing was the enthusiasm and professionalism of all the staff. We were checked in by a wonderful receptionist, Beatrice , who then escorted us to our suite, which she had upgraded to a bigger one for our anniversary. The furnishings, bed linen, coffee machine etc were all of a high quality and a huge bed that was so comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble and Beatrice was clearly proud to represent the hotel. Unfortunately on our first night, there was a slight problem with the air conditioning, but when we mentioned it the next morning, we were instantly taken care of and given a change of suite without question , and upgraded, yet again to an even nicer suite overlooking the front with view of the Grand Central station. When we came back from sightseeing , she had organised a bottle of bubbly on ice and an anniversary cake as a surprise left in our room. The rooftop bar was a great place to relax in the evening with drinks and nibbles, and again, the staff there were friendly and attentive. On our second day we were greeted by name and this attention to detail and warm welcome was present throughout our stay from everyone . The breakfast at the Excelsior is amazing - everything to a high standard and beautifully presented. Special thanks and mention to our lovely waitress Susannah. It’s fair to say that this is quite a pricey hotel, but in terms of value for money, it is unbeatable . The complimentary chauffeur driven Maserati facility was a great service - thank you to our driver Sergio for taking us into the city centre and for passing on his local knowledge! All the staff make this the wonderful hotel that it is, and we really did not want to leave! Milan is a wonderful city, but our stay at the hotel genuinely made our trip extra special! ❤️
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so pleasantly surprised by this hotel! We typically stay at the Park Hyatt but it was booked and this place was even nicer! It is renovated to perfection. Our suite was beautiful. Modern and thoughtful. The breakfast is amazing. Anything you want is there, including a juice machine with fresh veggies and fruits for you to make your own juice. They will make anything you want if you do not see what you want there. They have a lovely cafe for afternoon coffee. The location is good and bad. It is right across from the train station, so if you are doing day trips it is so convenient. I expected to hear noise, but did not hear anything. The neighborhood is not great shopping or dining so you either can take a taxi, walk or their Masarati can take you places. We did all 3 options and were great. Plus loved taking a train and then just being back at the hotel. Wonderful new option in Milan!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay at this hotel, we picked it due to the location as it is a short walk from Milan Centrale station, after a Frecciarosa ride from Venice. It is about 5 mins walk once you know which direction. Check in was straightforward. Room is clean and well appointed modern luxury manner. Shower is strong and you have the choice of normal shower head or rainforest type. We appreciate the complimentary water in the room, which also gets topped up during night turndown service. A number of highlights: complimentary transport to/from Duomo or Via Monte Napoleone (driver Guido gets a special mention for entertaining us), and breakfast (Daniel who kindly help us with the juice machine every morning). Highly recommended.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - One of the best places to stay in Milan. My third time staying in Milan been coming past three years during spring break & will definitely return again. - Excellent Location, next to the central metro station Milano. 5 min walk. - Clean rooms & friendly staff in general. - Very helpful concierge service. - Shishedo spa, the treatments are standard however the Aromatic / scented bath was a unique feature of the facilities. -Very clean, modern & well kept gym facilities.- Restaurants— Gallia : One of the best breakfast among Milan hotels.— Terrazzo Gallia rooftop restaurant: good food & ambience overlooking Milan city at night. - Complimentary Maserati transportation (Drop off / Pick up) to city center. The highlight of the place - A great value to MARRIOT Bonvoy members. - Special thanks to Mr. Luca for making the stay even more special.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Excelsior make this hotel exceptional. They give true 5 star service. Fast, efficient and always with a smile. Especially the staff at the conference and banqueting department! The food was also very good. The breakfast staff and food was as well equally good.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a gorgeous hotel, right across the street from the train station. Rooms were wonderful, service was good. The fitness center, while in a strange location, was quite functional. It wasn't very large, but it also wasn't very crowded, so it served it's purpose. We were there for a business meeting, and rented a conference room. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was very good. While the hotel wasn't cheap, I would recommend it again.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel. It is not cheap and is not located close to the center but it was right next to the train station which was very convenient. The hotel is clean and well designed. Service was amazing. Only stayed for one night but will surely come back.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited here recently and loved the room. The rooms were so clean and nice. I loved small balconies in the rooms. Staff were nice as well. I picked this location so we could take the bus back to the airport around the station easily. The hotel is very easy to get to from every location in Milan. I was afraid if the noise would be a problem as the hotel was located in city center/station, but it was so quiet!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I grade hotels by the quality and the service.The hotel is really quite remarkable. It is a historic facade surrounding some of the most remarkable, cool, Italian, "designer" features I have seen. There are leather panels and sleek marble - great technology. We really thought the hotel exuded a fashionable Milan "vibe."The shuttle is quite impressive - two Maserati cars to transport you around town. The spa is absolutely outstanding. A really nice rooftop bar and gym.But most importantly, the staff bent over backwards to accommodate us. I must really thank the Concierge staff - we asked them to work miracles to get us tickets to see the Last Supper, which is sold out for months - and they did. If you are looking for a fashionable Milan experience, I highly recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is impressive when you first arrive and staff were friendly and efficient allocating our room. Lifts are small but we used the main staircase to our room on the fourth floor. We had a very nice view of the station which is a magnificent building.Room was a reasonable size but not really enough workspace for a business trip. Reasonable wardrobe and drawer space. There was a large shower and bath and plenty of storage space in the bathroom. Large and comfortable bed with good sockets beside each side, including USB, one European and one UK. Always useful these days and often lacking. More sockets over the small desk area.We were disappointed when coffee and glasses that had been used were not replenished. One day a cleaning cloth was left on a chair, so housekeeping need to make more checks.Breakfast was included and the buffet was OK but nothing special. No toaster for example. Coffee (decaf) was awful!We did like the Terrace bar however which had nice nibbles with you drinks. The fitness centre is quite hard to find. It's located above the Spa and you need to take a separate lift to it. It has reasonable Technogym equipment but not a huge range. The room was also incredibly hot and it didn't help that not all the running machines had working fans.If you want to go to the main area of Milan, Duomo, La Scala etc the hotel offer a car, but I found the walk approx 30 minutes easy to although you do have to watch out for trams and trolley buses.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let’s get the negatives out of the way first. A lot of the guests here are pretentious and unbelievably obnoxious. I watched on many occasion’s guests thinking that just because they had a few designer clothes on, they could treat the staff as their own personal servants without a mention of a please or thank you. Secondly, breakfast is completely overpriced. We had a few items from the buffet and an omelette and for 2 people this came to 80 euros. Do yourself a favour and head down the road to eat. To the positives. The staff here are good and I especially liked the concierge team outside who gave us a lovely warm welcome on our arrival. The bedroom was great as well with a big comfortable bed The gym is really well put together with some excellent equipment. All in all, whilst I liked this hotel I couldn’t stand being surrounded my people with no manners which I found pretty appalling. I do however accept this is not the fault of the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for the first time as we always stay at the Grand hotel. The Gallia exceeded our expectations in every way. The reception was wonderful after a long flight they selected the best room for us and we were shown to our room that was perfect. Windows open widely so fresh air was gorgeous. The breakfast was delicious and wide variety. They brought us pancakes and they did fresh carrot juice that was very special. The concierge offered the Maserati to drive us to city center every morning which was very special. We were tired so had room service in hotel every night! It was the best lasagne and tiramisu we have ever had. Well done! Location is great, with train station across the road. We did loads of shopping in the station terminal and we went to Venice one day with the fast train. This hotel is perfect in every way.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in early March. Overall I had a great business stay at the hotel. This is a well-run, stylish luxury hotel with a polished and professional staff. I would be more than happy to return for another business or vacation stay.Specific comments below:Location: The hotel is located right next to the main train station. This makes it very convenient for a business traveler. I easily took trains to Zurich and central Italy in the morning and returned to the hotel in the evening. There are express trains to Malpensa Airport and the bus from Linarte at the main station. There are several subway lines at the station as well which makes it easy to get anywhere in Milan. If you want to stay near the main tourist sites this hotel is not as well located as others, but its just a few subway stops to the center of Milan.Room: I am am a Marriott elite (Ambassador) and was upgraded to a Atelier Suite four days before check-in after applying 3 Suite Night Awards. The Atelier Suite was a fantastic room. Very stylish, showed very little wear and tear and had a full complement of amenities including a mini-bar, coffee/tea maker, etc. If felt a lot larger than its stated square footage due to very efficient use of space. The suite has a solid door between the bedroom and the living room, a separate entrance area and a changing area as well as a large bathroom. The bathroom had a bath and a great rain shower (with a high tech steam shower appliance as well). The room was quiet despite looking out over the square in front of the train station and the blackout curtains in the room worked very well making it easy to get a good nights sleep. This was more than enough space for a solo business traveler and an ideal amount of space for a couple.Service: Everyone I interacted with at the hotel was pleasant, professional and polished. The breakfast staff were particularly nice. Everyone spoke excellent english.Marriott Elite Benefits: There is no lounge, but this hotel offers Marriott Platinum and above elites a free buffet breakfast each morning and the breakfast is excellent with a wide range of high quality breakfast items as well as made to order eggs. I also received a nice welcome note along with a gift of chocolates in my room.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A luxury stay in the newly renovated hotel is next to the central train station - extremely convenient. Still, visiting with our 4 year old daughter, we would prefer the center to be on walking distance. In this case, the Mazerati shuttle was an amazing convenience for us. I would definately recommend to be able to pre-book it, not to feel insecure. Staff is very professional. I would like to thank Marta - Front Office for her positive attitude and willingness to assist us during our stay, as well as Hankong - Breakfast service for recommending different bread flavors and offering to serve it hot for us, both of them with a big smile. I would deffinately return.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent one week at Excelsior Hotel Gallia in Milano and are leaving today. We have to say that everyone in this hotel, from the General Manager, Marco Olivieri to the complete staff made us feel welcome and at home during the whole stay. They would bring little details to our room everyday, chocolates, cookies ad plenty of water. The room was always perfectly clean with two services each day. Breakfast was a feast every morning, all included in the cost of the room. On the days we came back real tired Room service would be served in less than 25 minutes by a buttler. Last night the Manager sent an exquisite bottle of wine and cheese. Thanks so much, Mr. Olivieri. You have a 5 star staff including yourself! We will not have to look for any other place when we come back to Milano! Arrivederci! Grazie mile!!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great stay at this hotel in January. While it is not very convenient for downtown access (it is a long walk although you can either ask the hotel courtesy limousine to take you and take the metro) it is great if you are going to use the metro or train). Hotel is very luxurious and tastefully decorated. Linens, toiletries, furniture and decor were very elegant and high class. The food in both the restaurant and room service is splendid. The bAr is really cool and hip. Overall a great hotel!!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This really is a flawless hotelThe building and decor are both beautifully designed. The rooms are clean and spacious.The spa is a perfect end to a busy day sightseeing. The spa is huge with a large pool, jacuzzi, steam room and sauna. There is so much attention to detail which left us wanting for nothing. What stood out for me the most was the service. The staff are very attentive and friendly, which made our stay even better. I could not fault this hotel. It was the perfect stay
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: very convenient with many cafes and restaurants around the hotel. The central train station is located across the street. The Dumo is 2 km away (20-25 min walk). At the hotel corner you will find the shuttle bus stop for the Serravalle Designer Outlet (the bus journey takes 1 hr).Room: elegant, decent size in European standards, nicely decorated, the has coffee machine (Nespresso), very clean and well maintained. Room booked was premium room.Facility: well maintained, very clean, elegantly designed. There restaurant and cafe on site. Indoor swimming pool and 24 hr gym is available.Staff: Amazing staff, they will do everything possible to make your stay flawless. They welcome you a big smile and they are very professional. Check in and checkout in no time at all. The concierge services is outstanding.Overall: Great Staff, very good room and facilities, good location (great if you plan to use the train).
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family had an excellent stay at this hotel. They took great care of us during our stay and surprised us with a New Year's Eve treat. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and the hotel is located directly across from the train station. We were able to travel via train for shopping and site-seeing adventures.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this beauty for four days. The service and everything about the experience were AMAZING! I was upgraded to the room with the veranda that has the flags. My experience with the staff to have my clothes ironed, experience at breakfast and dinner on an evening in the restaurant were all superb! The hotel truly lives up to the name of luxury and I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this Hotel as part of a World trip due to its location to the Central Station . First we stayed for 2 nights then went on to Venice by train and returned by train to stay another night.We were able to leave some of our luggage at the Hotel for our return , rather than drag them all to Venice, which was really convenient. The rooms are of reasonable size , but very comfortable beds and luxurious bathroom with great showers.We had breakfast included , which was excellent to say the least.The doorman, Concierge , front desk could not have been more accommodating and helpful , with many having excellent English.We used the Maserati chauffeur service , a free service , several times, which again was an excellent service.Having Grand Central across the street , with the doorman escorting us to the train and our luggage...pricelessA great Hotel and good base for Milan ...highly recommend to all travellers
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel for the 3 nights we stayed here as our room was fantastically luxurious and comfortable. I could live here!! Checkin was very good with 4-5 associates at the counter to assist guests. The room was huge and comfortable with probably the nicest bed in Italy. The amenities such as tea/coffee selection was good as well. The bathroom shower was great with a built in sauna feature. I loved the breakfast with such a huge selection of items buffet style plus ordering eggs as well. What we really liked was the railway station and subway directly across the street which made our experience in Milan so enjoyable...loved the subway. I would stay here again anyway and anytime.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my wife for a weekend. I booked through a discount agency and so wasn't expecting a great room as managed to get a reasonable discount on the rack rate. The room was fine with a nice bathroom. We then had a slight issue with the hot water as it never really got hot in the shower, it was OK but not ideal. I notified the hotel the next morning but on our return it still hadn't been fixed - normally I would automatically rate the Hotel down for not fixing it. However, they upgraded us to an amazing room over looking the square and about double the size of our first room, at this point I thought this is what they should have done. Then room service came with a bottle of Prosecco to apologise for the inconvenience - a good touch.In addition there is an amazing Spa, pool 2 saunas, two steam rooms, ice room, thunder showers etc - it really made the weekend
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the third time we stayed at Gallia and as usual exceeded our expectations. The staff from the Bell Captian to Front desk associates to the restaurant/lounge personnel were full of enthusiasm and willing to go out of their way to please us. The rooms were immaculate and clean. Service from housekeeping was prompt. General Manger Marco and his assistant Kristina went out of their way to make our stay a very pleasant one
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The locaation was good. The staff were excellent. The whole decor was a little weird for my taste. All the chairs were very low and the best place to sit in the room was on the bed. Food was great and service was wonderful.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located next to Milan Central station. Duomo is 30 minutes walking, the hotel offers a free ride with a Maserati to the city center. Breakfast is adequate to a 5 star hotel.Staff is professional.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed here for two nights but loved every minute of it. The location of the hotel was exactly what we needed this trip. We were in Milan just to go to the Serravalle outlet. The outlet shuttle bus stops right outside the hotel, which could not be more perfect. We also were able to take the airport shuttle bus that's located next to the Central Station just next to the hotel. Our room was spacious, modern,well-appointed and very comfortable. The automatic night light was such a thoughtful feature. We had lunch at the restaurant which was simply lovely. I highly recommend this hotel. It will definitely be our top choice in Milan from now on.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family travelled to Milan a few times and had never stayed; we had always stayed in Como and drive down. We were not disappointed and the location is fantastic. The staff is helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet is good but could use more selections. We did enjoyed that we can create our own juices. Overall, great experience.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is absolutely magnificent from the outside. A class act. Sadly, the interior is a bit too dark and modern and really doesn't fit with the majestic exterior.Room spacious but dark. Really dark. But then again, the window was microscopic and the interior colours are a bland sea of grey.The winner for me was the terrace with a great view of the main station and the juice bar at breakfast.Expensive, I feel, all things considered.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently returned from a terrific stay at the Excelsior Gallia hotel on the north side of Milan, kitty-corner to Centrale train station. This hotel was completely refurbished in Grand art Deco style in 2015, and the rooms and suites, including the spacious bathrooms, are very elegant and spacious. The linens are all Frette and extremely soft, especially true oversized bathrobes. All the rooms at the front of the hotel have great views of the Grand Square in front of the hotel and Centrale station. The rooms are also very modern with nice TVs and multiple charging/usb outlets on both sides of the bed. Breakfasts are outstanding. There's also a terrific rooftop bar and restaurant. The bar has a very large outdoor patio overlooking the square, weather permitting. There's also an impressive Spa. Also, the hotel offers complimentary Maserati service to the Duomo/city center. Conference and staff service is also extremely attentive.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I adore this hotel & would recommend it to anyone. We stayed there on the front end and back end of our Italy adventure. The rooms are gorgeous. Breakfast is amazing. The beds are unbelievably comfortable (to me). Love the lounge! Nice wine. It is right across the street from the train station, which made the location perfect for us. They will take you to the Duomo / Shopping area via "The Maserati" .. well, that was spectacular!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don’t usually write reviews but this hotel deserves one. All aspects of the hotel are great. The staff is always polite, great interior and the rooms are modern, great spa. 5*. The hotel is located opposite the Centrale station which makes it easy to get to.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I just spent 5 days at the Excelsior. Everything at the hotel was wonderful. The room was large with plenty of storage. The beds comfortable with lush bedding. Bathroom was also large and immaculate. Our room was also very quiet. Could not have been better.The front desk staff was fabulous--great concierge service and always a lot of staff on duty, so never a wait. And our room service was prompt and served with a smile.We took a few day trips from the train station, so the location could not be better. It is literally a two minute walk from the station to the front door of the hotel. We wanted a location where we felt safe walking home from the train late at night and this hotel was perfect for our travels.And finally we loved the fleet of Maseratis available to take guests to and from the Duomo area. What could be more fun than being chauffeured around in a Maserati?
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 days in Milan recently and stayed at the Excelsior. We could not have loved a hotel more. The staff from every corner of the hotel were exceptional - they presented with a friendly smile and went out of their way to assist us. The room was comfortable and elegant, with every amenity. Breakfast was a delight, nothing short of that! The location of the hotel is so convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone spending time in Milan. Wonderful Hotel!!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow! I am beyond happy I found this hotel in Milan. I hosted a three day retreat for my clients in their Montenapoleon room and also stayed there for 5 days and it was truly a glittering reflection of Milan. My room was on the top floor and ultra modern and beautiful with great amenities. The entire property is beautiful, modern and very well kept. The service is amazing and efficient. There are no irons in the rooms but housekeeping does a stellar job ironing two pieces a day free. The restaurants are also great with breakfast and apertivo in the evenings. I also loved that they have the house car, a Maserati which takes you to the center of the city and picks you up. Plus great perks with partner stores. The concierge go above and beyond and overall, this hotel was a great experience. My event was a success and everything was top of the line. My clients were impressed and that made me totally thrilled. I highly recommend you book this hotel now because the price is worth it!!! It's in a great location in Milan and close to the Duomo area.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying at Gallia since 2007, the hotel went through a major refurbishment and yet again it came out on top as one of the finest and best hotels of Milan. Professionalism, excellence of service, fine dining, caring stuff and above all: awesome bedrooms. You can’t say you’ve been in Milan if you haven’t slept here. From the hotel director to the bartender, everyone really cares for all the guests and as the original motto of Starwood used to say: you belong! Will never stop recommending this hotel to anyone and everyone. Must try: the bar’s terrace, the wine cellar and obviously the brand new spa!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a short visit for me but i was impressed. The reception staff always helpful and attentive, the housekeeping without mistakes and the f&b of high performance. Probably the best hotel in town.P.S. a small recommendation: telephone should be picked up when ringing in guest services.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent one night in Milan and chose this beautifully rennovated hotel. We were so pleased with everything about it especially the rooftop bar and restaurant where we enjoyed a gorgeous sunset and beautiful views of the central train station and square. Very good location and the hotels car can take you anywhere within reason!! We chose the popular shopping street. Our upgraded room was gorgeous and huge!!!
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The luxury is felt everywhere in this hotel (except for the bathroom amenities, which could have been up-scaled, and the quality/variety of coffee options for the in-room coffee machine).Breakfast was the best I ever had, and even the room-service food was extremely good.Room was perfectly dark, with no light entering in the morning, and also perfectly quiet, with no sound coming in from the street.My two minor issues were - (a) the radio did not work; and (b) on check-in the room was not available, and the receptionist took my phone number to inform me once the room is available, but I received no such call.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel with great amenities and ambience. The rooms are spotless, staff are extremely helpful, steam and jacuzzi are great. Rooftop restaurant is brilliant with great views and drinks. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at Hotel Excelsior Gallia, and it was very impressive! Actually we visited the property quite long ago before its renovation, so this is our second time, to celebrate our anniversary. The location of the property is great, very convenient by walk (and next to the metro), and close to almost all major spots. We took the complimentary Maserati for a couple times, both drivers were very friendly and polite!The Concierge team of the hotel was expecially helpful, ie we were successfully booked at Michelin starred Seta and Vun, as well as Nobu with short notice. The Suite we got was also fantastic, with an excellent view, and the housekeeping lady was really nice and responsive (as I bumped into her once during the day)During the stay, I received a couple personal notes from Marco, the GM who welcomes us with warmest hospitality!! The experience overall was fatanstic, and I highly recommend this property to couples or families who would like to spend a relaxing yet fulfilling vacation in Milan!Sophia
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed a the hotel between Oct. 1-4, 2018. This was my first stay at the hotel although my family stayed here last year. Milan was our last stop in our 12 day Northern Italian trip that started from Turin and covered most of Piedmont and Lombardy regions. We stayed at highly rated hotels that were 3 times more expensive than this hotel but I was most pleased by the facility of Excelsior Gallia and the most impressed by their quality service that was present from the time we stepped into the hotel.Our room was upgraded and the view from the veranda was breathtaking. Breakfast was excellent and the pool, sauna and steam facility was probably one of the best in Italy. The restaurant was somewhat pricey but the quality of food and service was also a top notch. The location was very central and walk to the Central Train Station that can be connected to all over Milan and the rest of Italy was definitely a huge plus.We come to Milan at least annually and we will stay here again for sure.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So happy to return to the Excelsior Gallia in the Milan. We stayed here for 3 nights September 10-13. This was not our first stay (see previous review). When we found ourselves returning to Milan, the choice was easy. Unfortunately, this stay did not live up to its 5 STAR reputation. I booked an Excelsior room months in advance; I’m also a Marriott Platinum Premier Elite member. SPG and Marriott finally integrated to one system early August. My accounts were linked/merged, and my reservation showed up in my app under my Marriott Rewards #. The first indication something wasn’t right is when we checked in. While I was promptly greeted, I was not recognized for my Platinum Status, no upgrade offered, and the agent was quick to point out that breakfast was not included in the rate. I mentioned that I was a Platinum member and wanted daily breakfast as my amenity. I was told that my status was not showing on the reservation. Once he entered my number, my status was recognized and was handed a voucher to show at breakfast. He was also quick to point out that perhaps my rewards number dropped off due to the systems integration. I asked that now he had my correct status if any upgrades were available, I was told no. Not a very good customer experience.We were in room 414. A nice room, just like the excelsior room we had prior minus a small patio. There was a beautiful cake on a silver platter for our anniversary. This was a very nice gesture and greatly appreciated. Things went downhill or downstream the next morning. In less than 5 minutes in the shower, the shower water had flooded halfway through the bathroom. I was able to pop the filter off the drain and guide the water with my foot towards it, but it was backed up. The smell was terrible. It smelled like something foul was in there. I quickly finished and grabbed every towel – all beyond saturated with water. I quickly called to report the problem and ask for more towels. Maintenance came and said they needed to pour some acid down the drain and that would take care of it. The smell was overpowering, but we elected to have him do it in hopes my husband could shower. After waiting 20 plus minutes, my husband went in the shower. Same thing. It was not fixed.Prior to leaving for our day, we spoke to Chiara (sorry for misspelling) at the front desk to report the issue. She was very apologetic and professional. She told us she would get on it right away and give us an update later in the day. Later that afternoon, Chiara called and said they are not able to fix it, and the room was not operable. She said she had the Signature Suite available for us when we returned for our last 2 nights.Chiara walked us up to personally check us in the room.The Signature Suite located on the 5th floor is beautiful. Living room, sitting chairs, separate bedroom, his and her closets, makeup area separate from bathroom, one large bathroom and a smaller one in the hallway. Two separate Patios – one off the bedroom, one off the living room. The first night, I decided to have a bath. The first 10-15 seconds of turning on the faucet, the water was a light brown/rust color. The bathroom also has a musty smell. Our last night, I was awakened by a loud noise that came from the bathroom. In the morning, I was greeted by a puddle of dirty water on the floor and the vent from the Ceiling was on the floor. It had fallen from the wall with a surge of water. We couldn’t believe it. 2 rooms, similar experiences.Facilities were great as last time. This is why we returned. I would also like to recognize Marcello in the breakfast room. We enjoyed seeing him again on this visit. He is a true professional and all about the customer experience. Sorry Excelsior, Love the property, but this was not a good customer experience. In fact – I never heard from any member from management regarding the issues and the inconveniences we experienced. How could a guest be checked into a room where the bathroom was inoperable? Surely this was not a new issue, with a backup this severe, there had to have been some prior reports. We do look forward to a future stay and hopefully more of a 5 Star experience.
hotelName:
13    Excelsior Hotel Gallia, a Luxury Collection Ho...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While this hotel is not centrally located, it is on a bus line and not terribly far from the Mico convention centre. Truly however, what stands out is that the rooms and bathrooms are very large - especially by European standards, well-appointed and very clean. The staff was amazing and helpful at every turn. They booked tours, printed copies and went out of their way. The hotel also had lots of nice touches like snacks at all hours and a variety of ammenities.Highly recommended for the business traveler.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me, my mother and sister decided to go to Milan for a short break. After looking at a number of outrageously priced hotels for a 2 night stay, we settled on Milan Suite Hotel. We arrived late and as there is no restaurant on the premises, we decided to Deliveroo some dinner to the hotel. The rooms are big in size, clean and well equipped. Although located just outside of Milan, getting into the centre is not a problem and the lady on reception helped us to sort out a 24 hour ticket which was able to be used on all transport throughout Milan centre (you can purchase this at the front desk and is definitely worth purchasing). Be aware that these buses can be very busy during peak periods. We opted for the breakfast included option, which was lovely. I would definitely recommend as it is great value for money. There is a lot of selection from smoked salmon to a pancake making machine!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a second choice (not in preferred location), due to the first choice being fully booked. However, it was a blessing in disguise. As this hotel was a similar price, but the room was far larger and very well presented. Staff were very helpful and dressed smart. Breakfast was OK, food was good. But, the seating could be more comfortable and I was sat in a high traffic area, which wasn’t so good. Overall the experience I had for the one night I stayed was pleasant and the next time I am in Milan, I will book this hotel again. I will just make sure I chose a better table for breakfast. Hope you find this review helpful?
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is very attentive, the location is comfortable, the room is spacious. The breakfast is great for any taste and diet, there are plenty of choices. Thank you very much for fast and quality cleaning. I'll book again when I have an opportunity.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay for a base to explore Milan. Staff were excellent. Very clean, smart hotel and huge room and en-suite. Bus into town was right outside the hotel. A little more of a challenge to find the correct bus stop to get back again so take a photo of the bus map when using the metro.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Milan Suites Hotel for a few days in December and I left a great review then. We've just returned for a full week and, my goodness, it did not disappoint. The standard is fantastic, I would say over and above 4 star.Staff are wonderful,so pleasant and helpful. The room is large, very comfortable and cleaned every day. There are bar snacks,sweets and soft drinks available in the reception/bar area all day. The breakfast selection is quite amazing.The location is lovely and quiet and although around 25 minutes into the centre (on public transport) there is a bus service running every 5 minutes during the day - even over the entire Easter holiday - and also trams.As you can probably guess we had a marvellous time.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As other reviewers have noted the hotel is very modern, the rooms are very spacious, the staff very friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet has an incredible variety of food. All very positive. One thing to be aware of is that the hotel is a fair way from the city centre. It is also 20 minutes walk from the train station which links to the airport. This is a business neighbourhood which means not many people around at nighttime. It was strongly suggested to me by a local that when I arrived late at night I should get off at the next station and pay for a taxi from there to hotel as there would be no taxis at the Bovisa station and it would be very unsafe to walk. I did get off at Bovisa but he was correct there were no taxis. The hotel is quite hard to find from the station and so I would not have wanted to walk even if it appeared safe. I ended up ringing the hotel and getting the number of a local taxi company so I could order a taxi. I would strongly recommend that if you are arriving at night contacting the hotel in advance to get the taxi details. There is a smaller station about 10 minutes walk from the hotel to get into the city or there is a bus from across from the hotel which will take you a few train stops away from the Duomo. Another thing to keep in mind is that while it is a developing area there currently is very little in the way of restaurants etc close to the hotel (I saw 2). Given all of the other positives I would recommend it for a stay of a few nights but any longer and I’d suggest staying closer to the centre.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here last week for one night on route from lake Como to Copenhagen. It took a while to find the hotel from the local station but it was worth it as the girls who checked us in offered water and calmness. As it was cold and wet we ate at the nearby Raddisson hotel which was very good. The Milan suite room was big and had the best bathroom I’ve seen in a long time. Room was quiet and comfortable with a great bed and sitting area. Breakfast was good but the best part of this hotel was the service and care of the girls on the desk. I’d recommend it as an alternative to the expensive hotels in the city.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this as we didn’t want to be right in the city centre and we were not dissatisfied, it was lovely and the little touches like the 24/7 snacks in the lobby, the honey at breakfast direct from a beehive, freshly made pancakes, fresh orange juice and the staff cannot do enough for you, would highly recommend this as you can get a bus (57) across the toad which takes you right into the city centre for €1.50 single or €4.50 for 24 hours, travel around Milan is so easy. We went for 3 nights but could have easily done 2 more, we shall be back.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5 stars to this hotel and staff specially IRENE and MARK. 100% satisfied with the service and hospitality. Thank You so much IRENE and MARK for the amazing time I had during my stay. Just 15 mins from city centre.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff is professional and both check-in and check-out were very easy and fast. Rooms are very clean and very spacious especially by European standards. Breakfast buffet is rich and tasty. If you are traveling around Milan and vicinity, this hotel is very well located due to its proximity to highway exits while you re still in the city. However, main Milan attractions are still not walkable, you need to use public transport or taxi to reach City Center. For business visits this is a very convenient hotel.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its an only Suite Hotel. Located a bit outside the City Centre but a classy place to stay in The Junior Suite is 40 sq.meters with a big Patio attached. Its also excellent value for money. The staff are extremely helpful and accomadating.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, good rooms, clean bedding, excellent polite front desk staff. Adequate breakfast & easy check out. This hotel ticks all the boxes for a stay in Milan, no problems here at all. Highly Recommended.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is good, staffs was great & service was really nice. The room was really beautiful & have a lot of space. The welcome drink & snacks was served all day (please correct me if I was wrong). Staffs was really helpful. The hotel is a bit far from downtown (20 mins) by taxi but other things else just great!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in a questionable neighbourhood. Would rather pay more next time and be in a better more salubrious location. Nice room, cool decor inside hotel, rock hard bed. Good staff. Wouldn’t stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in the Milan Suite on numerous occasions and have always enjoyed the experience. The hotel is nice and modern with friendly staff, very reasonably priced room service and large rooms. There is a bus stop just across the road where you can get the number 57 into Milan for €2 this service runs every 20/mins or so and tickets can be bought in hotel reception.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Step inside and admire the wonderful decor and class of this hotel, the staff are friendly and polite and are a credit to the Hotel.A truly inspiring break, this hotel has huge spacious rooms, large TVs and a great restraunt to boot. The ease in which both Malpensa and Linate airports are just over 30 minutes away by car add to its charm. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent a week here for my birthday and the hotel is beautiful!!! I don't think I have ever stayed in a hotel where the rooms are that large. Everything was spacious, modern and so comforting. Bathroom had both a shower and separate tub that was perfect! The junior suite we had on the 2nd floor also included a patio that is the cutest thing for coffee in the morning. Yes there's a coffee pot and a huge selection of flavors to choose from. Bed was like heaven after long days of exploring Italy and housekeeping was like a dream. We left money and expensive things out everyday, not one thing taken. We actually came back to our valuables stacked neatly!! As many pros as there are to love about this property the one thing that I can say that needs improvement is the breakfast selection. It was pretty bland and even though it was included in our room rate, some mornings we didn't bother to go down. That and the hotel being a bit away from the main heart of the city (bus stop right in front of hotel though!) would be my only complaints. Property is def a gem and I would highly recommend!!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this Boutique for 3 nights and i did not have anything to complain about. I occupied one of ground floor rooms known as Naked Rooms. Hi-tech operations in the rooms and beautiful decor. Balcony was in a quiet setting.Hotel is far from the city but in a quiet area if you are looking for such.Friendly and very helpful staff delicious breakfast and fast internet.Nothing to complain about whatsoever.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well maintained hotel.Spacious bath room & spacious bedroom.Feel good in Long & big bathtubs.High ceiling with elegant look.Nice deco and serene.About 15-20 minutes to Milan centre.Suits self drive Travellers.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with our two girls 4 and 7. They organised a lovely baby sitter and close to expo so we could go to pearl jam IDay concert. They even had specials for events. Great responses prompt very helpful. Lovely room family suite 70 sq m. 20 mins from city but still great and close to train and bus. Would recommend this place !!! Great stay in milan . Good breakfast too.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay with my wife & son during our summer holidays. The room was very spacious and comes with a big Samsung flat screen TV. The staff were very friendly, especially Domy at the reception. She helped us to pay online a municipal driving fine that we received in Bologna. The only minus point is that the hotel is not near to town centre but you can still take a bus ride which is half an hour away.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good Hotel with testy and verity of Breakfast, although it was a short business trip i am impressed with their hospitality. Rooms are Good. Tiles flooring of Corridor makes noise when someone carrying their luggage.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice near train station (8 minutes walk) nice serivice and very helpfool,very comfortable room with kitchen annex, big tv set and clean bathroom and big big bad, all day water and snacks, perfect breakfast
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling Italy and choose this hotel for our 2 day stop in milan. Picked it because we wanted a little bit of luxury on our tour so had high expectations but the room still managed to exceed them all (hydro massage and private garden room). The staff were fantastic, the room was just perfect and the fancy shower was wow. Loved it that much that we didn’t even bother with the sightseeing too much and just spent most of our time relaxing. Only downfall is that it is out the way of everything but the metro and trains make it easy enough to get from the hotel to the center. Overall had a great experience
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An amazing hotel with wonderful staff, rooms and facilities!The hotel provides complimentary wireless internet hotspots that you can utilize whilst roaming around Milan.Although not in the city center, 20 euro will get you to about anywhere you want to go in a taxi & if you’re adventurous the bus costs 4 euro and you’ll be there in 25 minutes.Although the hotel doesn’t have a restaraunt dinner facilities (it does but the food is kept frozen) they advised us of the Radison Blu around the corner that had a beautiful dinner. And within 5 minutes walk is a supermarket for snacks and water and everything else you need.The rooms are spacious and modern, and a special mention to Irene who helped us on our trip she was very polite & helpful before we got to the hotel and even more so once we arrived.We will be back again — Grazie!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night at the Milan Suites Hotel in April 2018. It is a sensational hotel, well located on a bus route to Milan city center and at an affordable price. We enjoyed our stay very much. Friendly helpful staff, very nice breakfast. We would return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone wanting a clean, luxurious and affordable hotel within easy reach to Milan’s city center.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Milan Suites was the perfect place for a nice weekend in Milan. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. When we needed a cab they had it there in 5 minutes. I have celiac diesease and require gluten free food. They offered gluten free options at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Opt for the breakfast in the morning, it was quite generous with its portions. The rooms were beautiful, comfortable and spacious. The separate shower and bathtub was a nice touch too.  We went to the AC Milan futbol game, the hotel is only about a 15 minute taxi ride there and we took an Uber back. All around perfect hotel and great value!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb... from the welcome we received when stepping into the reception for the first time to the sincere send off when we eventually had to leave.The staff are excellent, helpful, sincere and friendly and provided brilliant advice. Our room was extremely well equipped, spacious and luxurious. Whilst we didn't eat here the breakfast looked to have an extensive choice of foods.The best touch was reserved for my wife who was having her birthday during our stay. We had some special items sent up to our room on the day and that was only on the back of a chance remark I had made the night before about it. Having stayed in many hotels around the.world over the years this.goes straight into the top 3, it's that good. Oh, and if you are concerned about where it is in relation to the centre of Milan, that should be seen as a good thing as you are really getting value for money and the travel connections of bus, tram or train mean you are really only 20 to 25 minutes away from Via Dante (for the Duomo) or the castle and travel is so cheap too it makes little difference, at least it didn't for us.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Milan Suite Hotel is great! Upon booking, I requested for a quiet and highest possible room - they granted my request. I also got some souvenirs and complimentary wine on the first day. The staffs were all friendly and accommodating. the room and bathroom were clean and spacious. I ordered spaghetti with tomato sauce and basil, i love it! The location is quite far from the city but it only costed me 15 € from Central terminal station to the hotel. I will definitely come back.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a weekend in Milan - have to say the Milan Suite Hotel was great.Rooms are very large & clean, comfortable beds, big bathroom especially for a hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful.You are located a little outside the main city centre - however the 57 Bus and 24hr travel tickets are a money saver (€4.80) valid on train, tram, bus.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is not that appealing. The nearest railway station was largely deserted and not easy to find. There is also not much in terms of restaurants and bars in the area, although you can take a tram direct into the city centre, I suppose if you wanted to eat out. However, the room was a pleasant surprise - large, modern and equipped with a large screen tv and fancy Lavassa cofffee machine. The staff were also very friendly and welcoming which made up for the location.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great rooms. Quality beds. Extremely quiet. Wifi is excellent everywhere. VERY friendly staff and a tremendous breakfast. Ask the front to request a taxi if you need it and they are there in less than five minutes.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My choice of hotel for staying in Milano for 8 days was a really good one I using very long time everytime for where to stay but this time I was taking into me what other guest have saying on trip advisor and other internet pages.I had a kind of contact with hotel before travelling and they was so professional that I after the first mail contact in the answering understood I have done a good deal.They answer all question I had so it was easier for me to know things around my holiday. No question was stupid.Hotel is located not in the center of town but its not so bad. From the most popular tourist things then You most expect around 30 minutes every way with bus 57. Then I speak about centrum of town if I can call it that. You can also stop before in the way to town at metro station Domodossola/Gerussalem. And then take metro in that direction You want. Its 5 metro lines in the town. Or You can of course take taxi i didnt do that I heard price was then around 20-25 euro.When I come to Milano from Malpensa I took train to Bovisa Nord station. Its took around 35 minutes and have the cost 13 euro. Then You can take taxi to hotel this 1,6 km or walk if You have good memory for streets that i did. Walked to the hotel and when I went home I took taxi.That was about transport system.This should be about the hotel.The people in reception is so nice some of the nicest people I ever have meeting under my travels so far 27 country. Nothing is a problem for them to answer and fix.Room was nice and very big after my meaning. It was around 45 kvadrat. The bathroom is big and had seperated shower and bath tub. Leaving room had very big television with many tv channels I only looked at some sports channel some few days.Shower and bath tub is lovely.Its 2 table with chair on both if You are there and want to work on computer.Its sitting group with sofa and 2 chairs and table for relaxing.You can make yourself tea or coffee there was different types of both.My room had a micro wave.The Wi-fi was super fast all 8 days all over the hotel area.There are breakfast possibilities at hotel I didnt eat that but seeing it when I passed out every day its look good. I eating a late dinner there they have some few chooses for small dinners.Hotel are selling transport tickets for 1,5 hour and 24 hours. Then You can use metro-bus and train in the center sone.You can hear the traffic if You are sensitiv for noise but it didnt affect my stay there I had something in my ears.Mini bar have different to drink but not much alcohol that not was a problem for me.Like You have understood I write a lot and before its too long I will stop there.I recommend this hotel from all parts of my heart.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel didn't look much from the outside and kind of seems in the middle of no where but it is actually a hidden gem. In terms of location, there is a bus stop right outside the hotel that will take you into the city centre in about 25 minutes - so not too bad! The hotel had a luxury feel to it, even though the price was not particularly expensive (in comparison to the rest of Milan). The room and bathroom were huge with big comfy bed, separate bath and walk in shower. There is a list of amenities in the bathroom from toothbrushes to razors that you can ask for (all complimentary) and there is a lovely selection of toiletries in the room. It was my birthday whilst I stayed there and the cleaners, noticing my cards up on the desk, left a bottle of red wine and a packet of milanese risotto in the room for our return - an excellent touch! Overall an amazing hotel, would definitely stay here again if I visited Milan.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very good. Large and confortable Room, with a big bed, TV, microowen, coffee machine. The WC is complete and so big. The worst thing is the room entrance is in a type of balcony, so in the Winter is very cold.The breakfast has a variety of breads, croissants, fruits, beverages and also eggs and pancakes.But the location is awful, far from the citycenter and no metro station in a Walk distance. Only a bus, but take 45m to Center.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have a humongous suite (more than 1000 sq. feet) ont the third floor #3107. All modern amenities. Huge curved television. USB plug in the wall etc. Attentive reception, nice breakfast very nice and charming staff. Good and affordable secure underneath at affordable price. Nice with babies.Well located. What a good surprise!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was lovely. Spacious room and a bathroom with both shower and a huge bathtub, very comfy bed and a balcony which was perfect for a morning coffee. The hotel was located about 20min on the bus from Duomo (number 57 which was just on the opposite of the entrance). Also about 10min walk from the train station with easy links to the Central Station (one change at Garibaldi). The tickets were available to buy at the reception. The staff in a hotel was very informative, friendly, professional and helpful especially lovely Irene who went an extra mile for us every time. She even helped us to plan a trip to Lake Como. Thank you once again for everything! ❤️ I can’t recommend this hotel enough and I’m sure we’ll be back again.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night and wish it could have been longer! This hotel offers beautiful, spacious rooms with large balconies. The room felt more like a large master suite than an average hotel room. The bed was very comfortable, there was a living room area with a large TV and a spacious, luxurious bathroom with both a shower and bathtub. The staff was incredibly friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The location of the hotel did not seem to be ideal as it is about 25 minutes from downtown and didn't seem to be in a very good area, but I think its an even trade when you consider how nice the hotel is and also how inexpensive. Definitely recommend staying here!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was extremely helpful and the room size, condition, and location was convenient. Right off a bus line that was easy to reach downtown Milan. Take a taxi to hotel from airport. Train not convenient. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we were booking we had a hard time finding a good value in a good hotel in Milan -- clearly the season was still busy even at the end of September. We were not sure about this place as it seemed to be in a strange area, away from the center of the city. Well, it IS in a strange area -- a bit ugly and sterile, but it didn't seem unsafe. A few other hotels are in the area, too. The street did not look promising to find nice restaurants either (with only cheap pizza joints and asian takeaways nearby). But the excellent front desk informed us of two outstanding places within walking distance -- although both fill up, so make reservations.The location isn't on any useful subway or tram/trolly line, either. The only option is a somewhat slow bus that takes half an hour to get to the Duomo.As for the hotel itself -- its mostly great news. Our junior suite was huge, the bed was nice and the bathroom alone could accommodate a refugee family of four! Front desk service was outstanding. The place is very stylish and an excellent value at this price point. Our only quibble was that €12 each for a continental breakfast seemed a bit steep.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed one night but wish we had booked a longer stay. On arrival the staff were friendly, helpful and very knowledgable. The junior suite we stayed in was excellent and superb value. Transport links are reasonably good with a train station within 10 minutes walk
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely spacious hotel room. I was really impressed upon opening the room door and then again when I saw the size of the bathroom! Everything was really clean and inviting. The staff were really friendly and welcoming too. The bus stop was right outside the hotel which took you straight into the centre of Milan. A fabulous base for our 4 day city break.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 2 dogs. The location is not the most convenient if you don’t have a car, but we did so it was alright. The hotel is very beautiful and we really liked it. The room was quite spacious for European standard. Breakfast was quite nice with good selection of food. Staff were very friendly. We would definitely stay there again next time we visit Milan, if we can get a good deal like last time :)
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean hotel overall, very spacious and comfortable stay however we had two single beds, my sheets or quilt cover had a slight smell which was unpleasant, have asked for the sheets to be changed however not sure if this was done as the second and third night I could still smell it :/ Staff were helpful and friendly. it's a bit far from the city, distance from the city centre is 25-30 mins bus ride, bus stop is right infront of the hotel and comes every 15 mins so that's good.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Smooth, super clean and cool (temperature) hotel with lovely, efficient and great staff who sent milk up within two minutes of asking and ordered a taxi at check out all within a minute - very very professional. The hotel itself is a bit soul less but it's stylish and the rooms are fantastic value for money with high ceilings. We stayed in the family suite, it's huge with a dining table for eight people and several sofas. All in all a really wonderful place for a few nights in Milan.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel for 2 weeks as part of our anniversary. On first impression the hotel and the staff are wonderful. Check in was from 2pm onwards, however we arrived early at 12, the staff were kind enough to hold on to our bags while we explored the area. Room 1114 was large, comfortable and was generally in good condition. After spending 2 weeks in the hotel we noticed a lot of things that are in need of some maintenance. The room. The carpet in the room really needed replacing, we saw in other rooms that had been done so one can only assume that they will get around to it. The room also needed a paint, you can see a lot of marks on the walls. They had a large Samsung TV in the room, with lots of channels however not many in English. I think it was only 2. So an area for some improvement. On the plus side, we could use the mini fridge to store our drinks at no charge. We also had a balcony which was nice.Breakfast was the best bit, they have a lovely selection and service was good. They do have a 'games room', but it more like a small section on the first floor. Only problem is they only have one controller, it's not worth playing on your only! Very small number of games.Room service was below average for a hotel of this size. We ordered in room service twice and then we find out that what we ordered was just frozen food heated up. Some major improvements are needed in this area. I would recommend not getting anything from room service, just walk across the street and you can get food from the lovely restaurant at half the price and cooked fresh in front of you.Room cleaning was excellent. They were thorough and each time. Make sure you use the cards outside to indicate that the rooms need doing.Two things that really went wrong at the hotel. Both are lack of communication from the hotel. There was a power failure when a lightning bolt hit the hotel. At first no one knew what had happened, all the lights went. At that stage all doors access failed, so no one could get in to the rooms. Luckily for us we were already in the room, but for others it was a different story. Went down to reception to see what was going on and the staff were struggling to find the backup keys to all the rooms. Alot of confusion on the whole, could be handled much better if the staff were communicating better.And finally on checking out. Our flight was at 6pm, so we thought we would leave our bags at reception and then come back at 3pm when our taxi would arrive. But to our surprise the hotel said they couldn't do that as they are closing for a summer break. At no stage did the hotel inform us that they would close at 12pm on our checkout date. This left us dragging our bags around in 36 degree heat. Luckily the Radisson Blu, which is around the corner, saved us, they held on to our bags so that we could get some lunch and wait for the taxi. Pretty poor for a 5 star hotel.Overall. Decent hotel, but requires improvement. Certainly not a 4/5 star. It would be more closer to a 3.5 star. Staff need to communicate better on arrival and inform guest of any potential problems.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner always says I have high standards when it comes to where we stay and this hotel didn't disappoint. The room was lovely and spacious and we are now planning on having a bathroom just like the one here! Bath was huge and really powerful shower. Bed was really comfy too!Staff friendly and welcoming and couldn't do enough to help and offer advice. As mentioned, TV channels very limited but we didn't go to Milan to watch TV so this wasn't an issue. The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars was due to the location. The bus stop is just outside and takes around 25 minutes to central Milan which is fine. The area isn't the nicest, although we didn't encounter any problems this is the only reason why we wouldn't return. There were a couple of restaurants, takeaway places and a supermarket within 5 minutes walk thought which is handy.Thanks to Milan Suite Hotel for a lovely stay!
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights. Room was great: can't say anymore. Would have been better if the tv worked properly though. Very limited channels despite advertising over 60. Reported but nothing was done. Allowed us a late check-out, which was great. However, most annoyingly, the hotel took money in advance despite emailing to say payment was due at hotel. Why was this a problem? Because I reserved (not paid) on a UK website. Even Booking.com emailed to say payment was on arrival. I have a card that doesn't cost overseas and I was going to pay in the hotel with that, not incurring fees for payment in Euros as I did. When I asked the hotel why they did this, they said it was in case of no-shows. But why did they take it 2 days before I arrived? The Chinese receptionist was very aggressive and was not listening at all when I was trying to explain what they had done. This spoiled what would have been a decent stay.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel shows the others how to do it. From the friendly welcome to the even more welcome cold mint and lemon water with a small snack selection (free) just round the corner from the reception desk,to the well designed walk way to the room everything raises your hopes you will be in a nice room. Nice doesn't do it justice-it's spacious, bright and has the largest bathroom with an enormous bath and separate (again large ) shower, Everything was spotless. Too many other good points to mention here ,go and be 'wowed'Lastly the most perfect receptionist IRENNA (not sure of the spelling) so helpful ,so friendly, she made a great stay into an exceptional one.PS Try the little café opposite for a sensational pizza.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel does all the basics really well. Excellent, friendly and helpful reception, spacious, spotless rooms with super showers and delicious fresh buffet breakfast. We used the hotel car park which was next to reception and cost 15€ a night. Buses right outside took us into the centre of Milan and there were very good restaurants nearby. If you want a quiet hotel which is excellent value this is highly recommended.
hotelName:
14    Milan Suite Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my husband, 2 sons and mother in law. We loved our stay. The only con is the distance from Milan, but there is a nearby bus that takes you there (about 30 min ride and buses were quite crowded).The rooms are very clean and inviting and the staff are happy to bring up whatever you need(iron, ice).
