Apparently a new subway stop is being built which will eventually be to the hotel's advantage, but at the moment, the site is loud and disturbing and makes reaching the hotel a challenge. The view from our terrace was a huge hydraulic crane teetering too close for comfort.8. There was no information about the hotel's own amenities in the room, nor a pencil or pad.9. The gym is reached via the main elevators and then a stroll through the whole lobby down more stairs which was somewhat odd.10. Close to a wonderful array of restaurants, cafés, duomo attractions, subway and busses and shopping galore.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a couple of days. The rooms were clean, and modern. Front desk was extremely polite, professional and very helpful. Hotel is within walking distance if most landmarks in Milan. Parking is offered in the hotel for 35 euro per night. On the other hand, hotel offers free wifi. Special thanks to Alfredo for making the stay memorable.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Typical NH hotel with modern facilities.Good sized bedroom and ensuiteCentral location where most historical sites are within walking distance as are the many designer shops.Ridiculous 30 Eur charge for breakfast shows that this hotel is probably mainly for business customers on expenses.There are plenty of places around the Duomo where a variety of better value breakfasts can be obtained.We ate in the restaurant one night and were very pleased. High quality food at highish prices but decent value.Good service although the restaurant was very quiet considering how busy the hotel was.Would definately consider staying here again if in Milan
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, yet there’s a huge pit with metro works right in front of the hotel and this will last a very long time.Rooms are ok, nothing special.Service is poor: staff is uncaring and not helpful. Some even sport a bad attitude when you ask questions.Loo flush water was broken and noisy; shower was stuck, you cannot even properly close the door as there’s a bidet in a very small bathroom. One of the lift was faulty and my key card never worked properly.I had to pay with points but they make lots of excuses and I had to pay whichever difference there was, truly they mistake. Surely I won’t go back.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lost my laptop bag at the hotel during checkin and the hotel did not even bother or show any concern. Even a review of the hotel camera was not possible. I would not recommend it.Did not take the hotel breakfast, found better options at a grocery store nearby and brought some cereal packs with me and it was more comfortable.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was very big and very well refined, clean with a lovely shower and bath. The service was great from reception who brought us to our room to the staff serving breakfast, where the quality was really good and the choice was very broad. Strategic position, walking distance to the closest underground station and the city centre.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed the staying at NH Collection Milano President for 3 days. Nice breakfast, friendly staffs from the information desk and the guest department, they are very helpful when we needed. Am expecting to stay next visit to Milan.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly placed between Duomo and Via Montenapoleone. The rooms are spotless and newly renovated. Breakfasts are superb. Service so quick that your eggs and coffee are served 2 minutes after ordering! Well done Kerlly! Good value for money!
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location in the heart of Milan city, at a walking distance of to the best places to see and shopping. It has a very helpful staff, an excellent bedroom and breakfast. My husband and I had a very good stay there.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this online through the NH hotels website at circa 800 euros per room per night ( 2 executive rooms with king beds)Mixed reviews The good -Great location next to Duomo Breakfast is nice ( except for the DJ)Hotel is modern Nice staffThe bad The king beds are two single beds pushed together held with a double bedsheet - this is completely unacceptable when after first night we requested king mattresses they said they don’t have any.The mattresses are probably the worst I have ever slept on in any hotel in the world! I have the worst pain in my back and have called a Chairopracter to attend my house as soon as I land in london.The bedding ( pillows and bedcovers etc) are not 5 star standards - they are very poor quality and 3 star standard at best With bedding and mattresses I had very very poor sleep over 5 days - this is after walking 8-10 km a day at salone del mobili.Over all I liked the hotel and location but mattresses and bedding need to urgently be addressed.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the room with a view and balcony. It's a bit noisy, you can hear the sound of the tram especially when the door is open.We couldn't turn on the aircondition bcz it will be cold and without it, it's hot so we opened the balcony door.The breakfast buffet was delicious, staff are very professional and the facilities are very clean.The lady in the customer relations in the lobby was very very helpful.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I used to stay in nh collection hotel in every visit to milano. For me i feel that it is like my home, they are so kind and welcomed, good service and also the location of the hotel. I recomed every one to try this hotel
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: everthing was absolutly perfect apart from the ventilation in the room. EXTREMLY noicy.I am travelling and stay at hotels three to four nights a week and done this for years.Never experienced noice like that before.Room 314
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks for making my stay special at arrival Grace, where we were greeted with a surprise gift voucher! The room was very comfortable, bathroom was amazing, every staff were friendly, breakfast was amazing. Victoria on guest relations side really helped us book our train tickets, special thanks to her. Mido helped us arrange taxis and suggested places to go. And finally after having to leave we requested a late checkout and Mr Alfredo helped us get an extended 2 hours. Once again special thanks to you all and hope to see you again! I would highly recommend this to all my friends and looking forward to come back as soon as possible!
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing night near Quadrilatero della moda,San Babila,Via Manzoni,...5 minutes by foot to Montenapoleone...It was amazing: I Love Milano and the hotel was so hot and amazing but the quotation is not high like others luxury hotels near this one
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the heart of Milan and very well connected with public transportation.The staff is very kind and full of tips in particular for foreign people.Food quality and quantity is good and the chef is always available to prepare any “on the side dish” for particular requests.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i stayed on my Nh hotel amazing location amazing staff at reception mrs grace she. was very helpful at check in select very modern room with nice surprise for anniversary room was very clean and bath was very modern i will definitely recommend any one to stay at same hotel five minuets from the milan center
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the NH President Milano from the 7th to 9th March celebrating a family birthday. Before our visit Victoria (of Guest Relations at the hotel) was extremely helpful in arranging the celebrations and that level of service continued from all the staff throughout our stay. Everyone (from the reception staff, bar and dining staff to the housekeeping staff) were very friendly and eager to make our stay special. We would certainly want to stay here again.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really apreciate the NH Hotels: everything goes well, location, quality of the property, service, etc; this is the reason that eveytijme I have to choose a hotel, in a city, I always look at the NH units
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not far away from the Duomo, good price for services offered. All personnel is smiling and willing to assist you in any mater. standard rooms are small, bathrooms are also small. Internet is working fine. Quality of sleep is good. Breakfast is good, fresh juices, available and a large selection of food available. Hotel have a parking connection which is convenient for the guests. Now the hotel have a big hole in front of it with a big crane, but when the works will be finished it could be an option for stay in Milan
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there for Milan Fashion Week and had quite a few requests, including having a rail in our room and the staff, particularly Eleanora, was incredibly accommodating. Besides a spacious room and bathroom and top notch amenities, the breakfast was incredible and the housekeeping staff was so attentive. For example, we asked for 2 more bottles of water at 11pm and I had barely put the phone down and someone showed up with 3 bottles. The next day after housekeeping, there were another 3 bottles without us asking for anything. We were hardly their most prestigious guests but we felt like VIPs from them remembering our names, requests and orders. Flawless service!
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Especially the staff.. The staff at NH President are trained to work in a 5star plus hotel, not just a normal 5 star. They take good care of every little detail just to make your stay as pleasant as it can be. Brava :)
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone was great, especially Kerly at the breakfast service.thanks, we will come again! Worth a stay if you visit Milano. Perfectly located in the city centre, could even see the dome from the 8. floor.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights, and you can reach all the main attractions by foot, including the Quadrilatero. It has view for the duomo, even. The staff is very friendly, special kudos for Alfredo (front desk) who gave us directions to everything since restaurants, to attractions... very nice reception. The construction in the front didn’t bother us at all, since the windows were soundproof.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A warm welcome on arrival, a free upgrade (thanks!) to a junior suite and incredibly helpful concierge made it a pleasure to stay here. The hotel is located just round the corner from the Duomo and on the route of the airport bus from Linate. The evening barman was charming and efficient. Room was lovely although had no view and the bed comfortable. Breakfast was exceptional for choice and quality.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Milano President is a great hotel in a fantastic location very close to the Duomo, maybe a 4 minute walk. The bedrooms are very well appointed and comfortable. The breakfast although not outstanding it is excellent as is the bar downstairs with great staff! The only thing I didn’t like is the lack of fresh air in the conference rooms of the first floor. Otherwise an excellent hotel.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my husband‘s Birthday and I spoke with them to arrange a bottle of champagne in the room. They organized everything perfectly. The next day they came again with a cake and a nice Birthday card for him. Thank you one more time to the staff that they took care of us so good. The rooms are really nice,good size, the bed is comfortable,you have everything you need. The hotel is just 5 minutes walking from the Duomo. All the staff are nice,helpful,they make you feel welcomed and they help you with everything you need. So I really recommend it and when I come to Milano again, I would want to stay here again.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I Booked a two night stay for a city break in Milan. The lady who checked us in on the Friday night was lovely, she made sure we had a nice room and also recommended a local restaurant for nice Italian food. When we got to our room they had left us a welcome note and little trio of deserts, was a really nice touch.The room was great, the bed was really comfy and the shower was of a high standard.Location is perfect, everything you need to see is in walking distance. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you xxx
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location excellent close to The Duomo and Vittorio Emmanuel’s Gallery. Room very comfortable with all amenities. Very friendly staff always willing to help. Excellent breakfast with everything you desire. I would be very happy to recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very good location . very good service . very good breakfast Esepicialy Fredrica who was very kind and helpfull. Me and my daugther .we had the jonior suite which was excelnt because we could sleep separtly
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was tired and the first hotel I saw it is this hotel , so I went to aeluedo and he gave me a great room with amazing view and with breakfast for a good price , and it’s near by the downtown , only 5 minutes walking
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is our Lions headquarters where we find ourselves a couple of times a month for convivial evenings and for Board of Directors. Well, every time it's a surprise for the quality of the food and the friendliness of the staff. Especially I would like to mention Dario and Alfonso for their availability and kindness. I highly recommend it!
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having chosen the NH Collection President Hotel for the first time this week was the right choice. A warm welcome at the front desk, a very clean room with daily maid service and the restaurant staff which I thank for their smile, availability and professionalism and I will quote a very kind and helpful person, Miss SABRA for all the effort déployés to serve us in the best conditions. Thank you all.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel NH Collection Milano President was our great impression! The place to stay at is very important for us to get wonderful impression from the city in whole.Perfect location, spacious superior room, great breakfast (oh, panettoni! — I am waiting for the next meeting during the season!), a nice photo-location in the hall and a lot of other details! But I always say that people are the most important part of the world. So, thanks a lot to the staff for such an elegant and delicious complement that we got! That was so moving!Hope to come back one day!
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location . Very good breakfast. The view from the room on 8th was fantastic you can see the Duomo from the balcony . Comfortable bed . Very polite staff.very good gym . free water all day outside the rooms and at the gym. the lobby very well decorated .
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Disappointing, the hotel did not appear to make much effort for Christmas. There was no special menu in the restaurant only a Christmas Tree in reception. We reported a fault with the phone it was not fixed. The milk pots and toiletries were not replaced. However, on our second day the maid, Katerina, was exemplary and made up for the previous day's issues. OK for business but not a holiday.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would like to say how we enjoyed our 3 days at your hotel.Great location and such a lovely room.My kind regards to Elisabetha who was on the guest relations desk she could not have been more helpful. Look forward to returning.
hotelName:
18    NH Collection Milano President
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The owner has taken his collection of amazing objects and has shared them within the confines of a very special and unique hotel. Written words can't describe the experience you feel staying here. We enjoyed two different suites..Inning and Stars and Stripes.Both very different but both spacious ,comfortable and full of interesting knickknacks and curious objects. All staff were friendly, especially Stefanie at breakfast. The included breakfast could have had more variety and fresher baked goods,but for an extra charge one may order from a menu.The location is perfect and the overall environment is first class at an affordable price.It all comes together in a "class act". No doubts it is our favorite place to stay in Milan
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a business trip to Milan we let someone else in our party select the hotel. Admittedly we (my wife and I), were reluctant to do so. When we arrived "The Yard" was such an unusual place that we almost turned around. Thankfully we did not. Visually the hotel is so different that it is a but unsettling. But stay with it. The charm of this place makes you feel as if you have walked into a game of "Clue" (i.e. Colonel Mustard in the library with the candlestick). Our stay was during the weeks in July when Europe was suffering from historic levels of heat (100 on average). But the yard was so special that it felt "cool." The staff was terrific. Shout out to "Stephanie" who runs the dinning room with grace and charm and might be one of the nicest people you will ever meet.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been all over Italy, but we had never been to Milan. We had a few days with no plans, so we decided to come to Milan pretty last minute (around a month ago). I’m sitting here writing this review in my amazing room here at “The Yard”. We checked in yesterday on 7/5 and WOW does this hotel go above and beyond. We emailed the hotel to use transportation from the airport (we were at the LIN airport and it was 55 euro to the hotel) and were greeted by Matteo, a wonderful host. The staff is very accommodating, and they speak english well!! We mentioned that we needed to leave very early this morning for a tour of Lake Como. Instead of opening up at 8 am (the usual), Stefanie opened up at 6:30 am for us!! Pastries are made in house...delicious.Our room is beautiful. We are staying in room 11, the Smash room (as seen below, all rooms are themed and this is tennis). I recommend others to request it!! We saw online to request a room with a balcony, which we got! I’m very picky about water pressure on showers due to thick hair...this one does the job! I love it! There are a lot of outlets, which are very nice after coming from a hotel in England that had 1 outlet for the 4 devices we needed to charge. We also loved the perks of the mini bar being included in the price as well as a free drink at the bar on the house for each of us - the bartender makes great drinks. The pizza place downstairs (Dirty Gym) is FANTASTIC. The chefs went above and beyond and honestly it was some of the best pizza my mom and I have ever tasted. We will definitely be back one more night, if not both this trip. After a long day of eleven hours of touring, I promise you this is the place you never want to leave. I have seen complaints of noise due to the bar, but we sleep soundly, and our hall has been totally quiet - it is like a dream! It’s going to be very hard leaving after our 4 night stay, we love it here!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place reminds me of a mix between a high scale Ralph Lauren boutique and a Parisian flea market. Quirky finds abound, old luggage, Barbers chairs, old magazines, portraits and Louis Vuitton luggage all jostle for position amongst a labyrinth of corridors and secret passages. Rooms are spacious and try and get a little balcony: soak up the sun with an aperol spritz after a gourmet pizza in the Dirty Gym on the ground floor.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a great location a Navigli with allot of restaurants & bars & amazing nightlife. We stay here during the Fashion week, and yet the price of the hotel with breakfast was costing 360.00 EUR a night. Their executive room = a standard room, so if you expect something else watch-out. In my room there was not even a computer desk, it was a small room but very nice with good shower. At the check-in we were not advised that minibar is included in the price however, I found this out the the check-out when trying to pay for the water, and the same thing happened to my colleague and few others guest, so for sure it is their way to be dishonest , and save monies. When I asked reception team why we've have not been advised about the Minibar , all she say I don't know, not even an apology. Furthermore, the breakfast allot sweet choice but very poor solty choice, and I was disgusted when they asked me to pay 6 eur for the fresh squeezed orange juice, after paying 360,00 EUR night for an executive room which = to small standard room. The Lobby and BAR, I found it very filthy with very old carpets, I personally don't think it has a special design look other than a filth. Evening Lobby Bar, we were waiting for a good 25 minutes if not more to order a two outrageously expensive cocktails, and waited another 20 minutes for the actual drink , and another 15 minutes for the bill. So, all together yea fancy Milan but think twice before you spend monies for The Yard Hotel because the guests are not treated so nicely and they're not appreciative at all.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a fabulously cool and friendly hotel. The rooms are quite large and super comfortable.The breakast is the best in Milan.The restaurant and the cool bar and lounge is fantastic.The staff treat you like family.Pina the dog we love her. Just love it Without doubt best hotel in Milan
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you don’t like club music in your hotel room until 10/11pm don’t stay here. If you don’t mind it, then enjoy the very cool decor and bar. The breakfast buffet was amazing. Parking garage was tight but it worked. I don’t think anything larger than an economy car could fit in the tight curving driveway down to the basement garage. Staff was lovely. Check In was confusing as there was a private party happening and difficult to understand where the actual lobby/Check In was. The room was nice with a private tiny patio. Nice amenities. Paper thin walls, so the music in the bar/lobby felt like it was just as loud in your room. It was heavy bass music, like a dance club. It seemed like a small hotel, so I’m not sure if there is a room that would be farther from the noise.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has lovely large rooms that are very quiet and have peaceful balconies. Although a bit strange at first, each room has a theme. Mine was football. It grows on you. The rooms are very clean. The hotel lobby is really a giant bar and the rooms are in the back. The neighbourhood in which the hotel is situated is pretty cool with lots of restaurants and bars and it is pretty easy to get to the main sites in Milan by public transportation.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, the Navigli district with its bars and channels. The staff is very friendly, and the facilities are top class. The big issue is the noise, they run a very popular lobby bar which is open until 2am in the morning. We had room 5 on the ground floor, with the corridor being separated by a thin sliding door from the noisy bar. No chance to sleep before 2am, when the music stopped and the bar closed. You may have a better chance to sleep higher up, facing the back, as the bar extends into the front courtyard. If you are a party person, then the hotel is the right one for you. My only complaint would then be that warm dishes at breakfast cost extra. If you are looking for a good night’s sleep, then better don’t book.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located some 20 min walk from the duomo and at 5 minutes from a nice canal along which you will find dozens of trendy bar and restaurants. The decoration of the common parts is absolutely stunning: a talented mix of everything, creating some kind of fancy old English club atmosphere. The rooms are less appealing. First their name is somewhat exaggerated: a junior suite is a small room, a suite is a regular one. The decoration of the room is very variable, depending of the sport pictured. Some are nice and cosy, others are a bit unpleasant (eg the basket ball one). Wifi is free and fast. The bed is comfortable. The breakfast is just okish: a clear weak point, as often in Italy. The staff is very nice and friendly. Overall, a very good hotel that could become an excellent one with some extra effort.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had searched for a luxury boutique hotel and found the Yard, booked it and gave it a try. It's amazing, truly perfect if you want something cool, different and completely unique. The design ethic is wonderfully insane, no two things anywhere you look are the same. Staff are amazing, service is excellent...rooms are unique and very well taken care of. A great place to hide away from the world for a while, perfectly situated for access to all the cool areas of Milan too. Oh and don't miss the bar..it's the best stocked bar I've been in for quite a while...try the Japanese Yoichi 10 single malt if there is any left, I couldn't get enough of it.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Yard is exactly as described by other reviewers. Rooms are spacious each with a different sports theme. I was in the skateboard room. Staff kindly accommodated my request for a room on the upper floor. I was a bit concerned about noise on 1st floor as rooms are somewhat near the bar area (which is quite lively in the late evenings). Beds are very comfortable, towels & rob are soft & luxurious and the minibar is complimentary which was an unexpected touch. Breakfast is beautifully displayed with lots of meats, cheeses, pastries, breads and yogurt. Eggs & bacon can also be ordered a la carte for a small price. Location is about a 20 minute walk to city center.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is simply amazing!! The staff is very welcoming and service minded. Always with a smile.The bartenders are great and the bar (The Doping Club) is super cool with so many tasteful drinks. It is a very popular place for Aperitivo and very busy with chic people from Milan. The breakfast is very nice, and the Sunday Brunch in the courtyard is also wonderful. Fresh fruits and vegetables, freshly squeezed juices, meat cuts, cheese, pastries, bread, cereal, yoghurts and eggs upon order. Something for everyone and a great atmosphere.The rooms are all differently themed and very stylish. Super nice. Elsewhere in the hotel there are antics everywhere, and some of these are for sale. It is such a cool place to walk around and just look and see at all the different collected items.This is such a cool Hotel! Hope to be back soon!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very unique lifestyle hotel adressing more the younger generation. However, we felt at home and all are really friendly - best is the managing lady (since about 7 years she is there) at breakfast. The Yard is used by a lot of urban and chic Milan citizens for aperitivo - so from 6.00 to 10.00pm. Cues are in front of the hotel in the evening. Be prepared to present your key.Very individual rooms - each is designed by a specific sport with all the accessories of that sport. Extremely nice. Only reasion to have 4 instead of 5 stars is because of the size of the rooms - really small and not cheap (we paid about 450€ per night for a double). Anyhow, we really would recommend this hotel if you want to appreciate an extraordinary, stylish hotel which is unique like Milan itself.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lots of friendly staff, high quality drinks in the bar and an awesome decoration. From the moment you step in front door you are in a overload of decoration, theme rooms included. Tennis room, rugby etc....Good shower, decent beds. Everything properly cleaned and well taken care of. Recommanded, even if it is just for 1 night!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped in for breakfast and fell in love with this place. I have traveled all over the world and this place is top notch! Is it a little pricey...yes BUT you get what you pay for!!!! If you want a delicious breakfast by an amazing chef this is the place! Also service was off the charts from the moment we sat down. We had Damien Bennati and he was so professional, nice, and incredible with service!!!! Next time we are in Birmingham we will definitely come back!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a definite must if you're in town. It is funky and very ecclectic. The staff are very helpful and professional, and were great during our stay. Check in was easy, and we were escorted to our room which was 'The Fishing' room. It was brilliant. Good bed and pillows, bathroom was large, however the actual shower is very narrow. Heating/aircon and TV all functional and easy to use. Rooms were stocked with a small mini bar which was complimentary and replenished daily. There was also a nespresso coffee machine for in room cafe, but you're in Italy!! Rooms were cleaned quickly and thoroughly, with water replenished daily. Breakfast was great! The selection is varied and I found everything to be fresh! We also had a drink at the bar one night which was fun. They have a well curated menu of drinks to select from. The only improvement I would recommend for this property, is more signage from the street, as we were there sure if it was the right place, along with clearer signs pointing to reception/dining room, as the hotel can be quite confronting when you first arrive, this would be very helpful especially for those arriving after a long haul flight!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of my favorite hotels in Milan. The decor is exquisitely designed. I love going here for cocktails. If you go, walk around the lobby and bar and take in all the fine design work. Masterfully done. This place will not disappoint. Something to see at every turn. There are secret rooms and a secret (private) bar. Don't miss this one!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This quirky hotel is a delight. Friendly staff, delicious breakfast and the most amazing collection of bits and pieces from history make stays here worth so much more than just a regular room. Make sure you save some time to wander around the lobby, bar and any other hidden corners you can find.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Yard Hotel is certainly one of the most colourful, cozy and very eclectic hotels I've stayed at. I wish it wouldn't have been so short, as I felt like I was right at home. The decor has so many intriguing elements, and the room had me feel very peaceful, and fun to be in, They certainly must have had a highly creative group to put it all together, as opposed to many other hotels, that have the same sort of boring basic colours and very little of any uniqueness, the Yard Hotel had me transfixed as if I was in a combination gallery, antique store, with very bold colours all over. I would give this place 5 stars for being so impressive. Location was great and it was a perfect retreat to want to hang out in. Superb!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My go to place in Milan, this hotels staff are just fantastic. The decor is a combination of all things warm, quirky and fun and stylish. The rooms are themed and perfect in every sense. Big cosy and stylish! It’s in the Navigli area filled with bars and restaurants and has a lonely atmosphere. Trains an trams are easily accessibly and all major sites are 15 minutes walking distance or a 5 minute tram ride!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super trendy amazing hotel... rooms are big large bathroom with a great shower... the bar area downstairs is super hip and a great place to hang for a drink... great location to the city center and navigili district... highly recommend
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Yard is beautifully decorated with themed rooms. We had a king "boxing room" suite, spacious with a cozy bed. Rain shower with CG Bigelow products. Good breakfast starts at 7:30am with pastries (donuts, quiche, croissants, bread), yogurt, fresh fruit, cheese and meats, salad. Friendly staff. Huge lounge area to work in during the day or have drinks during the night. Onsite (albeit tight) parking is available for ~25 Euro overnight.Con!Noise from the lounge area affects most rooms (rooms facing the lounge). On the weekends this can go on until 2am... not recommended for the light sleeper, or if you have a flight/appointment scheduled. Based on the noise alone, I would have given it 3 if I wasn’t so tired that I slept through the noise, and would have given it 5 if noise wasn’t an issue at all. Tip: Request a room in the back if you’re a light sleeper or visiting on the weekend.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's hard to find as there is no sign on the outside...which sets the tone for this hotel. Upon entering, you are bowled over by eclectic design. Almost too much to take in. The bar and conversation areas throughout the lower public spaces are amazing. My room had a kitchen, living room, bedroom and outdoor piazza. Underfloor heating in the bath. Staff are outstanding...no request goes unheeded or fulfilled. Breakfast is the best part of the day. The surrounding area is a lovely neighborhood perfect for strolling, sightseeing and finding wonderful places to eat. Its not a hotel...its your home away from home. This is my second visit and can't wait to return....
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful! We have stayed in a number of 'art hotels', but this one was the most amazing of them all. 'The Yard' is the lobby of the hotel, and looks to be a big antiques shop, chock-a-block with bric-a-brac: stacks of old suitcases, manikins, toy sailboats, gratuitously hand-lettered interior windows reading "The Secret Society of Mature Individuals" and maybe "The No Sleep Detective Agency". Think The Waldorf on acid. The staff were attractive and graceful; they weren't just stationed behind a desk the way it is in most hotels, but brought us coffee when we arrived after an early flight when our room was not ready yet, and unasked brought a coffee again and a snack when one of us was sitting in the lobby time-shifted-awake the next morning before breakfast. The lobby meanders into numerous siderooms, and all of it had comfortable looking plush furniture. The main room is terraced, and appeared to be open to the sky with a louvered ceiling; I couldn't see how they stopped all the antiques from getting wet in a sudden rainshower. The hallways to the rooms were reached by unobvious doors. We stayed in the room called JFK, and there were interesting pictures on that theme along the walls. Our room was actually quite big, and there was a little balcony with plants on a watering system.Okay, the hotel is not perfect, but what is. A light bulb was out in one of those industrial fixtures in the bathroom (alas, no tub), but we felt shy about bringing it to the attention of the staff. There was a crack in the glass in a corner by the foot of a chair on the balcony. The bed pillows could really be better.And you have to understand that it is a bit of a walk into the main area around the Duomo. But the Navigli area is great, too. Think Camden Town in London. The canals are crowded in the evening on a Friday or Saturday to an extent that it is sometimes difficult to walk along some of them and over the bridges due to all the people. There are countless restaurants along the canals soaking up the business from the restaurants along the surrounding streets. The restaurants included many happy hour buffets of all-you-can-eat-and-one-drink for 10 Euros, mid-range restaurants serving plates of good pasta and pizzas, and some restaurants trying to be a little higher end. There was an interesting bar scene on the weekends at the Yard, where locals flooded the place-to-be-seen lobby.I've read a number of things here about the breakfasts at the Yard, and wanted to comment. The breakfasts were fine. The breakfasts are continental. It's not the way it is in Norway, where the hotels are in a competition to win an award to have the best breakfast feast with seven varieties of eggs. But here there were croissants and bread and some cheeses and sliced meats and yogurt and fruit and juices. Little baked goods and sweet delicacies, too. The breakfasts were fine.Overall, we were really happy that we stayed here. The way our flights were, we stayed here two nights at the beginning of our trip, and two nights after our trip again in Milan, when we stayed in a different hotel closer the center. But we were glad to have experienced The Yard.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in the world. Everything is amazing. Atmosphere and decor of the hotel gets 11/10. Room is spacious and beautifully designed. Staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel bar is the best in the world. Location is superb. What more can you ask.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a week in early October. Our room was comfortable, well appointed, and had a nice balcony/outdoor sitting area. The bathroom was a great size although the shower itself is a little tight. Not a bad thing, just a heads up. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially when we arrived very early on our check-in day. They held our bags for us and recommended several things to do/see until the room was ready. We utilized the bar most nights for apertivo and enjoyed breakfast each morning as well. It's in a great location as well as everything you'll want to see is probably a 15-20 minute walk away. It is a very uniquely decorated place... it's a very cool look just very unique. Would absolutely stay here again!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in Milan. This hotel was very unique. All the rooms are suites. Ours was the canoe room. It had a king bed and a second room with two twins. The mini bar had water, soda, juice, and beer and was included which was nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It was about a 20/25 minute walk to the cathedral and the last supper.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second stay here in the last year and this stay was as wonderful as our first. Love the ambiounse and the kwirky style of this treasurtrove of antiquities and memorabilia. The attention to detail and care in our spacious suite was incredible,and fully serviced each day. The staff are a delightful and most helpful. My only disappointment during our previous stay was breakfast which was rather lacking in choice and variety, delighted to report this had improved greatly with both buffet and cooked breakfast available at an additional cost. In the evening the main lounge area becomes a cocktail bar popular with both locals and visitors alike creating a I intermate and stylish destination. Wonderful experience a ‘ hidden gem ‘
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Entering The Yard felt like stepping back in time to another era. It was fabulous, an oasis of style and beautiful items collected from around the world. Comfortable couches beckon you to slow the pace, relax with a drink on ice and savour the laid back vibe around you. All whilst flipping through one of an outstanding collection of coffee table books on offer. The themed rooms are full of character and charm, the breakfast delicious and the staff unobtrusive but on hand the moment you need them. From my perspective - the only choice for a stay in Milan.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed this hotel - it is so different. Our suites was called Wicket and it was really fabulous. The breakfast is great too. Location is good but not fantastic. I think next time we go back to Me... it is a tough decision.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly, we didn't know what to expect when we pulled up in front of a black garage with a large #8 stenciled on it. I called the hotel to see where I might deposit the car, and they asked if I saw the #8. I did, and soon the garage open its doors to swallow my Fiat 500L Prior to The Yard Milano, my favorite boutique hotel was The Cotton House in Barcelona. Elegant, quirky, modern all at the same time. I now have a new fave in The Yard. We honestly didn’t know what to expect. My wife thought we’d made another mistake along the lines of our first hotel in Porto, but to her (and my) surprise, this wasn’t the case.Nine years ago, The Yard Milano was a private residence. It was converted to a hotel six years ago with just six rooms. The owner began buying out the rest of the building and today, the property boasts 32 rooms, each of which is decorated with a different sports theme. Ours, Room 11, was called Smash and was adorned with tennis photos, rackets and the like. It came with a private outdoor seating area, modern bathroom, and comfy king-sized bed with a TY stenciled at the foot.If you like Ralph Lauren home décor, this hotel is Ralph on steroids. Nearly every surface in the its public and private rooms is covered with some eye-catching item or image seemingly acquired over a lifetime of attending estate and tag sales. But don’t get me wrong. It all works amidst deep lush reds and blacks. Words can’t describe, but the interior photos I took might.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived and were offered a complimentary drink (wine in our case), we felt like this Hotel is really taking care of clients in a special, thoughtful way. The amenities are first class, the rooms extremely comfortable and spacious, the little terrace wonderful for meals, there were enough electrical outlets for our many gadgets, enough hangers, fluffy pillows, a great mattress, an I-phone for our use during the stay, free drinks in the minibar, enough reading light next to the bed, the shower powerful and large and breakfast sumptuous and with freshly squeezed juices (which is also rare). It's obviously that a lot of thought has gone into making this Hotel special, and we like special! One suggestion is to have a menu in the rooms, or at least something explaining the hours of operation, and restaurants with menus available, including room service, which as it turned out is available, but we did not know. We will come back often!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice staff, great room. Would recommend for a south of Milan cite centre. Easy walking distance to the canals. It was nice to have a cocktail offered upon arrival. Would go here again next time we visit.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Yard for three nights in September 2018 and have nothing but great things to say about the hotel. The room was funky let luxurious. The common areas were so fun and unique from anything we have ever seen. The stand was very friendly and we loved the bartender! We also thought the location was ideal. We walked to and from the duomo easily (roughly 20min) and also got to experience the cool neighborhood the hotel is in. Would definitely reccomend staying here!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very charming Hotel, with a generous approach. I like hotels that are relaxed and have a sense of humor. I appreciate when the mini bar is complementary.Despite the location it is very quiet.You have everything veru close by and if needed you have the tram more or less just outside.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very trendy and was overall fine, but there were small issues that prevented me from giving five stars. It felt like people like the hotel for its design more than for any other reason. Issues I found included: the room we were in needs to be repainted and maintained a little bit better. The front desk staff is fine but nowhere near what you’d call ‘warm’, and I think warmth and personalization are what you should expect from such a small boutique hotel. It took 25 minutes for an iron and an ironing board to be sent up to the room. If you’re not going to provide an iron and a board in the rooms, please do not take so long to deliver one to the room. And perhaps I’m missing the point of their brand, but there seemed to be very little signage anywhere. The little hallway coming out of the elevator is super dark with a sign to the lobby that is unlit and super hard to decipher and see. The hotel was hard to find. They also lock the gate outside with a small intercom with which to call the front desk to open. All of this is okay, but the front desk should have explained this upon check-in. The key to the room is my own personal gripe: it is not a key card but an actual key with a gigantic keychain, which is cute but is a pain when you’re leaving the hotel to go out to dinner or something with its bulk and weight.The hotel had sent an email before our stay to warn us that the hotel street would be congested due to the F1 race. Great: but they did not provide information on hourly parking nearby (so that we could have parked the car and gone with our luggage to the hotel on foot until the race was over) or times in which to try and drive in (this would have been helpful to know, as we were driving in from Parma, and we would have left at least an hour earlier had we known they were closing the street at 1pm). All they said was it was going to be backed up. I know that all of these things are tiny issues, but I guess this is just me being a little disappointed with a hotel that’s ranked this high on TripAdvisor and only has 30-some odd rooms. It just felt like there was no real management.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After searching through several hotels, we wound up at The Yard.I was amazed at how good it was, picture do not do this hotel justice.Great service from great people working there.Next time I am in Milano, this is my #1 pick.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was extra comfortable (shaka room - surfing theme) and clean. The city center is a 10 min walk from the hotel. Staff was very helpful.The hotel is very, very beautifully decorated (extraordinary).
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fun and unique interior, full of, antiques, stuff, gadgets and art. If you fall in love with one of the items I understood that you can buy it. Good bar with amazing cocktails. Great rooms and good location (loved the grand canal area). The only downside was that the balcony was covered, surrounded by plants, which gave a slightly confined impression.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent one night at The Yard on our way to Lake Como. I only wish we could have stayed longer!It is a great hotel. The decor is awesome - not like any other place we have ever stayed. The rooms are large, clean and well appointed. I highly recommend it. I would definitely stay here again.Although we only stayed one night, the staff helped us with any questions we had. The were all very nice!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my third visit to The Yard and my first disappointment. The room we were assigned had a sagging couch and the air conditioner seemed to be groaning under the summer heat - which made it uncomfortable for sleeping. The bathroom was very clean and the storage space was ample but the comfort of prior visits was elusive.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's not often that I write a review whilst still staying at a hotel but as the final part of our Italian holiday and enjoying our first trip to Milan we chose The Yard. This hotel has the same feel as The Hoxton in Amsterdam where we stayed earlier in the year in that it is quirky, friendly (a particular mention to Valeria for her help, advice and importantly her good humour on reception) and in short, somewhere we would stay again when in Milan! The rooms are well presented with many cool fixtures and fittings such as Sky TV, well designed bathroom fittings and good lighting, but it's the overall ambiance that sells it to both myself and my wife. The reception area and lounge area are bright and full of sporting curiosities. The bar is well stocked with a gentleman behind it that can converse knowledgeably on his whiskies and gins with gusto. The communal areas are filled with an eclectic mix of memorabilia which makes the hotel unique in our opinion and we are looking forward to the rest of our stay whilst in this beautiful city.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is lovely, our room is lovely, the little veranda is perfect, but by far the thing that excited us about staying here was the lobby/bar. It’s large, with lots of comfy sofas and interesting details (love to post a pic but it explicitly says no photos or videos). But here’s the rub: I was sitting at a couch sipping a cocktail for an hour watching this frenetic blonde hostess race around the room arranging glasses, moving magazines on tables - just disrupting any sort of casual flow the room was set up to create. Then, she stops at my table and tells me I’m going to have to move soon because a party of 15 is going to take over my spot! Um Excuse me? I paid for a room in this hotel, and this is my lobby, which I’m fully willing to share... but I have to move to accommodate another party? Not cool.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was only able to stay one night but we wished we’d stayed longer! The hotel was beautifully decorated and I could spend hours looking through the quirky artifacts they use to decorate the space. We stayed in the Shaka room which was based on surfing. The courtyard is very trendy and great to sit and relax when escaping the tourist crowds of Milan. Highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The decor in this hotel is very unique. From the entrance through a striking courtyard to the theme rooms, it was a very fun experience. The staff was very helpful and accommodating, especially Paola who made our stay truly remarkable.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I Loved this place. The staff was excellent - Luigi, Paola, Veronica all were fantastic. I forget the bartender and breakfast lady name but they were wonderful. We stayed in room 5 which is the hockey room. Lots of space and a large shower. Easy 20 minute walk to all the site seeing spots. Close to the trains. Outstanding breakfast. Loved loved the vibe and people here. Look for this door. We walked right by it the first time.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our first night in Italy on our way to Lake Como. What a great hotel! Fun vibe, great decor. We stayed in the Wicket room, all cricket-related decor in the room. We loved everything about it. Cool lounge/bar area for after-dinner people watching. Had a great drink I don't remember.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel, amazing staff, this is the place to stay in Milan! Top tip go visit the public lido nearby if you want a swimming pool, and visit the local bars along the canal! Really quirky place which you could spend hours just looking at all the quirky collection of stuff!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice place Trendy, confortableTo suggest only to your best friendsIf you visit Milano you cannot miss this placeEven for dinner or just for a drink Or for a business meeting This will be your place to stay in Milano
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in their Penthouse room. They had several others that some of the photos will show, but the one we had was great! It was very large, the bed was a perfect balance of firm/soft with great pillows, the living area was extremely comfortable, the very large balcony was well furnished and reasonably private, and the bathroom was really nice. The room had really well thought out decor too, I mean every little thing, from the wall hangings to the bottle of house whiskey they provided completed the room. A nice touch was also the mini fridge was free, which so many other nice hotels fail to provide. From the hotel you have the canal, which is a very nice bustling area to walk, and everything from the Duomo to the fashion district and the cemetery were walkable in hot weather. I didn't get a chance to eat at their restaurant, but they have one of the most highly rated bars there and the cocktails were excellent. I really cannot recommend this place enough!
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted a place to stay in Milan to serve as our base for a 9 day exploration of northern Italy. The Yard turned out to be perfect. It is located in a great Milan neighborhood far enough away from the tourist trappings of central city life but close enough to not miss a thing. The Navigli is on a canal system that draws the most interesting people to the most diverse and excellent restaurants and shops. After every day trip we took (Venice, Florence, Como, Portofino) we would come back to The Yard and get refreshed. The atmosphere, people, and services were excellent. It’s like when you feel the location a movie is shot becomes another character in the film. All this for half the price of Main Street Milan.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to a business event in Milan for a couple of nights and stayed at The Yard Hotel based on a personal recommendation. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Very nice venue and staff, well located near the Navilli area. Quiet and comfortable room on the first floor, away from the traffic.
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the most amazing hotel for the money everything was exceptional, I have stayed at more expensive hotels with much lower quality. The whole place is like a museum for design, the staff are wonderful, cocktails amazing, food to die for. Great job guys! :)
hotelName:
19    The Yard Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a trip to Italy and spent 2 nights at the Uptown Palace. They upgraded us to a suite with a living room, 2 baths and a balcony on the 10th floor! We had a spectacular view of the Basilica and it was lit at night! The breakfast buffet had eggs, fruit, yogurt, cereal and pastries. The staff was excellent. The hotel was within walking distance of the Basilica and Sforza Castle.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positive: Very clean large rooms. The Bellmen were very friendly and helpful. Pretty nice location to everything. Negative: The check in staff was very rude and not friendly at all. The room cleaning service also threw our personal items around to the point half way through our stay we decided to not let them in the room anymore. Also they charged me more than Hotels.com quoted me.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a good stay overall. Staff are very nice, attentive and helpful, the double room is cosy and clean. Breakfast includes loads of choices too and some lovely selection of croissants! It is a very good four star hotel, and, considering the Milan prices, quite worth the price. Minor negative comments: Heating/cooling system was not working at all, toilet seat was wobbly and fan extractor in the bathroom needs fixing! Nevertheless, these aspects did not impact the quality of our stay.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Milan as part of a multi destination trip around Italy for our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a junior suite on arrival which was a lovely surprise. The hotel is in a handy location, about 15 minutes’ walk from the cathedral and 2 minutes from the nearest metro station. The bed was comfy and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean enough and spacious. Speedy WiFi connection. Overall a pleasant and comfortable stay.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were new to Milan when we booked, the hotel is a 5 minute walk to the metro and trams 2 minutes away, it took 20 minutes from Milan central rail station and there are lots of restaurants close by.Breakfast is buffet and typical European with lots of cold choices and very little hot included, you can have omelettes and fried eggs but they are extra.we had 3 rooms that varied in size and layout, stay away from the front of the hotel it is noisy at night, other rooms seem fineFront desk staff were professional and very helpful
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice reception greeting, 5EUR city tax pppn, decent brekkie - could have been topped up more often. quiet room, decent wifi, no bath but shower good. easy walking to the canals area and slightly longer to the more central parts.bathroom lighting good, cocktails at the bar not cheap but not unexpected!corner shop next door
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in a walking distance from the main city centre . Good access to the Metro @ Missoni . Went on the M3 line to main Centrale Station and got the train up to Lake Como [ about 1 hour ] and had a lovely day there. Read a few negative reviews about staff etc. but found all the staff to be very welcoming and attentive. Very nice breakfast with plenty of choice and Elena also very attentive to guests needs. Rooms are very comfortable and standard of cleanliness very good. Don't be put off by some of these reviews - you will enjoy your stay if you choose the Uptown Palace.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Uptown Palace is just 10min away from the city center, the staff is very very sweet & helpful, the rooms are big, beautiful & clean & we had a great time! Breakfast was biiiiiig! I'd definitely stay there again :)
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for two nights as I was in Milan for a job. The hotel was incredibly clean everywhere you looked, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. It is only a short walk (5-10 minutes) from the Duomo and there are lots of shops and restaurants/cafes nearby. There are also great transport links if you’re going a bit further. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom in particular was very nice. It’s a very modern hotel, nicely decorated. I will definitely be staying here again!
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not the normal hotel I stay when visiting Milan, however it is an amazing luxurious hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with everything that you might need. The rooms are very well presented (maybe a bit to old fashion - for my taste) a good 10/15 min walk from city centre, but still very central!
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel and staff excellent, nothing is to much trouble. Very well located, close to everything. Breakfast really yummy couldn't ask for anything more. Staff went out of their way to make us feel special. Thank you making our stay so memorable.Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this property after the usual hotels I go to in Milano were fully booked. The price/quality equation for this hotel is exceptional. It is centrally located near the historical town center, and equidistant from two metro stations. The hotel is located in a modern office tower, consequently the rooms are on the small side, but well appointed with comfortable beds and well appointed bathrooms. The breakfast, which is included in the price was decent although the service to get an expresso can sometimes be slow if there are many people. The staff at the reception were efficient and friendly. I would gladly return to this property. My only complaint concerns the coffee/tea facilities in the room. Instead of having proper China tea cups, there were only disposable paper cups which I find unacceptable for a four star hotel.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed 3 nights at the Uptown Palace in Milan. This was part of a long tour in which we stayed at 5 Italian hotels, and this one was truly the best.As soon as we arrived someone took our luggage and delivered it to our room.Checkin was relatively fast (we experienced long waits and inexplicably long processing at some of the other hotels) with 3 receptionists waiting when we arrived.We were first given a small room with a window directly facing an adjacent apartment building. After complaining we were transferred to a much larger room on the 12th floor with a mountain view! (Note that Duomo views are only from executive suites, and they really don't see much of the Duomo anyway!)The location is reasonable - it is about a 10 minute walk to the Duomo or Vittorio Emanuele. Taxi from the train station is about 15 minutes and 15 Euro. You can ask them to arrage a taxi to the airport which takes about 45 minutes and they will charge 100E to your bill. Brera is a 20 minute walk. One day we walked in a random direction and quickly found ourselves in a lovely residential neighborhood with local shops. Our stay included breakfast which is on the 3rd floor and very nice with cloth tablecloths and napkins. Staff immediately removes used plates with smiles on their faces, and are happy to bring you your capuchino or tea (no extra charge as in some hotels).There is a nice large lobby area where you can sit at the end of a long day if you don't want to be cooped up in your room. This was the only hotel on our trip to Italy that had a variety of English language TV stations, including BBC world news and CNN. However, the Internet connectivity is not very good - the WiFi signal is strong both in the room and in the lobby, but the connectivity frequently drops.I wouldn't hesitate to call this a 1st class luxury hotel, were it not for maintenance issues. In our shower (which had a great rain shower head) the soap dish wobbled. The closet had a LED lighting strip with proximity detector, but it had become detached from the closet and was dangling at one end. I happened to see a maintenance employee and showed him the issues, and when we returned at the end of the day everything was fixed! That was great, but this kind of thing should be taken care of without my mentioning it.However, I can't complain. I can only highly recommend the Uptown Palace.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is know that check in is usually after 1:00pm since check-out is at 12:00pm. However the hotel was more than happy to check me in a bit earlier than usual at 10:00am. It was a nice gesture that made a difference with me.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location and really comfortable rooms! The staff are very friendly and the bar is pleasant. The reason I gave 4 and not 5 was because our double bed was actually 2 single beds pushed together which made certain “activities“ challenging, the hairdryer worked intermittently and the aircon was not great. Even after setting the room temperature to 21c it never dropped below 25c. Overall really good hotel and would definitely use again.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall our stay at Uptown Palace was very pleasant. The hotel decor is nice with a luxurious feel, although I can see in some of the details why it isn’t rated 5 star. The rooms are very small, we were told we were upgraded upon check in to a ‘superior room’ although the size of this room was smaller than most regular rooms I have stayed in. Nevertheless the decor was nice and the bathroom was a nice touch with large shower and double sinks. One thing that has bothered us during our stay, was we seemed to be incredibly itchy. Both me and my partner found ourselves scratching all over during our stay in the bed. I will be keeping an eye out for any bed bug bites over the next few days (although I have a feeling it was a sensitivity to the washing detergent used on the sheets, and not down to bed bugs as we would have seen bites sooner if that were the case). In addition the rooms were ridiculously hot. We couldn’t seem to get the AC to work, and one night our thermostat read 26 degrees, which for a good nights sleep, is definitely not ideal. We both enjoy walking so it wasn’t a problem that the hotel was about a 15 minute walk from Duomo and the main shops. The only issue we found was in general there seemed to be very little in terms of restaurants near the hotel which meant we had to walk late at night in the dark, down some rather sketchy looking side streets. Yet again it might have been because of the time of the year with there being less people and things open. Not sure we will return to Milan, although for the cost of the stay and the friendly service of the staff, it was worth the visit.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We‘ve mainly had a great stay at the „Uptown Palace“ . The room was modern and warmly decorated, the staff was friendly and welcoming at all times. Nevertheless, there was a drop of bitterness after all. Upon checkin, we got a letter from the General Manager saying: VIP access! Your benefit as a Expedia VIP Member is: 20% off on FB services and early check in and late check out upon availability.I asked two different receptionists if we could check out about 2 hours later. They wanted to charge 50 Euro because it is a holiday (Jan. 1). Why handing out such a letter in the first place then! It makes guests feel special first, but in the end, if not fullfilled as promised, it leaves a sour taste to an initially perfect stay. Pitty. I‘ve filed a complaint at the reception. I then was told that 50€ for late checkout at 2 pm already is a special treatment. The hotel was „almost“ full, we couldn‘t sell the room, if we had granted extended checkout, and whatnot... Well, obviously, almost full means, there are still rooms available and if they can give us the room for two hours longer for 50€, they also could give it for free as promised in the letter.Anyways, as already had: Misleading letter, left a sour taste and we left the hotel dissappointed.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed in the uptown palace in Milan for 2 nights. The hotel was lovely, we checked in and got told we had been upgraded to a junior suite. The suite itself was really nice, plenty of room and finished very well. The breakfast was good and we enjoyed the selection. Situated in a good location, we were in walking distance to the Duomo and Navigli which we thought were great .
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel. Very comfortable and service is quite good. The location is okay, about a 15 minute walk from the cathedral but also quite close to metro stations and tram lines. There are a few restaurants and cafes within a close walk as well.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the staff is so genuinely nice. They really go the extra mile to help make a customers experience memorable and remarkable. My room, #507 was absolutely perfect. The hotel location is magnificent. Uptown Palace is for sure a 4****+ property. Kudos for those in charge of staff training - they are doing an amazing job. Well worth the stay!
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I left the Milan today on our way to London. We had a short but great stay at the Uptown Palace. The staff was friendly and efficient at check-in — our room was not ready when arrived in the morning but they took care of our luggage and it was in our room when we got back to the hotel. Room was spotless and quiet — we had a great nights sleep. We would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in very convenient location. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom well appointed. The people at the desk were very nice as well. Breakfast was provided and very ample. Overall very nice experience
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked three rooms here for my 40th birthday celebrations in Milan and despite telling the staff at check-in I ended up with the worst room. Staff performed a perfunctory rather than welcoming role. The room I was given was designed as an accessible bedroom (which I didn’t have a need for), with adapted bathroom facilities but there’s no need for a revolting shower curtain. I find them unhygienic (see picture). I was quite jealous when I saw the rest of my family’s rooms. There was no complimentary water in the room and the coffee ‘cups’ were polystyrene. One of the rooms in our party did have a coffee machine, so they were pleased. There was a turn down service and a little treat left on the bed. The hotel is in a good location, it’s clean and the breakfast is adequate. The bar is small and brightly lit but the staff were good when there was a mix up with the drinks order. There was a small problem on check out in that they attempted to charge us twice for city tax as it hadn’t been put on their system, but it was quickly resolved.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located - 15 mins walk to the centre of Milan. Very helpful staff - concierge and receptionModern design; rather characterlessStandard rooms are small; basic finish. Bed quite soft...Breakfast 3/10
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel on 9/6/18. The staff was excellent in assisting with the parking situation, and giving me directions to the hotel. However, GPS made the arrival a disaster for me. First...this is downtown Milan, so the fact that the hotel uses a garage is not unusual. The garage is literally located behind the hotel. It is convenient and very safe, once you find it. The fact that Milan is a series of one way streets, or streets with bus lanes and streetcars makes navigation difficult. Simply put...the hotel is on the main drag...but there is a small side street running parallel and ends right at the hotel entrance...so you need to turn in before you stop the hotel entrance. A challenge. Drive to the parking garage first...get out...walk to the hotel is easiest. Inside, the hotel is really very nice. The rooms are great, and my view was a huge window overlooking the Basilica di San Calimero and the main street. There is a nice bar open late, and the people at the front desk are great at helping you find a place to eat. Staff brought my bags up, took them and stored them, and were always helpful no matter the ask. Rooms are very stylish...perfect size, and very, very clean. Bathrooms are exceptional. This is more a boutique hotel than a grand palace...it is all dark colors and gold...very stylish. The bed is heaven though. Location is on a main street and about a 10-12 min walk to the Piazza Duomo. Very convenient. Tons of restaurants around...and there is a store right around the corner. I loved my stay here...very good value, and great people.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We expected the hotel to be nice, but they exceeded our expectations in so many ways. First, when we arrived in the morning, we expected we would have to wait to check in; after all, checkout time isn’t till noon. But the staff invited us to the lounge for complimentary cappuccinos and cookies—and then upgraded us to a suite with the most breathtaking view of the Duomo! Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful—right down to explaining how the taxi system works. The restaurant is very good, breakfasts offer many satisfying options, and the hotel’s location is very convenient to the Duomo area without all the noise. We highly recommend it, and will be back!
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, spacious room.Good location - 10 minute walk to the Duomo. 30 minute walk to the canals.Included breakfast was decent.TIP: The hotel offers reasonably priced private airport transfers. IE: Much less than what we paid for our through a tour company.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maybe I’ve become used to Asian standards but the service here is terrible (except for the lovely lady at the bar). No milk for tea, no water in the room, reception staff look like being at work and doing their job is the hardest thing anyone could possibly ask them to do. Location is great but this hotel offers nothing else, book anywhere else.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in this Hotel, a very good surprise, overall is perfect, good location.Front ofice people very simpatic and helpfull.The rooms are good, very good bed, bathroom very good. cleaning service very good as well.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All seemed okay with the check-in. The lady was extremely helpful, especially with the extra mile to get us to Monza by train. However, the ‘superior queen room’ with a ‘city view’ is not quite as advertised. The bed is king sized at best, I’d hate to think what the standard room is like if this is superior. As for the ‘city view, well it’s pretty poor as you can see from my photo. It wouldn’t be so bad had the reception guy not decided to argue with us as to what defined a city view!!! I’ve only just checked in, and I just hope this weekend In this hotel improves.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated in a commercial area and whilst others say it’s a 15 minute walk to the Duomo, the walk is not so attractive and there are no decent restaurants for at least 25 minutes walk. We scoured the area to find a touch of Milan but struggled.Sure there are 2 Carrefour stores just nearby but when on holidays a series of restaurants to choose from is vital.Our room was really beautiful as we had chosen the suite which had great views of the Duomo from the bedroom and the city from the lounge. There were 2 separate marble bathrooms both really lovely and very clean. Staff were so very helpful and the lobby is modern. The approach to the hotel is that of a multi story box and not so inviting. We had safety concerns about a single revolving front entry/exit door with no separate manual opening door for large groups or emergency occasions.The breakfast room is very depressing and unfortunately it matches the level of food served at breakfast. The only redeeming item at breakfast was the espresso coffees which were very good.As stated in my heading it’s the location and breakfast that was disappointing for us otherwise we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance to the Duomo and amazing shops and restaurants. Modern, new bathrooms and great size accommodations. Best breakfast for the Milan traveler. Staff could be friendlier and not condescending but not bad enough to keep me away. Will stay again...Grazie Junior suite sleeps 2-3 in a bedroom and 1 on additional bed in a small living room space.  out of 5
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
