review_body: We requested an "extra service" of leaving our luggage at the hotel several days before our actual stay because we were going on a side trip elsewhere and didn't want to be burdened with too much bags. Of course we assured them of the safety of its contents. They consented and made sure our bags were safe. A metro stop was being constructed right in front of the hotel but there was no noise nor dust. The quaint little family-run restaurant next door offered good home-style pastas and pizza. The hotel was 2 minutes from the road-tram (#12, #16 If i am not mistaken, which leads to straight to the Duomo). UPtown Palace was at a great location: we didn't want to be too close to where all tourists are and this hotel is at a more "residential" area. The room we were assigned was perfect for us: no carpeting (which I am sadly allergic to), good size to fit all our stuff, cleaned regularly, and quiet. We had a most pleasant stay. DEFINITELY would book here again.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ll start by saying we had a great time in Milan and Uptown palace completed this enjoyable stay .The hotel itself is very modern clean and has a really high end feel to it . the staff is very accommodating with our needs or requests and it’s done professionally and with a smile.Location - keep in mind the location is by no mean central, however it is within walking distance to the duomo or Porta ticinese (10-12m), the Missori metro station is about 7minutes away (M3 line)** Keep in mind that this hote location will become centric as soon as M4 line will opens currently under construction Carrefour express as well as few coffee shops and restaurants are within 2-5 minutes walk from the hotel Overall it is a very positive experience and if you accept being slightly off the hustle and bustle of the Duomo area you will have a pleasant surprise awaiting at the Uptown Palace .
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Read the review is good, I booked thru expedia in 2 weeks in advance, which it under VIP hotel. So i assume they might upgrade the room as i requested higher floor, upon chck in on 2/8/18 ask the front desk and claim they hotel is fully booked and only hv the floor allocated of level 2 with no view of any, checked thru from all the website it show still have rooms on the date of stay, i call the reception and ask what the perks that the hotel giving as it did not give me any letter which i received from other hotel of the perks from expedia, mr daniel from the reception claim that the champagne was the perks, but it jus stated compliment from the hotel and told him that we do not drink so it was exchange to 6 pcs hotel chocolate instead not only that wven the flushing system just kept flushing even after we release it I was so disappointed with the hotel it have a very good review but i do not see any, I hope i can speak to the management as im still here. I been using the VIP services with very much of getting the perks but not this hotel, i suggest expedia should review this too and ppl of you huys wanna book do scan thru
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Uptown Palace Milan is a friendly and comfortable hotel convenient to many Milan attractions. Rooms are spacious enough, breakfast is tasty and staff is very accommodating. It is in walking distance of the famous Milan cathedral.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 4* Hotel with 5* Hospitality. Everyone SO friendly and helpful. Really made my stay enjoyable. Highly recommended.Rooms are small-ish but clean, comfortable and more than adequate. Restaurant & Room-service food excellent. Everyone from front desk to concierge are friendly, helpful and offer service with a smile. Perfect location - close to City centre and yet far away from the hurt of tourists. Perfect in every way I can think of.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a newer modern hotel in a good location only 10 minute walk from it all in Milan. Clean comfortable rooms with free wifi and even included our breakfast. Small fridge, air conditioning and friendly staff made our stay enjoyable.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is close to everything. Really polite staff and they even recommended us a couple of places to visit. The room has everything you need and it looks very new. It’s also really cheap considering the quality. I will definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not too far to walk from the Metro station, then only 2 stops to the Duomo. Good room, great bed, breakfast was pretty good also. Would recommend for a short stay in Milan. Check in and check out were fast and efficient.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a European center of city hotel, there is much to commend it beyond location. A first rate breakfast buffet, rooms that tall people can fit in (a little small by North American standards but better than a typical New York City room), excellent appointments in room and public areas, amazing front desk and bell staff.Mind you they are rebuilding the subway station directly outside the hotel, so noise sensitive types should ask for a Courtyard facing room at the back!However the lack of a fitness room and rather overpriced in hotel dining are drawbacks - both of which could be fixed if management wanted to.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have mixed feeling about Uptown and if existing i would have rate it Good l not average and not very good. I stay 2 nights in a junior suite, the reception was very nice and helpfull but the extra bed in the suite was below average and the 2 nights were noisy due to ambulance going full noise to the nearby hospital in the middle of the night. Breakfast is good. Transferts booked to Malpensa overated.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a person that works in a Hotel whenevr i travel i always check trip advisor for the latest comments of the property where i will be staying. I contact the property itself and i book directly. Thats what i have done for my 1 night in Milan with the Uptown Palace. Initially i was looking for a Hotel away from noise, centrally located and 4* category. I booked mtystay directly with the Hotel. Reservation department was very very helpful. Upon arrival we were given room on the 10th floor. The room was cleaned to a high standard and it was big. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Reception desk very helpful. Breakfast of a very good quality. Easy to get a taxi from the Reception. I would like to mention Patricia from the Accounts department that helped me out when i had a query about my preauthorisation, she really went the extra mile to hekp me out. The Hotel must be proud of having such an employee. Would definitely go back to this Hotel on my next trip to Milan and would definitely recommend the Hotel. Thank you
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful Hotel and only a ten minute walk to the Duomo. Rooms are very clean and comfortable apart from the single beds being pushed together to make a double. Staff very helpful. Breakfast various choices to be had. Only downside, no english speaking channels on the tv other than a BBC and sport.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are traveling from oversees and have early arrival DO NOT book this hotel. When I made a reservation to the Deluxe Room I specifically asked to have my room a little earlier if possible since I was traveling from New York with my 12 y/o daughter. When we arrived at 9am the room wasn’t ready. I inquired when to come back the receptionist replied that check-in time is at 2pm and we should have reserved our room earlier and pay for extra night to be able to have our room as early as 9am. Unbelievable!!!!! And this is instead of offering me and my daughter to go and have a breakfast that they were still serving on 3rd floor! What a “wonderful” way to greet people from another continent!
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Short taxi ride from airport (less than 20 euros). Warm welcome. Good service -- in particular we were initially given a room on the 3rd floor near the restaurant and then asked if we could be moved to a quieter room. We were promptly moved to a lovely room on the 8th floor. Clean room with modern facilities. Twin sinks and amazing shower. We didn't test the breakfast -- we preferred to walk into the city to try any of the enormous number of excellent cafes. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of the duomo and other sites of interest. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The interior of the hotel and its rooms is stylish in a conventional way; the rooms have comfy beds with good pillows, and can be darkened properly (curtains). Note that some rooms have shower only; Wifi was not working in my room, but did in others (was travelling with colleagues). For an Italian hotel, the breakfast is quite good, with a reasonable choice and homemade products; for self-caterers (eg water), there is a supermarket next door with long opening hours.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think some of the reviews below are too harsh. Yes breakfast is a bit functional, yes free wi-fi is a bit slow (fine for browsing) and yes there's a faint whiff of sewage in parts of the corridors (probably more to do with Continental drainage systems than anything else). However, fundamentally this is an impressive, very well located hotel that you'll feel good about coming back to after a day's sightseeing (which is how I judge a hotel). If you fly to Linate like I did you can get to and from this hotel for the grand sum of €3, the current bus terminus being less than a 10min walk away. I spent a couple of nights here to in order to see several art galleries and walked everywhere. The Duomo and centre is less than 10 mins away and pretty much all the of the major galleries (plus the canal) within 25 mins and that's ignoring all public transport. If you've landed on this hotel I'd just book it and save yourself the time on more research.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To the contrary of the few bad reviews posted for Uptown Palace, i was pleasantly surprised that i had a really wonderful stay! Reception staff was helpful from the time of check-in to our departure. The room is really new and clean! I had an enjoyable stay! The bathroom is really huge with 2 separate sinks. The only complain we had was the faulty hair dryer. The hair dryer would die off once we on it on max and could only work on low air. This meant that our long locks needed more time to dry. Plus point, there's air-conditioning in the room.The location of Uptown Palace was amazing. 5mins walk down the road is a Carrefour express and had everything we needed. A Pharmacy is also right around the corner. Duomo Milan is a 15-20mins walk away and so easy to navigate. The only downside is that the area outside the hotel is under metro construction now and I'm not sure how would the noise level be for the hotel guests in the day. All in all, we had an enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were clean and modern and overall a nice stay in Milan. Breakfast was decent and had good choices. However, WIFI connection was horrible and we could barely do anything online with their FREE WIFI. Don't market something as FREE if you are not going to provide it earnestly. I had so much of trouble making online tour bookings or even checking-in for flights; basic for web browsing and not movie download. I've stayed in other 3-star hotels that had better WIFI connection then here. When i called down to the reception for some help with our local tour booking, i was just told they tried too and couldn't do the same thing due to a site issue on the vendor side and not on their WIFI; they also recommended i upgrade to the premium high-speed WIFI for 9euros a day. All in all i think the poor wifi is a ploy to get people to upgrade. Generally, very disappointing for a business hotel. I doubt you will be able to send any emails from this hotel. Other then this, hotel, while is walking distance to Duomo can be a little far for those that don't prepare very long walks. it is about 2 tram rides away, so not very close. Good that there is a supermarket close by but other then that there is nothing much within the vicinity. I wouldn't mind coming back here or recommending this place only if they upgrade their wifi connections. If Wifi is a must for you on trips, don't bother with this hotel; the snail speed will drive you up the wall.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Non-welcoming unprofessional staff need to know how to smileUncomfortable bed & pillows. Waked up in the morning with neck pain Bad location. Difficult to reach and far from the Domo Poor breakfast with limited options
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked two rooms for the Spring breakWe chose this hotel based on the reviews which now makes me wonder if I stayed in the same hotel !!!?? I will summarize my experience in the following points: -Difficult to reach the Hotel by driving using google map because of construction around the hotel.-Location is not the best if you are visiting Milan for shopping.-Very UNFRIENDLY staff at check in, hardly answers any question, and the staff at the check out was very rude (worse than the one at check in), as if they never learned how to smile.-The room was very small, no seating area although there was a chair that can not be used as no space for legs and it just made the room more tight.-Bathroom was of good size though.-No complementary water bottle !! But a kettle with tea bags and coffee are available.-The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows were the worst I have ever used, it guarantees you a neck pain next morning.- Coffee at breakfast tastes like dirty black water (sorry for the description).Not recommended at all
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I write from my room at the Uptown Palace. It is a little on the small size and feels quite dark on this rather grey March morning. On the plus side, there is a decent size and comfortable bed and my bathroom really quite smart with a spacious shower. I can see why this would be considered a 4* hotel even if the accommodation is not quite as plush as I have seen elsewhere.I have two tips for staying here. Firstly, accept that you will want to pay Eur9 per day for internet connection and, secondly, go out to eat. I didn’t pay the Eur9, not least because I object to paying for internet connectivity, but trying to work on my laptop was then a slow and frustrating experience. I can’t say that the restaurant serves bad food and actually service over dinner was good and efficient but the room is dreadfully lacking in character and ambience. I think a short walk would probably serve you well.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: still staying here, first it's in great location, breakfast is ok, the internet is free...which must be a joke, my girlfriend spent the better part of an hour trying to load a page on her laptop. complained several times and even brought the laptop to the front desk..she was told this was acceptable. decided to pay the extra money to get the faster internet, it's so slow I can't even do that.
hotelName:
20    Uptown Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival after a 30 hour flight at 9:30am the staff went out of their way to get at least one of our rooms ready. They provided space to get changed and freshen up.Breakfast was good (especially coffee) and the location is awesome - just a few steps from the train station, restaurants and open top bus stop.A great 2 night stop before heading out of the city.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good accomodation for a quick stop over. Located close to the main Milan Train station & metro. Close walking proximity to shops and local attractions. Lovely buffet breakfast. The staff here were accomodating & the rooms clean (family of 4 between 2 rooms)
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotels was very close to main train station, nice staff, clean rooms, good tv and channels, great wifi, good breakfast. It was perfect for our one night stay. I would definitely recommend it and stay there again!
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Made res for hotel to cap off our visit to Italy months in advance. The room we were given was directly above the restaurant and lounge. Major noise issue long into the night. Bathroom stank of sewer.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was blown away by the friendly staff who in every way went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. The hotel was clean, neat, and very comfortable. I could not ask for anything better in a hotel. Would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Close to train station. Quiet area so no worries about getting a night sleep. Rooms were exceptional clean and stylish and good value. I wi choose this hotel again on return to Milan and highly recommend it.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Just less than 5 minutes walk from north exit of The centrale station. Lobby is small but clean, neat, well maintained and decent. Reception staff were friendly. They gladly and patiently gave us really useful recommendations on nearby day trips. Room was not very big but sufficiently big. Definitely no problem to open our suitcases. Toilet was spacious and clean. Toiletries were provided. Cleaning staff politely greeted us in the morning and asked for permission to clean our room. We didn’t try the breakfast there but there was a lovely family style cafe just around the corner of the street and definitely recommended.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and modern hotel on a side street less than three minutes from the train station.So close to many restaurants, streetcar lines and convenience stores. Super quite and a great value. Fast check in and courteous staff.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional service and larger than normal rooms. Less than 10 minutes on foot from Centrale and 3 minutes from Sondrio station (yellow line). Neighbourhood is more residential which means good grocery stores, bakeries and meat shops. You need to travel a bit for better restaurants but it is easy. All staff speak English. This is the view from our room (206).
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near the central station. The location is very good but because of that the surround cleanness is not good. The inside of hotel is acceptable. The breakfast is good not excellent. I they have to add some hot dish a little more. But the espresso coffee selection was very nice. The room is small but similar with other hotels at Milan.The kindness of front desk was good. But I asked several question to find out some shop and failed to found out even I look around along with their recommandation.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location, close to central train station and we had a fantastic view from our room, facing the church. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice and the staff were very attentive. It is a great base for a short city break.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at Best Western Madison for two nights. The hotel is conveniently located in walking distance to Milano Centrale station and bus exchange, with shuttle buses to the airport. The area did appear somewhat sketchy though and possibly unsafe at night.Overall the staff were friendly and helpful. The complimentary wifi was appreciated, as was the generous sized elevator. The room was standard size. The bathroom was quite big, however despite placing the sign on the door, we were only provided with one towel each for the two nights. The shower pressure was also quite weak. The room was mostly quiet in regards to road noise however there was a pervading, intermittent banging noise throughout the entire stay that we could not identify. The bed was quite hard also. As such, this coupled with the noise led to poor sleep. We also had difficulty turning the heat down in the room so it became quite hot and stuffy, and opening the windows let in traffic noise.The major let-down was the food. We ordered room service a couple of times including pizza, two types of pasta, and steak. The pizza (when it was actually available) was mostly fine but was only available on one night. The pastas were lacklustre in flavour. The steak was very tough, fatty, and inedible. My partner ordered a toasted sandwich and it was burnt (see photo). The bread provided was also stale and disappointing. I also think charging 5.50 euro for the room delivery is excessive. A buffet breakfast is offered in the restaurant each morning. Unfortunately it was disappointing. Toast was very difficult to make and took a very long time. The hot food was rubbery and lukewarm, and the eggs tasted “fake”. The pastries were also stale and I saw a hair in the fruit salad.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is conveniently located only about 5 minutes walk from Milano Centrale, so is perfect if you are making your way to Milan by train. The room was not so spacious but it was clean and comfortable. Most staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, very good value.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just completed a one night stay here, and it definitely exceeded our expectations. Roomy, clean and with a very comfortable king sized bed. Very professional front desk staff also. Thank you to all for a great stay!
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel turned out to be a real find. It is located one short block from the Centrale train station and is on a rather quite side street across from a large church. The location is really convenient because of proximity to the train station and also the bus to the airport. There is a subway stop in the train station and a ride to the center of Milan takes only about 10 minutes. Also, there are good restaurants on the side streets near the hotel. There are quite a number of larger and much more expensive hotels in this neighborhood; among them the Madison is a standout value. Our room was of a decent size with ultramodern appointments. It was equipped with everything including a smartphone that was provided for our use to carry anywhere in the city during our stay. The hotel served a very nice breakfast and the staff was friendly and helpful. On any future trip to Milan this is where we plan to stay.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had to make a quick trip to Milan and found the Best Western to be the perfect place for us. We could walk to all the places we needed to go. The staff spoke excellent English and made sure our needs were met. Room was clean and comfortable. Delicious breakfast in the morning. With the high speed trains we were able to get from Venice to Milan in two hours.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well located in a quiet street next to Milano centrale a few minutes from Duomo and teatro alla scala by metro. Very clean and decent room. Very nice staff. My room was ready when I arrived at 11.30 am which I did appreciate. Price reasonable for Milano where hotels are quite expensive. Will use again this hotel when in Milano
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location near Centrale. Very friendly staff. Car park in house but with limited space to 5 cars max so booking is essential. Good rooms but a little bit tired. Breakfast is very basic. Don’t expect much. But coffee is great. I guess a lot of things are for sale at breakfast.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place to stay. The location for this hotel is great so close to Milano Centrale train station. The room wasn’t very big but all we need for a 2 night stay. We caught the train to see the Cathedral and sites in Milan (3 stops) very easy. The breakfast was very good and all you need. Make sure you try the restaurant at the end of the street fantastic inexpensive food. Would recommend staying here.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed one night as we arrived late after our flight from the US. The hotel is easy to find and a 5 minute walk from the Milano Centrale Station. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, both at check in and check out. Did not get a chance to try the breakfast but the room itself was spacious and had a balcony. The bed was comfortable and the water pressure on the shower was strong. To be honest, this is one of the nicest BW I've stayed in. We had a great night's stay and would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is literal steps from the central station, so it is awesome for location!! Check in, they were genuinely pleased to see us and check us in. Room was great, quiet and clean. Breakfast in the morning was terrific, hand made cappuccino's and a good sized selection of items for breakfast. I would not hesitate in recommending Hotel Madison!!
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is good, very near to the central station. Breakfast is not included, you need to pay 8 eur daily. They have free internet connection, it works. The room was clean. You have two bottles of water free but they didn’t put the second one. There is no slippery. The shower was small
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a 4 star hotel located a walking distance from the Milan Central Station. Great for travellers arriving and leaving by train. Them main attractions are more far away thow. Nevertheless there is the Sondrio metro station nearby.The rooms are nice, confortable and not too small.The breakfast is ok, nothing much but has everything that is expected.The staff is friendly and polite.Nothing very good but also nothing very bad.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here on November 2017. this is the best place that is very close to central station. 1 block from bus stop at central station (we were using bus from Malpensa airport) Milan is such a quiet city at night except the Duomo area. because I prefer to stay near central station rather than Duomo, I have to make sure the area is safe and near the public transport. Staff is very friendly, room is small but clean, fit for me and my husband. enough for having a good rest. they provided a handy phone in our room that we can bring outside and can be use free for local call and internet. will recommend this hotel to others.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is ideal. Near to the train station and it not so noisy. Everything is within walking distance and for Muslim traveler, halal food is just around 10 minutes walk.The staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel provide a mobile to help traveler getting around Milan.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I didn't pay attention to it until I was ready to check out. My bad! I'm too cheap to buy an international call/text plan for my iPhone when I'm traveling in other countries, so I can only use it when I'm in the hotel or a restaurant with free WiFi. But at this hotel... Each room has a cell phone you can borrow and carry around with you for navigation and all the things we love cell phones for. Free! What a lovely perk and the only hotel I've run into that offers this. The staff is friendly, the rooms small but clean, the beds hard, but...a cell phone you can borrow...! :-)
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was spacious, A/C and appliances worked well, service was good and linens and breakfast were spectacular. Hotel is a short walk to Milano Centrale in a decent neighborhood so it was optimal for a short visit to Milan. Only improvement would be the room’s bathroom which was ok but could be updated to make a 5 star rating.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is near to the central station, which is useful for tourist using high speed trains. The staff was also nice and helpful. The room was clean and spacious , I like the map phone idea .
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night before return flight home. Very nice breakfast for 6 Euro. Rooms are ok. Pretty average but decent size for Europe. Front desk staff were helpful as they stored our luggage while we visited for a night. Great location near train station.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights in May 2018. Initially my review was going to be much different than a rating of "4" but the hotel staff was able to change my mind. After arriving, our room seemed to be quite warm, compared to the lobby and adjacent hallway. I inquired to the front desk, which sent someone up to check on it within minutes. After adjustment of the thermostat, we stayed in the room for about another hour. There didn't seem to be any difference in temperature happening. We decided to go out for dinner, and mentioned to the front desk that if there was no change by the time we got back, we would be requesting a different room. After dinner we arrived back almost 2 hours later. As we entered, the front desk mentioned that they checked and there was no problem with the room. Upon entering the room its temperature felt no different. We gathered our belongings, and went back to the front desk. They gave us a different room with much better air circulation, and temperature. The room was upgraded from a regular room to a suite, which was very nice of the staff, even though we did not ask for that. Comparing the two rooms, the suite was very nice due to the extra space, however the regular room definitely had a more recently renovated bathroom. The hotel breakfast (included with the room rate) was EXCELLENT, with lots of various items to chose from. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, and would consider staying there again.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 4 nights in may. The location was perfect for the 2 day work conference as well as exploring the city. The central station is so close and many metro stations and trams are available to get you wherever you want, although many of the main tourist areas are walkable as well. The hotel is comfortable and the breakfast was great. Would recommend this hotel for a well price place to stay while exploring Milan.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night to see some Milano highlights. We didn't expect much but were surprised with the luxurious and spacy room. The hotel is coveniently located near Milano Centrale. Staff was a bit formal but very friendly. Breakfast was great. Good value for money.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the first hotel that we stayed during out tour to Italy. Fantastic hospitality, nice rooms, wifi connection and good Breakfast option. Breakfast costs Euro 6 per person. Its very close to Milan Central Station - 5 min. walk. There are lot of hotels nearby. Stefano was extremely helpful and very supportive to our requirements. This was one of the best stays in Italy.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this for a surprise birthday present for my partner, and we were not disappointed. It is only a few minutes walk to Milano centrale when you can easily get to anywhere in the city via train/metro/tram. The staff were brilliant and told us the best areas to go for what we wanted. The hotel was clean and the room was always in perfect condition when we returned on an evening. The bed was so comfortable, I slept wonderfully every night. Our room was on the side that faced the church so our view was always lovely. It is a quiet road so there was rarely any noise. Breakfast was beautiful, definitely worth the price. Everything was fresh and there was a great variation of meats, breads, fruit juice, cakes etc. The staff were also very welcoming and attentive every morning. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, it was close enough to the city for us to easily access everything but far enough not to be too expensive and loud. There were lots of restaurants within walking distance where we had some great meals, and there is also lots of good shopping in the train station only a few minutes away. We highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very convenient hotel as it is some 300 or so feet to the Central Milan Station. The station has connections to all or most of Italy. Walk a few feet go to the station , take a train to Venice in 2 and half hours. The Station is also home to the "Buses" from and to Malpensa, and buses to Bergamo and other sites. The Milan trolley car terminus is here and you can take the trolley to Navigli, the last stop. The hotel is located on a quiet street with a nice Italian Coffee Shop and around the corner from a great small Deli. The rooms are large. The breakfast is large. A super place
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great central location. We were on a short tour of Italy and relied on trains and buses, so the proximity to the central railway saved us time and money. Only 15 - 20 minutes walk to the shopping district which again saved time.Our room was a good size, wardrobes, tea/coffee making facilities and clean modern bathroom.Our stay was certainly made very easy with help from Stefano and Klaudio on front reception. They comprehended and answered my questions (in english) giving advise on restaurants and clothes shopping. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Great work gentlemen - THANK YOU.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for four nights while in Milan. The hotel is two blocks from Milan Central Station. You get out of the station from the right side instead of the front. Look for the signs for buses and taxis. You walk straight two block- you will see a big church in the end of the second block which is where the hotel is located. The streets are well lit and we felt safe walking the area in the evening- being watchful, of course. The hotel is very clean and the room and bathroom were very good in size. The front desk staff were helpful, specially Stefano. He was very customer friendly with a very humble disposition. We left for Verona for two days and then came back to stay at this hotel for the remain of our stay. The hotel held our luggage for those two days at no cost !!!!! this is a great service and a great reason to stay here. We were able to bring only a carry on with us which was very nice. One thing though, on our second visit, the room assigned to us had the thermostat locked at almost 80 degrees F. (26 C). I called the front desk and they send me someone who had no idea how to fix it. I called the front desk again and a gentleman came to assess the situation. He offered me another room, but with a queen bed instead of a king bed. The room was also much smaller in size. No discount was offered to me. But, in lieu of all the positives, I left it alone.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very close to the main terminal for train and access to metro. Easy to locate and walkable distance. Located a few stops from Duomo and other tourist spots in Milan. Our room was very modern. The bathroom was new and recently renovated. However, room 129 smelled. It smelled like a sewer back up. We ended up opening the bathroom window and closing the door to air the bathroom out. We only spent one night in the hotel so we decided not to make a fuss about it.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were nice and we had a lovely modern room with wood flooring and a good amount of space in both the bedroom and bath (shower) room (although not sure if the accessible rooms have more space than the other rooms, for some reason we were given an accessible room, perhaps it was the only twin room left...), it was generally quiet except when we could hear the toilet flushing from the room next door.Things which could have been better was to have curtains or be able to control the external window blinds, there was only see-through nets and the external blinds were halfway down and we didn't know how to control them (if we could). Lastly it was a bit disappointing the bed linen wasn't changed as I noticed a small stain on my duvet cover which I didn't fuss about because I thought I'll let them change it the next morning but they didn't, makes me wonder if their housekeeping knows the procedure that's on the hotel's changing bed linen card left in the room, I intentionally read it but it made no difference, if not for this issue then I would have given this hotel 4 out of 5.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very optimal for a city traveller, only a few minutes walk from the central train station and still situating by a street with minimal traffic. The suite room was spacious with a very good air conditioning, silent (although situating in the first floor) and with comfortable beds offering a good night sleep. The reception personnel was polite and very helpful. Very satisfactory breakfast. Really recommended.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chosen primarily for convenience of the area we needed to be in, so was not particularly close to attractions but was right near metro lines. Was excellent service and good value. Staff were wonderful in helping us with things we needed, and accommodated our request to leave our car parked in the space beyond our check out, as our tour did not arrive back in time. Very clean rooms.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at Madison twice in the last month, we find it very accessible to the city of Milan, very close to the Central railway station and metro. The rooms were a great size very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and will go out of there way to help you, beautiful breakfast.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a quiet room at this hotel, and was so happy that it came with a balcony where we could sit and have drink in the evening.All in all the room was very nice - comfortable and quite large. We were on the 4th floor and the location of the room certainly ensured that it was quiet with no noise from inside or outside.The hotel is located in a very handy location, close to the Statzione Centrale with plenty of restaurants etc. close by. Staff in the hotel were very helpful, allowing us to leave our bags there after checkout and giving lots of useful information about travelling into Milan and to the airport.Amazing breakfast - lots of choice and great value for money!
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B.W. Hotel Madison in Milan was a great choice. Very clean, good price, short walk to the train station (Stazione Centrale) , copious breakfast, and nice staff . Good option of restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is average and what I'd expect from a Best Western. It has nice size rooms, decent bathroom, we had a view of the church. The staff was friendly and professional. The property is two blocks from the train station which was great for our early morning train to Switzerland. I didn't stay long enough to explore the area but my niece, who was alone for one of the two nights, was able to find her way around without a problem. We used booking.com and didn't have any issue.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked-in on May 19, 2017, we totally booked 6 rooms, and arrived the hotel at 9am. The front desk was a very friendly kind and handsome guy, he used to work in Shanghai. When he knew that we just arrive Milan after flying 12 hours, and we were going to have meetings in the afternoon, he arranged several rooms for us to shower and to change clothes. We truly appreciate his understanding.The rooms are very clean, not very small. Breakfast and wi-fi very good. Location is very good. 5 min walk from train/metro station. Good value. Easy to catch a cab.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in February 2017 in single room. Everything was good, except the room was a bit small - but it still had everything one would need.Breakfast and wi-fi very good. Safe car parking included. Location 5 min walk from train/metro station.Good value.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel Madison twice during our Italy trip. We choose this hotel because it is very close to the Milano Centrale train station and because the cost fit our budget. The hotel is located a short walk from the train station. The hotel is very nice, comfortable and clean. The rooms were modern and well appointed.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I did not know this hotel when booking, and did not know what to expect. Very conveniently positioned near the main train station in Milan, but in a very quiet street. The room I received was very large, modern and comfortable. Staff was extremely polite and useful. Even when I called to get directions to the metro they very patiently instructed what to do. Price was very fair, and breakfast (for only €6) was excellent. I recommend and will go there again.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there on business and enjoyed my stay very much. the staff was very nice and helpful, the breakfast was very good (yes, I am talking chocolate croissants) and there was free wifi in the room which came in very handy as I needed to work.I would definitely go back (there's a very cool looking church right outside the hotel that I didn't get to see).
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Initially we had a fairly decent night at this place when on our way through Italy to the 2017 Moro GP race in Mugello. We sat at the bar most of the night and when returning to sleep the rooms were fresh and spacious. The trouble started the next morning at breakfast. We noticed most of the food at breakfast was stone cold and most of the containers holding the food were left open to the elements. When asking for fresh food to be put out one of the waitresses simply snapped at us saying "yeah I hear you, 5 minutes" how rude. After all of this the following day, 3 out of the 5 people in my party fell ill with food poisoning making our trip further into Italy extremely difficult. One of our party has had to leave early and is returning to the UK with gastroenteritis. When complaining to the staff at the reception after our dreadful breakfast, we were told to have a nice day. We will be taking this further as it has absolutely ruined out trip. AVOID THE FOOD!!!!
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fine and fair service. Excellent location, very close to the central station and to the metro. Good service and good wifi also. Breakfast was quite bad and they also charged 6€ for that, so that's reason why I'm giving a 4/5-rate.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located about 5 minutes flat walk from Centrale station, which makes it ideal for late arrivals or early departures. It is better than the many budget hotels around the station, but of course not as grand as the luxury ones. This is reflected in the prices.The hotel is clean, well decorated, and with friendly staff.The bedroom (a standard double) was very small, even for one person. It made if difficult to open a suitcase except on the bed. I would have been frustrated if staying for more than one night. The bathroom however was excellent, well appointed with a good shower and plenty of room.Breakfast is buffet style and fairly standardised. The breakfast buffet bar is far too small to cope comfortably with the number if guests trying to serve themselves at the same time. But the staff at the coffee counter are very helpful.Overall I would stay again on a one night stopover, largely because of the friendliness of the staff, but the hotel seems to have crammed too many rooms into the space available. Not surprising given the convenient location.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean hotel a few minutes' walk from the main station, refrigerator, friendly service. Breakfast average. Hotel directory in room states breakfast is on 4th floor, Breakfast is on ground floor. Adults will have difficulty with the needlessly complicated WiFi login procedure and the elevators, which have a mind of their own when it comes to deciding whether and in which direction they are going to move. We will stay here again the next time we come to Milan.
hotelName:
21    Best Western Hotel Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Klima by mistake bc my usual hotel was completely booked. I have found an amazing staff !! Among all Samba and Andrea at the bar were exceptionally professional al courteous. Worth mentioning we’re also Roberto of the restaurant crew and Miguel at the reception. This hotel is not extremely convenient to my job, but I would love to go back.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel but fare from centrum, they have a bus who take you downtown we don’t use that service, we took taxi and was not to expensive. I use the parking facilities under the hotel and I’m happy with the garage
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ok parking should be free of charge television should have more international channels not only the boring free italian channels with no news value at all. Actually most of the channels are a pile of crap for an international visitor
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room with a huge bed that sleeps very well after a long day in Milan. Keep in mind that it takes you about an hour from the hotel to the Duomo by public transport. Breakfast is good and plenty to choose from.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If going a little out of town doesn't bother you then this is the hotel for you ! Although a little far (they have a shuttle tho) everything is clean, the eco- friendly concept is a sure thing to support. You'll have all the accommodation you'll need. Moreover the brekky is nice and diverse.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in an industrial area. They do offer a shuttle ride to the nearest metro station but it is still quite a long distance and amount of time to get anywhere. Pros:-got a good price-the common areas in the hotel were clean-the room was clean-it includes a decent free breakfast-they offer a shuttle bus ride to the nearest station-restaurant that is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinnercons:-nothing (no restaurants, stores, or anything else) within walking distance-far from the city center-far from the airport-far from the train station-the restaurant is open at certain times (this seems to be the trend in all of Italy though)-the hotel is dark and the rooms are dark (dark wall colors and very dim lighting)Overall: The amount of money that we saved on the hotel, we spent it on transportation. A hotel closer to the city center would've been a better deal.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall is OK for meOnly 1 thing that I have to comment & complaint, due to my room is located close to the public road and there have very noisy from outside. I could not sleep well. Please consider the noise absorbent or other as applicable for noise reduction.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay. Very clean and tidy room. Comfortable bed. No exterior noise waking you up. Breakfast was great. Staff was very polite and helpful. The only problem we had was to locate it. You can park your car either on the public road or pay 10-12 € to use one of their parking spaces. There is a shuttle bus available every half an hour or so to drop you off at the nearby train station. Really great value for money. Well done!
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent very good time at the hotel. The quality of the food was excellent. The receptionists amazing and waitress and waiters well prepared. Menu a la cart and food excellent. Location is bit far from city, but for business purpose it's more than enough. Well done
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is new, clean and has comfortable bed. The breakfast is awesome with a wide variety of food. There is a small snack shop which has starbucks coffee and tea inside the hotel. A supermarket is also nearby
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with good food and services. GReat coffee besides the fact that metro is not close to the hotel it was a good stay overal since we had a car so we could travel to get to the metro station.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very positive in general. Clean and tidy. Spacious. Quiet rooms. Value for money on this trip but too expensive in my next trip. It's going to cost me 3 times the amount i paid in this trip. Overall very happy.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: loved the vaction there, its a pitty that the hotel is very far away ,there are no taxi service. no restaurants near by. Visitors that didnt order half-board, found out that the location of the beautiful hoetl is problem/
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel without knowing nothing about Milano and became surprised about the location, it was away from crowds but still really close to center. We rented a car but hotel provides free transport to center of Milan during all day which is great. Great staff, great room and everything really clean and quiet. 5*
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quality hotel .nothing of note nearby ,so the rail station shuttle is essential .Once you get the railway travelling is great, Turin, mountains in the north....all a train ride from the centre I'm glad I persevered
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i wll be back if some days later , it is nice . rooms big enough , breakfast is also good.nice staff . thanks for the arrangement of Klima hotel .the lobby is lux , me and my colleauge have a nice stay here.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of 3 stayed for 3 nights in Klima Hotel in Milan.Pros:Clean and tidyGreat for business stayHas Tea in the roomClose to motorwayQuiet even with room on motorway side. Good shower pressure Good bedsSlippers provided. Cons:No coffee in the room. Room felt cold all the time. Perhaps because it has tiled floors with no rugs. But slippers are provided. Nothing close by for food so had to use room service. Although there is a supermarket close by 5 mins drive. Staff didn’t seem to be interested especially when we ordered room service or didn’t speak English so was hard to communicate as we dont speak Italian. €10 per day for car park. Stayed in the green painted room as per internet pic. Why green?There’s no concierge. Had to bring bags to room ourselves. This is a very business stay oriented hotel. And above is just my experience. I would give it a 3 star.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every thing was perfect except the hotel location, you need 10 minutes to the nearest bus station. But it was really excellent for the other services. Thanks to the reception girl, she is very kind and helpful.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. They operate a friendly, free shuttle bus service which is a few minutes from Milano Certosa station which is only 25 minutes from the centre of Milan.The rooms are lovely and clean.I would recommend ordering a meal in the restaurant which is very good with lots of choice. The Aperol Spritz are to die for and the perfect start to a break!
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here whilst visiting the nearby expo site for an event.Spacious business-class hotel, rooms were modern, spacious and clean. Reception staff were helpful and the hotel also offers a free hourly shuttle bus to the expo site (though it's only a small van, so there may be a queue).Food options at the hotel are good - the restaurant is high quality and the breakfast buffet is very good. Room rate offers good value for money, particularly in comparison to some of the larger hotels closer to the centre of Milan.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very comfort room with amenities for a cup of tea at night. Unfortunately the spa is charged which in others similar hotels the experience is included in the rates. Breakfast at 8:30 am was very busy and my family and I had to come back later.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent comfort /price report.Rooms clean, well fitted and comfortable.Restaurant with good food, even if the list could be wider.The only not so perfect thing is the fact that location is a little far away from the city.If location would be closer to a transport facility would even be perfect.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm simply amazed! Cozy and comfy room, clean and spacious bathroom. Staff is friendly and helpful. Amazing food masterpieces in the restaurant presented by our waiter, Samba who made our stay even more enjoyable with his proactivity at each meal offering the best drinks, presenting the meal the way we asked (he acted before we even requested). Well done Samba! Coctails are delicious, breakfast is tasty and has various choices. We spent two nights in the hotel and can't wait to return. My best European experience so far.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights as we were flying out from Milan and the rates were very reasonable. The hotel is really new and fresh with spacious rooms, however it’s quite far away from any bars or restaurants. There is a free shuttle bus that will take you to the train station, the day we were there the trains were unfortunately on strike, however we found a tram stop nearby and had a fun adventure using the tram system, which are really fantastic once you work it out! Overall it’s a nice clean place to stay but too far away from the action.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After bad experience in other hotel in Venice, we booked this place for $80 per night, large room and shower area, very modern place, free WiFi & near hotel free parking available. Only 6 km from the main city, Grate place
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a standard clean business hotel, staff are helpful and friendly. There is no reason to stay there unless you have business to attend nearby. Pros: - Nice staff- Gym - Mini fridge in room (not very powerful though)- Powerful AC - Kettle, safe in room - 2in1 shampoo shower gel, body lotion, soap, vanity kit, shower cap- Hair dryer- Comfy bed and pillows- Blackout curtains - Good variety in breakfast but same everyday Cons: - Very far from the city, no shops or restaurants around, ugly neighbourhood - Cold room even AC was off - No coffee, only tea bags and sugar in room (can ask front desk but it took ages to get them)- TV didn't work (didn't bother to ask)- Safe didn't work properly - Not enough cloth hangers- The temperature of the water wasn't very stable in the shower- There was mosquito in breakfast area
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent an overnight stay at the klima while attending the Italian GP.We found the hotel very comfortable and spotlessly clean.We had dinner in the restaurant and the food was excellent. The chap who served us was extremely helpful and polite. Even though he told us he was only starting in the restaurant we found him very good and made us feel very welcome. Breakfast the next morning was of a high standard with plenty of options. We will certainly be staying here again. When we attend Monza next year.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was very nice, very clean and quiet. The blinds in the windows are apropiate if you want a good sleep also during the day. Breakfast was good and staf helpful. We realy enjoi the stay at the hotel.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here on my recent trip to Crotone in southern Italy, I have to say the hotel is lovely. Everything you expect from a hotel. The staff were friend and very helpful, as we arrived late in the evening they were more than happy to help me and my partner get food for the night.I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Reasonably priced, not a terrible location. Great nights sleep
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms, the beds (extra large matresses) and a REAL third bed, the staff... I was really pleased with it all and have seen many many hotels. Normally I don't do so many reviews, but I want to help you find a good hotel!
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a 4* and worth it, but the location is not ideal if you want to visit the city. Shuttle service is not really useful due to delay. Staff is kind and restaurant is good. Unfortunately during our time there was a massive group stay of very rude co-guests that kept making noise at night and behaving badly at the breakfast room.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped at Klima Hotel Milano for a night over while driving through the area with a very late arrival. I can say that this hotel was the best possible choice of high quality accommodation, convenience by car to avoid all the traffic in Milan and a fair price. The room has everything you might need, with a huge bathroom and an enormous bed. Bed size and quality deserves and A++++! Will definitely come back again!
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice accommodation,modern and large rooms, the decoration of the room was beautiful and simple and the hotel has up to date technology used,stuff very pleasant and helpful.as a disadvantage I consider the distance from the center of the city in conclusion a really nice stay
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very quite, despite being very near the motorway. It has shuttle bus to train station and only 3 stops awy from the next undergraound station. Very convenient. Staff is friendly and generous. The breakfast is OK and coffee machine uses powder milk instead of real so I missed traditional Italian cappuccino but this was made up on the last day by simple asking for one :-)
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As I observed on the first day when I get in room No.115 there is some bad smile and I told to Janitor what is the problem?, she told me the Air freshener and I solve it. After We turn from Venice we get a nice room . During My stay I released that we have a wonderful service and well organized staff. I didn't mean you are 100% perfect compare with other 4 star hotel but you hotel on the way of perfection when you keep your service and add some other feature . Finally Please Avoid or try to solve city tax collection method.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel near Rho Fiera. They have a scheduled shuttle bus to Milano Certosa for travel into central Milan and pick up can be arranged by calling the front desk. Food was excellent. Staff very curteous and helpful. Hotel room was nice.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place and not too far from milan City centre... Breakfast was very good and hotel was very clean... Overall great value for money and would definitely recommend to anyone going to milan... I will be back
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to TripAdvisor I found this really nice hotel to crash en route to meet up w/the family. The rate I paid was a true steal at not even $50! Also the prices at the hotel were very reasonable: €2.50 for a mini bar beer and €10 to leave the car in the underground parking for the night. The room was very nice & clean, large comfy bed and a very italian stylish bathroom with rain shower. The TV has about 300 chanels, every single one in Italian, but Wi-Fi is free so what do I care, right? I skipped breakfast and headed into town, for the 20 ride you really need a car. The hotel is a bit remote at the fair grounds but right next to the highway exit so really easy to reach. Highly recommend this hotel for a save and quiet nights rest near Milano!
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the checkin I waited 10 min as just one staff available, I asked if the place was safe to leave my car outside, he said yes but take everything out from the car or pay parking... the hotel is outside the city, just the entrance of highway, 25 min by car.At the checkout I waited again for someone to come to see me as both receptionist were at the bar, when she came I told her I want to checkout. And the telephone rang, it was more important that me, so I have paid at reservation so I said bye, she screamed and run outside to say I have to go back, i wAs at my car and I said,No! Im guest and you have a horrible attitude to me, I didn’t appreciate when I was outside all guest smoking thought I was a bad guy, I’ll never go back!!!
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely helpful staff. Free shuttle bus was excellent taking us to the idays festival and also picking us up late at night. Free shuttle bus also drops you off at certosa Station a few minutes away and then it's just 5 minutes to hit the main centre of Garibaldi. Can't recommend this hotel enough, chuffed we stayed with them. Rooms also amazing and breakfast varied enough for our liking.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good breakfast, room service and price. Big rooms. Pros. Incredible sport center and Wi-Fi. Cons. Far of the center and nothing around. So so. Shuttle bus service to the exhibition at good hours but only with 7 seats. I never got to take it.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice hotel with friendly staff and good breakfast. The room is also very spacious.Only thing: the hotel is a bit far away from the centre, but a shuttle bus exists from the hotel to Milano Certosa!
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the hotels is located a bit far from city center it is cozy, nice and new. Quietness is also a bonus!We didn't try breakfast since we slept long (bed was very good) hopefully it is good too.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself was nice the area is industrial so not the prettiest reception staff quite nice however we went for dinner and had a horrendous experience with a waiter who was rude stormed off during a discussion paced back and forth muttering following his interaction with us where he stated we should talk more slowly to him and that he wasn’t stupid He was however rude and unprofessional Reception staff offered compensation we submitted a written complaint and nothing was done for us Very disappointing couldn’t wait to leave and avoided that staff for duration of stay.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice property. My only issue, is that there is nothing around this hotel but businesses, very little to no night life. No shopping and only one cafe/bar near the hotel. Otherwise, the hotel is very clean and very modern.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only spent two full days in Milano, so just one night at the Klima Hotel, but very clean, easy to get to and very friendly personal. A bit isolated from the city so you need a car, which I did and all worked out great. Go, Explore and Enjoy !
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean. Wifi is really good. Breakfast is very good quality. It's the only hotel offered salad during my trip in Italy. Fitness room is clean and provide enough equipment for the gym addicted. There is shuttle service to the centre train station at every hour til late at night.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything in this hotel was good. Looks attractive, the rooms are comfortable, the staff is nice and professional, breakfast is also good. The level is really good for the price. The only disadvantage is the location. It's far from center and surrounding area is not attractive enough. But if you have a rented car it won't be a problem.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, tidy and clean, and well deserving the 4 stars. The main problem I faced related to the location of the hotel, which was outside of Milano centre, and unreachable by train/bus or metro
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Some positive and negative to the hotel:1. The rooms are nice and bathroom was updated. However my sink stopper wouldn't drain, and I needed to physically lift it to drain the sink. I'm guessing the staff probably had to do the same but never had it repaired.2. It's a 10 minute trip to the fairgrounds and they offered a shuttle which was great. The traffic is so heavy in the area, it would have been a long drive every day to return to other hotels.3.Breakfast is included as was evening appetizers which was very nice.4. The staff overall was very friendly and accommodating.5. Downside - it's so far from restaurants and more so you need to have a car or take a taxi which is really expensive! The cost from the airport to the hotel via taxi was 95 euros. It's in an industrial type of area so there's no where to walk at all.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very nice, modern and clean. Room is very good designed, comfortable and quite. The wifi is very stable and easy to connect. There are lots of choices for breakfest. By the way, It has 3 elevators, and you do not need to spend much time for elevators. Overall, it is very nice hotel to recommend.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for the duration of L'artigianno in Fiera for 12 nights. Several disappointing service complaints - only 3 hangers in room, no milk in rooms for tea/coffee (when asked for they tried to charge extra), waiting area for shuttle at Certosa station dodgy and felt unsafe at night, hotel does not mention in advertising that if you wish to use shuttle you need to phone them (very expensive if you don't have a local SIM) , breakfast exactly the same for entire 12 days (when asked if it was possible to have something other than scrambled eggs was told we could have fried eggs for an extra 8 Euros), front desk staff unable to explain how public transport system works in Milan (until after seven days of our stay we discovered they sell daily travel tickets at the desk!!!), hotel claims to be green but provides polystyrene cups shrink wrapped in plastic for bathroom use, fridge not working in one of the rooms and unattended to when reported. Finally to cap it all our hired van parked directly in front of the main entrance to the hotel was broken into on our last night and our left over stock from the fair stolen.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just spent two weeks at the Klima and were treated with first class service. Maitre Rodolfo and chef Alessandro went above and beyond to serve us. This was a business event so every minute saved, every detail taken care of has a huge impact on our events.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall very nice hotel. Nice staff, friendly and helpful. There were only two drawbacks, one is that breakfast consists mainly from sweet options (a lot of sugar) but that's my perception and the other that hotel is a bit far from Milan center.
hotelName:
22    Klima Hotel Milano Fiere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was a decent size for European standards and quite comfortable. The bathroom was very large.Downside was no international power adapters were available to borrow from the hotel.The hotel bar was nice for the espresso when we first arrived and for a cocktail before ending the evening.
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first trip to Milan.Really Milano is a beautifull city the monuments are fabulous.The location of The NYX hotel is extermely important. The central station is located far a few steps you can catch the metro or train or bus to explore MilanPersonally i felt uncomfortable in the room because it is small compairing to other hotel room in different country.Or for the service we cannot complain, the only thing that we didn't understand that every day they add a body lotion, we endup with 6 packs but everyday we have to request for hair shampoo
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location by the train station is great for excursions and your only a 40 min walk or 4 subway stops from the main attraction , the Duomo. Our room was on the smaller side and one of the days, the maid was there when we got back even though we had the "do not disturb" hanging on the door. Staff is just okay there. No one really goes out of their way to smile or say hi. Breakfast had quite a few options (European breakfast speaking) and dinner in the dining room was mediocre food. The outdoor space and feel of the hotel is funky, just not warm.
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very clean and new, we love the modern style, friendly staff and comfortable! Located in a very central era, the room was nice size, and the bed and bath were great. we took the suite so our room was very quiet.We would like to thank specially, Monica from the front desk, she was amazing, she help us with every question, made us feel at home, recommended the best places, and she is such a lovely and kind person, and we will defiantly will return to this hotel thanks to her.We are looking forward to staying in NYX Milan again!!!
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at NYX for a night before returning home after 10 days in Italy. Location was fantastic - a stone’s throw from Milano Centrale where we took the train from another city and to the airport. Supermarket and eateries were just around, and a tram stop right in front of the hotel entrance.
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife booked us into this hotel for my 60th birthday treat. She chose it for it's central location. It's a stones throw from the Central station and a 50 minute bus ride from the airport. Access to the reception area is up a flight of steps, not a big deal really as there is a doorman at hand to assist with heavier bags. There appeared to be a stair lift if you cannot manage stairs. Rooms are serviced daily. We were in room 321, which is at the back of the hotel. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Our shower head holder was cracked upon arrival. We mentioned this to reception and it was repaired almost immediately. Our room was a bit noisy art times, but we put this down to the rumbling of trams on the main street. The bar looked very nice, but we didn't use it. Basically your standard city centre hotel.
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is centrally located just infront of Milan Central Station.Its. nice property with various facilitiesRooms are bit compact and try to get the city view room which is better.Breakfast was good and overall services were excellent Is tay their while on a business trip during Mid May 2019.The staff was friendly and eager to help.Their are many restaurants nearby and a Vietnamese's restaurant is just infant of the hotel.Overall its a good location hotel for business and holiday travellers.
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thought this hotel was just okay. On first impressions it looks great - very new and modern, very clean, however it became apparent there were many things that really let the place down. The hotel is not accessible at all and you have to climb several steep steps. There are doormen who are super friendly who help you with your luggage, so that is something, although they are really the only friendly employees here. We liked the art in the hotel and the other quirky features like the arcades. Our room also had a (small) balcony - only a few rooms here do, I believe. There is also a roof terrace, and we had very good weather during our stay.Reception staff were very cold. Room was very small considering the price paid. It is right next to the train station & tram line - good location wise, but very noisy on a night which would be troublesome if you're a light sleeper. Barman who served us drinks on our first night was incredibly rude and aggressive, we had one drink in the bar and decided not to visit again. It was also quite expensive (€20 for 2 drinks). He even slammed snacks down on our table without even stopping to say anything. Very bizarre?! We were woken up at 8am on our first morning by the housekeeping??? This was incredibly weird, they could tell we were in the room so have no idea why they felt this was appropriate. What was even more unusual was that they then waited for us to leave the room to get in and clean? Even though we had then placed a 'do not disturb' sign on the door, they removed this and went in. Never seen anything like it!! Our balcony door broke twice and wouldn't close, we had to get it repaired both times. Very disappointing. The minibar is extortionate, €5 for a can of coke? All of the other hotels we stayed in in Italy had free minibars or much more reasonable prices.We wouldn't stay here again, you can stay at another hotel very close to the train station which has a much larger room and a spa bath, with incredibly helpful and friendly employees as well as a free minibar, for around the same price.
hotelName:
23    NYX Hotel Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a group travelling to Milan for holiday in June 2019. We chose this hotel for its excellent location (2 min walk from the central train station) and good reviews on tripadvisor. We were glad to have chosen this hotel. Check-in was fast and efficient. We booked a deluxe room with a great panoramic view of the train station. Super clean and spacious rooms for Italian standards. We asked the front desk for local food recommendations and the Italian food recommended was fantastic. I would like to compliment Mr. Filippo, the front desk manager for his outstanding customer service and assistance after my stay.
