The young lady at the front desk could not have been nicer or more welcoming--which is fabulous after a long overnight flight. While we were waiting, we were invited to go up to a lovely 7th floor outdoor patio where we were served with coffee and pastries and told to relax until the room was ready. It was a beautiful day and within an hour, we were ushered into a fabulous room with a gorgeous bathroom and separate area for luggage, etc. One of the best arrivals in Europe we have ever experienced. For the remainder of our 3 night/4 day stay, we were pampered and treated like royalty by the front desk staff, concierges (who are tremendous), maids, bar staff, etc. The level of service we received here was second to none. The happy hour in the main bar is lovely with a wide variety of h'ors d'ouevres and a great way to start an evening out.. I would return to Milan just to stay at this hotel. Choosing the Principe Di Savoia for your stay in Milan is not something you will regret.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Asked specifically for a quiet room and ended up across from a room in the 8th or 7th floor with a constant barking dark who had clueless inconsiderate owners. Also we could hear at night the constant thumping of a neighboring disco club. The barking dog was more annoying than anything, and we were knackered, but could not sleep because of it. Hoteliers could do nothing about this, except when the guests came back (2 clueless women) the hotel moved them elsewhere, thank goodness. We received champagne as a consolation, which was nice, except we generally do not drink alcohol. Also, walking around Milan was disappointing - not quite the glamorous city we expected to see. Vomit and dog feces galore on the sidewalks. But hey, people obviously like it here. You can hear conversation just outside the room, so sound proofing is lacking.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in a suite on the sixth floor. It was very large, especially after two weeks of european-sized hotel rooms, and the appointments, ac, lighting, bathroom and bed were excellent. Unfortunately, our room faced air vents to the subway, and the periodic rumbling went well into the night and started again early in the morning. This was not controlled by the double paning and we were on the sixth floor. Needless to say, the sleep quality was not what was expected from a luxury hotel. The service was excellent and they said that we could have changed rooms. However, this would have disrupted our one day in Milan.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient to the train station (preferred travel in Europe), walking distance (modest distance) to the Duomo, La Scala and shopping on Montana Napoleone. Breakfast is delightful, cheery and well stocked. The bar is spectacular. Nothing missing in the room and the concierge was extremely helpful.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is excellent. Our room was large, modern, clean & comfortable. The service was top-notch. Concierge & reception staff were extremely helpful. Centrally located & within easy walking distance of all sights & attractions. Food in the hotel bar & restaurant was excellent. However, room service was below par— really the only negative aspect of our stay. Better off eating in the lobby bar. I would stay here again when in Milan, and recommend this property without hesitation.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got there late and i was the meeting planner for the group I checked in day early and was told by the desk that I had to pay my room for the night separately .........no problem i told her as I was the host...... three phone calls later it got sorted out !rooms were ok not like four seasons but what was really upsetting to my group is that we had to eat bfast in the bar while other guests were seated in the restaurant...... !
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is wonderful and a fraction of the price of other luxury hotels in Milan. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated in a classic style. At the end of our trip where we had spent many nights in modern and minimalist hotels, it was really great to have a large bathroom with tons of counter space. Service is impeccable on every level and staff at the restaurant is super friendly. Breakfast was included and it was a feast!Although it is not centrally located, it is a very short taxi ride to all the main attractions and the hotel does offer a convinient car service as well. Overall fantastic value.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful rooms, elegantly appointed, large well appointed bathroom. Big comfortable bed. Classic styling. Staff were very helpful. It was Fashion week so they were busy, however everything went smoothly. A bit of a walk into the city, however plenty of food nearby. great gym. Rooftop area is very small, so we did not use it.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of Milano's oldest and best, although it is slightly off centre. Decor is traditional, the terrace for outside drinks and dining is most pleasant, and the service is always perfect. The linen bedsheets and marble bathrooms are so comfortable.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the minute we walked in the front door, until the minute we left, the staff at this hotel was incredibly gracious, friendly, welcoming and helpful. We could not have been happier with our stay and gorgeous room. This was out last stop after a month in Italy, and we can say the trip ended on a lovely note. This hotel meets a standard that many attempt to meet, but often fall a bit short. Our experience could not have been better.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Classic Perfection a Lasting MemoryHotel Principe Di Savoia in Milan is the absolute place for you if in search of Classic Perfection and fabulous luxury. A Dorchester Collection property.Jacobo at the front desk will welcome you with a smile and precision in making sure you have the perfect room. And super quickly. Excellent service!The rooms have wonderful high ceilings, very quiet air conditioning and perhaps one of the most comfortable firm beds ever. Best of all, the high pressure shower a real treat in the fully functional and spacious bathroom. Classic elegance and modern functionality at its best.What you will remember best in this property is the amazing guest service and warm hospitality. Ask for Sabrina Renna the Guest Relations Agent if you have the slightest issue. She works her magic and leaves you fully satisfied. If looking for restaurant recommendations you just need to ask Fabrizio at the Concierge desk. His recommendations were flawless. No doubt a master of his profession. At the ever so generous breakfast spread do try the Cappuccino (outstanding) and the delightful fruit selection. The fruit is a must try. Ask for Flor de Maria. She is remarkably astute at knowing what you want even before you have asked for it. At Hotel Principe "Classic Perfection" is the lasting memory you will leave with.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are luxurious, spacious and wonderful. Had both a classic and premier room and they were great. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Made us feel very welcome. Did not eat in hotel but choices were intriguing.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As other reviewers have stated the hotel has everything you need. The pool is very nice with an outdoor sitting area high above Milano. The bed was comfortable and sheets were also of high quality which is expected at a hotel of this level. I have stayed at hotels that charge much more and are only of equal quality. So I think you have a fantastic value in this hotel. Great quality, clean, great service, and reasonable price. Not to mention the location is great - 10 min walk to centrale train station.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are no words I may find to explain the absolutely exceptional, unique, elegant, charming, uncompromising, unparalleled, beyond expectations hospitality my family has enjoyed in this hotel. It was always my desire to provide my family with a great opportunity to live and experience the best of life a trip to Milan can offer. But the service standards offered by the front of the house and housekeeping and concierge in this hotel could not have been imagined in my most wildest dreams. Their beauty centre is a unique experience of relaxation after strolling for shopping in Milan the whole day. From the bar in the rooftop you can sip away your Martini while enjoying an obstructed view of the city. And there is a limo service provided by the hotel for your convenient tour of the city. Therefore live the life of a Prince at the Principe
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed at the hotel for a few nights during winter visiting Milan on leisure. I had also stayed a couple of times in the past for business. The hotel delivers consistently high quality and luxurious facilities including rooms and high quality service. Breakfast is great, concierge, and staff attentiveness all earn high marks. It's location is not the best when you want to visit the usual attractions in Milan, but you can always take a taxi, complimentary shuttle, or do a pleasant long walk. I should note that the surrounding neighborhood has also improved significantly with some mixed use developments nearby including shops, restaurants, offices and residences.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Their is a special feel to the Principe, that no other hotel in Milan has, from a warm reception, to being quickly settled in your room. If for some reason the room is unsatisfactory, they will do all they can to find a satisfactory solution.Even the bellmen respond quickly, to have your bags delivered or taken down, and amazingly remember the names of patrons.The Principe has not moved, but the surrounding neighborhood has been so improved, with lots of surrounding buzz.A whole new business center in the back, and lots of night life and restaurants.The hotel service is really impeccable, from the breakfast room, the concierge and all the hotel services.The one place they come up short is in the gym, which has a stunning view of the Alps, and on clear days, you can even see the Monte Rosa, The equipment is old and has not been replaced in over 20 years, great view great layout, with stunning pool and really nice dressing room. The equipment needs real change, while instructors are very polite, they spend their time reading newspapers, waiting to train someone from time to time. It's a real pity, and a waste of a really beautiful space. A couple of Peloton bikes, and the latest equipment, and for instructors to make sure that clients know how to use new equipment, will be real added value to the Hotel. Otherwise the bean counters will one day come in, tear it all out and replace it with a bar and restaurant
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing weekend at the Principe, from check in to check out the service is truly 5*++++.our room was very spacious even with an extra bed in it for our 11year old daughter. lovely views from our 2 balconies of the city. The room was immaculately cleaned daily with a turn down service in the evening. Lovely spa with amazing rooftop views.We enjoyed pre-evening cocktails in the lounge, thank you Annalisa for such impeccable service throughout our 4day stay. The Breakfast buffet was amazing.The hotel has a limousine service to and from the city if you want to take in the sites.I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I return to MilanI would highly recommend this hotel if your looking for a truly 5star luxury stay in Milan.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At Principe Di Savoia the opulence of yesteryears meets the 21st century service delivery. This hotel is simply one of it’s kind! From the rooms, the pool, sauna and the breakfast! The concierge team is on another level. There is one specific gentleman, I think his name was Modesta. Excellent Service!!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an upgraded room ( thanks Amex!) in this beautiful 1920's hotel. While the rooms are modern you can see the detail in the mosaic tile in the bathrooms.. I even took pictures! We ate dinner here most of our stay and try enjoyed it. Thank you to Anna for making our stay fun and putting up with all of our laughter. We loved this hotel. The rooms are plush, the service is excellent. They have a shuttle that runs into the shopping areas. While it's not far, it was quite warm while we were there so it was nice to have a ride back to the hotel. Breakfast was amazing each day. This was our last stop of a 2 week trip and we highly recommend it!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was good but a bit too noisy!Expected more as I have been in other hotels from the chain in Paris!Room was too small though I booked a deluxe room and had an upgrade!Outstanding was the assistance from the Concierge team!!!They made up for the disappointment!!!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel at the end of my three weeks in Italy and my stay here was just as I had expected. Excellent customer service, with extremely helpful staff. Pool and spa facilities were good, free limousine ride to town centre is a nice touch, room very comfortable and clean. Didn’t eat breakfast here as there are lots of cafes close by that are not as expensive, if you like cats the Crazy cat cafe is a must! The only negative was the shower in the small old fashioned bath, the water pressure was low and kept going cold. This was reported and didn’t spoil my stay. 200 Euros for a private car to the airport, 90 Euros in a taxi or a five minute walk to the train station and a ticket costing 13 Euros. I know which one I chose.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After over twenty years I stay in this hotel I truly consider it the best in Milan, I do love others like il Grand Hotel de milan or the Four Seasons, but price wise the Principe di Savoia is unbeatable. Dorchester collection remains one of our family choices, whether at Coworth Park where we often stay or Principe, the quality of rooms, linen, size and general atmosphere is amongst the best you can find in the world. Aperitivo at the bar is truly a noce moment as well.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When the Principe Di Savoia was first recommended I hesitated because I knew there was a Four Seasons in Milan and that is usually my go to hotel. Well I absolutely made the right choice in booking the Principe! It is an exquisite hotel with very spacious rooms and customer service of the highest standard. When we arrived, we were greatly as if we were regulars with news that our room had been upgraded. The room was ready even though is was only 1pm. We quickly unpacked and went to the restaurant for lunch and again, received a wonderful greeting and a great table in the garden. When the people at the next table began to smoke (a big problem with outdoor tables in Italy) we asked for an indoor table. Our waiter quickly arranged an indoor table with a view of the garden. The food was delicious and looked as good as it tasted. The breakfast buffet was outstanding each morning of our stay and the waiters knew our coffee and tea orders after our first day and had it ready for us as we were being seated. I needed some assistance with a medicine that needed refrigeration and the hotel staff quickly and efficiently came to my aid. The bellman at the front door each evening was outstanding, getting us taxis, recommending walks, providing a map of the shopping and again, knew our names after the first afternoon! This is a quality hotel with truly amazing service. I recommend it highly.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. The food is beyond good, the staff is super friendly and they’re willing to help with anything you ask. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. It’s not besides the downtown but you can walk from there and be there in about 20 min.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous, spacious room. Huge bathroom with shower and freestanding tub. Impeccable service and hospitality. Turn down service was very nice. Perfect rooftop views! Transportation into town. The resataurant was a little expensive but very good food. Bar was a nice atmosphere.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Principe di Savoia more than 25 times and will undoubtedly continue to do so every time I go to Milan. It's just home to me. And a very comfortable and luxurious one!My favourite thing: the staff. Even though everything in the hotel is superb, the friendliness of the staff is simply outstanding. I feel very well taken care of whenever I'm there and they make sure to express it. They know perfectly well which room I like and will go out of their way to put me in it every single time.The food is amazing; from room service to the huge buffet breakfast, I love it all. And I simply love to sit at the lobby lounge while I work and enjoy a cappuccino, seasonal afternoon treats and of course, some great aperitivo. Again, the staff is always super welcoming and looking out for any needs I may have all the time.Rooms are all beautifully decorated (think classic, old-school luxury hotel) with all the modern amenities you may need (great TV) and I have never seen one that's not super spacious. And believe me, I've seen a lot of them.For my nights in, nothing beats trip to the gym, a visit to the pool and to finish it all, a great massage at the spa.Location is very good as well, a short walk to the Milano Centrale and a very pleasant stroll to the downtown/Duomo area.What can I say? This hotel has converted me into a forever loyal Principe di Savoia guest!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i stayed at the Principle di Savoia for 2 nights for business. The hotel looks like a grand dame, steeped in history and elegance. It's located close to the business district but within walking distance (20 mins) to the Duomo. The sign of a good hotel is the strength of its concierge service and here the hotel really shines. All of my questions and requests professionally and kindly managed. The front desk was good but not quite as user friendly....a mistake on my final bill was eventually corrected but without as much as a simple 'sorry'. Pity, because I was overcharged twice during my stay (I was also charged at the hotel bar for a bottle of wine instead of a glass).My room was lovely, with a convenient hallway that ensured that I couldn't hear any hallway noise. The beds were ok - a bit hard for my taste - but otherwise fine. The tv had a few nice sports and english language channels. The bathrooms come with great products (Aqua di Parma). The shower is fine but not as nice as other 5 star hotels. There is a gym which is very nicely equipped compared to other hotel gyms. It even includes a small indoor pool. Finally, the restaurant downstairs is good - the breakfast buffet is nice although the selection is not as elaborate as some. Overall, despite a few small niggles, I enjoyed my staff and would certainly return.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed here for 2 nights and wished it was longer. Everything was great!The staff could not have been more accommodating and always replied with "it would be my pleasure." Not exactly in the center of the action, but appreciated the quiet and exclusivity. If you want action, go to the rooftop bar at the Melia next door. On par with the Cipriani in Venice and Villa D'Este in Como. Can't wait for next visit.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for a conference and I think it is the perfect hotel for this activity. The room was clean and quiet and even if it was a smoking room there was no smell at all. Service was very good.In my opinion is not a touristic destination but more of a business one.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Milan for four days on a mix of business and pleasure and although the hotel was absolutely wonderful I found Milan a real let down. The hotel was incredible, friendly staff who were all very helpful. Lovely large, clean rooms with plenty of space and big powerful showers. Unfortunately whilst in Milan we were mugged twice and I would warn any visitor to be very careful when walking around the centre. One of the most annoying experiences was at the castle where there seem to be hundreds of African guys forcibly trying to place a piece of "lucky" string on your wrist and then charge you for it. We politely said no ten or eleven times but they just became aggressive and pushy, luckily the local police where nearby and we were able to call them over. Very unpleasant experience. I couldn't recommend the hotel enough but I won't be visiting Milan again. Another thing to watch out for is the taxi drivers, they are all ready to exploit the hell out of you. We asked the price for a taxi from the airport to our hotel and three taxi drivers told us 70 Euro, I told them I would just try Uber which they tried to put me off, they told me no Uber would collect from the airport.…. 5 minutes later a brand new Audi Q7 Uber turned up and it cost us 19 Euro to get to the hotel. We used Uber everywhere and were amazed at both how cheap they were and what incredible cars they all drove!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The welcome by Sergio was unexpected and most welcome; he was both kind and efficient.The room was comfortable, as advertised, with the best of furnishings an toiletries; Acqua di Parma. The standard of cleaning was immaculate, with the maid making a second pass before bedtime.While the hotel is ideally located between the main railway station and the cathedral square, there is a complementary pre bookable car service to the centre throughout the day.Of particular interest was the spa and gymnasium. Just amazing, located on the tenth floor with a spectacular view of the new city skyscrapers. Breakfast service was most friendly and professional, with all you would expect from this class of hotel. Beware, however, of any food or drink extras as these are eye wateringly expensive. €20 for an omelette. Seriously?Overall, I would recommend this wonderful traditional hotel and would use it on further trips to Milan.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first stay here at our son's recommendation. This is a large step above the facilities and service I had been accustomed to in most European hotels and the staff was the most friendly and accommodating. Our junior suite was perfect with two spacious rooms and a large updated bath. Breakfast was a great buffet of fresh items with something for everyone including custom omelets. The bar service was superb and the hotel gorgeous. All this was accomplished by a staff that was attentive but, not intrusive. Really appreciated the free shuttle service to the Duomo and La Scala.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Principe Di Savoia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for the first time for a business trip as I wanted to try somewhere different. I would definitely return as it was a great stay. The staff were very helpful with anything you needed. I had a superior double room which was a great size and had everything that I needed. The bed was a good size and was comfortable but the pillows not so much. The bathroom was a big size which had a big bath with a shower, lots of essential toiletries (which included conditioner which is good as not many hotels include this) a bath robe and slippers two sinks and plenty of space. The storage space was good as well as having the safe as this is key. I think for the room it would have been good to have more lighting as I felt the room was always dark even in the mornings. Breakfast was included and this was very good with lots of variety. Hot drinks were served to you which was nice. There was lots of choice and the yoghurts were great! Overall it was a good stay here at the hotel and I will be returning, especially to use the terrace bar which unfortunately I didn’t make use of.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our last hotel in our 2 weeks in Italy. I picked up a cold on my next to last day, and am so grateful I was at this hotel when it happened. The shower was amazing (they give you bath salts so I soaked my feet too), the bed was comfy and room service saved me since I was too sick to head out. The breakfast offered downstairs was excellent. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the tea in the lobby was a welcome touch. Great location - recommended!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had everything we wanted and the staff was very accommodating , good location, nice rooms, attentive staff and a nice roof top bar and garden which made for a nice place to stop for a while before we headed out each day. Would diffidently return when we are back in Milan
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We come to Milan very often and this is always the place we choose to stay. However, today, we are not going to review the hotel, the location and the staff (which is quite obvious that we like, by always choosing to stay here). We would like to share something of o major importance. That is, during breakfast, we saw a guy who was serving us. He was extremely polite, with a smiling face, very quick at his duties. However, there was something uncommon about him. When we asked his colleagues about him, we were told that he was "transitioning" and that, even though he was in the middle of the process, everybody respected HER true nature, by admiring and supporting the choice made. This is just amazing! This is the true purpose of a hotel, where everyone is welcomed and accepted for what he/she is, no matter what religion, race, skin, color or gender, that do not really matter. What really matters are, humanity, politeness, acceptance and respect for one's path. Many compliments on this! The whole world should be and act that way. Keep up with the good work, looking forward to seeing you soon again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot believe what a gem this hotel is .From the front desk staff totally awesome, bell staff amazing, and every thing in the hotel this was one of the best places we have ever stayed in in Italy. People told us not to bother with Milan THEY WERE WRONG! I absolutely love this city. From the people, the food, the markets, the history and the Opera it is a city not to be missed when travelling to Italy. This hotel is super convenient located close to everything. We walked everywhere. The bed super comfy the toilettries great I do not have one single thing that is negative.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Okay hotel - thought it quite expensive for the mixed variety of rooms it offered. We travelled as a group and everyone has something quite different for the same price. Okay but not brilliant.Lovely roof terrace though for evening drinks.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in this hotel 3 times and it is always a safe election: the hotel is clean and well located in the preppy area of Brera but the best it is its staff: professional and extremely nice! Always helpful and smiley. I tried the SPA as I was feeling a horrible backache and what I surprise I found Eugenia which gave the best massage ever!!! Even better than 5star hotel ones. I will repeat no doubt; great value for money
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicely located, especially if you're going to La Scala. Relatively pricey, but was attractive, convenient, and well-staffed. Clearly recently renovated tastefully, I was surprised when I asked for a softer pillow and they said they only had the two kinds of polyester pillows already in the room. Loved having an interior room with attractive greenery all around. And the room even had a balcony. Overall, a nice place to stay.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS:super hospitable staffprovided free cellphone that yo could make local calls and use data on during your stay. came in super handybreakfast buffet was super delicious and the best breakfast buffet I’ve had during our 10 city tour with different live music on a daily basisCONSrooms very smalllocation not as good as I had expected
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is in the best possible location in Milan. I was there for 3 nights. The room was so so. It was clean and quiet. Very small. The bathroom was upgraded but could use some maintenance. The breakfast was amazing! I did have dinner in the restaurant and was sorely disappointed. With so much great food in Milan, don't do it!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a brilliant location right in the centre of town. It has a fantastic roof bar which unfortunately does not open each night. Room was comfortable but in the small side. Breakfast was average.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We lucked out getting a room on the seventh floor with a jacuzzi tub at Hotel Milano Scala. We had ordered a superior double, but I think it helped that we arrived just about check in time at 2:00 PM. The hotel had a great location at the edge of the Brera on Via Dell'Orso, close to the Duomo and La Scala Opera House, the arcade of Vittorio Emanuele and near the fashion quadrilateral. We wished we had had more time to explore the area, but we only stayed two nights before a flight on our way home from Malpensa. We had good meals at L'Osteria di Brera and Obica. Even at these restaurants, a plate of pasta was only about 10 Euros. (Manhattan has an Obica, but everything costs fifty percent more.) There is generally a cover charge at the restaurants for each person of two or three Euros, but you can consider this as a component of a tip. A new Starbucks that was said to be the biggest one in the world had just opened up on Via Cordusio. The room itself was a reasonable size, and the bed was very comfortable. Everything was pretty high tech. There was a large patio looking out over the city, and steps outdoors leading down to terraces with a rooftop vegetable garden for the hotel restaurant and an outdoor bar. The hotel staff were very professional and helpful. The hotel provides an iphone device with mapping software, so you shouldn't get lost in the city. There were many good choices of things to eat at breakfast, and a young woman was playing a harp there one morning.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay with good service. Very close to most of sights.Good tips from concierge where to go and how to get there. Location is excellent. Live music at breakfast icing on the cake.Will visit again. Many thanks for the whole personnel. Must visit:Opera, Dome, Brera district. Take a day out to lakes.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location, close to all the major tourist attractions in Milan. I had a knee injury when I arrived the day before in Italy and needed to get a wheelchair because of pain and walking difficulties. The front desk staff helped us find a medical supply store and also drove us there, provided us with an interpreter, and drove us back! All of this was done with a smile and graciousness. The room was small, as they tend to be in Europe, but clean and the breakfast was the best we had in Italy hotels. Can't say enough good things about our experience there.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located near la Scala, Il Duomo,,etc. this small luxury hotel has both attributes that make a good hotel great - clean up-dated physical features, and a staff that goes out of their way to accomodate your every need.Buffet breakfast was more than ample with fresh squeezed juices, baked goods,eggs, etc.Antonio on the front desk and the wonderful concierge were both most helpful in heading us in the right direction be it to a special restaurant or out of the way sight that most casual tourists might miss in Milan. Would not consider staying at any other property in Milano!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is clean and in the right spot, but there are probably many more with these attributes. The rooms are so small, you hardly feel like you can breathe. No less 2 people are just too many. I’ve been in many Italian hotels, but this one wins out on tiny. If you are staying more than a night, find another hotel. It’s very well situated near everything. It’s expensive and just not comfortable. I know we could have done much better and be much happier. Our stay in Milan was diminished because of this hotel. The breakfast is good, service ok.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well located, 5 min walk from the Scala and shopping places. We booked a superior room and it was very nice. The breakfast is great with a lot of choices and a real international buffet. The staff is very friendly. But careful the car park doesn’t find all the cars: we booked a parking spot at the hotel but the car doesn’t fit in but they managed to find a place in another car park close by.Definitely a place to stay in Milano.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely small hotel within walking distance of Milano Cadorna Station, close to Brera area and within 5-10minutes walk of Duomo, La Scala etc. staff were very helpful and breakfast the best on our whole journey.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Milano Scala for 6 nights in August and were very happy with our choice. Our long flight from Australia arrived quite early in the morning and the lovely reception staff settled us into the Libary with coffee while our room was prepared so we could check in early. Our room was very comfortable, clean and nicely designed, and the breakfasts were very nice - but the real highlight was the staff - the front desk staff were very helpful and friendly (Yolanda, Andrea and Simone all looked after us with good humour!) and the breakfast room staff were also friendly and looked after us well, as did the porters. We were very taken with the morning music performances - you don't expect a live performance by a classical musician while you are having a hotel breakfast! We particularly enjoyed that (we heard harp, classical guitar and harpsicord), a very nice touch. The hotel was really well located for what we wanted to do - a very short walk to the Brera Art Gallery and all the Brera outdoor restaurants; also very close to the Duomo, the Museo Poldi Pezzoli, and the Ambrosiana Art Gallery too, and of course the Galleria. Alas in August there were no shows at La Scala, but anyone visiting Milan for the opera would be perfectly located at this hotel (as it is just down the road). A very nice hotel and thank you to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is about two blocks from Castle Sforza, which is awesome - full of a wealth of beautiful artifacts - and a short walk to the Duomo and Galleria. We had "Superior Rooms" which were bigger than normal rooms, and had a quirky balcony in the interior that surrounded a courtyard. There is a rooftop garden that I am sorry we missed. We will be back.This was a family vacation and we rented two rooms for the price of one at some other places we looked at.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights and would not hesitate to recommend. The cleanness, size of room and hotel staff were brilliant. The rooftop bar is lovely to sit and watch the sun go down and was a nice place to read our books for an hour or so to recover from doing the tourist things. Lovely places to eat are around the corner. The staff were probably the best thing about this place. They gave us wonderful suggestions on how to get places, were to go shopping when we didn't want to go to tourist area and even gave us a late check out so we could shower before starting our long flights at 5pm. My only suggestion would be to have a muesli at breakfast with other cereals but saying that the breakfast was still really great. We would happily return.Cost E$13 for Taxi from train station and E$20 to Linate airpor. Easy walk to tourist attractions.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All good. Breakfast was a good variety of food. The room was nice and quiet. Staff all very friendly and helpful, made us feel welcome from the start. Location is convenient for the Duomo - although no where is particularly far in this compact city centre.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel. Super friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are very well laid out but a bit tired. Breakfast is excellent and the roof terrace lounge has wonderful views. The location could not be better, between La Scala and the Duomo and the the Brera and designer districts. Lots of fun fashion, good food and one of the best museums in Italy, Pinacoteca Ambrosia.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Muito bom! Quarto, atendimento e localização maravilhosos!Esperamos poder voltar em breve!Very good!Room, service and location are wonderful!We are looking forward to going back soon!Grazie Mille!Andréia and Marcelo
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our one night was wonderful. Great truffle restaurant nearby and close to all attractions. Attentive desks clerks and good AC! Highly varied selections for breakfast. We would go back happily! Easy distance from train station by Uber or possible to walk (< 2 miles).
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not at all happy with d hotel. They switch off d room AC without informing you. Room service is poor u ask for any thing it takes them couple of hours to deliver. Buffet breakfast is so so. You ask for a omelette they charge u 12 Euro without informing you. No view as such from d room. No chairs in d balcony. Will not stay here again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very confortable and luxury (bathroom)Good service / helpfulGreat breakfast with live musicBar a bit “Cold” and rooftop bar closedSuper well situated close to the scala / duomo / mode centre / lot of restaurants
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Generously sized Superior room with elegant and spacious bathroom. It was a very big step up into the tub/shower so take care getting in and out. Fiveute walk to Sforza Castle and 10-20 minute walk to the Doumo and The Last Supper. Varied European style buffet breakfast was fine but a bit bland. Extremely friendly and helpful staff provided good dinner recommendations and advice on how to get around. Lovely rooftop bar has a great view of the city. Aperitivo was varied and tasty. Wish the bar opened earlier than 6 as it would be nice to have an earlier drink after a day of sightseeing.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Make sure you book a table for the rooftop bar on arrival! It fills up quickly and even as a guset of the hotel they will deny you or hurry you along if you don’t have a table at this popular spot! Definitely the highlight of the hotel, but the buffet breakfast affords abundant options and all are pleasant. Concierge services make valaint attempt bit seem to be parttine.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here was a delight, a wonderfully helpful concierge, great front desk staff, good breakfasts and a roof top bar. The hotel provided us with good recommendations on what to see and where to eat, the concierge planned our day with a range of interesting places which we would otherwise have missed. The standard room is comfortable and a reasonable size. The hotel location is great for sightseeing (we didn’t need a taxi at all during our stay). Book the bar - it gets busy.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in Brera - room round inner jasmine covered courtyard did not have a view but for the central location was remarkably quiet. Our standard room was compact but well equipped - the breakfast was good and internet and AC worked well. Roof top bar is a plus but note you will need to book and it is - we thought - surprisingly expensive. Reception staff are a delight - friendly and helpful - while efficient .
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Rooms are small . TV is old with a small flat screen. The gim is very small with few old equipments which are not suitable for a 4 stars hotel. Price is too high for what you get . If you do not mind to walk 5-10 minutes you can find many other alternatives.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came there after checking trip advisor feedback and faire prices. I knew it was nicely located but no real clue of the hotel . Absolutely perfect , very nice employees , warm welcome , nice breakfast , parking just close to hotel . Very trendy settings , nice bathroom ( bath might be dangerous for old person , then ask for showers ..) . We will come back for sure for an another concert or show ...
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Milano Scala is in a great location not far from the Duomo and the Brera district which has great restaurants. The staff were very helpful and provided great service. The included breakfast was an amazing spread with eggs, Italian meats & cheeses, fresh fruits, assorted juices, coffee and pastries. Would definitely return!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was for business in Milan and had to be in the city center. Hotel Milano Scala is the place to be. Rooms are good, silent location, pretty nice staff and nice roof terrace. Best experience was the breakfast. The quality of the breakfast is really good, but the best part was the lady playing the harp. Amazing wake-up call and not expected. What a blast and what a way to start the day. Compliments!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a business trip but it felt like an indulgent vacation! Original and attractive room deco, welcoming hotel staff and facilities, plus walking distance to everywhere you want to be in this gorgeous city Center. The hotel also offers massage appointments but you must book in advance. In my one hour of free time, I walked to the botanical gardens enjoying some wonderful window shopping and then stopped for a people watching coffee at The Bulgari hotel.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located very centrally in Milan, the Hotel Milano Scala, is tucked away. Friendly staff greet you from the start, the rooms are well appointed and breakfast is not to be missed.Air conditioning works well (the heating system is cranked up in winter), or if you wish you can open a door. A very pleasant three nights.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The quintessence of an elegant boutique hotel! Perfect location in the center of MIlan within walking distance of Teatro alla Scala, Piazza Duomo, the fashionable shops and restaurants around Via Montenapoleone and trendy Brera district. Quiet and relaxed atmosphere,modern,spacious rooms, all amenities, extremely friendly and most helpful management and staff. What a lovely experience in all respects!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You cannot beat the hotel for its location in the midst of the vibrant Brera district, a stone's throw from La Scala Opera House and 5-minutes' walk from Duomo and the Victorio Emanuele II Arcade.as well as the Visitors' Information Centre where most local excursions commence.As many reviwers have rightly commented, the standard guest room is very small indeed, but this is more than made up by the nice ambience of this modern boutique hotel, its highly personal service, well provided and sumptuous breakfast which is accompanied by the soothing melody of the harpist to begin your day. The charge is not cheap for a 4-star hotel; but for its central location and superb service, we would certainly like to return here on another holiday trip.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s has been a fantastic experience The hotel is located in an excellent area. You can visit some places by walking. The service is good but I want to leave my special gratitude to the concierge that took care of me as a friend in a situation that scared me. The breakfast is fantastic. You can eat very well before your long walk in the area The room is clean modern and comfortable. I strongly recommend.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beauty of this hotel architecture is indescribable. It is a very old building that has not sacrificed the beautiful details in converting it to a hotel. I requested a change at the last minute and the staff was most accommodating. Rooms are spacious and very quiet. I intend to return to Vencie and stay at this lovely place again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last weekend I took my 15 year old nephew to Milan to see the match ACMilan - Juventus and to enjoy the city. The Hotel Milano Scala was recommended to us by a friend. The location was superb: a 10 walk from the Malpensa express station and 5 minutes from the main sites in the center. The spectacular rooftopbar even offers a view of the Duomo. The room was very nice and boasted a balcony. It was a big surprise to find a cell phone in the room, called “Handy”. The Handy came preloaded with useful maps, tourist advice and a great list of discounts. It furthermore offers free international calls! A really nice feature, and fully complimentary. The brakfast buffet was sumptious and there was live music on both mornings. We were served cold coffee, and when we asked for new coffees, the staff was very apologetic and extremely friendly in their response. Location, amenities (Handy!!) and the friendly made our trip. Thanks team Hotel Milano Scala; we will be back!!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice boutique property in the downtown; convenient to the old business district. Excellent service by staff.Comfortable rooms, fast elevators.Unfortunately was unable to use the outdoor patio seating, but was a nice draw.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The moment we entered the hotel , we felt something was wrong. The decoration looks awful in the reception. The staff is super friendly and efficient in the check in process. We reserved a junior suite and when entering we were shocked. The rug is really worn, the sofa is so uncomfortable ! It seems like an elephant was sitting in it for a month. The floor lamp is broken, the furniture is scratched , the nespresso machine not working !!! And the worst of it is the red “theater like “ curtains are covered with dust and made me allergic immediately. Location js good , in Brera neighborhood, all kind of restaurants and cofee places around. Conveniently located near The Scala and Il Duomo.I believe this hotel needs some work , for 350 Euros /night I expected something better.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel with fabtasic balcony to green garden. Good rooms and fantastic bathroom. Reception with excellent service attitude (Andrea you are one of the kind, thx). Good smart parking (although it is tough to get there with car with all one way streets :)). Excellent brakfast and the live harp music really makes it special. Will come again!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stay here six to eight times a year as we go in and out of Italy. A delightful small hotel, beautifully located, near to La Scala, the luminous Brera District and Museum, and the Palazzo Real. Warm front desk service, rooms that are pleasant, clean and quiet, if not particularly spacious (it’s Milan, people!). They recently helped us secure tickets to La Scala, we have arranged a couple of times to have our bags picked up and sent to the U.S., they have a pleasant bar and the breakfast is more than adequate. Do not ever imagine that you can book a room here during Fashion Week, however! It is appropriately priced for its location.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location in center of city - easy cab ride from train station and Europcar office, one subway stop from express train to Malpensa airport. Small but not tiny room, VERY well appointed, balcony overlooking inner garden, generous breakfast, helpful and knowledgeable concierge. Very happy with stay.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. This hotel is a short distance from the duomo and the Brera district, in a lovely part of Milan. As a solo female traveller I felt very safe walking around the district. An aperol spritz on the Sky Terrace after a days sight seeing is a lovely way to end the day.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend was just asking me if I knew any great hotels in Milan. At first i said the Armani is great, and then i remembered the Scala. We stayed there last year and it was wonderful. and so reasonably priced. I suggested that above the Armani.We took a suite which whilst not large, was perfectly ample, particularly as we had a balcony and a small terrace. The location of the hotel is perfect and within walking distance of everything we wanted to visit. The staff could not have been more helpful and even organised secure parking for our car, 2 minutes walk away.Breakfast was good and the restaurant and bar were excellent.All in all, this is a very comfortable, great value hotel in Milan.Is it better than the Armani? Of course not! But it is better value for money, and just as enjoyable.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here at the beginning and end of our two week Italy vacation and found it to be a good hotel. It's small and boutiquey, the staff is very nice, and the rooms are a good size. It met our expectations.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is perfectly located. A short walk to the major tourist attractions and to amazing restaurants. Breakfast was good. The staff were amazing and extremely helpful. Our room was generous but we did upgrade so more expensive.The roof top terrace had a wonderful view but was too costly. They could get more business by properly pricing the roof top terrace.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is a very good,well located,clean hotel with good staffs.we were there from 17/07 for five nights.we were three .when booking about three months earlier i had kindly asked for a courtyard,twin bed and higher room.but none of my observations was considered and they gave me a room in first floor toward noisy street!!!!!!also tv did not work properly.the sofa bed was big but not comfortable.we had a 11 hours time with no electricity and not a usual breakfast for that morning.i know that loss of electricity may occur every where but handling the problem is important which was not good.it is expensive hotel for the value.also breakfast was average with not skilled servants.so according my experience it is an average hotel but does not worth the money you pay.however it has a good location,skilled staffs,clean rooms.and finally playing different music instruments during breakfast was awesome.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has all that is needed for a perfect stay in milan. I found the hotel very clean and the bathroom was spotless with a good shower .It's in a really good position to walk to the shops the cathedral And the centre . The breakfast had a good selection though there was quite a wait for coffee . The roof top bar made good cocktails, served lovely nibbles and played good music when I was there.All if the staff without exception were lovely . I have left 1 star off as I would have liked tea and coffee in my room. But I knew this wasn't supplied when I booked. I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very friendly and helpful, room was comfortable (I was on the side with a terrace), breakfast buffet was great, and location was great--short walk to the Scala and the Duomo, good restaurant/cafe options.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Milano Scala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for one night at this unique hotel, which was about 15-20 minutes walk from Milan Central Station.Our room is on level 2, in the middle of the garden with 2 rooms below and 2 rooms above. The furniture were of old fashion, but room was big with a double bed and another single bed (so can accommodate 3 guests), the bathroom was renovation and new, with sky light coming down from above.Pro: 1. Room was big and clean and stock with basic amenities.2. Breakfast was comprehensive, and service was good.3. Staff were friendly, polite and professional.4. Although the hotel is “near” to Milan Central Station, but if you have heavy luggage, it is advisable to take a Taxi which cost about Euro 10.5. We managed to find a few Chinese restaurants nearby, serving good authentic Chinese food at reasonable price.Cons:1. My room was at level 2, but without lift. Thank goodness we have hotel staff to bring the two heavy luggage to our room.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was impressed with the service - very slick and welcoming, and a great first impression of Milan. It was a little walk to the sights, but absolutely acceptable. Room was a little small, but nicely designed (although a very awkwardly placed towel rail in the small bathroom made things tricky!) If you can avoid the smokers, there’s a lovely courtyard in the back which is perfect for drinks and breakfast. Would certainly stay again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for just one night. Our rooms were lovely clean and spacious.The bed was wonderfully comfortable. There was a quite beautiful courtyard where it was nice to cool down in the shade. We kept our luggage at the hotel as we were catching a night train the night we checked out in the morning.,. We found the young gentleman on duty in reception very helpful and friendly.We would have liked to stay longer.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel Sanpi Milano. The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk from the central train station. It is very close to a Metro stop. While the area around it is very busy, it is on a street that doesn't get as much traffic. Our room was very quiet. It was small with little room for our luggage. The bathroom was very nice, large and modern. WiFi worked great. There were ample plugs for recharging devices. Front desk staff were very helpful and accommodating. They allowed us to keep one of our rooms after checkout time which was much appreciated. Breakfast was excellent! The garden is lovely. The gym is quite small with few machines, but at least they have one. Hotel Sanpi Milano is a good choice for a comfortable stay in Milan.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this hotel is superb,our room was lovely with a particularly good bathroom,great shower. This was the last of 5 hotels we had stayed and definitely,the best. We cant wait to return to this little oasis in such a busy city.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it’s a four star dated hotel.The two most helpful and friendly ones behind reception were Daniele and Paola . Thanks for your help in directions and writing on map and taking time to explain . Also the Japanese restaurant next door was superb , all you can eat for dinner £22 well worth it to splurge out.Breakfast was great.Hotel was a 30 min casual walk toDuomo . I wouldn’t stay any further away as June was hot!I got lost walking from main central train station but will be walking there 30 mins approx , when I leave to take train toAirport - as have the map now for main streets so looks easy :)And it’s £5 tax a night , I did think Expedia included this but appears not. Still happy as quiet room requested and it was and early booking price discount good.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: wonderful hotel and staff! Milan not so great but the hotel lovely. Very busy city and crazy driving with lots of horn honking. Staff very professional and helpful. Breakfast was great also. The loveliest garden to eat it or just enjoy.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Sanpi was much, much nicer than we expected. We stayed in room 108 and found it to be very comfortable and conveniently located. When I booked the room and saw that it included breakfast I assumed it probably would be continental but I was very wrong. They have meats, cheeses, eggs, breads, fruit, vegetables and just about everything you can imagine except. You get to eat on real china with silverware and it's all in a beautiful setting. We found the staff to be more than helpful. They helped with directions, suggested places for Apertivo and much more. There's no doubt, we'll be staying there again if we head back to Milan.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my son for one night, hoping to catch a good sleep before leaving Italy. Unfortunately had a room on the first floor towards the mid-garden area, and could hear all the noise from there until about 2am. Calling the reception evicted one party from the garden, but this was only temporary relief. The rooms were definitely not sound proof to this direction! Shame really, since otherwise the hotel was perfect: location excellent, staff helpful and polite and also the breakfast was great.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service at all times. Very easy walking to all places. Would recommend this hotel to overseas travellers.Restaurants close by are great. Laundromat easy accessible. Shopping and hop on hop off bus easy walking.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well located hotel, near to metro station, stores and Corso Buenos Aires. A cozy hotel, room very clean. Staff are nice and helpful. It was great staying there. I would come back and I recommend it to other visitors in Milan.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great breakfast each morning, amazing cocktails at night, good value for money. Friendly staff. Lovely garden area with an “egg chair” to relax in. We spent a night in the garden ordering drinks and playing cards. Nice atmosphere to relax. Rooms have a comfy bed. Always made up perfectly by the cleaners each day. Iron and ironing board available on request. City tax is €5 per person, per night. Payable when you check out. A bit noisy from the street, but only really noticed it in the morning. Good selection of restaurants and bars nearby. Would recommend to others
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms vary, but ours was a delightful room with Art Deco features and wooden panelling. A pleasure to stay in. The bar staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very extensive in a very pleasing room. The price was extremely reasonable given the quality of the decor and general ambiance. I would happily stay there again. Overall a friendly atmosphere prevailed.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights. Location is excellent. It’s just about 200m from Via Buenos Aires. Also about 10-15 minute walk from la Stazione Centrale Milano.Breakfast in this hotel is fabulous! The selection is wide and quality very good.Staff are friendly and helpful.The room we booked was a Superior double. Be aware that these rooms have a deep bath with no ‘stand up’ shower; this means that the shower rose/shower head is attached to the wall, not far above the bath. One must sit in the bath and duck head under shower rose to wash your hair.You can detach the rose and stand up BUT it’s difficult to wash with only one available hand while holding shower with the other. You can of course ask your partner to stand and hold the shower rose above your head whilst you wash.Or, select a different room style.Room size was fine, with good wardrobe space and the bed was comfy.Afternoons the bar is open for drinks in the courtyard area - very pleasant.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Sanpi was one of our favourite hotels on our 5 week trip of Europe. We wished we could have stayed more than 2 nights.- Really great location. - Close to lots of cafes and restaurants. Try Pave around the corner- 15 minute walk to Central Train Station. - Multiple trams close by including #1, #33, #9- Staff very friendly, helpful and accommodating- Room was clean, quiet, a good size, great storage, modern bathroom, balcony overlooking the courtyard and the bed was comfy too (we stayed in Room 115)- Breakfast room and bar had beautiful decor, courtyard garden was lovely- Breakfast had a lot of variety especially with dietary requirements like gluten free options- Great value
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good and friendly staffgood location,close to metro stationgood value for moneyroom is clean and tidyservice is very professional andeffecienta very nice boutique hotelroom is very quiet especially when it is facing the gatden
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having seen the pictures on the website I was disappointed with the room we had. It was functional and clean but very dated. Nothing like the pictures. That said the hotel is in a good position and the staff were helpful and pleasant. Our room was overlooking the side street which you would expect to be quiet but with the trams passing at the top of the street we could hear these right through the night making sleep more difficult
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This nice hotel is situated between the city centre and the central station. Although the walk to the city centre is a little longer it can be done part way through a very nice park. Tram route 1 also runs by outside so you can catch that into the centre if you want. We found the staff very friendly and pleasant and our room, being a corner room was very spacious with a very smart large sized bathroom. The breakfast is very good with cold continental and some hot food can also be found. (Bacon and eggs for all us Brits!) More specific hot foods can be ordered at a price. It's kind of a boutique sort of hotel and I'm not sure it works all through the building. Certainly downstairs in the foyer and the eating areas it does but not so much upstairs where it looks a little tired. The only thing that vexed us in anyway was the lift we had to use each morning that was very reluctant to come up to our 2nd floor no matter how many times we requested it! It seemed to hover around -1 to the first floor. One morning we got so tired of waiting (despite requesting it several times) we used the adjacent fire escape stairs that were open. This though was our only real quibble.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is beautiful. Staff were friendly, kind and would do anything to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Location is very good with an easy walk to Milano Centrale and close to main attractions. Would highly recommend staying.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in a superior room for 3 nights in May and our stay was wonderful Main points:Room was spacious and light - fantastic bathroom amenities No noise from other guests and minimal noise from outside Breakfast was continental - plenty bread, spreads, cereals and fruit Bar service at night was always prompt and served with a smile and polite chat Their garden (although not warm enough for us to sit out in the morning) was lit by fairy light at night, very romantic! There are even blankets by the door so you can stay out longer and be wrapped up. Hotel is a 10-15 min walk from centrale station and there are metros are either end of the street so super handy!! There are also tram stops a few minutes walk away Reception keep your key when you go out which I think is a huge bonus personally, the keys are quite chunky so less to carry plus less chance of losing said key! Tourist tax for us was €5 per person per day and we paid on check out, super easy. We would not hesitate to recommend hotel Sanpi to our friends and would most definitely stay again!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in the city center. Bar and restaurant is small and intimate with a very nice garden. Breakfast is excellent and staff is friendly. There is some notice from the street at night but nothing big. We had visitors in the garden;-)
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous service, courteous and extremely helpful staff at front desk and room service. Lovely spacious rooms. Our stay was very very nice . The location is very strategic in terms of public transport and even to walk to nearby Pier, Dolmadace palace, Istiklal street, Taksim square, Galata tower. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent Hotel, great breakfast, good located between central station and Placa Duomo, excellent serviceminded staff and great , clean , nice rooms with good bed.Nice garden to eat and relax in. Perfect gym.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Impressed with the welcome and service from staff, who were accommodating and helpful in booking taxis, providing information and finding us a spare adapter when ours broke.Breakfast was nice, the rooms were comfortable and tastefully decorated, but the best feature was the garden - a little oasis in central Milan.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Sanpi for 3 nights when visiting Milan. We found it a pleasant 15 minute walk from Central train station and easy to find. Located central walking distance between the station & the Duomo. We were greeted in a friendly manor and check in was easy & straightforward. Our luggage was taken to our room on the first floor. Room was clean and spacious with a nice shower, tea/coffee making facilities & a comfortable bed. Breakfast here is absolutely fantastic - a great selection of cereal, fruits, eggs, cold/hot meats, pastries & cakes. But the real credit to this hotel is the helpfulness of the staff. Upon moving on to visit another part of Italy we realised we had left behind a highly important valued item & called hotel Sanpi to ask if this had been found. Daniele went completely above and beyond and was the most helpful & considerate hotel employee we have ever dealt with. Luckily housekeeping had located the item & Daniele ensured that this was kept safe for us at reception for when we were able to return a couple of days later to pick up. We are forever grateful to this hotel for their kind help & would certainly stay here again when we return to the city. Highly recommended!!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel Sanpi for 4 nights . We had a lovely time and enjoyed our stay.The breakfast was lovely and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would like to thank Christian who ran the bar for all his help . He always took time to talk to us , and recommend places to go. And gave us directions!!! As this was our first time in Milan we really appreciated his help.The personal service given by all the staff meant that we felt like a friend rather than a guest at the hotel. All the staff from cleaners , waitresses and reception were very friendly. I would definitely recommend this as a great place to stay in Milan. Thanks Lynne
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived early. They were accommodating and took our luggage and let us return for check in an hour ahead of schedule. The room was large with tall ceilings and a divider separating the sleeping area. It had a spacious bathroom with good amenities. The breakfast had a good selection food. The people were helpful and friendly. We like this hotel and would return. Our room was ground floor corner, so there was some street noise but to bad.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the place and people , will def go back , best value for money Went with my teen Easy to get to from train station Immediate street a little dicey at night as far as neighborhood but it was safe Great restaurant in and out Superb staff
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is about 5 min walk from the red line metro that connects to attractions and shopping areas. It is a 15 min walk to the central railway station. Is is located 5 min walk from Corso Buenos Aires where a lot of shopping can be done. Some nice restaurants are located also very close to the hotel. As for the hotel itself - breakfast is perfect hot and cold variety of food and drinks. The room was OK, AC worked well, the bed was comfortable. The staff was very kind. My complain is that it was a little dusty is some places.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - nice room with a large bathroom- staff very friendly and helpful like during the stays before- very rich breakfast buffet- close to metro station to the centre- shopping facilites nearby (Corso Buenos Aires)
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sanpi Hotel, central placed in Milano are absolut a visit worth. I was visiting Milano together with some freinds and I can warmly recommend to stay at Sanpi hotel. The hotel have good rooms, good breakfast and a wonderfull back yard where you can enjoy your breakfast or just a cup of coffee. Quality and price is quite good.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a very pleasant stay for us. It is a lovely hotel but it is the staff who really make it special. Very charming and helpful. The room was very comftable and good working A/C. Bathroom was clean and large enough for two to get ready in. We would stay again. Very handy location for access to the whole city. Some nice bars and resturants in the area.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff in this place were all absolutely amazing. Very friendly, helpful and engaging.By the time we left after four days, I felt like i knew many of them personally. They don't have a full on restaurant but the breakfast buffet had a good variety and the food was very fresh. Love the location. Walking distance to the trains or subway.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third time in Sanpi Hotel and every single time been surprised how they manage to exceed expectations with every single customer.Very friendly staff going extra mile to make customers feel at home.A big thank you to every single staff member!Gabriel
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi All, I stayed in this hotel over the weekend. best location, plenty of bars and restaurants near by, 2 min walk from the main shopping street. gentlemen receptionists, gave full details of shopping area, to the san siro. thank you all
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located and we had a nice experience in our one night stay.its also in a fairly funky (but not loud) area, where there are lots of local and diverse foreign restaurants around.There's a gym (which isn't common in Italy hotels), as well as a bar with breakfast. Breakfast was fine, but nothing special.Most of all though the staff were really nice and helpful.In particular, my wife and I were looking for an aperativo place with a buffet. Online research wasn't working out, so we called the front desk. Within 10 minutes they had found us a great spot just 7 mins walk away.Love that kind of serviceALSO - the price was very reasonable.Overall, a happy experience.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful day & night in Milan and staying at the Sanpi was perfect. The location is wonderful, close to the central station and shopping. And close to public transport to get to all the cultural attractions. I even managed an early morning run in the park which is 5 minutes from the hotel. The hotel is clean, modern and the staff are helpful and all speak english. We have an 8year old daughter and the hotel is child friendly.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you are a traveler and you spend a lot of hours in hotels, you really appreciated feeling at home, with people who know your name and your preferences and take care of you. The best if to do it in a wonderful environment so close to the center in a walking distance and surround of nice places to go for dinner.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was great. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Free water and chocolates in the room (nice little touch) 20 minute walk to the main station. Staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The barman made fantastic cocktails and got bar snacks (again a nice little touch).
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel definitely gets a 10 out of 10,great atmosphere and great location.Rooms are very clean and beds comfy.Cant day enough good things about the staff,they go above and beyond to make sure all your needs are met.Also when you book with them you can access their digital concierge scrollidea,found this a very useful service as I was able to source tickets for attractions that I couldn’t source anywhere else
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice quiet, spotless room facing the lovely garden where we enjoyed our nightcaps served by a cheerful bartender. The hotel is walking distance from the Central Station (if you are traveling light) and also from the major sights so we found the location convenient. Also lots of restaurants to choose from in the neighborhood. The breakfast buffet was very good. Overall we were happy to stay in this hotel.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located between the Gardini Pubblici and the Central Station. It's a pleasant walk through the park or an enjoyable ride with the old tram to the city center. Well located for a city weekend.The hotel staff compensates with friendliness and service, e.g., broader than expected breakfast choices, late staying bar staff or prompt help with reservations, for a bit outdated rooms and bathrooms. The neighbourhood can be a bit noisy, but since I have lived in Milan for a while, I know that it is a loud city.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had to cancel our booking due to medical issues. The room has been payed for 1 month, but one person had chicken pox and we had to cancel. The property informed us they have a non refund policy even in this situations.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here and was very surprised. First, the rooms are outdated. The AC in the room wasn’t working and became so hot at night, I called down to see if I could get a fan or something and was told they didn’t have any.
