I opened the window which helped cool it down but then had a mosquito flying around the room and noise from the outside. The next morning my girlfriend woke up first and noticed ants all over our bathroom. The ants were coming in from their garden and swarmed our room. We were then moved to a new room after I showed them. The bartender wasn’t very friendly and when I asked him where a good restaurant is he said to ask the front desk. For all the nice places we stayed in Italy was not expecting what I got. The pic is from just outside the room where they were coming in.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an issue with the fan not working and toilet was loose. Manager quickly gave us a nicer room, extra plug in fan, wine and chocolate. Very kind. Service and helpfulness could not be better. Whether it was to get us a cab, print something from my email etc. people at the desk are extremely helpful.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reasonable Hotel in convenient location. Staff pleasant and helpful. Breakfast comprehensive also bar menu. Some noise from early morning deliveries. Local information in room would have been helpful. Plentiful supply of toiletries.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Milan for a weekend city break, and chose this hotel, as it was not a chain hotel and had a bit of individual style. The location was convenient for access to metro, and other transport, and there were many restaurants and bars nearby. The immediate location is not terribly attractive, but seemed safe enough. The public rooms were well appointed and there is an attractive courtyard area. There are many different room styles, including suites and balconies overlooking the courtyard. The staff were excellent; very helpful and friendly, and all spoke good English. Our room overlooked the street, and was a little noisy, as we had to leave a window open, because the a/c didn't seem to work, but this wasn't a big issue. Overall, an enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel convenient for both central station and metro. Staff extremely friendly and knowledgable. We had no issues during stay but i’m Confident if there had have been they would have been dealt with. Good breakfast and bar. Bathroom was a bit dated and on the small side but main room was large and comfortable. We received an upgrade which was a pleasant surprise. Overall would be happy to return in the future.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well situated for getting around Milan. Clean rooms, friendly staff, good food. The garden is a very nice feature of the hotel, lovely to sit outside in nice weather. The reception staff couldn't be more helpful and very friendly bar/restaurant staff as well.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recommend this hotel.I stay by my self .but I’m not sad.Why?Cause,Staff is very very kind.so if you come by your self,that’sok!Their smile make me happy!I want come back here.i miss staff.Thankyou
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is conveniently located close to the Central Station, which is good if you plan to make short trips from Milan to the surrounding areas. The bedroom is quite spacious and the bed is comfortable.The bathroom is big, clean and bright.Breakfast has a great array of items, including gluten-free and lac-free products.It is possible to go walking up to the Cathedral and there are some options of restaurants and bars in the neighborhood.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best place to stay in Milan. Staff was fantastic. The room was confortable and very clean. Very good breakfast. It's close to Milano Central train station and it's very well communicate by metro, only 3 stops to the Duomo.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very nice hotel. It is about a 20 minute walk to the train station and 25 minutes to the duomo or a short metro trip. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Special mention to the bartender. Very friendly and funny.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From start to finish the staff were amazing. The reception desk staff couldnt do enough for you and my favourite was the barman. He went above and beyond and have never met such a skilled, funny and kind person behind the bar. He made are stay great. The hotel was very nice in general. I would stay again!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very good place to stay in Milan. There was a great variety of cheeses and pastry for breakfast. The hotel is in 5 minutes walk to the red metro station - 3 stops to Duomo. Small Auchan (with great vines and snacks) is at the corner. We had a very yummy late dinner in the Asian bar nearby and a great (and cheap) lunch at the local bar / cafeteria. Quite room with two showers :) nice and clean. Very friendly and efficient staff. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was so kind and helping , room was also having all basic needs and well ordered , bc of some personal issues we were two houra late to checkout but they didnt charged extra and were very kind to us . Whenever we will go agaon to milan we will definitely stay there .⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is in close proximity to pretty much every place you might want to go to or see in Milan,close by is a main street with plenty of shops restaurants and cafes,the staff are very helpful,friendly and polite,breakfast is standard continental but gets the job done,overall,if you are in Milan for a short visit and and budget is a concern (Milan is quite expensive as it is) you couldn’t go wrong with this hotel,for me at least it was perfect and i have no complaints.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel- excellent service, staff with smile, very good breakfast, clean, good location near metro station, nice Italian atmosphere. the unique problem is the little bit noisy at night from the street.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I found the Hotel Sanpi to be within easy walking distance of Milan Central railway station, whete we arrived and also within easy reach of the Duomo on foot. The Metro had a station close by the hotel, for those for whom walking may not be convenient.The hotel had a unique, modern style and the staff were impeccably professional, whilst remaining very warm and friendly.Our room was comfortable, stylish and well appointed and we enjoyed sleeping in comfortable beds with good quality linen.Breakfast was a real highlight, with an excellent choice of commestibles of the best quality. The Italian pastries were particularly delectable.The neighbourhood had a number of restaraunts offering a range of cuisines as well as pleasant, stylish bars.The area was quiet and peaceful and yet within easy reach of the centre of the city.We really enjoyed our stay and if visiting Milan in the future we would not hesitate to return to the Hotel Sanpi.Thank you to all the very pleasant and very professional staff. Everyone was excellent.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in the Brera district in Milan, room comfortable for 2 guests, a little traffic noise on the second floor, generally I think this is common in Milan, tea/coffee facilities available in your room, breakfast in the dinning area available with a good selection
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 3night stay at this hotel was great. The room was comfortable & clean, the breakfast was enjoyable and the staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again . There is a little gem of a court yard garden and plenty of places to eat nearby
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We hadde a marvellous stay in Milano, a city which has everything. At Hotel Sanpi we were taken well care of, in a nice,quiet room. Breakfast was also very good.Reception was always very helpful. Two very good restaurants straight outside - this will certainly be our place in Milano.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Sanpi, Milano can't be faulted for their level of service or the fantastic nature of their staff. Location had everything, which included a short walk to restaurants, one of the main parks in Milan and shopping districts. The gorilla bar and garden at night provided a wonderful atmosphere to end a day in Milan. The wonderful Christian (the bartender) provided a high end of service that couldn't be faulted , the level of welcome from him was that you just wanted to stay that much longer in the lounge and garden. Breakfast was had a good variety of food to partake in before starting the day.The faults were that on Saturday Night there was a local nightclub that was making enough noise to keep us awake. We had a ground floor room whose shower had this issue whereby it kept flooding the rest of the bathroom because it couldn't drain fast enough. A lot of towels and bathmats would prevent it reaching the carpet outside but it was disconcerting.These two things aside, we would have no hesitation in returning to the Hotel Sanpi. Also they served one of the best Chardonnays that we ordered on holiday.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an amazing Hotel with style and fantastic staff. We were a small family who met as part of a reunion, and everyone loved their stay, Breakfast was great from coffee to cake - loved it all. Efficient from check-in to check out. Thanks Hotel Sanpi Milano!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No, I didn't like it. The hotel is a mix of old cheap and some tentative design which didn't work. It has a strange smell in the corridors.Some rooms are renewed and some are not, I got a renewed one and I don't want to know what the non renewed look like. Terrible rooms view and terrible windows (pics attached)Staff at front desk is VERY NICE, friendly and helpful, they're the only reason why actually I'm not giving 2 points instead of 3. Breakfast room is very nice and the food is good.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Over night stayed, location not far from Milan Central Station and walkable to metro stations with multiple restaurants options near by. Nice front desk and dog friendly hotel. Our room was looking out to courtyard and was quiet and relaxing. Would not mind stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had asked for a superior double room as I know that European hotels can be smaller and glad I did as the room was large with two windows and a big luxurious bathroom. Also had a view of the indoor garden which made it even better.I stayed in Milan for six days and did not tire of the breakfast as it had a vast choice of food such as scrambled and hard- boiled eggs, ham, brie and other sorts of cheeses, juices, pastries, croissants and lots of fruit. I loved the fact that greens were served with artichokes and cherry tomatoes. Not always easy to stick to a balanced diet while a tourist so the greens were a great addition to breakfast. You can ask for cappucino if you do not want to use the coffee machine. The setting was very pretty and staff helpful.Was within walking distance of two subways and when I had to pick up dinner, there were lots of places to choose from, close the hotel. I thought it was a nice touch to have a basket of apples available all day long.Lots of comfortable places to sit in hotel lobby.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had been to the hotel 4 years ago and was happy to return.The new breakfast room is lovely - like a little cafe style and all the food was presented very well, plus there was a great selection.The staff are extremely helpful and friendly.The room was good, beds comfortable but the bathroom was very small with all the Italian inclusions, bidet included, so the space was very cramped.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The noise of the trams in the adjacent street sounded like a recycling truck was dumping glass bottles outside my window on REPEAT...it was SO loud. Couldn't shut the window as the room was too hot and aircon unavailable at that time of year (not sure why, but it may be a govt regulation. The staff were AMAZING: sympathetic, helpful and kind (we had left our passports in Venice and had to go back for them). They did everything they could for us...short of move the hotel to a quieter spot!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found the staff to be very friendly, from the bar staff to the concierge. There was a specially lovely bar girl who was very friendly and nice. Christian helped us with our enquiries and organised a taxi transfer to the airport. We had a twin room and although it was probably on the small size it was very clean and adequate. Lots of cupboard space and the bathroom was very good. There was outlook from the window but it was nice and quiet. For our budget this hotel met our needs. Breakfast was very good and lots of choices, did not disappoint. Within walking distance to the Metro and Via Buenos Aires. Although the street looked a bit dodgy with odd characters our experience was only positive. Within walking distance from Central Station although we had trouble locating it. The Metro was easy to use but difficult to work out which platform to be on. Nice hotel with lovely outdoor garden perfect for that drink in the afternoon after a long day.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was lured to this hotel by the decent reviews it got on TripAdvisor and the relatively good value it projected. Looking at its website I saw a good offer from an international credit card company which sounded promising. Upon arrival the promises started disappearing. We were warmly greeted at the reception desk and told we got a courtesy "upgrade" to a superior room. Upon entering the slow elevator we were lifted into a hall reminiscent of a 1980's discotheque, complete with faux LED stars a bright shiny gold dusted floor and blueish modernist/impressionist stucco. Very kitschy. Our room was very small and quirky as is the whole hotel. It had the same decor as the hallway complete with a Gustave Klimt replica. The bathroom was also small and awkward, All with a useless vaulted ceiling to make up for the missing horizontal space. The tub was fit for a pole vaulter or a high jumper and is an open risk of severe injury as it is set about 2-3 feet from the floor (no kidding!). You need to be tall and fit to enter it. There is no shower but a hand held contrivance which makes it all but impossible to take a full body cleanup. Dangerous to say the least. That should be changed to avoid a fatality. And that was not the worse part. The room was almost at street level in a street which has many a late night watering holes for national communities. It gets loud past midnight and up to 3am. So be ready to handle some noise and rowdiness. To make things worse, the outdated telephone system does not work properly and we were unable to call in for a wake up call.The rest of the hotel is awkwardly designed as it seems to be a collection of joined buildings. The lobby is not ample but consists of several nooks. Enough said about the unpleasant part of the stay. I would like to point out the Sanpi's saving graces too.The staff is nice. Breakfast is abundant and good. Capuccino is outstanding during breakfast. The inner garden is pretty, peaceful and very quaint. The location is very good, close to the Repubblica Metro station and within walking distance of many attractions and great restaurants, including Via Buenos Aires and its shopping and entertainment.This property should not be advertised as a four star property though, but should be advertised as a three star property, which is what it really is.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location has to be a big plus for this hotel, close to several Metro stations, but not an unreasonable walk into the Duomo. The street the hotel is in appears a little 'dodgy', but we walked it day and night, even though often people 'hanging' around, it didn't feel unsafe. The breakfast was very good, and a plus was the lovely quiet garden, a small oasis, and very pretty at night with little lights. Have to agree the front desk staff seemed a little 'disinterested' and were not very helpful at all when asking directions or advice. I have marked it a 4, because I think it is value for money in a city that is pretty expensive to stay in - though the room we had, wasn't the best - I think 'generally' they are pretty good. Quite small, especially the bathroom - but that is fairly typical. We looked out to a wall, so the room was quite dark, but a few rooms along would have looked into the garden - the plus with this is that it was very quiet, though the street wasn't particularly busy with cars, there are a number of bars and restaurants. So I would tend to recommend a room looking out to the garden, but maybe pay a little more so you are not at the wall end, and maybe a bit higher up with more light. There was no ventilation, or natural light in our bathroom, with that and the air con, the room had a slight smell, not really bad, but notice it when you first come into the room. Another plus is the several laundry options close by, on the same street are several places that you can leave laundry to be done for you and ironed, and a few blocks away, there is a street to the right, where they have pay washer and dryer, 7 euros for a load.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An easy walk from the Central Train station and about a 25 min walk away from the Duomo. Very clean rooms and a great breakfast buffet included in the price. Did not use the meeting rooms or work out facilities. Had some difficulty communicating with the hotel via Expedia messaging, but all worked out in the end.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very disappointed. Other than Bar Manager Christian (who were both excellent and friendly) and his apprentice, most front desk staff were very rude. We didn’t quite understand when being a front desk clerk and doubling as concierge, the staff wouldn’t try to be friendlier. They don’t give out any recommendations and act like it’s a huge favor when you ask for anything. The clerk checking us out this morning (Sunday, 7 Oct) was the worst so far! The hotel is dated and needs lots of freshening up too. I would not recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really can't fault this hotel.Great staff that are friendly and always willing to helpA great room - very clean and comfortableBreakfast is great too - plenty of choice, and all good quality Happy to recommend
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Sanpi was beautiful, friendly and the staff were extremely helpful to all our questions.On arrival our rooms were not ready as it was 10.00am but luggage was all stored for us and we were offered breakfast.When we returned later that afternoon our rooms were allocated and our luggage was inside the rooms.Rooms were lovely with full range of toiletries and towels supplied.Bed was massive and very comfy, spotless white linen.Metro was a few minutes walk and trams also local.Breakfast was available with a great variety of continental choices, cereal and gluten free.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An abosolately amazing hotel in a not so great part of Milan, as we found out most of Milan the lower street level is always quite dodgy, with three weed places just around the corner from us. But the hotel was out standing and had an amazing breakfast buffet that catered greatly to a gluten free diet.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were fabulous, it is a great location close to transport, shops and things to see. The roof top had great views was a great place to chill, breaky was good and so was the bed. We would stay there again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely LOVE this hotel! Here’s why:LOCATION Although it is within walking distance of Milan’s central train station, we were jet lagged, so decided to take a taxi — only €5.20. On our return trip, we walked.For our first day in Milan, we wanted to take it slow, so we appreciated that the hotel is only a few blocks from the Public Gardens. We spent the afternoon sitting in the park, trying to adjust to the time difference and lack of sleep. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the general neighborhood. We particularly liked the Azzurra Grill.The red line metro is only a few blocks away. The third stop is the Duomo.SERVICEWhen we arrived around 11 AM, no rooms were available, however staff at reception suggested we leave our bags and relax in the lounge. About 15 minutes later, he was back with our key. Our bags had already been placed in the room.We left Milan for a couple of days, then returned. The hotel stored one of our bags until our return.All of the staff we encountered were helpful and welcomingROOMThe beds were comfortable; the room was clean and quiet.Breakfast was adequate, and you could order special items for a price.Room amenities included the usual shampoo, conditioner, plus a few unexpected extras like slippers and shoe cleaner.Towels were plentiful.There was a hair dryer. It was one of those that is attached to the wall. I brought my own, so didn’t use it.Water pressure was good.The room was air conditioned and the cooling system was not noisy.You can get light meals if you don’t want to go out for lunch or dinner.Overall, we were very pleased with our stay.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were looking for a place to stay while doing a quick "pass through" Milan, in and then out of the railroad station. The Hotel Sanpi was great for this. An easy walk to and from the station, and then a pleasant stroll to the center of Milan or an easy metro or trolley ride. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, the room very comfortable, good breakfast, and all around good experience at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: arrived way too early but the room became available at midday.Good shopping close by.At night the street becomes alive and the variety of restaurants is exceptional. Try the Eritrean food. Restaurant Aysha ( I think) very good
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location. Close to the Duomo and other attractions as well as shopping. The street is fairly quiet and the staff are remarkably helpful. I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I recently stayed here on a one night stop over after travelling from Australia on route to Como. We chose the hotel due to the proximity to the central train station. The receptionist who attended to our check in was delightful, such a cheerful nature and very helpful with tips on getting around Milan. ( checkout receptionist was not so friendly).Our room was lovely, modern and so much larger than we are used to getting in Europe. Breakfast was included and it was plentiful. We would stay here again If we came back to Milan.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel with amenities that go over and above. Fabulous value for the money spent. We can not say enough good things about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. We would definitely book here again
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Milan with partner to celebrate his b'day.The hotel had a good deal at a time of the booking so we decided to get a room.We were upgraded to a better room which was a nice suprice! In general it's a nice little hotel with s great city based location. The place is very clean, servise exceptionally nice which made us feel very welcomed staying there. The rooms need to be modernised a bit but for the price it was very good place to stay!The food was also very good with a great selection for breakfast.Thank you hotel Sampi
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really close to the hop on hop off bus, 9 blocks from the train, and pretty easy access to everything. Not a bad deal for your money! Breakfast was ok but it did its job. I didn’t take advantage of the patio but it looked wonderful. I stayed in the room really close to the elevator and I never heard a sound.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here one night. The hotel is decent, but rooms were pretty worn, and had a strange smell from the bathroom (we had two rooms on different floor, and both had the same issue). Breakfast was good and street quiet. Good communication to other parts of town. Staff was semi service minded.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Sanpi is in a great location, few minutes walk from porta Venetia Metro station and 12 min walk from Centrale Milano . It offers easy access to most landmarks in Milan , an excellent breakfast is served with a variety of choice until 11 am so no need to stress or rush . Our room was standard room , simply decorated but was very clean and we had a comfortable sleep. the best part of this hotel was the welcoming staff which made our stay so comfortable we rebooked again on our way back from Switzerland. Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling for leisure and business alike. A special thank you to Beautiful Rosaria who was very welcoming and who offered us the best Italian espresso we could wish for
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First class hotel where staff were all friendly offering advice where sought. In particular the evening barman who recommended areas to experience real Milan away from tourist hotspots. Room excellent. Breakfast superb.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An exceptionally well located boutique hotel, close to the Metro and trams, easy walking distance to a major shopping precinct and surrounded by great food options. The staff were friendly and eager to help, the rooms, while small, were comfortable and clean and the breakfast buffet was more than adequate “Perfecto”
hotelName:
27    Hotel Sanpi Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was great! The breakfast was small but still had some great selections. The Room Service had some great food, though the Steak was hard. The pool had a great view of Milan and was the perfect size. The room was modern and it was clean and modern and had all the essentials needed for a great stay. The Spa and Gym were nice too and added a great touch. A great hotel to stay if you are staying in Milan.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was wow.Where do I start.I was checked in by Laura who was absolutely welcoming, Rafaela at concierge took care of all personal arrangements and so was Fillipe, Sonia, Pietro, Joseph and Antonio made breakfast an everyday excitement and the manager Luigi, what can we say, he made sure every minute of our stay was an absolute pleasure. Viu will offer you rates lesser the most Milan hotels with 6* star service all round. We will definitely be back to this little gem of a hotel in Milan. WELL DONE HOTEL VIU.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I used Bonvoy app to book my stay. Front desk informed me about double booking issue at my arrival but indicated problem was resolved 1hour later - the app having duplicated my booking. In fact, they waited for a day after my departure to charge my card by claiming their hotel has nothing to do with Marriott Bonvoy group. I am disputing the amount.Expect of unfair billing practices, good quality hotel.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a lovely hotel - very clean and the service was outstanding. My room was easily large enough for two (even the bathroom - with a heated towel bar and light controls for the whole room at the bed). The rooftop pool was lovely and the hotel bar had outstanding cocktails - like beyond. The location is not ideal for sightseeing on foot, but every time we needed transportation the staff had a cab available within 5 minutes. I even left a few items in the room and they were very helpful in getting them back to me (in the US). I was very happy with my stay.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has all the amenities and comfort you want, whether you’re in Milan for work or pleasure. My suite was extremely comfortable, clean, and quiet. The staff was very attentive and friendly, and although some reviews have disliked the location, I really liked it. Sure, it’s not in the dead centre of the touristy areas, but why would you want to stay there? Those areas are often too crowded and annoying. This hotel is in a wonderful and interesting neighbourhood, so you can explore something really Milanese vs a touristy version. It’s safe, so you can easily walk to the Duomo, for example, or take public transportation or a taxi/rideshare. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here, and I will do so again on my next trip toMilan.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pay attention. False advertisement. The pool is someday fully privatized. Like today. I was kick out by four men while the pool was supposed to be open one more hour. And believe me when it is 35c outside paying for a hotel with a pool make sense. I was treated like I wasn't a guest of the hotel !
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Viu Hotel MilanThis is a new hotel ,open a little more than a year, in a run down area next to Chinatown. There are great views of the Cemeteria where Toscanini is buried from the top floor bar. The view is currently unpleasant due to construction but eventually a park will cover what is now underground parking.A taxi to the Duomo or center runs 10 to 15 Euros . There is a tram stop but getting tickets for it can be quite difficult as the local stores that sell them are often closed! The hotel does not run a shuttle to town as does the Principe Savoia which is about the same distance from the center but on the North East side of town.The best part of the stay was the very attentive and gracious desk clerk, Clara who goes way out of her way to help her guests!The rooms are well appointed and well decorated in a very contemporary minimalistic style. There are plenty of outlets!There is an roof top pool and bar which is pleasant after a long day but the restaurant downstairs has no flavor and the service appears amateurish.There appear to be very few Italian restaurants of quality near by.It will be a while before this hotel is ready to be a first choice in its expensive price category.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at the hotel for few nights end of the May . The staff of the hotel is extremely professional and friendly as it should be in a 5 star hotel . The room was big and comfortable. What we liked the most at the hotel was rooftop pool and bar where breakfast was served as well . The hotel is around 30 minutes walk from Duomo which was perfect .
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying at Viu Hotel in Milan this weekend. The Hotel is exceptional, a rooftop pool which is spotless due to the amazing attention of one man and the waiters are excellent. Rooms are contemporary design, very tasteful. A short taxi drive from the centre, €10 so you don’t miss out on shopping! We will definitely come again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this excellent hotel. Rooms spacious and excellent facilities. Lovely friendly receptionists. Only negative was the lack of iron in the room. When asked we were told its now against the law to have an iron in a hotel room. However, it then cost me £67.00 to have my clothes ironed. I think the hotel should put this on their website as I visited Rome two years ago and it wasn't the law then, therefore I didn't think to check this out before visiting. This information is only available on trip advisor, which i found after the fact.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel VIU is very stylish and actually exactly our way of accommodation. However, there is a lot of room for improvement. With only 12 sunbeds for 124 rooms, chances of getting one is very little. No shade on the rooftop except for 3 big umbrellas, covering 6 sunbeds. Extreme noise coming from 3 construction sites surrounding it , even on Saturdays. For a small pool (really small), way too many very young, screaming and splashing kids. I have no understanding way a stylish place with a nice, but tiny roof top accepts families with toddlers (300€ per night). I guess this will only be worse in July. Also, charging 35€ for breakfast under that circumstances is way over in my opinion.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional doesn’t just represent the sleek architecture & interiors, it extends throughout the customer service team.Filipe organized an in room massage prior to arriving from Australia (highly recommend either Sam or Elena), and dinner in their Bulk restaurant which was delicious. Thanks to David for help booking visits to Museums & intricate train directions. Breakfast was beautiful, what could be better than having a morning espresso on the rooftop contemplating the day?! Being a solo traveler the pool area was ideal to relax and take in the atmosphere. The room was quiet (excellent sound insulation) and very comfortable bed. Thank you Hotel VIU team for your care and exceptional customer service. I will definitely return.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: in addition to having nice room, nice lounge nice bar and restaurant on the ground floor we went for drinks on the rooftop bar, lovely view, nice service and beautiful pool . we will be back to try the restaurant
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stayed a night but had an incredible stay. Gorgeous room, very helpful and nice staff, excellent breakfast. Unfortunately didn't have time to try the spa out... next time. Only small negative waiters at breakfast didn't seem vert organised and made a few mistakes.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayd here one weekend with my colleague. Hotel is elegant and clean and the staff was also really great. At the rooftop they have a nice pool area and also pool bar where you can order drinks and snacks. They also have a electric car chargers at the parking hall, which was a big bonus for us while driving Tesla.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place with a pool area and 360 degrees views of Milan. Only 2 years old and a rooftop bar and breakfast area to enjoy the views..... great room with contemporary furniture in line with the Design hotel theme. This will be our new place to stay in Milan! Oh, fantastic staff who give great service and friendly attitude
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came on a a special occasion, we've been upgrade in a Junior Suite Room.Very dedicated staff and great breakfast. Although the hotel in note located in the center, it is very well connected, 10-15 minutes to the center by tram.Thanks the all staff for making this stay unforgettable, we will be back
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good and quiet hotel, clean and relatively big rooms, friendly and helpful staff.The hotel is not close to the center of Milan but if you take a taxi it costs 12-15 €. You can ask the reception to call it for you. You also can walk about 30 minutes if you want.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel to stay for 3 days in Milan. The room was very clean, modern and new. The hotel greeted us with a bottle of prosecco and cake, which was a very nice touch. Thank you!The two things we didn't like were the view. Our rooms overlooked a construction site, not a very exciting view when you first visit Milan and expect a 5-star hotel... The other area of improvement was breakfast. I would have never paid 35 Euros for a breakfast of this kind in a restaurant. It was very basic and not 5-star quality. The choices were limited and vegetables not fresh. I'd give it 2/5..
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel last year for the first time and really appreciated its modernity, efficiency, cleanliness and amazing staff. Location wise I was a little concerned about being in Chinatown but I couldn’t have been more wrong.....super conveniently located for the metro system and next door to the tram stop direct to Brera and Doumo (€4.50 for a day pass), this hotel is honestly one the best I’ve stayed at in Milan....cannot fault it, especially on a sunny warm day when you have can fully utilise the pool on the roof deck
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautifully decorated, clean and so pleasant to stay in. The service at the bar & restaurant is incredibly good, everyone treated us very nicely. Beautiful pool on the roof top, with a great view.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very stylish and close to the central train station and in Milan's Chinatown. The rooftop is fabulous and the staff is very attentive. I would highly recommend it. Rooms are very good and so is the internet. My only complaint is that their internet service doesn't allow streaming. So there was a polo match that I wasn't able to watch and also before going to the airport I tried to download films to watch and it was impossible.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a night at this hotel.we were nicely welcomed by the staff given an upgrade. The room is nicely furnished and clean.The location may be a little odd, but it is easy to use the tram to reach the Doumo. And the area itself is interesting to discover.The breakfast on the 8th floor is beautiful view and so is the service.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here three nights on business.The property is super stylish, being part of the Design Hotels collection. My room was large, with not the best view, but that's what you get when you book via Hotels.com. I did have a nice welcome bottle of wine for being a gold member on Hotels.com.All amenities were high end; a good shower, large TV, good number of power outlets in the right places. I'd also recommend the restaurant; a little hard to get a table so do book, but great food and a nice atmosphere.The location is a little out there if you're into the tourist attractions, but easy to get into central Milan via a 10-15 minute tram ride or Metro, which is super easy to use. Uber is also possible, though Milan doesn't have UberX.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has to be one of my best hotel experiences. From the moment you step in and are greeted by the reception team you feel good . We were checked in by Rafaella and she was so so helpful , passionate about what she is doing and wants to provide the best experience, she showed us all the places to visit on the map , told us how to get around and spent the time needed to do all she could. Big thanks Rafaella! Also must mention Giacomma who throughout our visit was so helpful and always happy to see people and help them . The man who checked us out (sorry forgotten name) was also very helpful , happy and delivered great service . All in all this Team of great people have been put together perfectly and make the hotel stand out with pride ! Thanks All ! The hotel itself is beautiful, very clean , great facilities and has its own very pleasant fragrance , seriously you can smell it from around the block as you approach it . They even delivered a complimentary cake and drink on my Sons Birthday, again demonstrating their attention to detail . Rooms are perfect with great shower etc . Thank you again for making our first time in Milan such a pleasure .
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in Milan's chinatown, Hotel VIU's location might at first seem like an oddity for a luxury hotel – however, after spending three nights – we found the location perfect for Milan and would gladly return to the area.In terms of location, the hotel was approx. 3 km from the central station, with a taxi taking about 10 minutes for a cost of €10. Several trams ran nearby, with a metro station just a few minutes walk away. We found it generally took about 30 minutes to walk to the center, although the neighboring areas offered plenty of local places to eat and drink, and with transit, we could get almost anywhere in a short amount of time. When it was time to depart, we took a taxi to Linate airport for approx. €30.Arriving in the evening, check-in was friendly and efficient. Throughout our stay, the front desk was helpful and proactive, offering travel advice, providing transit tickets, and ultimately taking care of some of the small shortcomings we had with housekeeping.Our 4th floor King Deluxe room was modern and spacious, decorated in a modern and modest Italian manner. All of the standard amenities you would expect were present, including a Nespresso, large TV, and plenty of space to work. The bed was extra comfortable and we appreciated the general quality and condition of the room.The bathroom was large and well appointed with Malin+Goetz toiletries, although we were surprised to find no conditioner in our room. On our second day, after a couple of attempts, we were able to finally receive a double-sized container but were disappointed the next day when housekeeping removed it from our room after only having partially been used. In fact, it seemed to be the norm to simply throw away partially used toiletries and replace them, versus being more eco friendly and letting guests complete one set before moving on to the next.Housekeeping itself left us a bit flummoxed: while it was great to receive daily turn down service, personalized notes about weather, and delicious cookies, simple tasks such as replacing used Nespresso pods or tea bags, or tidying up cords, went undone.While we didn't have a chance to dine at the hotel, we were impressed by our welcome amenity of sweets and wine, as well as with the beautiful rooftop lounge. Views of Milan were available in all directions and the outdoor pool looked extremely enticing – even if it was the middle of winter.All in all we had a comfortable stay and would definitely consider returning if the price was right. The only downsides we really experienced was the inconsistent housekeeping which while forgivable, shouldn't be an issue at luxury hotel.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located near Monumentale, the hotel is new and very well design.Room are almost perfect and hotel's bar & restaurants speechless.Unfortunatelly, the service is not in line: - Concierge/Guest relation was trying hard but end-up giving us bad advises and adresses for dining.They were also unable to book us tickets to an exhibition as they required our credit card to do: charging our room was not an option proposed!- At the ground floor restaurant, we took an order that didn't come after 40 minutes: the waitress explained to us that staff in the kitchen gave our order back and forth to each other and end-up that nobody took in charge of it!!!We cancelled our order as they request us to wait for 10 to 15min more..So in 2 days stay: that was enough i guess..Hopefully, management will fix that problems to be at the level that international standard required.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little bit far from city center But it's near to new city zone (city life mall)But you get a very well design hotel and facilities instead Just 15-20min by tram to duomoStaff very polite Really recommend to stay here
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was such a treat to return to the coddling that the Viu team provides its regular guests. The rooms were clean and well serviced, and the team at breakfast is always welcoming. The restaurant and bar are consistently great as well. It would be a nice bonus if they could offer upgrades though
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have been to Viu Milan on two occassions (both business). It has everything I need, and deem important: a well-appointed and quiet room with Nespresso machine, good bed, fast and stable internet, a modern and well-equipped gym and great food.So far my first choice in Milan (also like the Radisson, but that feels a bit off). It is in walking distance to city center or 10min by taxi. Staff is welcoming and friendly. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two weeks after our very first stay at the VIU we returned for another splendid weekend. Special thanks to Laura for welcoming us so cordially. There must be something in the VIU DNA, just like Luigi her take on welcoming us was refreshingly different - very professional, yet passionate and fun. She put us right into vacation mode before we had even set foot into our room. Speaking of who which, the room was excellent once again. Elegant, quiet, and, of course, impeccably clean. The spa is a real treat and the cocktails at the lounge bar are top notch, on par with stand-alone cocktail bars. The pool on the roof deck is still our favorite - our oasis in Chinatown of Milano. Thanks VIU. Rob
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful new building and the people could not have been nicer. We stayed 15 nights at the hotel and got to know most of the staff. On our first day we met Luigi and Laura at the reception desk. They turned out to be two of the nicest and most helpful people in Milan. Luigi upgraded our room on arrival and personally escorted us to the room explaining the hotel features to us along the way. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very clean and modern. Housekeeping did an excellent job everyday. We had a delicious dinner at the restaurant on the first night but decided to seek out other restaurants for the remainder of our stay. Breakfast buffet was spectacular at the rooftop restaurant/bar. Sofia was a wonderful hostess and made us feel right at home every morning. She even tried to teach me some Italian. We opted to do our sightseeing travel by taxi because the tram system was difficult to understand and we wanted to travel efficiently and not waste time waiting for tram and transfers. There was only about 2-5 mins waiting time for a taxi and 20 minutes for a tram. Taxi fees averaged 2-3 times tram fees. Traffic around the hotel was noisy as was the construction site across the street. Soon the construction on that side of the building will be finished. The other side has a large parking lot being constructed and is responsible for quite a bit of noise. With a crane still in place, it does not appear to be finishing any tome soon. Traffic and tram noise is pervasive throughout Milan, so other hotels are equally noisy.While the hotel is non-smoking, smoking is permitted in the outside garden and on the outside of the terrace. To us non-smokers this is an irritant that blows inside the restaurant. We did not try the Michelin-rated restaurant only because we need to eat earlier than 7pm.The best feature of the hotel is the friendly staff at Reception and Terrace . At both places everyone spoke English very well. They tried their best to be kind and helpful. Outstanding staff I recall are Luigi, Laura, Raffaella, Clara and Lucrezia. At the Terrace Buffet I commend Sofia and Alex for trying to make our stay as nice as possible. If it were not for the noise I would rate this hotel a 5 star. They are doing everything right and as soon as the construction stops it will be 5 star. BTW our weather in October was perfect, sunny everyday, about 75 degrees.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impressions of this place are very good - the bar in the hotel is cool and lobby decor is great. The staff on reception are fantastic and make you feel very welcome, though we were only told about places to go in Milan as we were leaving and given a map then! The room itself we booked was good, spacious and comfy, although it overlooked a gigantic building site. Location isn’t very central, in the middle of Chinatown on the outskirts of the city, though it’s up and coming as a location maybe. Some downsides include the fact the shower pressure was pretty poor and that there was no iron in the room - we were told we had to pay for any ironing. Also breakfast wasn’t included in our rate and was quite expensive, I felt like seeing the roof terrace on my first morning and decided to get a coffee there - for €6! The pasticceria nearby was selling the same coffee for €1.50 We liked the room products, nice shower gel and shampoo, but for this price you’d expect some better extras, like a free ironing service or a nespresso machine in the room instead of just Nescafé sachets. All in all it’s a nice hotel but was very expensive and needs some improvements
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the hotel it self if great, it’s still just brick and mortar. What makes it stand out is the people/staff and excellent service culture that permeates all through this establishment. Special mention for Luigi at the front desk, who was simply amazing. Thank you all the wonderful staff at Hotel Viu Milan.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had embarked on our 7 week holiday and half way through decided to go camping. Suffice to say, it lasted around 45 minutes somewhere between Lake Maggiore and Milan. We were panicking for a room for two nights and stumbled upon Hotel Viu.I could wax lyrical the live long day, but will keep it short. Kids loved it. So did we. For ten outstanding service, great facilities, roof top pool a must! And the food sublime; I would heartily recommend this to business traveler and families alike. In deed, my partner went back and used as a 2 day business trip. All in All, excellent!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel up to 50% of my time and spend far too many nights in hotels. Rarely does a hotel surprise me, but this place was spot on. Genuine service, great rooms and an excellent location in Milan. I recommend it without hesitation.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great add on to Milan hotels. Overall things work well - room with attention to detail in the design and overall atmosphere. Great roof with pool and view.Design hotel? or just a hotel thats been designed? for me just a hotel thats been designed, with words absolutely fine.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in June 2018 for a few days. The rooftop terrace and pool was our favourite part. We very much enjoyed the staff that took care of us up there during breakfast. One employee (I believe his name is Pietro?) was even nice enough to remember my soy latte order from the previous day... I do not consume dairy and appreciated him remembering! I also appreciated the gym! Thank you hotel VIU Milan!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel VIU Milan is a Designer Hotel with a great rooftop pool, amazing signature restaurant (try the cheese tasting menu), great wine, very friendly and helpful staff. they will always great you with a smile.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Impressed in general by their friendly & helpful staff, and clean, tidy and trendy rooms. Got upgraded to their Balcony room too due to my honeymoon too so we were very happy. Just need to be mindful that the hotel is located near Chinatown which is a bit far away from the main shopping area in Milan (e.g. Brera, Duomo). So after dinner / shopping in the main area, it may not be too safe to walk back to the hotel even if it's just 30 mins walk - I took taxi every night which is obviously not that cheap in Milan.That said, still a highly recommended hotel - its lower price relative to other 5 stars hotels in Milan has very fairly reflected its relatively less convenient location. Value for money choice for higher end travelers.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At first we thought the hotel was a bit out of place as there was building works still going at the front(couldn’t hear anything) and not much else around, the tram stop is right outside and there is a nice area with bars/restaurants only a 2 minute walk away so plenty to do.Staff are friendly,rooms are plush and very clean as you’d expect.My only issue was a lack of an iron, we normally travel from place to place and pull out clothes each day as required, they offer an ironing service which would have cost us about €70 as we wanted 2 lots each as we wanted to go in the evening as it was our wedding anniversary, we didn’t go out that evening as I begrudge paying that for something we normally do in every hotel we’ve been to,free.Having said that, the hotel did notice it was our anniversary and we came back to find a bottle of Prosecco,chocolates and card left in the room for us.I would definitely stay here again but I’d make sure I brought a travel iron.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not in a central location, but very good and new facilities. Design interiors. Very beautiful bar and pool in the rooftop, with views to the city and the nearby Monumental Cemetery (one of Milan must see attractions). There´s a construction site close to the hotel but rooms are well isolated and it is not noisy. Warm staff in the reception and a bit more stiff in the pool area. Very good gastronomic restaurant within the hotel.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ミラノのチャイナタウンにある新しいホテル。当然ですがお部屋は清潔でとても快適で、スタッフも親切で余計なストレスがありません。また、このホテルの特筆すべきポイントはプールとレストランです。プールは狭いですが、ルーフトップにあってとても気持ちが良い！朝から入れますので、出発ギリギリまでのんびりリフレッシュできました。ランニングが好きな方は、周辺を走ってからこのプールでクールダウンなんて最高です。このホテルに決めたら水着をお忘れなく。そしてレストランも良かった。そこまで多くメニューは無いですが、必要充分です。気になるところは、景色があまり良くない点と周辺環境です。隣が建設中なので景色は工事風景しか見れないのと、周辺は中華街で、市街地はやや遠いです。コルソコモまで徒歩10分で、私は散歩がてら全然歩きましたが、利便性の高い場所ではありません。それでもこのホテルは泊まる価値があると心から思いましたし、隣の工事が終わり、もう少し周辺エリアが活気づきそうなポテンシャルがあるので、このエリアのランドマークになる気がしてます。A new hotel in Chinatown, Milan. Naturally the room is clean and very comfortable. Staff is kind, there is no extra stress. Also, the most notable points of this hotel are the pool and the restaurant. Although the pool is narrow, it is very comfortable on the rooftop! Since I can enter from the morning, I was able to refresh leisurely until departure. If you like running, this pool is the best cool down place. Do not miss a bathing suit if you book this hotel. And the restaurant was also good. There are not many menus so far, but they are necessary enough.The point to worry about is that the scenery is not so good. Because the neighbor is under construction, the scenery can only see construction scenery. And the surrounding environment the neighborhood is Chinatown, the city area is a little far. It was a 10 minute walk to Corso Como, I took a walk and I walked at all, but it is not a convenience place. Still though I really thought that this hotel is worth staying, and since the next neighborhood construction is over and the potential area is a little more likely to be lively, I feel like to be a landmark in this area.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel VIU for one night on our Italian road trip. The hotel was very modern and clean. We received some wonderful treats from the hotel as it was my birthday and for staying with VIU which was a lovely touch. The hotel had a beautiful rooftop pool and bar which was a great place to relax after a day exploring the city. The hotel was a little far from the city centre however the metro is only a few minutes away. This was my favourite hotel on our trip many thanks Hotel VIU!!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel in Milan was one of my trips for my 40th!It was a lovely hotel, rooftop pool/and breakfast was awesome. Fluffy slippers and robe in rooms. Rooms clean and high standard - really good beds for a good nights sleep, no hotel noise. Great bar on the ground floor. Staff were efficient and super friendly - great tourist advice. Tram stop 20 yards from front door to take you into Milan centre / train station round the corner. Very good experience - slightly out of town but worth it. Things to watch out for - July 18 there is construction work going on in the area - there was no noise or disturbance but it wasn’t a pretty view from our room but that wasn’t an issue for our trip.We thoroughly loved this place and I’d have no heitation going back.Cleanliness was perfect and room size and comfort was exceptional.Thank you for a wonderful stay Hotel VIU.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel VIU is a well-designed, chic hotel at Milan’s artsy neighborhood. Very Brooklyn, or Shoreditch if you’re British. Absolutely love this hotel. Just steps away from Chinatown, you’re sure to get your money’s worth. Hands down, the best service in town! The property also holds an amazing Michelin-star restaurant, a rooftop outdoor pool, and 2 bars that serve the best cocktails you’ll ever have. I highly recommend. It felt like home more than anything. Spacious rooms and really comfortable beds; you’ll have a hard time leaving. Certified as one of Milan’s best kept secrets. Book your stay, you can thank me later. Very best,Mr. Raven
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this new hotel in the china town district of Milan .the hotel was completed last year and is perfect for exploring the city of Milan .our room was a junior suite and had everything you could possible think of .large walk in closet,bathroom with bath tub and separate shower as well as all the other items you would expect from a five star hotel .Staff were excellent,courteous,and helpful .the bed was one of the best we have slept on so much so we are looking to change our mattress from John Lewis to this type .breakfast was optional and we had the full breakfast so much to choose from .this hotel has a roof top pool (allbeit) not a large one but the lunging area on the roof with 360 views across the city are great for sunbathing or chilling .will def be back here again .
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel but slightly out of the city centre needing a walk through China Town or a taxi/uber to reach the true city of Milan. But still worth the stay as the staff were friendly and very helpful, the rooms luxurious and near to Garibaldi station to catch the trains to Como.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been staying at the Viu for couple of days. Everything was perfect. I've been staying in a "junior suite with terrasse" room. Facilities are very high level, the terrace is outstanding. Roof top piscine is amazing. Food at restaurants is really good. Service level is really a 5 stars service level. To cut a long story short, everything was perfect. Many thanks to the full team for such a pleasant experience. All the best
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The holiday was lovely, the hotel was great and there was a nice swimming pool on the roof. The best thing about the hotel is the people working there. Everyone is so kind, the guest relation knows all the good spots to eat/drink at. The food is great especially the sandwiches and the room cleaners are good! This hotel definitely deserves the five stars it has! For us the location was great aswell, in the middle of chine town. There were so many different cultures around the hotel!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everywhere is very cleanLovely rooftop terrace with nice drinks/ snacksRooms very spacious Luxury accomodationGood location, Staff helpfulWith recommending places to go.House keepers very nice and always a high standard
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stumbled upon the Viu when looking for a hotel with a rooftop pool, and what a gem we’ve found. The service was excellent. The rooms stylish. And the rooftop views stunning. We will definitely return. Highly recommended!Thanks Luigi, for the warm welcome!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay here. Fantastic location in a very local neighbourhood which was nicely removed from the main tourist areas yet still very accessible - with some good restaurants and bars nearby. The pool is a nice touch though isn’t realistically used for much more than a backdrop for guests’ instagrammable pouting photos. Nice setting for breakfast though which has a good a la carte option.Rooms were fine - not blow away great but did the job and with comfy beds.Service was always very friendly and helpful.Overall a nice place to stay in a cool city.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is nice and clean and we enjoyed the stay - but there are too many things...- rooms are fair priced but prices in the restaurant and the bar are outrageous. Four colas and a water are 32 euros and a decent glass of white wine is 12 EUR!- distance to center is a bit too fare - easy 40min walk and when it’s summer you’re sweaty and tires once reaching the center.- food in bar area is boring yet still pricy- breakfast is nice for the eye but also boring and expensive. Fruit (except a melon) is whole and simply eating a whole apple is not appealing...- staff seems nice but very young- pool is too coldConclusion: nice hotel but too many “buts”...
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed the VIU Milan in June for 2 nights as a birthday present and couldn't have picked a nicer hotel. Upon arrival we received a very warm welcome and got upgraded to a room with terrace, which absolutely topped it off for us, as I quite enjoyed sitting outside and reading. Bathroom furnishings were luxurious and the bed a dream.The Pool and Bar / Breakfast area on the rooftop were amazing as the view over Milan was so relaxing and the food delicious.As we wanted to discover Milan we received valuable advise from the concierge - everything we wanted to do was walkable and we discovered a few hidden gems that way too. Similarly I had a list of restaurants that I was advised to try out. The concierge again gave us some local insight, inquired about our desires and then 2 nights in a row gave us the best advise on where to eat and booked for us. We didn't regret it once as we had delicious food, restaurants known and visited by locals and appropriate for what we wanted to spent.Overall a fantastic long weekend! Thank you VIU !!!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here one night upon arriving in Milan after a 12 hour flight. Excellent place to get over jet lag! Decor is warm & chic. Room was so comfy. Plush, good quality bed, sheets & furnishings; much attention were paid to details. We were provided a proper baby cot for our 9 month old instead of the usual flimsy pack & play cots that most places offered.Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was quite good. It was pleasant sitting outside on the rooftop restaurant in summer. Only downside is that it overlooked a construction site but this is a temporary nuisance. The hotel is situated in Chinatown, about 20-30 min walk to Duomo. The Porto Garibaldi tram stop is conveniently located right outside. Overall, wonderful experience staying here.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very nice, but for the price it still could do little bit better. On the arrival nobody is outside to welcome you or to help you with the luggage, which should be really a standard in a 5* hotel. Staff at the reception is nice and friendly, our room was not ready yet (we have arrived half hour before check in) so we went for snacks and drink on the terrace, which is very nice. The pool on the terrace looks much bigger on the hotel official photos, its actually quite small for the hotel of this size so theres not enough space (only few sun beds, than some tables), if you are paying over 250€ per night you would expect better comfort there also it might be worth considering the pool adult only zone as I felt there like around public swimming pool. Breakfast for two is 70€ and for that prize again not that great, even though it has nice touches like fresh juices and good choice of fruit. Location is not that great, you are around chinatown, but lot of the places are closed.Rooms are nice, clean and comfy and staff is friendly and helpful. Overall it was a good stay, but for the price it can still improve.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend this hotel. The location is great, very close to metro station and tram line. The rooftop area is great for evening drinks, and the pool would be great on a hot day. The service was excellent and check in and check out were easy. Would 100% stay again
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon entering a cloud of interior perfume hits you which is not a great start. But things progressively went upwards after that. The hotel is clean, vey well operated and almost all staff is correct and exceptionally friendly. Our room ( in this case a 'superior' ) was a bit sombre and dark but the well appointed and spacious bathroom generously made up for that. Breakfast was great which is the exception in Italy where breakfast is very low on the list of priorities. The possibility of jumping in the pool on a hot Milan day deserves extra bonus points. The day of check out we were still offered access to the pool and gym ( which is reasonably equipped for a hotel gym) to shower and change which is real service. Overall Im really impressed. the staff nailed it for the full 5 stars for me.Room for improvement; the lighting in the room is all or nothing. The light-plan with touch panel doesn't really work in the IMO too dark room. The colour palette is just too dark and sombre and already a bit dated tbh. The consumptions at lounge/pool area are insanely expensive. Also, the pool is maybe a bit too small to accommodate multiple families with children.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had to plan my sisters bachelorette party and Sonia the manager went above and beyond for us! The staff were great, the hotel is in a great location and the rooms were very stylish! The facilities were in tip top condition too! Definently worth a stay while in Milan!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our last Day in Italy and couldn’t have made a better choice. Very upscale, rooms are ultra modern & the bed was the most comfortable I’ve had my entire trip! The entire staff is genuinely nice. It was very hot - 44! and the pool was a bit crowded but we got some lounge sofas and chairs rather quickly. The pool is immaculate! We loved the drinks and snacks served poolside by our adorable waiter. I wish I had gotten his name!I will definitely book this hotel on my next return to Milan...the exquisite stargazer lilies in the lobby looked so elegant next to the modern decor. Well worth the price!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed at the hotel VIU and were extremely impressed. The staff were very friendly and catered to our needs, the concierge was also very helpful showing us where the best places to visit were and how to get around the city. The rooftop pool is beautiful and the waiters/waitresses were amazing. Would definitely recommended staying at this hotel, with a tram stop 1 minute away it made it easy to get to shops we wanted to visit.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right away when we stepped in to the hotel we were greeted well. We arrived some hours before check in but were well taken care off during the wait. There was minor “incident” with cleaning but hotel staff was very professional and sorted it right away. So even we had some complaints we never felt like being “a problem” but rather a chance to improve. The hotel in it self is very stylish and very well designed. And food. Oh dear it was absolutely delicious. Top points! So I can very much recommend this hotel to anyone :)
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed for a weekend (without kids) and I booked it because of their rooftop pool - This is my 5 stay in my Milan, which i have a great love for, and we have tried to see and be in different areas. Its about 30 min walk from the central (9 euro with an uber in day time//18 in the evening/night) but it's a lovely walk. Milan is beautiful and my opinion should be experienced by foot.When we came to the hotel, we were instantly impressed, It's very modern with many plants, and its typically trendy and modern hotel in an upcoming area, which can still look a bit more unpolished. We came early and had already plan to sit and work before we could check in - They did however try to accommodate us as good as they good. And we noticed right away that the service level was exceptional high. Some hotels can be so fancy and trendy, that you feel in the way, and some just make you feel that welcome and no matter what they wanna aim to please. And they did - There was some minor things with housekeeping, but they instantly tried to fix it, and instead of excuses or starting a debate who did what, it was just fixed.The room was spectacular, very modern with a walk in wardrobe which wanted me to change my house_now - very modern with lots of mirrors and the bathroom exactly op. of the wardrobe had mirror aswell, reflecting each other, make the space feel huge. The bathroom was amazing well with rainshower you just wanna live in - which my husband did for quite some time. Moden rooms, big tvs and comfy bed, and usb plus next to the bed. Personal I would have loved a bluetoth speaker and maybe some smart tv functionality, but I'm also a bit of tech freak:)The gym is small but very fresh, but you have to come early (or late) or it will be crowded (guys please add netflix option to the threadmill screens:))The breakfast at the rooftop.. Where to start..? It was amazing, My husband and I live quite healthy and we are a bit tired of fat breakfast with no healthy options.. When we asked for coffee with Almond or soy milk, they came with both.. Black glutenfree bread, fresh veggies and mozzarella made by angels..It's clear they went for smaller but much higher quality, which was fabulous, and yes sitting on top of Milan drinking Italien coffee (with soy milk) having the sun dancing in the pool.. Gives you a wonderful "life is good feeling" And it is - 5 big stars to VIU Milan for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel looks the part and is pretentious in the extreme. We were welcomed this afternoon by “Filipe” who assured us that he would do everything to make our stay comfortable. But he and his staff are incapable of adjusting the air conditioning in our room to achieve an ambient temperature less than 24 deg C. Having attended the room once and listened to our complaints on two further occasions they can only tell us that the room was getting cooler. In fact it did - after sunset it cooled by half a degree. As a result I am writing this review in the middle of the night unable to sleep and wondering whether our car is enjoying a more comfortable climate for the 38 euro/night we are paying for its accommodation.Unless you are a heat freak this hotel is not for you.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The VIU were amazing. Upon arrival they greeted us with an upgraded room and chilled bottle of Prosecco as we entered the room. Nothing was too much. The concierge service were fantastic, we visited two restaurants selected by them and were well looked after as we dined. We’ll be back for sure! Philip the concierge stood out for his amazing customer service and selections of places and restaurants to visit.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can really recommend the Hotel VIU. The rooms are nice, everything is clean, the pool on the rooftop is amazing. The service was extraordinary. The receptionists and the concierge were extremly polite, helpful and funny! I will definitely go back there next time i am in Milan.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed only 2 nights should have stayed longer. Rooms very modern and well designed. Funky roof top bar but what makes the place great is the staff. Great service and a wonderful attitude to the guest. Will stay again for sure. Thank you all.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt at home in this hotel. It is in an area that feels like a quiet neighborhood and also seems to be going through a revitalization.The staff was helpful and friendly. The check-in process could a little quicker but that's a small thing. The room was well-appointed with stylish furniture, was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable with quality linens. The bathroom was also nice and spacious. We enjoyed the nice view and the small balcony.It is not in the heart of the action or where many other tourists are but we liked that aspect. It is located not too far from the Porta Garibaldi Sotterranea Station where we arrived. There is a tram that stops right next to the hotel so it is convenient to take into the shopping/eating area nearby. We walked to the Duomo di Milano and it took us around 25-30 minutes. I'm sure the tram would take you to that area as well but we liked exploring the city along the way.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel VIU Milan is nice but since its pricey a lot of expectations comes along and as new as they are there are still small things to work on! A heated pool in May wouldn't be wrong ...for a start!!!!
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel, as a suggestion from a colleague at work as it is close to the office. The hotel seams brand new, rooms are spacious with large shower. I really enjoyed the terrace space to have a drink at the end of the day. It has a swimming pool very shallow.The gym has top of the technology equipment however it only opened at 7Am most of days (after feedback it open before - thanks!) Staff was friendly and attentive. Breakfast was the only draw back, it was just ok.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been staying here from Monday, using most of the hotel facilities which by the way are really good. Had a very good dining experience at Morelli restaurant Friday night but due to a private event I was asked to leave the hotel bar (the only one) and offered a spot outside. Accepted, feeling disappointed but left for my room unattended. This is substandard.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicely put together reception.Room was standard tasteful boutique hotel - bed super comfy. Breakfast was bowls of fruit - not just the usual apples oranges and grapes. Good selection bread cheese & meat. Poached eggs spot on.Pool - fab-u-lous after day in tedious meetings. Good G&T as well.Location - walkable to centre (20 mins) near china town. Cute little italian just up road on the right witg home made pasta. My italian colleague adored it.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for 3 nights! Such a beautifully designed hotel with luxurious interiors. The rooms are 5* and are well payed out, clean, and spacious. We were very well looked after and the service was very prompt! Staff were helpful and made our experience even better. We will 100% be staying here again when we return to Milan.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decoration was nice, staff was very nice but the rooftop terrace pricing was ridiculous. 8€ for water (which was given free daily, and costs 0,30-2€ in stores/restaurants), 14€ for a 16cl ”house wine” glass etc. If you pay 300€ for a night you would expect, that hotel wont try to fool you with 5000x water prices.
hotelName:
28    Hotel VIU Milan
